loans.name: Suzane

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Suzane M., who is married and has two children aged three and seven. In 2007, Suzane established her charcoal business. Working six days a week, eight hours a day, and assisted by her husband, she earns about $30 every month. She now requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of charcoal. In the future, Suzane plans to increase both the quantity and range of the stock. She thanks you for your support.

These small, black, and dirty pieces of dry earth are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal), and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Samuel Feliciano

texts.pt:
Samuel Feliciano M. is 33 years old, married and the father of 2 children, aged 9 and 5, the eldest of which already goes to school. As well as his children, he supports his mother and 6 brothers and sisters.

Samuel was in school until the 5th grade and had to leave due to his family's financial difficulties. When he left school he went to the land of the Rand (South Africa) to look for a job, but things didn't go to plan as he ended up being the victim of a shooting accident, so he came back to Mozambique where he started the business from which he lives to this day with the help of his wife.

Samuel is a trader who woks from 10am to 4pm and has no employees although his wife does help him. His business consists of selling clothes and drinks. He buys the clothes and some of the drinks in South Africa and purchases the rest in Mozambique.

This is Samuel's second loan from Hluvuku and he has never borrowed from other institutions. He heard about Hluvuku from friends who were already customers.

Samuel's biggest dream is to have another store and to sell more products, thereby increasing his revenue.

Translated from Portuguese by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Samuel feliciano M. tem 33 anos de idade, casado, pai de 2 filhos com idade entre o maior 9 anos e menor 5 anos, o maior já vai a escola. Para alem dos seus filhos sustenta a mãe e 6 irmãos.

Samuel estudou até 5ªclasse e não continuou por dificuldades financeira da família. Quando deixou de estudar foi a terra do Rand a procura de emprego e por lá as coisas não saíram no primeiro plano onde sofre um acidente de baleamento e assim volta a Moçambique e começa um negocio com qual vive até hoje com ajuda da sua esposa.

Samuel é negociante e trabalha das 10h as 16h não tem empregados tem ajuda da esposa. O negocio consiste em venda de roupa e bebidas. As compra de roupa faz na africa do sul e as algumas bebidas o resto adquira em Moçambique.

Para Samuel este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e nunca solicitou noutras instituições. E conheceu Hluvuku atraves de amigos que já eram cilentes.

Para Samuel o maior sonho é ter outro estabelecimento comercial e vender mais produtos aumentando assim os seus rendimentos.

loans.use: To purchase more products for his shop

loans.name: Messan Victor

texts.fr:
Messan Victor A. was born in Aklakou in TOGO in 1957. A married father of four children, he has made a living in agriculture for more than 20 years. Currently, his agricultural income does not allow him to meet the basic needs of this children. Very dynamic, he began selling brooms, a flourishing business in his area.

But the capital he has at his disposal is very small, so he is asking for a loan to strengthen his purchasing power in order to maximize his profit. Thus, he will be able to improve his family's standard of living.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

A. Messan Victor est né à Aklakou au TOGO en 1957. Marié et père de quatre enfants, il vit de l’agriculture depuis plus de 20 ans. Aujourd’hui, ses revenus agricoles ne lui permettent plus de subvenir aux besoins élémentaires de ses enfants. Très dynamique, il s’est lancé dans le commerce de balaies ; une activité très florissante dans sa localité.

Mais le fonds de commerce dont il dispose étant très insignifiant, il sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son pouvoir d’achat afin de maximiser son bénéfice. Ainsi il pourra améliorer les conditions et niveaux de vie des membres de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell brooms

loans.name: Oscar Agostinho

texts.pt:
Oscar Agostinho L. is 38 years old, from Inhambane and is married with 3 children. His eldest is a 9 year old son who is in 4th grade and his second eldest is his 6 year old daughter who is in 1st grade. His youngest is his 3 year old daughter who is not in school yet. He basically supports his family of 5 alone (himself, his wife and 3 children).

Oscar was in school until the 9th grade when he was incorporated into the Mozambican armed forces. After the signing of the general peace agreement, he was integrated into the navy where he remains to this day and where he recently benefitted from a 6 month training course abroad to become an instructor. His house is still in construction and he is currently renting.

Oscar has worked in planning for 3 years and is currently sector chief. He learnt through day-to-day experience whilst still a soldier at the Boane barracks over 10 years.He has a monthly salary of 7015,00 MZN and from this he saves 2000,00 MZN.

This is his fifth loan with Hluvuku which he heard about from colleagues who were already clients and has never borrowed from other institutions. His biggest dream is to see his house being finished.

Translated from Portuguese by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Oscar Agostinho L. tem 38 anos e natural de Inhambane é casado maritalmente e pai de 3 filhos. Primeiro com 9 anos e estuda na 4ªclasse e a segunda com 6 anos na primeira classe e a terceira com tres anos e ainda não estuda. Basicamente sustenta a sua família que é sua esposa e seus filhos.

Oscar estudou até 9ªclasse e para por missão de serviço, foi incorporado nas forças armadas de defesa de Moçambique e depois da assinatura do acordo geral de paz foi integrado na marinha de guerra onde se encontra até hoje e pouco tempo beneficiou se de uma formação fora do país como instrutor durante 6 meses. A sua casa ainda está em construção neste momento vive alugado.

Oscar trabalha na area de planificação a 3 anos e chefe do sector. Aprendeu no quartel de Boane ainda soldado por experiencia do dia a dia num periodo de 10 anos. Tem um salário mensal de 7015,00mt e poupa deste 2000,00mt.

Este é o quinto empréstimo na Hluvuku e nunca teve doutras instituições e conheceu a Hluvuku atraves dos colegas que já eram clientes. O seu maior sonho é ver a sua casa concluida.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish his family home

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Rehema M., who is married and has two children aged four and six. In 2005, Rehema established her grocery business. Working seven days a week, ten hours a day, and assisted by her husband and one employee, she earns about $440 every month. Rehema has already received and repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Rehema thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Mame Yacine

texts.fr:
Mame Yacine B. is a woman who was born in 1964 in Dakar. She now lives in Thies, is married and the mother of three children. After cooking for her family, she runs a small business selling food products such as tamarind. Her goal in requesting this loan is to increase her income.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Mame Yacine B. est une femme née en 1964 à Dakar. Actuellement elle vit à Thies ou elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Après avoir fait la cuisine pour sa famille, elle s'adonne au petit commerce de denrées alimentaires comme le tamarrin. C'est dans l'optique d'améliorer ses revenus qu'elle sollicite ce pret.

loans.use: Small Business Selling Food Products

loans.name: Neves Changoma

texts.pt:
Neves Changoma N. is 47 years old. He's from Tete in the centre of Mozambique and is the father of 3 children. He lives with his wife, their 3 children and 4 step-children. They are officially married.

Neves was in school until 9th grade and stopped as he had to attend obligatory military service. In 1969 he had signed up as a member of FRELIMO (Mozambican Liberation Front) and in 1983 entered obligatory military service and went to train in an official capacity in Umbelezi, where he worked until his retirement.

Neves is retired with a monthly pension of 4997,00 MZN (around $200). This is his third loan and they were all used to buy construction materials for his house. He dreams of seeing his house finished and fully furnished and as such he intends to pay the loan in full before it is due so that he can request another loan.

Translated from Portuguese by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Neves Changoma N. tem 47 anos de idade é natural de Tete ao centro de Moçambique e pai de 3 filhos. Vivem com esposa, seus 3 filhos e 4 enteados. Casado maritalmente. Neves estudou até 9ªclasse e parou por incorporar se ao serviços militar obrigatório. Em 1969 tinha se inscrito como membro do partido frelimo e em 1983 foi ingressou nos serviço militar obrigatório e foi treinar em arte oficiais em Umbelezi onde trabalhou até a sua reforma. Neves é reformado com uma pensão mensal de 4997,00mt. Este é o terceiro empréstimo e todos foram usados na compra de material para construção da sua casa. Tem como sonho ver a sua casa concluida e mobilada assim pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro crédito.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish building his house

loans.name: Hamidou

texts.fr:
Mr. Konaté is a native of Thies, born in 1962. He is married and lives with his wife in the Lamy district of the city. His main business is the manufacture of postcards, which he sells to local bookstores and shops in Dakar. At the same time, he creates works of art which he sells during tourist season. With this loan he wants to increase his working capital.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr Konaté est un natif de Thies en 1962. Il est marié et vit avec sa femme au quartier cité lamy. Sa principale activité consiste à fabriquer des cartes postales qu'il vend aux librairies de la place ou à Dakar. En meme temps il fait des tableaux d'art qu'il vend pendant la saison touristique. Avec ce pret il veut renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Making of postcards

loans.name: Awoma

texts.fr:
Born in 1952, Awoma S. is a very dynamic widow who specializes in the preparation of kom, a highly appreciated meal in the south of TOGO. She has run this business for 40 years. Not having a large enough capital base, she has been unable to maximize her profits and subsequently improve her standard of living.

Furthermore, she has not been able to satisfy the large demands of her customers. It is for all of these reasons that she is asking for a loan which will serve to buy maize, tomatoes, and fish, which are indispensable in securing a consistent income for her.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1952, S. Awoma est une veuve très dynamique spécialité dans la préparation de kom, un repas très apprécié au sud du TOGO. Elle exerce cette activité il y a de cela 40 ans. Ne disposant pas d’un fonds de commerce assez important, elle ne parvient pas à maximiser des bénéfices pour améliorer ses conditions et niveau de vie.

Par ailleurs, elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire à la forte demande de sa clientèle. C’est pour toutes ces raisons qu’elle sollicite un crédit qui lui servira à l'achat du mais,tomates,et poissons indispensable à la sécurisation et à la consistance de son revenu.

loans.use: To buy maize, tomatoes, and fish in bulk

loans.name: Eva António  José

texts.pt:
Eva António José N. is 27 years old, from Boane and a single mother to a six year old girl who is in the first grade. As well as her daughter she supports her mother by sending her money at the end of each month.

Eva is in the 11th grade at the Joaquim Chissano high school in Boane. She has always lived in the same house and in the same area. She lives in her parents' house.

Eva has been a trader for 6 years. She opens her establishment every day from 8am to 8pm and has one employee. Every products she has brings in some income as each customer chooses the right product for their hair. Income varies, but is around a minimum of 500,00 MZN which increases on the weekends. Monthly she saves 1000,00 MZN. At the moment she intends to increase her product range in order to increase revenue.

This is her third loan. Her first was for 6000,00 MZN, which she used to buy merchandise and the second was for 9000,00 MZN, which she also used to buy beauty products. The loan she is now asking for, of 15000,00 MZN, will also go towards buying beauty products.

It is Eva's dream to see her beauty salon be of a high standard with the capacity to attend to 15 customers at the same time.

Translated from Portuguese by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

Eva António José N. tem 27 anos de idade e natural de Boane, solteira e mãe de uma filha de 6 anos que estuda na primeira classe. Para além da sua filha sustenta a sua mãe enviando dinheiro cada fim do mês. Eva estuda na 11ªclasse na escola secundária Joaquim Chissano de Boane. Ela nunca mudou de local de resídência sempre viveu na mesma zona. Vive na casa dos pais. Eva é comerciante a 6 anos, onde abre o seu estabelecimento das 8h as 20h todos os dias e tem uma empregada. Para ela todos os produtos que tem lhe proporciona qualquer coisa dado que cada um escolhe o produto para o seu cabelo. Os rendimentos varia entre 500,00mt minímo e aumenta nos fins de semana. Mensalmente poupa 1000,00mt. Assim neste momento pretende aumentar os produtos de forma aumentar as receitas. Este é o terceiro empréstimo, onde o primeiro foi de 6000,00mt que usou para compra de mercadoria e o segundo foi de 9000,00mt também usou para compra de produtos de beleza. Assim este que pretende é de 15000,00mt também vai aplicar na compra de produtos. Constitui grande sonho para Eva ver o seu Salão numa classe bem alta com capacidade de atender no total de 15 clientes ao mesmo tempo.

loans.use: To increase stocks for her salon

loans.name: Agbohoédé

texts.fr:
Born in 1977 in Tékonou, Mrs. Aghohoédé A. is married to a laundry worker with whom she lives in the village of Logodomé. She is the mother of two children and specializes in producing red palm oil. She buys palm nuts in bulk and uses them to make red oil, which she sells. But today, her desperate lack of money means that she can no longer produce as in the past. To stimulate her business and make the most of the current harvest, she is requesting a loan to buy some palm nuts. This will enable her to improve on the level of income she has today.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1977 à Tékonou, Madame A. Agbohoédé est mariée à un blanchissuer avec qui elle vit dans le village de Logodomé. Mère de deux enfants, elle est spécialisée dans la production d’huile rouge. Elle achète les noix de palme en quantité importante avec lesquelles elle prépare de l’huile rouge qu’elle commercialise. Mais aujourd’hui, le manque cruel d’argent fait qu’elle n’arrive plus à produire comme naguère. Pour se relancer et faire face à la campagne actuelle, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter des noix de palme. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer son niveau de revenu qui est aujourd’hui.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Carlos Paulo Benedit

texts.pt:
Carlos Paulo Benedito K. is 41 years old and a native of the Lago district in the Niassa Province of Mozambique. He is a single father of three children; the oldest is 18 years old and studies at the university, the younger two are not in school. In addition to his family, he supports his brother in the Niassa Province, to whom he sends money monthly.

Carlos studied through 12th grade and did not continue because he was drafted into military service. Carlos grew up in a family setting, that is, with his own parents. In 1986 he had to leave his family to live in the Maputo Province to complete his obligatory military service. Carlos lives in a rented room.

Carlos has been a soldier for 22 years and works from 7:30am to 3:30pm Monday through Friday. Carlos learned this work through the training and various combats during the Destabilization War. He has a monthly salary of 9670 meticals and saves 2000 meticals monthly.

This is Carlos’ first loan with Hluvuku (Kiva’s Field Partner) and in his life. He has a dream to buy a mill and a boat motor.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos Paulo Benedito K. de 41 anos de idade e natural do distrito de Lago na Província do Niassa, solteiro, pai de 3 filhos sendo o maior com 18 anos e estuda na universidade, os dois mais novos não estudam. Para alem da sua família sustenta o irmão que se encontra na província do Niassa enviando dinheiro mensalmente.

Carlos estudou até 12ªclasse e não continuou por ter se incorporado nos serviços miliatra obrigatório. Carlos cresceu num ambiente família, isto é, viveu com os próprios pais. Em 1986 teve que deixar a família para vir na província do maputo para cumprir o S.M.O. Carlos vive numa casa de aluguer.

Carlos é militar a 22 anos e trabalha das 7:30 as 15:30, da segunda a sexta-feira. Carlos aprendeu o seu trabalho durante o treinamento e em varios combates durante a guerra de Destabelização. Tem um salário mensal de 9670,00mt e poupa mensalmente 2000,00mt.

Para Carlos este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e na Vida. Tem como sonho comprar uma moageira e um motor para Barco.

loans.use: To buy construction material to build his family’s house

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou N., whom everyone calls Fatou, is a young woman who was born in 1970 in Thies. She lives with her husband in the Parcelles Assainies district of Thies. After completing her housework, she shops at the local market for the ingredients to make incense, which she sells to her neighbors, her intended customers. She has requested this loan in order to increase her profit margin.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Aissatou dite Fatou N. est une jeune femme née en1970 à thies. Elle vit avec son mari au quartier des Parcelles Assainies de Thies. Apres les travaux ménagers, elle s'approvisionne sur le marché local de produits divers pour faire de l'encens qu'elle revend à ses voisines qui sont sa clientèle cible. C'est dans le but d'augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire qu'elle demande ce pret.

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of goods

loans.name: Arfino

texts.pt:
Arfino C. is 35 years old and a native of Nampula, a province in the north of Mozambique. He is a single father of three children: the first is 6 years old, the second is 3 years old, and the youngest is 3 months old. In addition to his children he supports his sister, sending her money in Nampula, where she lives.

Arfino studied through 6th grade and then did not continue because of his family’s financial situation. In 1984 he enrolled in the military, which was disarmed in 2002. With his retirement money he decided to open up a small business selling diverse products, a business which he continues to grow today with the help of his girlfriend. Open 7am to 5pm, the store primarily carries vaseline that sells for 15, 20, 30, 40, 50, and 60 meticals. The main challenge that he cites is the 30-km trip on public transit to transport his goods from the city of Maputo, where he acquires them. He earns 2100 meticals per month and is not able to save anything.

In January of this year, he was contracted as a security guard at a company called CMC. He works from 7am to 7am the following day, in 48-hour shifts. He has a monthly salary of 2400 meticals.

For Arfino this is his seventh loan in life, his second with Hluvuku [Kiva’s Field Partner] and his first with Kiva. He used his first loan of 7,000 meticals to buy merchandise. He obtained his five previous loans at Banco Tchuma.

In the near future, Arfino intends to expand his business by selling new products such as sacks of corn and peanuts.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer.

Arfino C. tem 35 anos de idade, natural de Nampula, uma província que fica ao norte de Moçambique, solteiro e pai de 3 filhos com idade entre; primeiro 6 anos, segundo 3 anos e o mais novo com 3 meses de idade. Para alem dos filhos sustenta uma irmá enviando dinheiro para Nampula onde se encontra.

Arfino estudou até 6ªclasse e não continuou por condições financeira da família, em 1984 ingressou nos serviços militar qual veio a ser desmobilizado em 2002, e com o valor da reforma decide abrir um pequeno negocio de vende de produtos diversos, actividade que desenvolve até a data hoje com apoio da esposa com um horário das 7H as 17Horas . tem como produto em destaque a Vaselina que vende por (15mt; 20mt;30mt;40mt;50mt;60mt. Aponta como principal dificuldade o transporte uma vez que os produtos adquire na cidade de Maputo e desloca de transporte Publico a uma distancia de 30km. Tem um rendimento mensal de 2100,00mt e não consegue poupar nenhum.

Em Janeiro do presente ano foi contratado como segurança numa empresa denominada CMC. Com horário de 7... as 7horas do dia seguinte e um intervalo de 48horas. Tem um salário mensal de 2400,00mt Para Arfino este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no kiva, onde o primeiro foi de 7000,00mt qual usou para compra de produtos e Sétimo na vida onde os 5 obteve do Banco Tchuma.

No futuro tão breve Arfino pretende ampliar o seu negocio vendendo novos produtos tais como Milho e Amendoim em sacos.

loans.use: To increase stock for his shop

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Sakina K., who is married and has one child, aged 10 years. She has one other dependent living with her because he is an orphan. In 2006, Sakina established her fruit business which. assisted by her husband and one employee, she operates seven days a week, five hours a day. Sakina has already received and repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of fruit such as bananas, mangoes, and avocados. In the future, Sakina plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fruit such as mangoes and bananas.

loans.name: Angelica Rodrigues

texts.pt:
Angélica Rodrigues M. is 42 years old, a native of the city of Maputo, and married. She has one daughter who is 26 years old and attends 7th grade at night school. Aside from her family, she supports her father who lives in the province of Manica, in the center of Mozambique.

Angélica studied through 5th grade and then stopped because of a lack of means. For a while she lived outside the city in the Manhiça district of the Maputo Province. There she met her husband, and later they moved together to the Alto-Maé neighborhood in the city of Maputo. For the last five years they have been living in the Bagamoio suburban neighborhood of Maputo. They live in their own house, though it is still under construction.

Angélica has been an employee for 23 years and works from 7am to 3:30pm, having learned her trade and gotten experience on the job itself. She has a monthly salary of 2200 meticals and saves 1200 meticals.

For Angélica this is the third loan from Hluvuku [Kiva’s Field Partner], and she has never requested a loan from other institutions. Her grand dream is to see her house completed and to see her family well-sheltered.

Pictured above is Angélica with her granddaughter.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer.

Angelica Rodrigues M., tem 42 anos de idade, Natural da cidade de Maputo, casado maritalmente e pai de 1 filha com 26 anos de idade ela estuda na 7ªclasse curso noturno. Para alem da sua família sustenta o seu pai que se encontra na província de Manica ao centro de Moçambique.

Angelica estudou até 5ªclasse e não continuou por falta de condições, por um tempo viveu fora da cidade no distrito de Manhiça na Província do Maputo e lá conheceu o seu marido que mais tarde vieram viver na cidade de Maputo bairro Alto-Maé e a 5 anos vivem no bairro suburbano de Bagamoio na cidade de maputo. Numa casa própria a pesar estar ainda em construção.

Angélica é funcionaria a 23 anos com horário das 7 as 15:30h aprendeu o trabalho ganhando experiencia no próprio trabalho. Tem um salário de 2200,00mt por mes e poupa 1200,00mt.

Para Angélica este é o terceiro empréstimo na hluvuku e nunca pediu noutras instituições. Tem como grande sonho ver a sua casa concluída e ver sua família bem alojada.

loans.use: To buy construction material for her family's house

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjovi G. is 24 years old and lives in the village of Logodomé. She is married and has two children. Her farmworker husband has great difficulty in meeting the basic needs of the family. As a result, Mrs. G. gives over the income she makes from her small fish business to the daily expenses. This presents an impediment to the development of her business since she has no financial means. She is requesting a loan to stimulate her business in order to draw greater profit from it.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame G. Adjovi est âgée de 24 ans et vit dans le village de Logodomé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Son mari cultivateur a beaucoup de difficulté en ce qui concerne la satisfaction des besoins élémentaires de la famille. Pour ce faire, Madame G. Adjovi sacrifice les revenus tirés de son petit commerce de poissons pour les dépenses quotidiennes. Ceci constitue un handicap pour l’évolution de son activité puisqu’elle manque de moyens financiers. Elle sollicite un crédit pour redynamiser son activité afin d’en tirer meilleur profit.

loans.use: Fish sales

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Frida S., who is married and has two children aged 8 and 12. She has two additional dependents living with her because they are orphans. In 2007, Frida established her traditional African cloth business. Working six days a week, five hours a day, and assisted by her husband and one employee, she earns about $110 every month. Frida now requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of cloth, dye and other chemicals which she will use to make a new range of colourful cloth. In the future, she plans to open another business and employ more workers. Frida thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of traditional African cloth.

loans.name: Ibrahim's Group

texts.en:
These are Ibrahim C., Derick B., Daniel B., Foday K. and Alusine K.. They are all working for the army. These soldiers want loans for various reasons. Ibrahim K. wants to use the loan to build a house. Derick, Daniel, and Alusine will use theirs to give to their wives to add onto their current business capital. And Foday will use his to pursue his education. They are requesting a loan of US$ 1,550.

Lamin Turay who is the leader of this group was born in Freetown, 31 years ago. He is married with 2 children.

loans.use: To give to their wives to invest in businesses

loans.name: Abel Albino

texts.pt:
Abel Albino D. is 47 years old. He is married and the father of four children, all of whom are school-age and attend school. In addition to caring for his own children and his wife, he supports his mother plus grandchildren, nieces, and nephews, making a total of 18 people in the family for whom he is responsible.

Abel studied through a basic level of auto-mechanics and was not able to continue because he lost his father very early. He has never moved from this city and always lived here in the city of Maputo. In his free time he likes sports and volleyball. He lives in his own house, inherited from his father.

Abel has been an employee of C.M.O. for 21 years and works from 7am to 3:30pm. He learned his trade in the industrial school of Matola. He has a monthly salary of 2882 meticals. This is his second loan. His dream is to complete the restoration of his home and ask for another loan to construct small rooms to rent in order to add to the family’s income.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer.

Abel Albino D., 47 anos de idade. Casado e pai de 4 filhos, todos com idade escolar e vão a escola. Para alem dos seus filhos e esposa sustenta a sua mae mais netos e sobrinhos que totalizam uma família de 18 pessoas sub sua responsabilidade.

Abel frequento o ensino até o nível básico na área de mecanica auto e não continuou por falta de condições perdeu o seu pai muito cedo. Nunca mudou de cidade sempre viveu aqui na cidade de Maputo nos tempos livres gosta de atletismo e Voleibol. Vive numa casa própria herdada do pai.

Abel é funcionário da C.M.O a 21 anos e tem um Horário das 7 as 15:30h. Aprendeu o trabalho na escola industrial da Matola. Tem um salário mensal de 2882,00mt. Este é o segundo empréstimo. Constitui seu sonho concluir com as reabilitações para solicitar outro empréstimo afim de construir pequenas dependências para aluguer assim aumentará os rendimentos famíliares.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for his family's house

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Aminata G. is married and the mother of five children. She lives in the Lamy district of Thies and she runs a small business from the front yard of her home. Mornings she provides breakfast to neighborhood workers and passersby; in the afternoons she sells various merchandise, including incense. She has requested this loan in order to increase her sales.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Aminata G. est une femme mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle vit au quartier cité lamy et c'est devant sa maison qu'elle fait du petit commerce. Le matin elle vend le petit déjeuner aux ouvriers du quartier et aux passants; les après midi elle vend des marchandises diverses dont l'encens. C'est dans le but d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire qu'elle sollicite ce pret.

loans.use: Small business

loans.name: Adelaide Joaquim

texts.pt:
Adelaide Joaquim C. is 50 years old and is from Manjacaze, province of Gaza, in southern Mozambique. She is the single mother of 7 children. Besides her children she supports her grandchildren, who live with her.

Adelaide studied until the 4th grade and then had to quit because she got pregnant and was forced to go back home. In 2000 she decided to go back to school to finish 5th grade, and she is currently in the 7th grade.

In 1987 Adelaide, along with her husband and children, was forced to abandon Gaza province due to the war and move to the outskirts of the city of Maputo. In 2001 her husband decided to abandon her and the 7 children, leaving them in the worst possible conditions, especially in terms of housing. The house he left them collapsed, and Adelaide is trying to solve the problem by building a better one.

Adelaide has worked as a cook since 1982. Her workday begins at 7:30 a.m. and ends at 4:00 p.m. Her monthly salary is 1,800.00 MT, and she is not able to set aside any of it. Her savings go toward paying her loan, and whatever is left goes toward food expenses. This is Adelaide’s third loan through Hluvuku. All her loans have been for construction materials, since she is building her home in phases. Her biggest dream is to see her family living in good housing conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Adelaide Joaquim C. tem 50 anos de idade e natural de manjacaze provincia de gaza ao sul de Moçambique. Solteira e mae de 7 filhos. Para alem da sua familia sustenta netos que vivem com ela.

Adelaide estudou até 4ªclasse e parou por ter se engravidada e foi obrigada a ir ao lar. Só em 2000 é que decide voltar a escola e fez a 5ªclasse e agora frequenta 7ªclasse. Em 1987 Adelaide foi obrigada abandonar a Provincia de gaza junto com a familia que tinha formada ( Marido e filhos) devido a Guerra e foi para nos bairros perifericos da cidade de maputo onde em 2001 o marido decide abandonar a ela com os 7 filhos em piores condições principalemte habitacional e a casa que lhes deixou ficou a tumbar e agora está nesta de procurar resolver o problema construindo uma casa melhorada.

Adelaide trabalha como cozinheira desde 1982. Tem um horário de 7:30 até 16:00h. Aprendeu o serviço dentro da empresa a 20 anos atras. Tem um salário mensal de 1800,00mt,não consegue poupar . a minha poupança é para pagar o credito e o que resta é para despesas de alimentação.

Para Adelaide este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku sempre pediu para compra de material de construção uma vez que está construindo em fazes. Constitui seu grande sonho ver sua familia bem alojada.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: Biesha

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 53-year-old Biesha N., who is married and has four children between the ages of 13 and 27. She has two dependents who live with her because they are orphans. In 1999, Biesha established her traditional African cloth business. Working seven days a week, eight hours a day, and assisted by her children and two employees, she earns about $150 every month. Biesha now requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of traditional African cloth in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of traditional African cloth.

loans.name: Wadjindé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Wadjindé A. was born in 1964 in the village of Logodomé. Married to a farmworker, she has focused on growing corn for more than two decades. The income she makes from this business is almost entirely eaten up by the daily household expenses, since her husband’s income is very inadequate. She therefore lacks any working capital and is requesting a loan in order to boost her business. This will enable her to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Wadjindé est née en 1964 dans le village de Logodomé. Mariée à un cultivateur, elle s’est donnée au commerce de maïs depuis une vingtaine d’années. Le revenu qu’elle tire de cette activité est quasiment consommé par les dépenses quotidiennes du ménage parce que le revenu de son mari est très insuffisant. Ainsi, elle manque de fonds de roulement et sollicite un crédit pour ce relancer. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer la qualité de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell corn

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.fr:
Ndeye G. is a young woman who was born in 1980. She lives in the Lamy district, in the city of Thies. Ndeye is a seamstress by profession and runs her business out of her home. With this loan she wants to buy a new sewing machine, so she can complete her orders on time and increase her income.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Ndeye G. est une jeune femme née en 1980. Elle vit au quartier cité lamy de thies. Elle est une couturière de profession et gère son activité chez elle. Avec ce pret elle veut acheter une nouvelle machine pour terminer ses commandes à temps et maximiser ses revenus.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Momodu's Group

texts.en: Members of this group are Mamodu S., Alpha T., Bernette K., John Roman K. and Lamin Foday. They are requesting a loan of US$ 1,700. They`ll use their loan either to give to their wives for their retail businesses or to buy building materials. As for John Roman K., he will use his to further educate himself. As monthly wage earners, these soldiers will be paying SMT through their paymaster.

loans.use: To give to  their wives to invest in their current businesses

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi B. was born in 1976 in Logodomé in the Vo prefecture. He is married and the father of two children. A builder by trade, he is also involved in other activities, such as storekeeping and stock farming. He wants to buy a motorcycle taxi to have an additional source of income. To do so, he is requesting a loan for a term of 16 months. Achieving this goal will enable him to provide for his family’s needs. 
Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer. 

Monsieur B. Koffi est né en 1976 à Logodomé dans la préfecture de vo. Il est marié et père de deux enfants. Maçon de  profession ; il exerce aussi d’autres activités comme le commerce et l’élevage. Il veut acheter un taxi –moto pour avoir une source de revenu de plus. 

La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Dorah K., who is married and has one child, aged 30. She has two dependents who live with her because they are attending school in the area.  In 2006, Dorah established her pharmacy business. Working seven days a week, 10 hours a day, and assisted by two employees, she earns about $70 every month.  Dorah has already received and repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase an additional stock of medicines. In the future, Dorah plans to renovate her business place. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional an stock of medicines.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou B., whom everyone calls Amicollé, is the manager of a health cooperative. Concurrently, she runs a shop out of her home, which she has entrusted to her sister. Her business hinges on the retail sale of livestock feed, including millet, maize, and sorghum. With this loan she hopes to increase her inventory in order to maximize profits during the rainy season.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Aissatou B. dite, amicollé, est gérante d'une mutuelle de santé. Paralèlement, elle a un magasin chez elle qu'elle a confié à sa soeur. Son commerce est axé sur la vente au détail d'aliments de bétail, notamment le mil, le mais, le sorgho. Avec ce pret elle compte renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de tirer le maximum de profit durant l'hivernage.

loans.use: Sale of Livestock Feed

loans.name: Hointossoudé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Hointossoudé A. was born in 1957 in Tokpli-glimé. Married and the mother of five children, she lives with her entire family in the village of Logodomé. Extremely conscientious, she specializes in rearing and selling goats. The problems she faces are financial, since she does not have enough money to build an enclosure for the goats or buy more goats, which means her income is very low. She is requesting a loan to buy some goats and build an enclosure. Achieving this goal will enable her to increase her income.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Hointossoudé est née en 1957 à Tokpli-glimé. Mariée et mère de cinq enfants, elle vit avec toute sa famille dans le village de Logodomé. Très dévouée, elle est spécialisée dans l’élevage et la vente de chèvres. Les difficultés qu’elle rencontre sont d’ordre financier, car elle manque d’argent pour construire un enclos pour les chèvres et pour en acheter d’autres ; ce qui rend son rendement très faible. Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter des chèvres et construire un enclos. La réalisation de ce projet va lui permettre d’améliorer son revenu.

loans.use: To buy some goats

loans.name: Alpha's Group

texts.en:
This group of soldiers are requesting a loan of Le 5,000,000.00 Their names are: A. M., Morie Lahai, Mohamed A., Umaru K. and Abdul K.. Their leader, A. M., was born in Kenema in the east of Sierra Leone. He is 32, married with 3 children. A. combines military work with photography at the barracks. He snaps photos of his colleagues, for a fee, during festive times or whenever there is something official going on. A. will use his loan to buy rolls of films and a new camera.

His other colleagues, like Morie Lahai and Mohamed A. want to use their loans to build houses, while Umaru K. wants to use his loan to buy furniture. Abdul K. wants the loan to give to his wife for her retail business.

loans.use: Buy a new camera and rolls of films

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Mr D. is about fifty years old and lives in the Cité Lamy neighborhood in Thiès. With help from his son, who lives abroad, he managed to create a business. For six years, he's been buying goods in Rosso (Mauritania) and reselling them to the local merchants as well as to his neighbors. With this loan, he would like to increase his working capital.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

mr D. est un quinquagénaire qui habite au quartier cité lamy de thies.avec l'aide de sonfils qui vit à l'étranger il a pu démarrer son ptit commerce depuis plus de six ans .son activité consiste à aller à rosso pour s'approvisionner pour venir revendre ses marchandises aux commerçants de la place mais aussi à ses voisins.avec ce pret il veut renforcer davantage son fonds de roulement .

loans.use: To increase the working capital of his business

loans.name: Gbassivi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Gbassivi B. (née Ego), born in 1972 in Egocopé, is a storekeeper who currently lives in Logodomé in the Vo prefecture. She is married and has three children. In view of her increasing business, she is requesting financing in order to sell food products. She plans to use this funding to develop her business, and she will then be able to improve the living conditions of her family and most particularly ensure that her children can go to school, since their father’s meager income falls short of meeting all the household expenses.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame B. Gbassivi née EGO en 1972 à Egocopé, est une commerçante qui vit actuellement à Logodomé précisément dans la préfecture de Vo. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Vu l’évolution de son activité, elle sollicite un financement pour vendre des produits alimentaires. Par ce financement, elle compte progresser dans son commerce et sera capable d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et surtout assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants car leur papa par son maigre revenu n’arrive pas à couvrir toutes les charges de la maison.

loans.use: Food sales

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 56-year-old Zuhura M., who is married and has four children aged between 19 and 36. She has two dependents living with her because they are orphans. In 2007, Zuhura established her traditional African cloth business. Working 7 days a week, and 11 hours a day, she earns about $200 every month from this business. Zuhura has already received and repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of traditional African cloth in bulk. In the future, she plans to renovate her place of business. Zuhura thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women..

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of traditional African cloth.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi A. is 32 years old and originally from the village of Yohonou, but today he has opened a hardware shop in downtown Amégnran. He is married and the father of five children. His shop is in a favorable location, since it is the only shop in the area that sells hardware. However, Mr. Koffi A. lacks the financial means to respond to the high demand he faces. Therefore, he is requesting funding that will improve his sales and revenue.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

De 32 ans d’âge, Monsieur A. Koffi est originaire du village de Yohonou. Mais aujourd’hui, il a ouvert une boutique de quincaillerie à Amégnran-centre. Il est marié et père de cinq enfants. Son point de vente se situe à un endroit très favorable puis qu’il est le seule à vendre les articles de la quincaillerie. Mais face à la forte demande, Monsieur A. Koffi manque de moyens financiers pour y répondre. Ainsi, il sollicite un financement. Ceci va améliorer son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu.

loans.use: Hardware shop

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Dorothy N., who is married and has four children aged between 3 and 15. In 1998, Dorothy established her tailoring business. Working six days a week, 11 hours a day, and assisted by her husband and one employee, she earns about $50 every month from this business. Dorothy now requests a loan in order to purchase an additional sewing machine, as well as cloth and thread. In the future, she plans to open another business. Dorothy thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sewing machine, cloth and thread.

loans.name: Augustine S.k.'s Group

texts.en: These are Augustine S.K. K., Andrew B., Ibrahim K., Abu-Bakarr K. and Mohamed K.. They want a loan of US$ 1,650.  Augustine will invest this loan in his education; Andrew B. will give his share to his wife to do business with; Ibrahim K. will buy building materials with his share to complete the building proccess he has begun; Abu-Bakarr will give his share to his wife to invest  in the business she is currently doing, and Mohamed K. will use his on his childrens` education. Augustine (left) takes leadership of this group. He is 33, born in Kailahun and he has 3 children.

loans.use: To further educate himself

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Zainabu R., who is married and has two children aged four and nine. She has two other dependents who live with her because they are attending school in the area.. In 2008, Zainabu established her charcoal business. Working six days a week, and 11 hours a day, she earns about $230 every month. She now requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of charcoal. In the future, Zainabu plans to to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

These small, black, and dirty pieces of dry earth are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal), and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Born on November 23, 1977 in Lomé, Mrs. Abla A. currently lives in the village of Amégnran where she works as a hair stylist. Married and the mother of two children, she is the owner of a hair salon called COIFFURE ENYONAM. Modernization calls for the use of up-to-date and adapted appliances in order to be competitive. Faced with an ever growing and demanding clientele, she is requesting a loan to buy a hair-dryer and cosmetic products. This will allow her to respond appropriately to the expectations of her customers.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 23 novembre 1977 à Lomé, Madame A. Abla réside aujourd’hui dans le village d’Amégnran où elle exerce son métier de coiffure. Mariée et mère de deux enfants, elle est propriétaire d’un salon de coiffure nommé COIFFURE ENYONAM. La modernisation impose l’utilisation des instruments adaptés et modernes pour être compétitif. Face à sa clientèle sans cesse croissante et exigeante, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter un séchoir et des produits cosmétiques. Ceci lui permettra de répondre valablement aux attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products and hair-dryers.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 54-year-old Frida C., who is married and has four children aged between 17 and 35. She has one dependent living with her because he is an orphan. In 1999, Frida established her poultry business and is assisted by her children and one employee. She now requests a loan in order to purchase additional chicks and feed. In the future, she plans to to open another business. Frida thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku. Who or what are ‘kuku’, you may ask. Kuku is Swahili for chickens, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiple naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and feed.

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 65-year-old Zena M., who is married and has four children aged between 20 and 40. In 1998, Zena established her fish business. Working seven days a week, 10 hours a day, and assisted by her children, she earns about $100 every month. Zena now requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of fish. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish.

loans.name: Osman's Group

texts.en:
The following military personnel are requesting a loan of US$ 1,700. They are: Osman M., Patrick T., Mohamed S., Borbor Patrick S. and Mohamed T.. All of these except Mohamed S. want to give their loans to their wives to invest in their current businesses. For Mohamed, he wants to invest his in his academic pursuits.

Osman M. who assumes leadership of this group was born in Kabala but is presently working in Makeni. He is 28, married with 2 children.

loans.use: Give to their wives to invest in their current businesses

loans.name: Anani Nestor

texts.fr:
Mr. Anani Nestor S. was a taxi driver by profession. He left this job in order to run his own small business selling well water in rural and urban settings. He is the father of six children who are all in school, and his expenses continue to rise due to the industry’s significant competition in urban settings. Worried about dealing with weaker profits in urban areas, he decided to increase his service locations in rural areas by requesting financial support for acquiring new materials – namely, a motor-pump, generator and tank for the opening of a well water sales location in a neighboring town. The loan will allow him to increase his financial performance and to better address the needs and development of himself and his family.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Anani Nestor était un chauffeur de Taxi de profession. Il la laissé aujourd’hui au profit de sa propre petite entreprise de vente d’eau de forage en milieu rural et urbain. Père de six enfants, tous scolarisés et dont les charges ne cessent d’augmenter dues à la concurrence remarquable de son activité en milieu urbain. Dans le souci de pallier à cette faiblesse de rendement en milieu urbain, il a décidé d’augmenter ses points de services en milieu rural en sollicitant un appui financier pour s’acquérir de nouveaux matériels à savoir moto-pompe, groupe électrogène, tank pour l’ouverture d’un point de vente d’eau de forage dans un village voisin. Le crédit lui permettra d’augmenter son rendement financier et mieux faire face aux charges de la famille pour son plein épanouissement.

loans.use: Well construction

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 44-year-old Mariam K., who is married and has four children between the ages of 17 and 26. In 1998, Mariam established her grocery business. Working six days a week, 11 hours a day, and assisted by her husband, she earns about $70 every month. Mariam now requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk.. In the future, she plans to to increase the quantity and range of her stock.. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beans, rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Matrona

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Matrona N., who is married and has two children aged 12 and 15. In 2006, Matrona established her used clothing business. Working seven days a week, 10 hours a day, and assisted by her husband and one employee, she earns about $310 every month from this business . Matrona is now requesting a loan in order to purchase an additional stock of used clothing. In the future, she plans to to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost, and the general appeal of anything western or modern. Some argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress; however the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

loans.use: To purchase an additional stock of used clothes.

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
A young building draftsman by profession, Mr. Yao A. was not able to open his own office, and began selling generic products – in particular GNLD (Golden Neo-Life Diamite) products – in order to provide for his two children and his wife. Hoping to increase his supply, he is requesting a loan to better accomplish his goals. Such a loan will have a great financial impact on his family given the significant increase in profit that he will have earned.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Jeune dessinateur bâtiment de profession, Monsieur A. Yao n’étant pas en mesure d’ouvrir son propre cabinet, il s’est lancé dans la vente des produits génériques spécialement les GND (Golden Neonlife Diamite) pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille de deux enfants et une femme. Voulant augmenter sa capacité d’approvisionnement, il sollicite un crédit pour mieux réaliser son projet. Ce crédit ainsi débloqué aura une grande répercussion financière dans sa famille sans oublier la nette augmentation du profit réalisé auparavant.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of generic products.

loans.name: François Yely

texts.fr:
Mr S. is about forty years old, married, and lives with his children. He works as a watchman, but when Tabaski (Eid al-Adha) is approaching, he also buys some sheep to resell them during the feast. He has done so for three years, and is seeking this loan to carry on with this business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr S. est un homme d'une quarantaine d'année qui est marié et vie avec ces enfants. En effet il intervient dans le secteur du gardiennage mais en meme temps à l'approche des fetes de la Tabaski il achete des moutons pour les revendre pendant les et cela depuis trois ans. C'est dans le but de cette operation qu'il sollicite ce pret.

loans.use: To buy sheep to resell during Tabaski (Eid al-Adha)

loans.name: Mohamed Lamin's Group

texts.en: This group of soldiers are requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 1,375. Three of them will give their share of the loan to their wives to invest in business so that the proceeds they get from these businesses will complement their salaries. The other two will use theirs to complete the building of houses they have already started. Their names are (right to left), Mohamed Lamin M., Mohamed M. K., Saidu Kabba, Peter K. and Sulaiman  K.. Mohamed Lamin M. (for this purpose) is the leader of this group. He is 27, born in Kailahun, over 150 miles from Makeni. He has two children who are currently living in Freetown with their mom. His wife will invest this loan in her current soft drink business.

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a thirty-five year old mother with two children. She lives in the community of Huayllapampa, situated thirty minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Marina and her husband make hand-crafted bricks (unbaked) that they sell to people who finish the process. Additionally, Marina has a store where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meat.

Marina is a member of the Violeta Village Bank.

Marina needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($375 US Dollars) to invest in rice, sugar, oil, and noodles to expand her business.

Marina’s dream is to expand her business and see her children finish their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in rice, sugar, oil, and noodles to expand her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa owns 3 motorcycle taxis and sells chicken feed for a living. She has 5 children, 2 of whom are still in school. One of the motorcycle taxis is driven by her husband, Oswaldo. This couple works in unity in order to help their children pursue higher education. Oswaldo is in charge of the motorcycles, while Rosa manages the business. In the future, they wish to open a lube center. Therefore, Rosa is requesting this loan in order to give her motorcycle taxis maintenance, purchase spare parts, and rent a business space in which to sell motor oil.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa es propietaria de 3 motocarros y también se dedica a la venta de comida para pollos, ella tiene 5 hijos, 2 de ellos aún estudiantes.Uno de los motocarros es manejado por su esposo, Oswaldo, esta pareja trabaja en unidad para brindarle a sus hijos, estudios universitarios. Oswaldo, está al cuidado de las motos y Rosa es quien administra el negocio.En adelante tienen el deseo de abrir un lubricentro, para ello Rosa solicita el presente préstamo para dar mantenimiento a sus motocarros, comprar algunos repuestos que necesitan y alquilar un local para la venta de lubricantes. Apoya a esta pareja a continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Give maintenance to/purchase spare parts for motorcycle taxis, and rent a business space for motor oil sales

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a fifty-nine year old married mother with nine children. Gregoria works in the central street in the city of Ayacucho, where she sells “cancha” (corn snacks) from 2:00 PM in the afternoon to 10:00 PM at night from a cart. She buys the ingredients for the cancha and makes them herself. Additionally, Gregoria sells sweets and canchas at different city events.

Gregoria is a member of the Violeta Village Bank

Gregoria needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($375 US Dollars) to invest in more corn and oil to expand her business.

Gregoria´s dream is to have a stable grocery store and supply her business, while having a home of her own.

loans.use: to invest in more corn and oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Ms. Matilde C. is 34 years of age and sells sweets for a living. She also owns a stand in the local market in which she sells chicken. This mother works for her 5 children, whom she would like to see earn a college education. Matilde gives thanks to God daily for having such wonderful children. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to increase her merchandise and obtain bigger profits to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Matilde de 34 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de golosinas y también tiene un puesto en el mercado de su localidad donde vende carne de pollo. La razón del trabajo de esta madre son sus 5 hijos y brindarles estudios universitarios, Matilde diariamente da gracias a Dios por tener unos hijos maravillosos. El préstamo que solicita es para incrementar el capital de su negocio, aumentar su mercadería y obtener mayores ganancias para el sustento de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Adjowavi

texts.fr:
Born in Attitogon in 1964, Mrs. Adjowavi M. currently lives in Blamacondji with her husband, who is a farmer, and her five children. Being illiterate, she learned early on that working on the land is always reliable. Known as a devoted woman, she is becoming an example among women during the agricultural period. This year she has high hopes for the new crop season. To accomplish her goals, she is requesting this loan in order to rent land and buy fertilizer to enrich the soil. This way she will be able to expect a good harvest, allowing her to better provide for the many needs of her family.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Attitogon en 1964, Madame M. Adjowavi vit actuellement à Blamacondji avec son mari cultivateur et ses cinq enfants. Analphabète, elle a compris très tôt que le travail de la terre ne trompe jamais. Reconnue comme une femme très dévouée, elle devient une référence parmi les femmes en période agricole. Cette année tout son espoir se repose sur la nouvelle campagne agricole. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite ce crédit pour louer les terres et acheter de l’engrais pour nourrir les sols. Ainsi, elle pourra s’attendre à une bonne récolte qui lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux nombreux besoins de sa famille. ra à mieux satisfaire les besoins des personnes à sa charge.

loans.use: Renting land and purchasing fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Cancio

texts.es:
Mr. Cancio Y. works in public transportation with his motorcycle taxi. He has 2 school age children, who are his reason for getting ahead in life. He is a 39-year-old man who works arduously on a daily basis because he would like to be able to provide for his children’s college education. Cancio needs to repair his motorcycle taxi and purchase another one, which will allow him to obtain greater profits. Furthermore, he would like to hire a responsible driver, which means that he will be creating a job for someone else, much like the chance that he had once been given. He needs a loan in order to realize his dream.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Cancio se dedica al transporte público de pasajeros, es propietario de un motocarro, es padre de 2 hijos que aún estudian y son su razón de seguir adelante. Tiene 39 años, a diario trabaja arduamente porque es su deseo poder pagar la universidad de sus hijos. Cancio tiene la necesidad de reparar su motocarro y poder comprar otro, para así, obtener mayores ganancias, además de contratar a un chofer responsable, con lo que estaría brindando trabajo, como una vez se lo dieron a él. Para esto necesita de un préstamo para realizar su sueño.

loans.use: Repair motorcycle taxi and purchase a second one

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Mariluz is a 26-year-old mother of one daughter, who means a lot to her and fuels her desire for self-improvement. She lives with her husband, Sergio, who owns a motorcycle taxi business. Mariluz has been selling groceries and basic need items for several years. With this business, she has been able to help with the family expenses. Due to her charisma and kindness, Mariluz has many customers, which is why she needs to expand and develop her business, eventually converting it to a mini market. In order to do this, she requires this loan so that she can achieve the plans that she has laid out.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariluz tiene 26 años y es madre de 1 hija que significa mucho para ella, sobre todo sus ganas de superación, ella vive junto a su esposo Sergio quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en motocarro. Mariluz se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad desde hace años atrás, y con ello contribuir con los gastos familiares. Debido al carisma y amabilidad en su trato Mariluz tiene gran cantidad de clientes, por ello se encuentra en la necesidad de aumentar e implementar su negocio y posteriormente convertirlo en un minimarket, por ello requiere del presente préstamo para lograr su meta trazada.

loans.use: Expand general store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a thirty-eight year old married mother with four children. Elvira has a stand in the “April 12” market where she sells groceries with the help of her husband. Additionally, Elvira has another stand in the “F. Vivanco” market where she sells ingredients to make traditional breads, sold exclusively during community events. She also has opportunities to sell mustard, tomato sauce, vinegar, and soya sauce to different chicken restaurants in the city.

Elvira is a member of the Violeta Village Bank.

Elvira needs a loan of 2400 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($850 US Dollars) to invest in rice, sugar, milk, condiments, and various soups.

Elvira´s dream is to advance her children´s education and have a large store and a chicken restaurant.

loans.use: to invest in rice, sugar, milk, condiments, and various soups.

loans.name: Assanvi

texts.fr:
Born in Attitogon in 1972, Mr. Assanvi T. currently lives with two people in his care despite remaining single. A kind, calm and dynamic man, Mr. Assanvi T. is a standard farmer. Respected by his neighbors, he loves to work on the land, and it is indeed this work that generates his income. The crop season having just begun, he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to use on his corn in hopes of yielding a good production. This will allow him to produce more, and to better provide for those in his care.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né à Attitogon en 1972, Monsieur T. Assanvi bien que demeurant célibataire, vit actuellement à Blamacondji avec deux personnes à sa charge. Brave homme, calme et dynamique, Monsieur T. Assanvi est un cultivateur de référence. Estimé par ses voisins, il adore le travail de la terre. C’est d’ailleurs de ce travail qu’il tire ses revenus. Cette campagne ayant encore commencé, il sollicite un crédit pour acheter de l’engrais qu’il mettra aux pieds de ses maïs afin d’espérer une bonne production. Par ce moyen, il parviendra à plus produire et à mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses personnes en charge.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for crop farming

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha has been selling fast food for a long time. At 32 years of age, she has demonstrated that she is a proactive woman who spreads joy to those who know her. By means of her job, she has been able to move her 5 children forward, and they in turn take the fullest advantage of getting ahead. Martha is a woman with the desire for self-improvement. As a result, she wants to expand and develop her business because it is located in a commercial zone. She has the support of her husband, Segundo, who helps her out a great deal in her business. However, in order to reach her objective—having a kiosk made that will better welcome her patrons—she needs a sum of money to invest in her business, thus fulfilling the plans that she has laid out.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace mucho tiempo, a sus 32 años demuestra ser una mujer proactiva que contagia alegría a todo aquel que la conoce. Mediante su trabajo está sacando adelante a sus 5 hijos, quienes aprovechan lo máximo para salir adelante. Martha es una mujer con deseos de superación, pues ella quiere ampliar e implementar su negocio puesto que se encuentra ubicada en una zona comercial. Ella cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de Segundo, su esposo, quien la apoya mucho en este su negocio. Sin embargo, para cumplir su objetivo, mandar a construir un kiosco para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes, ella estima de una cantidad de dinero que invertirá en su negocio y de esta manera cumplir con su meta trazada.

loans.use: Have a kiosk made in order to improve customer service

loans.name: Rosine

texts.fr:
Born in Attitogon in 1979, Mrs. Rosine T. is a young, married woman. A mother of one, she is responsible for seven people. Making cassava flour is her business. She buys standing cassava plants, digs out the root, peels off the skin, grinds it, and wrings it to get the leaven which she roasts. This is how she gets her cassava flour, which is ready to consume. Well liked by consumers, cassava flour is in great demand. Today, in worrying about increasing her production, she is seeking this loan to buy more cassava plants. This will help Mrs. Rosine T. to better provide for the numerous needs of her family.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Attitogon en 1979, Madame T. Rosine est une jeune femme mariée. Mère d’un enfant, elle supporte au total sept personnes. La production du gari est son activité.. Elle achète les maniocs sur pieds, qu’elle déterre, épluche l’écorce, le fait moudre, l’essore pour finalement avoir le levain qu’elle torrifie. Ainsi elle a son gari qui n’est que la farine du manioc près à consommer . Bien apprécié par les consommateurs, la farine du manioc est très demandé sur le marché. Aujourd’hui, dans le souci d’augmenter sa production, elle sollicite ce crédit pour plus acheter du manioc. Ceci pourra aider Madame T. Rosine à mieux subvenir aux nombreux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase cassava with which to make cassava flour

loans.name: Karen Roxana

texts.en:
Karen is a thirty-six year old married mother with four children. Karen and her husband have motor-taxis that they rent to people that transport passengers around the city of Ayacucho. They originally bought one motor-taxi with their savings and loan and now they have three motor-taxis with plans to buy one more. Additionally, Karen works in a notary´s office as an administrative assistant.

Karen is a member of the Violeta Community Bank

Karen needs a loan of 2600 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($925 US Dollars) to invest in another motor-taxi to expand her business.

Karen´s dream is to be economically established with a house she owns, to see her children become professionals, and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to invest in another motor-taxi to expand her business.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
The flavor that Gladis gives to her dishes drove her to build a food sales kiosk in her home because her patrons deserved better service. Gladis, a 26-year-old mother of two, is an amazing woman because at her young age, she shows many young mothers that people can move ahead if they resolve to do so. Gladis gets support from her partner, who works as a bricklayer. Gladis needs to keep succeeding in her business, which is why she wants to expand, develop, and give atmosphere to her business. In order to do all these things, she is requesting a loan from you. Gladis awaits your speedy response.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Su buena sazón para la comida hizo que Gladis construyera en un espacio de su propio domicilio un kiosco para la venta de comida, pues sus clientes merecían una mejor atención. Gladis a sus 26 años es madre de 2 hijos, mujer sorprendente, ya que a su corta edad demuestra a muchas madres jóvenes que si se puede salir adelante cuando uno se lo propone. Gladis tiene el apoyo de su pareja, el cual trabaja como albañil. Gladis quiere seguir surgiendo en su negocio y para ello quiere ampliar, ambientar e implementar nuevas cosas en su negocio, para todo ello de una cantidad de dinero que solicita a ustedes en préstamo. Gladis espera su pronta respuesta.

loans.use: Expand and improve her food sales kiosk

loans.name: Serigne

texts.fr:
Mr Serigne Cissé has been a merchant for more than four years. At this time, he is single and without children. He's been a member of the mutual association for several months, and seeks this loan to increase his stock of food products.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

mr serigne cissé est commerçant qui pratique cette profession depuis plus de quatre ans.actuellement c'est un célibataire sans enfants .il est membre de la mutuelle depuis quelques mois et sollicite ce pret pour renforcer son stock de denrées alimentaires.

loans.use: To increase his stock of food products

loans.name: Luz Angélica

texts.es:
Luz has worked selling food for a long time now in a food stand in her town’s market. She works to support her children and help her husband with their expenses, reasons for which she does not lose her desire to move forward. Her children help her a lot with her work when they are not doing schoolwork. Luz is 37 years old and has a great desire to improve her life. One of the things that she would like to improve is her housing and for this she needs to buy construction materials which is why all of her profits from food sales are being saved for this goal. Luz is requesting a loan which she will invest in the purchase of ingredients to increase the number of meals that she sales each day which will allow her to obtain higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

Luz se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace ya mucho tiempo en un puesto del mercado de su localidad, ella trabaja para sacar adelante a sus hijos y desde luego para apoyar con los gastos a esposo, motivo por el cual no pierde sus ganas de seguir adelante. Sus hijos la apoyan mucho en su trabajo durante sus momentos libres del estudio. Luz tiene 37 años y muchas ganas de progresar en la vida, una de las cosas que desea es mejorar su vivienda y para ello necesita comprar materiales de construcción, por ello todas las ganancias de la venta de comida están siendo ahorradas con este fin. Luz solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de insumos para aumentar la cantidad de platos que vende diariamente, y así obtener mayores ganancias.

loans.use: To buy food and cooking ingredients to increase the number of meals that she sells daily.

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr:
Mr. Komlan T. was born in 1969 in Attitogon. He currently lives in Toulassicondji with his six children for whom he is responsible. He breeds pigs. Nicknamed “Meat Papa” by his customers, he is trying to meet the needs of meat consumers. He is seeking this loan to buy piglets and to build a pigpen. In eight months, Mr. Komlan T. will be able to sell his animals and earn enough money. The funds will be used to pay back his loan and improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur T. Komlan est né en 1969 à Attitogon. Il vit actuellement à Toulassicondji aux côtés de ses six enfants à charge. Il pratique le petit élevage de porcs. Surnommé par ses clients PAPA VIANDE, il fait aujourd’hui, un grand effort pour être à la hauteur des besoins en consommation de viande. Il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des petits porcs , de son et aménager son enclôt. Dans huit mois, Monsieur T. Komlan pourra vendre ses bêtes et gagner assez d’argent. Les fonds lui serviront à rembourser son crédit et à rendre les conditions de vie de sa famille meilleures.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Janina

texts.es:
Janina is 25 years old and has two children who are the job of her life. She is the owner of a car driven by her husband, Eliseo, which is used urban passenger transportation. Both want to give their children what they need by providing for their education, food and healthcare. Janina wants to improve the means of her employment, which is why she needs to buy parts and get her motor-car fixed as it is the only form of sustenance that she has. Janina’s plan is to save enough to be able to open a small grocery shop in her home in the future. As her house is located in a highly transited place it will ensure a better life for her family. She needs capital to be able to achieve her objective which is why she is asking for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

Janina tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, los mismos que son la razón de su vida, ella es propietaria de un motocarro que es manejado por su pareja, Eliseo, en el transporte urbano de pasajeros. Ambos desean brindar a sus niños lo necesario, velar por su educación, alimentación y salud. Janina quiere mejorar su herramienta de trabajo, para ello requiere comprar repuestos y mandarlo a arreglar, ya que su motocarro es el único sustento que tienen. En lo planes de Janina está el ahorra lo suficiente para más adelante abrir una bodega para la venta de abarrotes, ya que su casa se encuentra ubicada en un lugar muy transitable y así asegurar una mejor vida para su familia.Ella requiere de capital para lograr su objetivo. Por lo que solicita su apoyo.

loans.use: To buy parts in order to repair their motor-car with which they provide transportation for passengers.

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor Manuel is 25 years old, he is a young father with dreams of prosperity. He works hard as a driver of a “motocarro” (motorized 3 wheel cart).
