Him and his partner have a 1 year old girl, they hope that one day she has a profession. Victor Manuel wants to buy parts to fix his motocarro. With the money from his job he wants to fix his house, he requests a loan with the promise to repay it on time and he thanks in advance for the attention you give to his request.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Víctor Manuel, de 25 años es un joven padre con muchos sueños de prosperidad, por eso es que trabaja arduamente, él se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, es chofer y propietario de un motocarro. Él y su pareja tienen una niña de 1 añito de edad, que esperan más adelante sea una profesional.Víctor Manuel quiere comprar repuestos para su motocarro para luego mandarlo a reparar. Con las ganancias de su labor como transportista desea arreglar algunas estructuras de su vivienda, por ello que solicita en presente préstamo con la promesa de cumplir puntualmente con sus pagos, y agradece de ante mano la atención a su pedido.

loans.use: Purchase parts to fix his motorcycle and transport passengers.

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es:
Aquiles is 51 years old, he is a single father of 2 students. He works buying and selling grains (corn, beans and others) to help support his home, and to pay for the studies of his children. Aquiles wishes to buy more merchandise and take advantage of the season now, because there will be less grain later, he is also thinking of renting a space to sell the grains. For these reasons, he requests a loan through here, hoping to find people that believe in him and in his work and who help him achieve prosperity.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Aquiles tiene 51 años, es padre soltero, tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando, él se dedica a la compra y venta de granos (maíz, fréjol y otros) lo que le ayuda a sostener su hogar, y a pagar los estudios de sus hijos. Aquiles desea abastecerse de más productos, ya que quiere aprovechar la temporada, pues en adelante serán escasos, así mismo, tiene pensado alquilar un local para la venta de su granos. Con estos motivos ingresa su pedido de préstamo por este medio, para que pueda encontrar personas que crean en su trabajo y esfuerzo y lo apoyen a favor de su prosperidad.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale grains to sell them later

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a forty-eight year old married mother with four children. Luisa travels to different regional fairs once a week to buy animals, like cows, goats, and pigs. After purchasing, she transports the animals to the city of Ayacucho where she sells them. Occasionally, she sells the animals in a small market in San Juan.

Luisa is a member of the Violeta Community Bank.

Luisa needs a loan of 2600 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($925 US Dollars) to buy cows, goats, and pigs to expand her business.

Luisa´s dream is to proviD. a good education for her children and have a car to transport her livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows, goats, and pigs to expand her business.

loans.name: Kokou Jean

texts.fr:
Born in Attitogon in 1981, Mr. Kokou Jean A. is a young, married man. He is responsible for five people. Farming is his main occupation. He started working the land after elementary school, which he had to quit. Today, he makes his income by selling farm produce. At the beginning of every crop season, armed with his tools, Mr. A. leaves his house every morning and returns in the evening. In order to increase his yield, he is seeking this funding to buy fertilizer to enrich his land. After having sold his produce, he will be able to pay back the loan and save up for a new season.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Né à Attitogon en 1981, Monsieur A. Kokou Jean est un jeune homme marié. Il compte à sa charge un total de cinq personnes. L’agriculture est son activité principale. Il rejoint le travail de la terre après ses études primaires qu’il a dû cesser par la force de ses choses. Aujourd’hui, il tire son revenu à partir de la vente des produits agricoles. En début de chaque campagne agricole, houes sur l’épaule, coupe – coupe et poker en mains, Monsieur A. quitte tous les jours sa maison et revient, les soirs. Pour augmenter sa production, il sollicite ce financement pour acheter de l’engrais afin d’enrichi ses terres. A la vente des produits, il réussira donc à rembourser le crédit et à épargner pour une nouvelle saison.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the crop season

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a fifty-seven year old separated mother with one child. She is an unemployed teacher, but owns a convenience store at her house where she sells vegetables, meat, groceries, liquor, telephone cards, and gasoline. Additionally, Margarita travels to the city of Tambo every two weeks where she sells telephone cards and gasoline, products that she buys in the city of Lima. Margarita plans to open a small gas station at her house.

Margarita is a member of the Violeta Village Bank.

Margarita needs a loan of 1600 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($575 US Dollars) to invest in more telephone cards and gasoline.

Margarita´s dream is to buy a motor line to distribute gasoline, and to have a vacation and visit countries outside of Peru.

loans.use: to invest in more telephone cards and gasoline.

loans.name: Mamodu's Group

texts.en: These are Momodu M., Daniel T., Sayo K., Temu S. and Mamodu S.. They are all working with the military here in Makeni. They are requesting a loan of U$ 1,375.  Momodu will use part of the loan to give to his wife to do business with and with the balance he will buy himself a few pieces of furniture. Daniel and Mamodu will give theirs to their wives to do business with. Sayo said he will use his to pursue his education and Temu will use his in a house building project he has begun. Momodu M. is the leader (for this purpose) of this group. He is now 45. He was born in Koinadugu, and he is married with 4 children. His wife sells local produce.

loans.use: Give to their wives to invest in businesses and part for educational purposes

loans.name: Edjossan

texts.fr:
Mr. Edjossan A., a farmer in Afangbédjicopé, was born in 1975 in Attitogon. A father of four, he is married to a goods seller with whom he lives. Known to his business neighbors as a nice man, Mr. Edjossan A. never misses a crop season. This year, his land became sparse. To fertilize it, he is seizing the opportunity to get a loan to buy fertilizer in order to expect a good harvest. This way, he will be able to better provide for his children, especially in regards to schooling, health, and food.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Edjossan, cultivateur demeurant Afangbédjicopé, est né en 1975 à Attitogon. Père de quatre enfants, il est marié à une revendeuse avec qui il vit toujours. Bien connu par ses voisins d’activités comme un brave homme, Monsieur A. Edjossan ne manque aucune saison de culture. Cette année, ses terres sont devenues très pauvres. Pour les fertiliser, il vient saisir de cette occasion pour bénéficier d’un crédit pour acheter de l’engrais afin d’espérer à une bonne récolte. Par ce moyen, il pourra réussir à mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants surtout en matière de scolarité, de santé et alimentaire.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for farmland

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina is a humble mother. Sabina and her husband work together as farmers. They have 5 children who are the motivation for this couple. Farming can be risky during this season because of the changes in prices due to the economic situation her country is going through. However, what really affects her production is the cost of fertilizer needed for the land. This is why she requests $725 USD (2,000 soles), to be able to purchase fertilizer, improve the quality of the products and have more demand. She hopes that you can help her get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Sabina, es una humilde madre de familia, ella y su esposo tienen 5 hijos quienes son el motor de vida de esta pareja, quien juntos se dedican a la agricultura.Esta labor puede ser muy arriesgada en esta época, debido a la variación de los precios por la coyuntura económica que está viviendo su país. Pero lo que realmente afecta considerablemente su producción, es el costo de los abonos y fertilizantes necesarios para sus terrenos.Por ello que requiere la cantidad de 2000 soles para poder comprar los abonos y fertilizantes y sus productos agrícolas sean de mejor calidad y mejor cotizados en el mercado. Ella espera que usted pueda ayudarla a conseguir este monto en calidad de préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for crop land.

loans.name: Amélé Elise

texts.fr:
Born in Attivé in 1972, Mrs. Amélé Elise A. is an energetic woman. Married and a mother of two, she currently lives with her husband, a peasant, and her whole family in Blamacondji. Selling cassava flour and corn is her principal occupation. Sacks in hand, she circulates from village to village to buy her products which she sells at the local markets and to the customers in Lomé, the capital. Today, she intends to seize this opportunity to increase her buying power with this loan in order to sell more. This will allow her to improve the living conditions of her entire family and her own business conditions.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Attivé en 1972, Madame A. Amélé Elise est femme très dynamique. Mariée et mère de deux enfants, elle vit actuellement avec son mari, un paysan et toute sa famille à Blamacondji. Le commerce du gari et du maïs est son activité principale. Sacs en mains, elle circule de village en village pour acheter ses produits qu’elle revend sur les marchés locaux et aux consommateurs de Lomé, la capitale. Aujourd’hui, elle compte saisir de cette opportunité pour augmenter sa capacité d’achat à partir de ce financement afin de mieux vendre. Ce pouvoir lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de toute sa famille et ses propres conditions d’activités.

loans.use: To buy and sell cassava flour

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos has a 15 year old son, who studies in a city close to their community. He sends money biweekly for his studies and food. Carlos works hard on his crops, he even spends weeks in the farm and away from home. Carlos and his wife (who is pictured because Carlos travels frequently) try to cover all their home expenses as farmers. Both wish to increase crop production and improve the quality of their livestock to be able to increase the price. They request this loan which will be destined to purchase livestock of good breed and fertilizer for their crop land. They hope to grow as farmers with your help.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Carlos es padre de 1 hijo de 15 años quien estudia en una ciudad cercana de su localidad a donde envía quincenalmente una pensión para sus estudios y su alimentación. Carlos trabaja arduamente en sus terrenos de cultivo y hasta pasa semanas enteras en sus chacras que se encuentran lejos de su hogar. Su esposa (en la foto) y él tratan de suplir las diversas necesidades de su hogar como agricultores y ganaderos. Ambos desean incrementar su producción agrícola y mejorar la raza de su ganado para poder elevar el costo de venta. Para ello solicitan este préstamo que estará destinado a la compra de ganados de raza y a la compra de abono para sus terrenos cultivados. Ellos esperan que con su ayuda puedan crecer como agricultores y ganaderos.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for crop land and good breed livestock.

loans.name: Holonyo

texts.fr:
Mr. Holonyo A. is a young man. Single, he has no dependents. He quit school for financial reasons and started to work the land, which is what his parents do. Today a big farmer, he is looking for ways with which he will be able to increase his yield. He hopes to seize this opportunity by asking for a loan in order to buy fertilizer for his corn. After selling his crops, he will first pay back his loan and then will use the rest to meet his needs and to improve his working conditions.
 Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.
Monsieur A. Holonyo est un jeune homme. Célibataire, il n’a pas de charge. Il cessa ses études pour des raisons de support et renoua avec le travail de terres qui est celui pratiqué par ses parents. Aujourd’hui, devenu un grand cultivateur, il cherche les moyens par lesquels il pourra augmenter son rendement.

Il espère saisir de cette opportunité par solliciter un crédit afin  d’acheter de l’engrais pour ses maïs. Après la vente, il remboursera d’abord le crédit et orientera le reste à la satisfaction de ses besoins et à l’améliorer de ses conditions de travail.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Claude

texts.fr:
Claude A. was born in 1975 in Afagnan Gbleta, but at present lives in Kpoteme Kpessou. After finishing elementary school, he quit school and went to work. A healthy young man, he is married and the father of children. Today, he manages to feed his family by working the land.

Each year Claude gathers in a granary full of corn, which he later sells. He is applying for this loan at the beginning of the season in order to rent a tractor for plowing and to buy fertilizer. The income from his harvest will permit him to better provide for the needs of his children.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Claude est né en 1975 à Afagnan Gbléta. Il vit actuellement à Kpotémé Kpessou. Instruit de niveau primaire, il cessa les études et renoue avec le labour. Jeune homme vaillant, il est marié et père d’enfants. Aujourd’hui, il arrive à nourrir sa famille grâce au travail de la terre.

Chaque année, Monsieur A. Claude réussit à construire un grenier de maïs qu’il revend après. En début de cette saison, il compte solliciter ce crédit pour louer un tracteur de labour et acheter de l’engrais. Après récolte le revenu lui servira à mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: Tractor rental and purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa And Obdulia Group

texts.en:
Rosa is a forty-one year old mother with one daughter. Rosa travels to the city of Trujillo to buy footwear and to the city of Puno to buy leather jackets, DVDs, bedspreads, and sheets. She sells her products on credit to workers of well-known companies or public institutions, who pay her back at the end of each month.

Obdulia is a fifty-two year old divorced mother with two children. Obdulia sells baby and children´s clothing in a rented loft. She buys her exclusive products in the capital city of Lima with the help of her young daughter.

Rosa and Obdulia are members of the Despertar Village Bank.

Rosa and Obdulia need respective loans of 400 and 800 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($425 US Dollars) to buy more footwear, clothing, and bedspreads.

Rosa and Obdulia would both like to own their own stores one day and each hope that their children will progress to become professionals and economically established.

loans.use: to buy more footwear, clothing, and bedspreads.

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Victor is a determined man. He is committed to his occupation as a farmer mainly because thanks to that he can maintain a home and provide education to his 5 children, who go to school in the city. He has to send money for the university tuition and the necessary for their food and other expenses. He can’t stop working until his children have successfully completed their studies. Victor leaves early in the morning to go supervise his land; he goes on his horse to make the journey less tiring. He now needs to increase his production, for what he needs seeds and fertilizer. He requests this money as a loan with the goal to increase his income and cover all the needs of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Don Víctor es un hombre empeñoso y dedicado a su labor como agricultor, sobre todo porque gracias a ello puede mantener su hogar y la educación de sus 5 hijos, quienes cursan estudios en la ciudad, a donde tiene que enviar la pensión de la universidad y lo necesario para sus alimentos y otros gastos.Es así, que no puede dejar de trabajar hasta que sus hijos concluyan con éxito sus estudios. Víctor sale muy de mañana en compañía de su caballo quien hace que el recorrido hasta sus terrenos sea menos cansado.Ahora, él desea incrementar su producción y para ello necesita de semillas y de abono para su tierra, dinero que le solicita como préstamo con el fin de poder incrementar sus ingresos y cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer for land.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a fifty-five year old married mother with four children. Rita has a grain mill in her house, and with the help of several employees, she provides milling services. Rita buys cereal and processes it to later sell in different markets in the city of Ayacucho. Additionally, Rita makes dried potatoes and washes quinoa and sells them to middlemen that take them to coastal cities.

Rita is a member of the Despertar Village Bank in Ayacucho, Perú.

Rita needs a loan of 2000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($750 US Dollars) to buy more potatoes and barley.

Rita´s dream is to develop her business, have more capital, and improve her house and her children´s studies.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes and barley.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.fr:
Born in 1986 in Attitogon, Innocent A. is a energetic young man. Single at present, he has worked since quitting school. He’s in the business of selling shoes.

Innocent purchases the shoes in Lome and returns to sell them to local consumers who wish to buy them. With the upcoming peak season in mind, he is seizing this opportunity to request a loan to increase his inventory.

With the proceeds from the sale, he will repay the loan and improve his standard of living and business.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1986 à Attitogon, Monsieur A. Innocent est un jeune homme très dynamique. Aujourd’hui célibataire, il vit de son commerce après avoir cessé ses études précocement. La vente des chaussures est son activité.

Il achète les chaussures de Lomé et revient les vendre aux consommateurs locaux qui les désirent. A la pointe des fêtes qui s’annoncent, il compte saisir de cette opportunité pour solliciter ce crédit afin d’augmenter ses marchandises.

Après vente, les revenus lui serviront à rembourser le crédit et à améliorer ses conditions de vie et d’activités.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of shoes

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Mauro is the father of 8 children. They help him with the agriculture activities and are the motor that keeps him working hard for their future. He works fast to achieve quality products. The high prices of fertilizer have caused his production to slow down, he wishes to do better, have more production and increase the number of hectares with crops. To do it, he needs capital, which he requests through a loan and hopes that you can help him, this way he can look forward to a profitable production to increase his income and pay for his children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Mauro es padre D. 8 hijos quienes son su ayuda en sus actividades dentro D. L. agricultura y su motor para trabajar arduamente por su futuro, el trabaja a un ritmo acelerado para obtener productos D. calidad. Pero por los altos costos D. los abonos y fertilizantes ha disminuido su producción, L. cual desea mejorar, cultivar en mayor cantidad y ampliar sus hectáreas D. cultivos.Para ello requiere D. una inversión, dinero que solicita como préstamo y espera que usted pueda ayudar a conseguirlo, así poder tener L. esperanza D. que su producción y cosecha sean rentables para mejorar sus ingresos económicos y cubrir L. educación D. sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Patrick B.'s Group

texts.en: Patrick B. J. assumes leadership of this group. He was born in Freetown 30 years ago. He is married with 2 children. J.'s wife has been selling food items here in Makeni for the past two years now. J. will like to get a loan to give to his wife to add onto her current business. Other members of the group are: George Bating G., who wants the loan to invest in a business of some sort; George Brima K., who will use his own loan to renovate his house; and Sheka T., who wants to use his loan to continue his education. They are requesting a loan of 3,600,000.00 SLL.

loans.use: Invest in wife's business

loans.name: Eurocina Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a fifty-four year old single mother with one child. Mercedes has a stand in the “April 12” Market where she sells baby and children´s clothes, products that she acquires from the city of Lima on a monthly basis. She sells her clothing from 8:00 AM in the morning until 7:00 PM at night.

Mercedes is a member of the Despertar Village Bank in Ayacucho, Perú.

Mercedes needs a loan of 2000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($725 US Dollars) to buy more pants, diapers, clothing sets, sweaters, and drawers to further expand her business.

Mercedes´s dream is to have a large store, for her son to have a secure job, and to build a home.

loans.use: to buy more pants, diapers, clothing sets, sweaters, and drawers to expand her business.

loans.name: Ida Claudia

texts.en:
Ida Claudia is a sixty-seven year old single mother with one son. Ida Claudia had an Internet computer service business at her house which recently closed because she did not have enough customers. Ida Claudia has a new project to start a restaurant as her house is situated in a busy area.

Ida Claudia is a member of the Despertar Comunal Bank.

Ida Claudia needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($375 US Dollars) to invest in pots, plates, and tables to start her restaurant business.

Ida Claudia´s dream is to build a house, see that her new business is successful, and help her son to have a good future.

loans.use: to invest in pots, plates, and tables to start her restaurant business.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr:
Amélé A. was born in 1993 in Attitogon. She currently lives in Afangbedji Kope with her husband and their two children. She engages in the production of cassava flour, and manages to feed her children because of her endeavors. Today she is seizing the opportunity to request a loan for the purpose of buying cassava, which she will process into gari, a West African food made from the cassava tubers. The income that she will derive from this trade will permit her to both repay her loan and to improve her family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Amélé est née en 1993 à Attitogon. Elle vit actuellement à Afangbédji Kopé avec son mari et ses deux enfants. Son activité est la production de la farine du manioc. De cette activité, elle réussit à nourrit ses enfants. Aujourd’hui, elle compte saisi cette opportunité pour solliciter ce crédit afin de s’acheter du manioc qui lui servira à produire du gari. Le revenu qu’elle tirera de ce métier lui permettra d’abord à rembourser le crédit et à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille

loans.use: Purchase of cassava for processing into gari

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo is a very hard-working man who spends as much time working in agricultural production as he can. This is the only activity through which he is able to support his family, his wife and five children who are still small and students. The care of his crops requires fertilizer for a good harvest and Leonardo is experiencing tight finances that have not allowed him to purchase these fertilizers. For this, he asks for a loan, money that will help keep his farmlands producing with quality. He is awaiting your response, he hopes, with gratitude, that it will be favorable.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Leonardo es un hombre muy trabajador que dedica el mayor tiempo posible en la producción agrícola, la cual es la única actividad con la cual puede mantener a su familia conformada por su esposa y sus 5 hijos, los cuales son aún pequeños y estudiantes. El cuidado de sus cultivos requiere de abono para una buena cosecha y Leonardo está pasando por ajustes económicos que no le permiten adquirir estos abonos, por ello solicita un préstamo, dinero que le ayudaría a que sus terrenos de cultivo sigan produciendo con calidad. Él estará al pendiente de su respuesta, esperado con agradecimiento sea favorable.

loans.use: Purchase of Fertilizer for his Farmlands

loans.name: Mamerto

texts.es:
Mamerto is a 58 year-old man who has the strength and interest to continue working in agriculture, an activity that he started when he was a boy. This work helped him raise his children who are now independent, each with their own families. Because he does not have his children nearby, Mamerto feels happy to share his life with his long-time wife who gives him the strength to continue working for their well-being and, as a good woman, she provides him with love for his health. However, they are certain things that limit his production, mostly the high prices of fertilizers which are necessary for his fields and because of this he asks for a loan with the hope that you are the right person to help him in his work as a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mamerto es un hombre de 58 años de edad que sigue manteniendo la fuerza y la entereza para seguir trabajando en la agricultura, actividad que inició desde que era niño. Dicha actividad le ayudó a educar a sus hijos quienes ya son independientes y cada uno tiene su familia. A pesar que ya no tiene cerca de sus hijos Mamerto se siente feliz por compartir su vida con su pareja de toda la vida, esto le da fuerza para seguir trabajando por el bienestar de ambos y como toda buena mujer, su esposa vela con amor por su salud. Sin embargo, hay ciertas cosas que limitan su producción, que es básicamente los costosos precios de los abonos, los cuales son muy necesarios para sus terrenos, y en base a ello, solicita un préstamo con la esperanza de que usted es la persona indicada para ayudarlo en su actividad como agricultor.

loans.use: Purchase of Fertilizer for his Farmlands

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es:
Ovidio works in agriculture. For this, he leaves his home to head for his distant farmlands that he must care for and fertilize at certain times. His wife (in the photograph) tells us that, beyond the hard work Ovidio does for the good of his family, she feels that her husband tries to help her and to be a suitable help to her so that she gets ahead with her plans, like their family. They are asking for a loan to purchase fertilize with the goal that, in the coming harvest, they will have quality and profitable products. Both hope that you can meet their request for the good of their agricultural production.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ovidio es un hombre dedicado a la agricultura, por ello se ausenta de su hogar para ir rumbo a sus alejados terrenos de cultivos los cuales tiene que cuidar, abonar y fertilizar cada cierto tiempo. Su esposa (en la foto) nos comenta sobre la ardua labor que Ovidio realiza por el bien de su familia, siendo ella su pareja trata de ayudarlo y ser su ayuda idónea para seguir adelante en sus proyecciones como familia. Ellos están solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abonos con el fin de que en la venidera cosecha obtenga productos de calidad y altamente rentables.Ambos esperan que usted pueda atender a su solicitud en bien de su producción agrícola.

loans.use: Purchase Fertilizer for his Farmland

loans.name: Julián

texts.es:
Julián is a father and the head of his household. For this, he must work to cover his family’s needs, above all those of his three daughters who are students and who generate many expenses with their studies. For this, Julián thanks agriculture and the earnings he has made in it. He’s succeeded in acquiring a little money that he invested in opening a small shop that helps him with his finances and to serve his neighbors who now have access to diverse basic need products close to their houses. Julián wants to be able to establish his business and supply his shop with the best basic need products in his community. For this, he needs the loan that he asks for with the aim that you will be able to make him a loan and help him in the success of his projects.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Julián es padre y cabeza de su hogar, por ello tiene que trabajar para poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia, sobre todo la de sus 3 hijas quienes son escolares y generan diversos gastos por sus estudios.Por ello que Julián gracias a la agricultura y las ganancias que obtuvo en ello, logró adquirir un dinerito el cual invirtió en abrir una pequeña tienda que le ayuda en su economía y en servicio sus vecinos que ahora pueden tener acceso a diversos productos de primera necesidad más cerca de sus casas.Julián desea poder implementar su mercadería y surtir su tienda con los mejores productos necesarios dentro de su comunidad. Para esto requiere de dinero que solicita ante su persona con el fin de que usted pueda prestarle y ayudarlo en el logro de sus proyectos.

loans.use: Increase in Merchandise for his Shop

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Flor is the mother of a little 2-year-old girl who she watches over and for whom she cares. Thanks to agriculture and the raising of animals, she has been able to afford her household expenses and to recover from being left by her partner who betrayed her and abandoned their child. But Flor has demonstrated that despite the circumstances, she has been able to come out ahead. Now she has a great quantity of animals that she raises to later sell in markets. She wants to invest by purchasing one more cow so that she will then be able to sell milk. It is for this that she requests a loan that she will invest in continuing to grow economically to pay for her daughter’s needs and to save for the costs of her education in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Flor es madre de una pequeña niña de 2 años por quien vela y cuida. Gracias a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y reponerse del abandono de su pareja, quien la engaño y abandonó a su hija.Pero Flor ha demostrado que a pesar de las circunstancias a podido salir adelante, ahora tiene una gran cantidad de animales los cuales cría para luego venderlos en los mercados. Ella desea seguir invirtiendo en la compra de una vaca más con la cual pueda dedicarse a la venta de leche consecutivamente.Es por ello que solicita un préstamo que invertirá en seguir creciendo económicamente para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su hija y ahorro para los gastos de su futura educación.

loans.use: The Purchase of a Cow for Additional Income from Selling Milk

loans.name: Luz En El Camino-Group 3

texts.en:
Anita H. is a kind lady who is very enthusiastic about managing her business. She has been receiving loans from Esperanza for two years. She operates a shop where she sells items such as homemade bread and a variety of refreshments. She uses her loans to purchase the items that she sells and the bread ingredients.

Ms. H. is a mother of five children, ages 5, 10, 11, 13, and 19. The eldest lives with her sister. She is also a devoted member of her church, which is where she spends much of her free time. Her favorite foods are those that have coconut in them. Therefore, she enjoys making coconut specialty items to sell. Ms. H. hopes to see her business grow and provide a better life and further education for her children.

Ms. Anita H. is a member of a 5 person group (Group 3) that is part of a 30 person micro-bank called Luz en el Camino, which translates to Light in the Road in English. In the picture, Ms. H. is second from the right. She is with members of her group and other borrowers. Anita's story is just one of a list of men and women who are improving their quality of life through the help of Esperanza's micro-credit loans. This group has united with a common vision of a better life with faith and hope in their hearts and an unbreakable spirit. Each associate in this bank has a similar business, whether it is selling bread or operating a hair salon. Thank you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in the store as well as ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Philip F.'s Group

texts.en: Philip F. K. assumes leadership of this group of soldiers. He was born in Yifie. He is married with one child. Philip's wife sells local produce here in Makeni. He will use his loan to give to his wife to add onto her existing business. Other members of the group are: Thomas K., who also wants to give his loan to his wife; Samuel Christain J., who wants to invest his own loan to build a house; Majid M., who will give his to his wife to invest in her business; and Joseph G., who wants to do business with his loan. These guys will be remitting their loans to SMT through their paymaster at the end of each month. They are requesting the sum of 5,000,000 SLL.

loans.use: Give loan to their wives to invest in businesses.

loans.name: Mujeres De Vida Group

texts.en:
Members of Ms. Lourdes D. M.’s group describe her as being the “head “of the group. Energetic and ambitious, she is borrowing from Esperanza for the first time. Her group consists of young and ambitious ladies who hope to change their lives through these loans. The newly formed group is called Mujeres D’ Vida and has five members. In the picture provided, Ms. D. M. is second from the right. The sixth person (standing in the back) is their loan officer, Nelly Mercedes Pena.

Ms. D. M. is starting a food shop that specializes in selling various cheeses as well as salami and sausage. Her loan will be used to purchase the items. The business will be run out of her house. One day, she hopes to have store.

She is the mother of two children, ages five and eight. She enjoys listening to music and going to the beach. Even as she plans on starting her business, she is trying to learn English. Lourde's story is just one of a list of men and women who are improving their quality of life through the help of Esperanza's micro-credit loans . This group has united with a common vision of a better life with faith and hope in their hearts and an unbreakable spirit. Each associate in this bank has a similar business, whether it is selling cheese and meats or operating a hair salon. Thank you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase food items to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr:
Born in Attitogon in 1974, Adjowa A. is married and the mother of eight children. Adjowa engages in the production of gari, a West African food made from cassava tubers, and it is through this venture that she is able to support those in her care. Having noted the considerable demand in the marketplace, she sought this avenue to request a loan to purchase cassava to be processed and ground into flour. After its sale she will repay her loan and direct whatever is left over to the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Attitogon en 1974, Madame A. Adjowa est mariée et mère de huit enfants, A. Adjowa exerce une activité principale : la production du gari. C’est d’ailleurs de cette activité qu’elle arrive à supporter les personnes à sa charge. Ayant remarqué, que la demande est devenue importante sur le marché, elle a voulu passer par ce canal pour solliciter ce crédit afin de s’acheter de manioc qu’elle transformera en farine. Après, vente, elle remboursera son crédit et orientera le reste aux besoins familiaux.

loans.use: Purchase of cassava to make into gari

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia is a very active woman who, through her communication skills, tries to relate to people to create situations that benefit the sale of her agricultural products. The production of citrus fruits is what she most likes and makes her feel content in addition to being the principal generator of income for her home. However, one of her limitations that is developing rapidly is a problem with her health. Ofelia suffers from asthma which limits her from doing certain activities. But, without doubt, she is a very optimistic woman who struggles to keep this from harming her production and, thanks to God, until now, she has been able to work adequately. Because of a rise in the price of fertilizers, she is asking for a loan, money that will give her the opportunity to improve and maintain her production adequately.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ofelia es una mujer muy activa que por su capacidad de comunicación trata de relacionarse con las personas para abrir espacios que favorezcan la mejora de la venta de sus productos agrícolas.La producción de frutos cítricos es lo que más le gusta y la hace sentir contenta, además de ser el principal generador de ingresos en su hogar. Sin embargo una de sus limitaciones para desenvolverse con rapidez es su problema de salud, Ofelia sufre de asma, lo que la limita para realizar ciertas actividades, pero sin duda es una mujer muy optimista que lucha por que esto no perjudique su producción y gracias a Dios hasta hoy a podido trabajar adecuadamente.Debido a la alza de los precios de los abonos solicita un préstamo, dinero que le dará la posibilidad de mejorar y mantener su producción adecuadamente.

loans.use: The Purchase of Fertilizer for her Fruit Fields

loans.name: Miramar Femenina- Group 4

texts.en:
Ms. Rosa D. has accessed loans from Esperanza for four years.  She has operated her business for five years. She owns a fruit shop where she sells items ranging from bananas to melons. Although she started business a year prior to receiving her first loan, her business needed a strong financial boost from Esperanza.  Her loans are currently used to purchase the fruit that she sells. She is an avid member of her church and also enjoys going to the nearby beach and dancing. Her favorite food is fried fish.  Rosa hopes to expand her business by beginning to sell more items such as chicken.  This will increase her income and allow her to better provide for herself and her family.


Ms. Rosa D. is a member of a 5 person group (Group 4) that is part of a 35 person micro-bank called Miramar Feminina.  In the picture, Ms. D. is first on the left.  She is pictured with her group members and other members of the micro-bank. 

  Rosa's story is just one of a list of men and women who are improving their quality of life through the help of Esperanza's micro-credit loans.  This group has united with a common vision of a better life with faith and hope in their hearts and an unbreakable spirit.  Each associates in this bank has a similar business, whether it is selling fruit or operating a taxi service. Thank you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 26 year old wife and mother. She has one child who is in school.

Anita has been a food vendor for three years. She prepares and sells banku (a local dish prepared from milled maize and eaten with all kinds of local soups). Banku is a delicacy most Ghanaians eat everyday as breakfast, lunch or dinner. Anita also sells fried rice. Her business is doing well and she wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. She therefore wants to use this loan to buy more maize grains, vegetables, rice and assorted meat for her operation. She hopes this loan will help her increase her savings and thereby improve her family's well-being.

Anita is a member of the group called “Enka ho daa” (It shall come to pass). In this group, members agree to act as social collateral to guarantee access to loans and to help repay the loans for one another.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize grains, rice, vegetables, assorted meat and other groceries

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, thanks to her work, can offer her children and her family daily nutrition, but more than that, she feels active and useful for her family and helps her partner, she dedicates herself to the production and sale of citrus fruit. Although daily, this activity takes time and care she does it with a lot of optimism, knowing that thanks to this she can continue growing, not only economically, but also as a person. Victoria has many desires to be able to increase her plantation, for this she thinks to acquire more land and different plants to better the variety of her delicious products, as a result she will increase her sales and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria gracias a su trabajo puede ofrecerles a sus hijos y su familia un alimento diario, pero más que eso, ella se puede sentirse activa y útil para su familia y una ayuda para su pareja, ella se dedica a la producción y venta de frutos cítricos. Aunque diariamente esta actividad toma tiempo y cuidados ella lo ofrece con mucho optimismo, sabiendo que gracias a ello podrá seguir creciendo, no sólo económicamente, sino también como persona.Victoria tiene muchos deseos de poder ampliar sus plantaciones, para ello piensa adquirir otro terreno y adquirir plantas diferentes para aumentar la variedad de sus deliciosos productos, para así incrementar sus ventas y ganancias.

loans.use: To purchase additional lands and other plants to increase her fruit production.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Veronica is a woman who despite the difficulty, dedicates herself to agriculture and tries not to allow the harshness of the climate break her while the heat depletes her strength. She doesn’t leave work to bring daily bread to her house, she dreams of seeing her sons develop and grow healthfully. She cultivates citrus fruit, bananas, coffee, products that are very profitable in the different seasons, but the sale of coffee is responsible for the largest portion of her profits. Due to this, she desires to purchase a better quantity of plants to grow in order to produce a better quantity of coffee, therefore she requests a loan, she hopes you can lend it to her to increase her production and give her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica es una mujer que a pesar de lo difícil que es dedicarse a la agricultura trata de no dejarse doblegar por las crudas inclemencias del clima y por el calor que debilita su fuerza. Ella no deja de trabajar, ni de llevar un pan diario a su casa, con el sueño de ver a sus hijos desarrollarse y crecer sanamente. Ella cultiva frutos cítricos, plátanos y café, productos que son muy rentables en las diversas temporadas, pero la venta de café es la que más ganancias le proporciona. Debido a ello desea comprar mayor cantidad de plantas para cuidarlas y puedan producir gran cantidad de café, por esto requiere de una cantidad de dinero, que espera usted le pueda prestar para que pueda incrementar su producción y poder brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.

loans.use: To purchase more coffee plants to cultivate in her lands.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
A young teacher by profession, Koffi A. gardens on the side. Married and the father of one child, Mr. A. adds to his income from the sale of his garden produce, to be able to better provide for the needs of his small family. His clientele has grown significantly of late, and anxious to meet this demand Mr. A. is seeking financial support to purchase pesticides and a large quantity of seed. If granted, this loan would permit him to better cover family expenses and to increase their standard of living.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Jeune Enseignant de profession, Monsieur A. Koffi à pour activité secondaire le jardinage. Marié et père d’un enfant, Monsieur A. joint les revenus de la vente des produits de son jardin pour pouvoir subvenir un temps soit peu aux besoins de sa petite famille. De nos jours la demande des clients devient de plus en plus considérable, dans le souci de couvrir cette demande Monsieur A. Koffi sollicite un appui financier pour s’acheter les produits phytosanitaires et les semences en grand nombre. Ce crédit octroyé lui permettra de mieux couvrir les dépenses de sa famille et augmenter son niveau de vie.

loans.use: Purchase of seed and pesticide

loans.name: Hilarious

texts.en:
Hilarious is forty years old. He is married with one child.

Hilarious has been a carpenter for the past twenty years. Carpentry has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He owns a carpentry shop where he manufactures all kinds of furniture. He says for lack of adequate working capital, he is not able to pre-finance most of the orders from his customers. This, he said, slows down his work because he has to wait for funds from his customers before any work can begin. This is a big delay.

Therefore, he requests this loan so he can procure useful working tools and furnishing materials like polish, glue, and sand paper, which will help to improve his efficiency. Hilarious believes this will improve his income and ensure a good living for his family. He belongs to the community group called “Enka ho daa” (It shall come to pass) Trust Group. In this group, members agree to act as social collateral to guarantee access to loans and to help repay the loans for one another.

loans.use: To procure useful working tools and furnishing materials like polish, glue, and sand paper

loans.name: Magnely

texts.es:
Malgeny is a woman who works in agriculture producing citrus and bananas which is her passion, she works to help give her kids an education. For this activity she is recognized as a woman who commits herself to this work for the wellbeing of her family, she does not leave for work with the same strength everyday. In these moments, Magleny requests a loan that she will invest in her lands, above all in the purchase of coffee plants to begin with this product in addition to the fruit, she is sure that with your support she will make progress and have a prosperous harvest and future.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Magleny es una mujer que trabaja en la agricultura y la producción de cítricos y plátanos que es lo que le apasiona, trabajo que le ayudó a brindar la educación a sus hijos. Por esta actividad es reconocida como una mujer entregada al trabajo por el bienestar de su familia, ella no deja de trabajar con la misma fortaleza todos los días.En estos momentos Magleny solicita un préstamo que invertirá en sus terrenos, sobre todo en la compra de plantas de café para iniciarse con este producto aparte de la fruta, está segura que con su ayuda podrá progresar y tener una producción prospera a futuro.

loans.use: To purchase plants for fruit production, furthermore coffee plants to begin producing this product.

loans.name: Zacarías

texts.es:
Zacarías S. P. is in the cleaning business for a company in Piedras Negras. His son, Miqueas, helps him support their family. They would like to have a loan of $1,200 USD in order to build two rooms in the back their house because it is too small and their family is big. He wishes to improve their living conditions. He had already started construction of the two rooms but had to leave the project unfinished due to lack of funds.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Zacarías S. P., se dedica a la limpieza en una empresa de Piedras Negras su hijo Miqueas le ayuda para poder mantener a su familia, ellos desean un préstamo de $1,200 dlls para construir dos cuartos en la parte de atrás de su casa ya que es muy pequeña y su familia es grande y desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida. El ya había empezado la construcción de estos cuartos pero por falta de recursos la dejo sin terminar.

loans.use: Construction of two rooms

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia, thanks to fruit and coffee production has been able to fulfill her role as a mother and sustain her home, give her family security, nutrition and care for her children. Now she wants to dedicate herself to the purchase and sale of fruit and for this she needs an adequate environment and to purchase fruit at wholesale. For this she requests a loan to acquire a store where she can begin her business without leaving her position producing fruit in the fields. She hopes for your support to begin her business that she thinks will better her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Celia, gracias a la producción de fruta (cítricos) y café ha podido cumplir con su rol de madre para el sostenimiento de su hogar, brindar seguridad, alimentación y cuidado a hijos. Ahora ella desea poder dedicarse a la compra y venta de frutas y para ello tienen que contar con un ambiente adecuado y la compra de fruta al por mayor.Para ello solicita un préstamo de dinero para el alquiler de una bodega donde pueda empezar su negocio sin dejar de lado su producción de cítricos en sus terrenos de cultivos. Ella estará esperando su apoyo para así iniciar su negocio con el que espera mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To obtain a place to sell her fruit.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris is a woman who is happy with herself, because ever since she was small she liked to be surrounded by nature and the color and life of the fruit from trees. For her, her job is a place where she feels happy and thanks to it, she also knows that she could better the quality of her life and that of her family. To cover the expenses of the fertilizer for her lands and to have better products to sell in the markets, Doris requests this loan that would help her continue paying for her children’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Doris es una mujer que se siente feliz en lo que realiza, porque desde pequeña le gustó estar rodeada de la naturaleza y del colorido y vida que le dan las frutas a los árboles.Por ello su trabajo es un lugar donde se siente a gusto y que gracias a ello sabe también que podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.Para cubrir los gastos del abono de sus terrenos y tener mejores productos atractivos para la venta en los mercados, es que Doris solicita este préstamo que ayudaría a seguir solventando los estudios de sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her fruit plantation.

loans.name: Fuente Para El Desarollo- Group 2

texts.en:
Josephina K. A. has a very open and welcoming personality and loves to laugh. She lives in a small town in Samana called Las Galeras. She is the mother of four children, ages 11, 15, 16, and 19. All of them live with her except her eldest. In her spare time, she enjoys music and going to the nearby beach.

She owns a business, selling materials for shoemaK. and other products such as perfumes. The loan will be used to buy materials and the other items she sells. Ms. K. A. has been worK. with Esperanza for 2 ½ years. She was able to start her business with the help of loans she acquired. She is currently worK. out of a small wooden house. In the future she hopes to have a larger establishment maD. of stone that can withstand the weather.

Ms. Josephina K. A. is part of a 6 person group (Group 2) that is part of a 35 person micro-bank called Fuente para el Desarollo, or Fountain for Development in English. In the picture, she is in the middle with a white sleeveless shirt. The others are group members or members of their micro-bank.

Ms. A.'s story is just one of a list of men and women who are improving their quality of life through the help of Esperanza micro-credit loans. This group has united with a common vision of a better life through faith and hope in their hearts and an unbreakable spirit. Each of the associates in this bank have a similar business whether it is selling shoemaK. materials or operating a taxi service. Thank you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase shoe material and the perfumes (Avon) to be sold

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is a 28-year-old young man. He works very hard to provide food for himself and his three younger siblings.

Albert is single and he sells second hand (used) shoes and other footwear in a market center. His previous loan enabled him to start trading in used shoes. For this he is very thankful to Sinapi. Through this business, he is financing his younger brothers’ education. Albert wants to use this new loan to buy more women's shoes and slippers to meet his clients’ preferences in the market. This will enable him to make more profits.

Albert is a member of a community group called “Enka ho daa” Trust Group. Members agree to act as social collateral to guarantee access to loans and to help repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more women's shoes and slippers

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 49-years-old. He is married with one child.

William has been a publisher for the past five years. Publishing has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He owns a press shop where he prints his clients’ orders. He has requested this loan so he can procure additional tools and materials like printers, ink, and paper. This will enable him to expand his operations. William believes this will fetch extra income to improve the welfare of his family.

He belongs to the community group called “Enka ho daa” Trust Group. In this group, members act as social collateral to guarantee access to loans and assist one another in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To procure additional tools and materials like printers, ink and paper

loans.name: Timothée

texts.fr:
Monsieur K. Timothée est né en Avril 1980 à Hédjékopé dans la préfecture de VO.
Marié et père de deux enfants, il est évangéliste. Très dynamique, il  est doué dans la production d’huile de palme. Il sollicite un crédit pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Timothée K. was born in April 1980 in Hedjekope in the prefecture of Vo, Togo. Married and the father of two children, Timothée is a minister. He is very active and gifted at producing palm oil. He is seeking a loan to support his famiy and improve his standard of living.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase of palm nuts

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora N. Quispe has a business of cosmetics and the sale of clothes. She sells them from her home and sometimes she does not have anyone with whom to leave her small daughter. She also has a place in an open air market in the neighborhood of Tembladerani . She has worked with our institution for almost a year. This client has a good history of fulfilling her credit obligations, and she is very responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

LA SEÑORA FLORA N. QUISPE CUENTA CON EL NEGOCIO DE COSMETICOS Y VENTA DE ROPA SU MERCADERIA LA ADMINISTRA EN SU CASA YA QUE AVECES NO TIENE CON QUIEN DEJAR A SU PEQUEÑA HIJA, TIENE APARTE UN PUESTO AMBULANTE EN LA ZONA DE TEMBLADERANI Y TRABAJA CON NUESTRA INSTITUCIÓN CASI UN AÑO, ESTA CLIENTE TIENE UN BUEN HISTORIAL CREDITICIO DE CUMPLIMIENTO Y ES MUY RESPONSA

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 37-years-old and a widow. She has three children who are currently in school.

To support her household, Gloria has been selling soft drinks and meat pie in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She says selling soft drinks is very lucrative. Therefore, she wants to expand her inventory, which will enable her to make better income to meet her family’s needs.

Gloria is a member of the group called “Enka ho daa” (It shall come to pass). Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of soft drinks.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
For Silvia the most important thing is the well-being of her family, through her work she tries to cover their expenses and give them peace. She dedicates herself to the production of fruit, especially citrus fruit, although her work is very hard and tiring because of the strong sun, she knows that she is being rewarded with the love and smiles of her children. But without a doubt, her labor makes her feel useful as she helps her partner sustain their family, they both make an effort to succeed and do their best at their jobs. The difficulties that they face now come from a lack of money to acquire the necessary fertilizer for their cultivated lands, for this reason they request this loan, to better themselves and increase their production, a quality fertilizer will produce a quality fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Para Silvia lo más importante es el bienestar de su familia, con su trabajo trata de solventar los gastos de los suyos y brindarles tranquilidad. Ella se dedica a la producción de fruta, en especial de cítricos, aunque el trabajo es muy duro y fatigante por el fuerte sol, sabe que es recompensado con el amor y la sonrisa de sus hijos.Pero sin duda, su labor la hace sentirse útil y ayuda a su pareja con el sostén de la familia, ambos se esfuerzan por salir adelante y dar lo mejor de sí en su trabajo.Las dificultades que ahora tienen es por la falta de dinero para adquirir los abonos necesarios para sus terrenos cultivados, por ello que solicitan el presente préstamo, para la mejora y aumento de su producción, ya que un abono de calidad, se reflejará en un fruto de calidad.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for their fruit plantation.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro is a hard-working farmer because he knows that the only way he can support and provide for his loved ones is through hard work and dedication. Consequently, he leaves home every day at dawn to work in his farm and to look after his cattle and other farm animals.

Pedro wishes to improve the quality of his cattle by purchasing a best-of-breed bull, hence the request for the loan. He will always cherish the memory of all those who gave him a helping hand when he needed it by granting him his request.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Pedro es un laborioso agricultor porque sabe que la única manera de satisfacer las necesidades de sus seres queridos y brindarles lo necesario para su desarrollo es con esfuerzo y dedicación. Es así que como todo padre responsable sale todas las madrugadas rumbo a su chacra donde se dedica a abonar la tierra y regarla adecuadamente. Paralelamente se dedica al cuidado de sus animales, los que le ayudan en el trabajo del arado, por ello vela por su bienestar diariamente, porque son el apoyo para la siembra.Pedro desea mejorara la calidad de sus vacas, para ello debe comprarse un toro de mejor raza, y este el motivo por el que solicita el presente préstamo, con la esperanza de recibir atención a su pedido y con la promesa de que su agradecido corazón tendrá siempre en la memoria a las persona que le tendieron la mano cuando lo necesitó.

loans.use: Purchase of a pedigree bull to improve the quality of his cattle

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es:
Aquiles and his wife support themselves and their children by working in farming and animal husbandry. They grow potatoes and corn in their farm and sell milk and cheese produced by their cows.

They plan to purchase another cow so that they can sell more milk and cheese in markets in the surrounding towns. They hope to fulfil their plan with your help.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Aquiles es un hombre dedicado a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura, actividad que le ayudó a solventar los gastos en su hogar y sobre todo en la alimentación de sus hijos. Gracias a la crianza de vacas, puede dedicarse a la venta de leche y quesos junto con a su esposa, igualmente se dedica al cultivo de productos agrícolas tales como la papa y el maíz. Estas vacas le han traído muchas satisfacciones, por ello que desea adquirir una más con la cual puedan incrementar la cantidad queso y leche. Esta pareja de esposos se está preparando para vender sus productos no sólo en su ciudad, sino también en los mercados de las ciudades aledañas a la suya. Ellos esperan por su ayuda para que sus deseos de ampliar su mercado prospere.

loans.use: Purchase of an additional cow to increase sales of milk and cheese

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a thirty-eight year old mother with two children. Isabel sells traditional food on Saturdays and Sundays in a regional fair located on a street near the city stadium. Isabel´s specialty is to make mondongo (a soup with corn and meat, broiled overnight) with the help of her partner.

Isabel is a member of the Suni Village Bank. (Suni means “Secure” in Quechua).

Isabel needs a loan of 1500 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($550 US Dollars) to invest in rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, corn, and firewood.

Isabel´s dream is to own the property for her restaurant, have a grocery store, and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to invest in rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, corn, and firewood.

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.en:
Martha is a forty-four year old married mother with four children. Martha has a convenience store located in her home where she works with the help of her children from 6:00 AM in the morning until 10 PM at night; selling groceries, vegetables, stove gas, firewood, drinks, and meat. She also prepares lollipops in her store.

Martha is a member of the Suni Village Bank. (Suni means “Secure” in Quechua).

Martha needs a loan of 2,000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($725 US dollars) to invest in more sugar, rice, oil, potatoes, noodles, and firewood.

Martha´s dream is to improve her business, further stock her store, and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to invest in more sugar, rice, oil, potatoes, noodles, and firewood.

loans.name: Delia And Precila Group

texts.en:
Delia and Precila are members of the Suni Community Bank. (Suni meaning “Secure” in Quechua). Delia is a thirty-four year old mother of three children.

Delia travels to regional fairs once a week to buy animals and cheese that she sells door to door. Her sales have increased as her credit has increased

Precila is a married, sixty three year old mother of five children. Pricila travels to the Ayacuchana Jungle where she sells groceries and buys cacao, ajonjoli, coffee and other products to sell to middlemen in the city of Lima.

Delia and Precila request respective loans of 600 and 750 soles to invest in pigs, lambs, cheese, sugar and rice.

They dream of being able to construct their own houses, to have their own stores and to acquire cars to transport their products.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, lambs, cheese, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Lucero, Judith And Teresa Group

texts.en:
Lucero, Judith, and Teresa are members of the Suni Village Bank. (Suni meaning “Secure” in Quechua).

Lucero is an unmarried twenty-one year old woman. Lucero sells many different types of men´s pants that she acquires in Lima and in different markets of the city of Ayacucho.

Judith is a twenty-five year old mother of one son. Judith makes “roasted milk,” a dessert of fresh milk and eggs) with a rented oven. She sells them to different stores.

Teresa is a thirty-one year old mother of two children. Teresa buys firewood from suppliers and sells the firewood from her home.

Lucero, Judith and Teresa need respective loans of 600, 300 and 900 Peruvian Nuevo Soles to invest in more pants, milk, sugar and firewood to further expand their businesses.

Lucero, Judith and Teresa´s dreams include having their own grocery and clothing store and providing a good education for their children.

loans.use: To purchase pants, milk, sugar and firewood to further expand their businesses.

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
Casilda is one of those women who work extremely hard to improve their families’ quality of life, and the way she plans to achieve this is by doing what she knows best: farming. She was taught farming techniques by her parents as a child and the nature of her work and her eagerness to get ahead in life motivate her in tending her farm every day. Consequently, her farm products are consistently of better and higher quality.

Casilda needs your support, with this loan, in investing in the farm and improving next year’s harvest.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Casilda es una de las mujeres que lucha por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y la forma de cómo conseguirla es poner en marcha sus capacidades en lo que mejor sabe realizar, su trabajo de agricultora.Desde que era pequeña supo desenvolverse adecuadamente en este trabajo gracias a los secretos que le enseñaron sus padres puede obtener productos de calidad y mejorados. Este afán de seguir trabajando y progresando la impulsa a salir todas las mañanas hacia sus tierras de cultivo. Casilda necesita de tu apoyo con el préstamo solicitado para invertir en sus tierras y mejorar su próxima cosecha.

loans.use: Capital investment for the farm

loans.name: Ruben Rafael

texts.es:
51-year old Ruben Rafael L. T. is from Guatemala and is a resident of the Cantón Juchanep, Totonicapán. He runs a weaving business. Beforehand he worked as an operator for a neighbour for three years. With the little bit of money he saved, he opened his own workshop. Now he has eight looms producing cortes (long skirts typical of the region) with help from a loan which he obtained from an institution. With the loan he is now seeking from ASDIR, he wants to increase both production and his income so that he can pay for the basic necessities of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Ruben Rafael Lacán T.: Casado, guatemalteco, de 51 Años se identifica con su número de del Cantón Juchanep, Totonicapán. Esta persona labora en la tejeduría en un principio trabajó como operario para un vecino durante 3 años, con un pequeño dinero que el tenía ahorrado se propuso colocar un taller propio lo cual le funcionó. Ahora tiene Ocho telares en función de la producción de cortes típicos para dama con la ayuda de un crédito que adquirió en una institución. Con el Préstamo que solicita en ASDIR, pretende aumentar su producción y al mismo tiempo sus ingresos para poder sufragar las necesidades básicas de su familia.

loans.use: Working capital to buy raw materials

loans.name: Maria Anabela

texts.es:
20-year old María Anabela C. T. is single and lives in Caserío Xetinimit in the village of Nimasac, in the municipality and department de Totonicapán. Maríua has worked in a leather workshop for more than five years. Two years ago she decided to open her own workshop with help from her family and the Institución Asdir which gave her a loan of Q.5,000.00 which has now been paid off. She is now requesting another loan of Q.7,002.00 to be invested in the workshop. Every day she works on new designs so that her products are able to compete in the local market.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

María Anabela C. T. de 20 años de edad, soltera, con residencia en el Caserío Xetinimit, de la Aldea Nimasac, del Municipio y departamento de Totonicapán quien actualmente se dedica en la Talabartería ya que tiene mas de 5 años en venir trabajando dicha actividad por ser el que hacer de la familia y hace mas de 2 años decide formar su propio taller con la ayuda de sus padres y de la Institución Asdir el darle un crédito de Q.5,000.00 donde ha sido ya cancelado donde se dio cuenta que tuvo ganancias por lo que ahora nuevamente se presenta para solicitar otro crédito de Q. 7,002.00 para ser invertido en el taller de la solicitante en donde día a día se preocupa de estar actualizada en los estilos para poder competir en el mercado local.

loans.use: Purchase of materials and tools for her leather shop

loans.name: Julio Humberto

texts.es:
Mr Julio Humberto R.' principal activity is making and selling the highest quality shoes, based on 40 years experience. He started with a small location on the street, where we went very early in the morning until the late hours of the night, because he wanted to move forward his life and have the power to offer something to his family. This is how he fought through a long time, for the power to obtain his business. He is a client that has worked two years with the institution without any delay, and he is very responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

EL SEÑOR JULIO HUMBERTO R. TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL LA FABRICACIÓN Y VENTAS DE ZAPATOS AL POR MAYOR, CON LA EXPERIENCIA DE 40 AÑOS EL COMENZO CON UN PEQUEÑO PUESTO EN LA CALLE DONDE EL SALIA DESDE MUY TEMPRANO HASTA ALTAS HORAS DE LA NOCHE PORQUE EL QUERIA SALIR ADENTE Y HACI PODER BRINDAR ALGO A SU FAMILIA Y FUE ASI QUE EL LUCHO DURANTE MUCHO TIEMPO, PARA PODER OBTENER SU NEGOCIO ES UN CLIENTE QUE TRABAJA DOS AÑOS CON LA INSTITUCIÓN SIN RETRASO ALGUNO Y ES MUY RESPONZABLE EN SUS PAGOS

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Ms. Alicia A. de Ochoa works in food sales located between La Sucre and Colon. She lives in a house in Anticretico in the neighborhood Miraflores. She is a single mother and she has two little granddaughters who are in her care since her mother passed and they counted on her as their only support. She also has a second job as a teacher. She is a punctual client and is very dedicated to her granddaughters.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

LA SEÑORA ALICIA A. DE OCHOA TRABAJA CON EL SERVICIO VENTA DE COMIDA UBICADO ENTRE LA SUCRE Y COLÓN VIVE EN UNA CASA EN ANTICRETICO EN LA ZONA DE MIRAFLORES ELLA ES MADRE SOLA Y TIENE DOS NIETITAS QUE ESTAN A SU CARGO YA QUE SU MADRE FALLECIO Y SOLO CUENTAN CONE ELLA COMO SU UNICO APOLLO, ADEMAS ELLA PRESENTA UNA SEGUNDA ACTIVIDAD ES PROFESORA ES UNA CLIENTE PUNTUAL Y MUY DEDICADA A SUS NIETAS

loans.use: To buy food to attract clients

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
35-year old Guatemalan Margarita S. J. is married. She was born in the municipality of Patzité in the department of el Quiché. She is a businesswoman, buying and selling women’s clothing such as cortes (long skirts), blouses, sweaters, and aprons.

She started her business with the help of her mother who also worked in the same business. They used to go door-to-door selling the clothing, but now they have a stall in el Quiché. With the help of her husband who works in the freight business, she transports her merchandise throughout the department. With the loan she is requesting from ASDIR, she is planning to buy more merchandise as there is a market for her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.



Margarita S. J.: Casada guatemalteca de 35 años de edad, originaria del municipio de Patzité departamento de el Quiche. Dicha persona se dedica al comercio específicamente en la compra y venta de ropa para damas tales como cortes, blusas, suéteres y delantales para dama. Su negocio inició con la ayuda de su madre quien se dedicaba al mismo negocio, en ese entonces los vendían de casa en casa, ahora tienen un puesto de venta en el Quiché con la ayuda de el marido quien se dedica en hacer fletes, traslada su mercadería para dicho departamento. Con el crédito que solicita en ASDIR, ha planificado aumentar el capital de trabajo ya que tiene demanda en su negocio.

loans.use: Working capital to buy women’s clothing

loans.name: Carlos Felipe

texts.es:
21-year old Carlos Felipe P. C. is single and lives in Caserío Tzanquieck in the village of Nimasac, located in the municipality and department of Totonicapán. For more than three years he has worked as a shoemaker; then six months ago he decided to start his own workshop. He is asking for a loan of Q.7,008.00 from the Asociación Asdir so that he can continue his work and meet the high demand that occurs during the months of December, January, February, and March of next year. This is Carlos’ second loan; he has shown responsibility in his monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Carlos Felipe P. C. de 21 años de edad, solter con residencia en el Caserío Tzanquieck uleu, de la Aldea Nimasac, del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán quien por mas de 3 años viene ejerciendo su actividad como zapatero pero hace mas de 6 meses se sometió a crear su propio taller de zapatería y esta solicitando un crédito en la Asociación Asdir por la cantidad de Q. 7,008.00 para poder seguir trabajando en esta época, para poder cubrir la demanda en la época buena la cual es en los meses de diciembre, enero, febrero y marzo del próximo año, ya que es su segundo crédito que solicita en donde ha demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos mensuales.

loans.use: Working capital to buy raw materials, tools, and machinery for his shoemaking business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy, a diligent 23 years old, became a mother at the age of seventeen and to support her child, and without hesitation, she started a business selling CDs and DVDs in the town of Santa Lucia. Due to her ability and customer care, her business is growing steadily and customer orders are increasing.

She would like to expand her business and fulfil her existing orders. She therefore requires your financial support in the form of a loan, repayable over six months, to purchase CDs and DVDs.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Nancy fue madre a los 17 años, desde entonces sin pensarlo dos veces decidió emprender su negocio de venta de CDs y DVDs, negocio ubicado en el pueblito de Santa Lucía, gracias a su predisposición para este negocio y a la amabilidad con las que atiende a sus clientes, su negocio poco a poco va creciendo, aumentando cada vez sus pedidos, los cuales Nancy desea complacer.En estos momentos esta diligente madre, ya de 23 años desea ampliar e implementar su negocio, para ello requiere de vuestro apoyo económico para la compra de CD y DVD, dinero que será rembolsado en un lapso no mayor de los 6 meses.

loans.use: Purchase of stock for her business of selling CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Silvana Jose

texts.es:
Mrs. J. is associated with the Leon 2000 Foundation, having gone through 4 credit cycles, all of which have been working capital. Her business is the sale of Italian gold articles, gold plated items, and silver articles. She also carries out shoe sales alongside a sister of hers that has a stand and yields a portion for her business.

This person lives at home with her in-laws and she does not have children. Her greatest dream is to have children and to have her own house. She is attending a course on decorating but she has not developed the idea, especially becuase this country is not big on this type of service.

Her husband works outside the home and he provides support for her projects, as a small business owner. Her sales she carries out in cash and on credit and she collects payments on pay days, depending on the amount of credit, she recovers the sum within two months. Her major clientele are university students in the National University of Nicaragua, and the people in the market. She buys items in wholesale paying cash, this way she can generate a greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora J., tiene de trabajar con fundación leon 2000, cuatro ciclos de prestamos, todos han sido para capital de trabajo teniendo como actividad la venta de prendas de oro Italiano, oro laminado, prendas de plata , dedicandose tambien al comercio de calzado, en conjunto con una hermana ya que ésta tiene un tramo y le cede un pequeño espacio para que doña silvana oferte tambien parte de su mercaderia. La señora vive en casa de sus suegros, no tiene hijos, su mayor sueño es tener hijos y tener su casa propia, ella tiene un curso en decoraciones pero que no lo ha desarrollado ya que en nuestro país no es bien demandado este servicio. Su esposo trabaja fuera del departamento, quien a su vez le ayuda y le apoya en sus proyectos, como microempresaria. En cuanto a sus ventas estas las realiza de contado y credito que recupera en dias de pago, dependiendo del monto en credito lo recupera en un plazo no mayor a los dos meses, sus principales clientes son docentes de la universidad nacional autonoma de nicaragua, y personas de los mercados. Ella compra por lotes de prendas, de contado totalmente ya que de esta manera le genera mas ganancias.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Because of the variety and taste of the delicious breads they bake, the family of Luz Marina is very popular in their locality; to the extent that their bread has become an essential part of their customers’ daily diet. As a result, Luz Marina built a clay oven in her house and every day, with the help of two junior assistants, she bakes and delivers delicious bread to various grocery stores in her town, Juliaca.

With your support, this diligent and enterprising mother would like to purchase flour and enlarge her oven so that she can bake and sell more bread.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

La familia de Luz Marina es muy popular en su localidad debido a que siempre se caracterizó por los deliciosos y variados panes que elaboran, complaciendo de esta manera el paladar de sus asiduos clientes, quienes encuentran en este producto uno de sus indispensables alimentos.Es por ello que sin pensarlo dos veces, Luz Marina decidió instalar su propio horno de barro al interior de su casa, todas las mañanas, con el apoyo de 2 jóvenes trabajadores, se encarga de hornear y elaborar deliciosos panes que son distribuidos en las diferentes bodegas de su ciudad, Juliaca, el deseo de esta diligente y emprendedora madre es ampliar su negocio, ella espera recibir vuestro apoyo, préstamo que le permitirá adquirir materia prima (harina) e implementar su horno, para así aumentar el volumen de producción de sus panes.

loans.use: Purchase of flour and enlargement of her clay oven for baking bread.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana is a very diligent woman who, since becoming responsible for her own financial support, has tried her hand at several businesses. Unfortunately, none of them proved successful and as a result she decided to start selling shoes. She buys the shoes from suppliers in the city of Tacna and sells them from a stall in the Tupac Amaru market in her town, Juliaca.

Liliana has several plans for her business, for which she requires additional capital investment. This loan will enable her to purchase new additional stock of new shoes to offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Liliana es una mujer diligente, desde que se independizó económicamente tentó suerte con diferentes actividades, pero desafortunadamente en ninguna lograba tener éxito, es así que decidió vender zapatos, mercadería que adquiere en la ciudad de Tacna y la vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado Tupac Amaru de su ciudad, Juliaca.Liliana tiene muchos planes para su negocio, para ello requiere contar con mayor capital de inversión, por lo que solicita este préstamo, dinero que le permitirá adquirir novedosos zapatos que ofrecerá a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of new and varied shoes for the business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria was born in Pucara district. Her animals (cows) provide her with milk, which she and her husband use to make delicious cheeses for sale in bulk in Juliaca, Puno and Arequipa.
