Thanks to their honorable and fulfilling work, Victoria and her husband are able to meet the needs of their family and provide a quality education for their two youngest children, so one day they can live comfortably.

This family hopes to continue caring for and feeding their young calves so that they will continue to provide fresh and nutritious milk, and to increase production of their mouthwatering cheeses. To make this possible, Victoria needs your financial support, which she will use to purchase cattle feed that will provide better nutrition for her cows.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

El distrito de Pucara es el pueblo natal de Victoria, quien gracias a sus animales (vacas) que le proveen leche, puede elaborar junto a su esposo deliciosos quesos que son vendidos al por mayor en la ciudad de Juliaca, Puno y Arequipa. Gracias a este noble pero complaciente oficio, está haciendo posible cubrir las expectativas de su familia y la de sus 2 menores hijos a quienes anhela ofrecerle una educación de calidad para que en el futuro se desenvuelvan convenientemente.

El deseo de esta familia es seguir cuidando y alimentando a sus becerros para que con el cariño que le brindan les sigan proporcionando de su fresca y nutritiva leche y así aumentar la producción de sus apetitosos quesos. En esta oportunidad Victoria requiere de vuestro apoyo económico, dinero que invertirá en adquirir forraje y así fortalecer la alimentación de sus vacas.

loans.use: Purchase of dairy cattle feed

loans.name: Danny

texts.es:
Danny, 27 years old, is a talented young man. He learned about textile artisanry from his sister Yenny, who gladly and patiently taught him her useful skills. Danny and Yenny together own a small workshop where they make woven goods. The workshop also provides jobs for three young workers. Together with their employees, they make the perfect team for this work. Recently their output has increased, requiring various wools to fulfill orders placed by their clients, who are always satisfied with their work. This young brother-and-sister team would like to purchase greater quantities of wool and expand their workshop, which will provide their employees with a more comfortable work environment.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Danny es un talentoso joven de 27 años de edad, aprendió la bella labor de la artesanía textil de su querida hermana Yenny, quien gustosa y pacientemente le enseñó sus valiosos conocimientos. Actualmente, Danny y Yenny poseen en sociedad un pequeño taller de tejidos, donde brindan trabajo a otros 3 jóvenes con quienes hacen un equipo perfecto para esta labor, por estas temporadas el volumen de producción de sus trabajos se ha incrementado, requiriendo variedad de lanas para cumplir cada uno de las solicitudes de sus clientes, clientes quienes quedan muy satisfechos con su trabajo. El deseo de estos jóvenes hermanos es adquirir mayor cantidad de lana y ampliar su taller, para brindar mejor comodidad a sus colaboradores.

loans.use: Purchase of wool and expansion of textile workshop

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria is a woman of small means who lives in an area outside of the city in the mountains, in a small adobe house of very humble conditions. Together with her spouse she works as a travelling salesman to the population in the mountains, where she sells her merchandise. She is a woman who from a very young age dedicated herself to work and was not given the opportunity to study. She doesn't want the same thing to happen to her children, so because of this she and her husband are dedicated to working every day of the week.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Es una Sra. de bajos recursos vive en una zona alejada de la ciudad del alto, en una casita de condiciones muy humildes hecha de adobe juntamente con su esposo se dedican a la venta de artículos viajando a un población de el alto donde consigue su mercadería, es una señora que desde muy temprana edad se dedico atrabajar y no pudo la oportunidad de estudiar y ella no quiere que pase lo mismo con sus hijos por eso ella y su marido se dedican a trabajar todos los días de la semana

loans.use: To invest in jewelry and seasonal clothes

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Mr. M. advertises by means of a vehicle with loudspeakers, promoting sales and events. He is very grateful for the support he previously received with this first loan from Kiva. With that loan, he was able to give the down payment on his vehicle so that he could use it to promote his products and those of other businesses in the city of Nuevo Laredo. He has already repaid his loan and is requesting another one so that he can purchase a higher capacity sound system, thus increasing both his clientele and his income. His children also work in this business. They are all independent, but the family collaborates in sharing the equipment for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. M. se dedica a la publicidad de otros negocios perifoneando en la ciudad sobre promociones y eventos. El Sr. Pedro está muy agradecido por el apoyo que recibió del primer préstamo de Kiva. Con el préstamo el pudo dar el enganche de su vehiculo para trabajar promocionando sus productos y los de otros negocios en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. El ya pagó este préstamo y está solicitando otro para comprar un sonido de mayor capacidad para su negocio y así tener a más clientes y más ingresos. Sus hijos también se dedican a este negocio del perifoneos. Cado uno es independiente pero la familia colabora en compartir equipos para el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase loudspeakers

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina is a mother of 7 school-age children who need her support to be able to successfully complete their primary school education. As such, Alejandrina and her spouse eagerly have dedicated themselves to their bakery for more than 20 years. Their work helps cover their household expenses. It’s also a service to their neighbors, seeing Alejandrina distributes bread in bulk to the bodegas (small grocery and sundries stores) in the area.

Because of the higher cost of flour, the bakery has entered a difficult period. For this reason Alejandrina is requesting a loan to purchase needed flour and to continue making and distributing the bakery’s delicious bread. Alejandrina also plans to purchase machinery to facilitate her work in the bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Alejandrina es una madre de 7 hijos los cuales son escolares y requieren de apoyo para lograr concluir con éxito su preparación, es así que Alejandrina y su pareja trabajan con ahínco y dedicación en su panadería hace más de 20 años, esta labor ayuda a satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar y es un servicio para sus vecinos, puesto que Alejandrina distribuye panes al por mayor para las bodegas.

Por el costo elevado de la harina su panadería está pasando por momentos muy difíciles, por ello solicita un préstamo para adquirir la harina que le hace falta y seguir preparando y distribuyendo sus riquísimos panes, como también comprar algunas maquinarias que faciliten su trabajo dentro de su panadería.

loans.use: Purchase of flour and machinery for improved operation of her bakery

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda is an enterprising mother who, with lots of effort, managed to open in her home a small bodega (grocery and sundries store), which has helped Olinda cover her family’s needs. Nevertheless, with three children comes greater responsibility, and greater costs, too. That’s why Olinda would like to increase her store’s profits. She would like to expand and acquire new products to satisfy her clients’ needs. To do this, she needs a loan, which she will use to purchase merchandise and supply her store with a wider range of products. Olinda trusts that you are the person who can help her with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Olinda es una mujer emprendedora que con mucho esfuerzo logró instalar en su hogar una pequeña bodega que hasta el día de hoy ha suplido las necesidades de su familia. Sin embargo, 3 hijos es una mayor responsabilidad y mayores gastos también, es así que su desea acrecentar las ganancias que su tienda le proporciona. Olinda desea ampliar y adquirir nuevos productos que satisfagan las demandas de sus clientes. Para esto requiere de un préstamo, dinero que invertirá en la compra de mercadería y surtir su tienda con diversidad de productos. Olinda tiene fe de que usted es la persona que podrá ayudarla en su negocio.

loans.use: Expansion of her store and purchase of a variety of merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia is a mother who is committed to her farm work. Her work enables her to meet the needs of her 10 children, who in turn help her in the fields. Florencia grows potatoes and corn, products that are in high demand in the markets, where greater quality brings higher prices.

To enhance the quality of her products, Florencia needs natural and chemical fertilizers, which recently have become more expensive. This makes it hard for Florencia to afford them. For this reason she is requesting a loan to be able to purchase fertilizers. In addition, Florencia plans to help her husband with buying and selling meat and, in so doing, join efforts to improve their wellbeing. She is hoping for a positive response, which will assist her in her work and at the same time improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Florencia es una mujer entregada a su labor como agricultora, con la que pueD. mantener las necesidades D. sus 10 hijos, quienes D. igual manera le ayudan en sus terrenos D. cultivo. Florencia cultiva papa y maíz, productos que son muy solicitados en los mercados y D. acuerdo a su calidad, valorados.

Para mejorar la calidad D. sus productos, requiere D. abono y fertilizantes que en estos tiempos han sobrepasado los habituales costos, lo que hace difícil poder adquirirlos, Florencia solicita este préstamo para poder comprar estos abonos y no tan solo ello, sino también ayudar a su esposo en la compra y venta D. carne y así juntos anudar esfuerzos para su bienestar. Ella estará esperando por una respuesta positiva que le ayuD. en su actividad y D. la misma forma mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of natural and chemical fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Doña Manuela is 44 years old, single, and a resident of Cantón Pachipac in the municipality of Nahualá, in Sololá department. Since her parents’ death, she has struggled to get on in life. Currently she works in Artesanía “Tejeduría” making crafts such as the tablecloths typical of the region. With the money she earns she has managed to pay for expenses such as food, clothing etc. She also supports her 52-year old sister who lives with her.

At the moment she doesn’t have sufficient money to continue with the business, so she went to the offices of the Asociación “ASDIR” to ask for a loan to buy weaving materials. This way she will be able to meet the demands of her customers and make more money.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Manuela tiene 44 años de edad, soltera, residente del Cantón Pachipac del Municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, soltera, desde que murieron sus padres ha luchado para sobresalir adelante, actualmente se dedica a la Artesanía “Tejeduría”, específicamente elaboración de telas típicas, por medio de sus ingresos o ganancias ha logrado sufragar sus gastos de alimentación, vestuario, entre otros; y como también apoyar a su hermana de 52 años quien vive juntamente con ella. Actualmente no cuenta con el capital suficiente para seguir con su negocio y por tal razón se vio en la necesidad de acudir en las oficinas de la Asociación “ASDIR”, para solicitar una ampliación de capital de trabajo para comprar materia prima y así poder atender la demanda de sus clientes y obtener mas ingresos o ganancias.

loans.use: To buy materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel is a single mother with a lot of responsibility. She cares not only for her young son, but also watches her brothers and sisters. (Her brothers and sisters are still students, while her parents are getting on in years.)

Thanks to her farm work, Maribel has been able to cover household expenses and it’s for this reason that she works hard day after day to improve her crops. She is worried, however, because she cannot afford the high cost of natural and chemical fertilizers. Maribel is requesting this loan to improve her crops. She hopes you will be able to help her obtain the money she needs to continue supporting her brothers and sisters as well as take care of her young son.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Maribel es una madre soltera, y tiene una gran responsabilidad, no tan sólo por su pequeño hijo, sino de sus hermanos por quienes también vela, ya que sus padres son ancianos y sus hermanos aún son estudiantes.

Gracias a su trabajo como agricultora ha sabido sobrellevar los gastos dentro de su familia y es por ellos que día tras día se esfuerza cada día más para mejorar sus cultivos. Sin embargo, los costosos abonos y fertilizantes la tienen preocupada ya que no puede adquirirlos y solicita este préstamo para la mejora de sus cultivos y espera que usted pueda ayudarla a conseguir el dinero que le hace falta y así seguir apoyando a sus hermanos y velar por el crecimiento de su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: Purchase of natural and chemical fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
Livia is a humble mother of three small school aged children. She works in her crop fields where she is exposed to the sun and, above all, the cold typical of the mountains of Perú. This activity is rewarded in the harvest, which brings a lot of joy to her children because they know that their parents will have money to buy them some necessities. This is the reason Livia desires to increase her income and the only way that she can achieve it is by improving her products and expanding her field and to do this she needs a quantity of money that doesn't have and so is requesting it as a loan from you with the aim of being able to count on your support.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Livia es una humilde madre de familia de 3 pequeños hijos que aún son escolares, trabaja en sus terrenos de cultivos, donde se expone al sol y sobre todo el frío típico de la sierra del Perú. Esta actividad es recompensada en la cosecha, que le trae mucha alegría a sus pequeños porque saben que sus padres tendrán dinero para comprarles algunas cosas necesarias.Por ello que Livia desea poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos y la única forma como puede lograrlo es mejorando sus productos y ampliando sus cultivos, para esto requiere de una cantidad de dinero que no posee y lo solicita como un préstamo ante usted con el fin de que pueda contar con su apoyo.

loans.use: Investment capital for the improvement and enlargement of her crop fields

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo is a humble father of two children whom are his reason for living. He works selling meat , which is a complicated task since Arturo has to travel to distant towns to buy animals and later sell the meat in the booth that he has inside the market. Arturo would like to have sufficient money to buy a larger quantity of rams and chickens. This is the reason that he is requesting this loan with the promise of being punctual and responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Arturo es un humilde padre de familia de dos niños quienes son su razón de vida, él se dedica a la venta de carne, esta es una labor complicada ya que Arturo debe viajar a diversos pueblos alejados para comprar animales y luego vender su carne en el puesto que tiene dentro del mercado. Arturo desea una cantidad de dinero para comprar mayor cantidad de carneros y pollos. Es así que está solicitando el presente préstamo con la promesa de ser puntual y responsable en sus pagos.

loans.use: Purchase of rams and chickens for his butcher shop

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es:
Aidee is a mother of three small children whom are her love and engine that propels her to work with determination to progress as a merchant and make her business a sustainable one. Her kiosk of groceries and sweets is the only activity that she does to satisfy the needs of her children and serve as support for her husband, who is a farmer. This activity is of much help, therefore she desires to expand it and supply it with more diverse products to beat the competition since she is located in a pretty commercial zone and so she has to maintain her business at the level of the competition. This is the reason why she is requesting a loan and hopes that you will be the person that can help her see that her business prospers.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Aidee es madre de tres pequeños niños quienes son su adoración y motor que la impulsa a trabajar con empeño para progresar como comerciante y hacer de su negocio un negocio sostenible.Es así que el puesto de abarrotes y dulces que posee es la única actividad que realiza para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus niños y sirve de apoyo a su pareja quien es agricultor. Esta actividad es de gran ayuda, por lo mismo que desea ampliar y surtir de diversos productos para superar a la competencia, ya que se encuentra en un lugar bastante comercial y para ello tiene que mantenerse al nivel de la competencia.Por ello que solicita un préstamo y espera usted sea la persona que pueda ayudarla a que su negocio prospere.

loans.use: Enlarging her kiosk and purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is a sweet woman that works selling food insiD. a market, an activity with which she helps her husband with the household expenses. Even though their children already have their own families and live separately, this couple remains in love. Thanks to her activities they don't feel lonely, instead they have great desires to continue ahead and realize some of their dreams. Juana wishes to expand her food booth and proviD. a better service to her clients. This is the reason why she is requesting a loan for the purchase of various utensils and furniture necessary to improve the environment and service to attract a larger number of diners. She is waiting for your response.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana es una dulce señora que trabaja en L. venta D. comida dentro D. un mercado, actividad con L. cual ayuda a su pareja en los gastos dentro D. su hogar, debido a que sus hijos ya tienen su propia familia y viven aparte, esta pareja veL. en amor, uno del otro. Gracias a sus actividades no se sienten solos, sino con grandes deseos D. seguir adelante y concretar algunos sueños. Doña Juana desea ampliar su puesto D. comida y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.Por ello solicita un préstamo para L. compra D. algunos utensilios y muebles necesarios para mejorar el ambiente y L. atención y atraer a mayor cantidad D. comensales. ElL. está a L. espera D. su respuesta.

loans.use: Purchase of furniture and utensils to improve the booth in the local markets where she sells food

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Ms. Bertha L. has a small general store located in the Américo Villarreal district of the city of Nuevo Laredo. Ms. Lopez was previously given a loan by Kiva. She has already finished repaying her first loan.

She is requesting a second loan in order to restock her shop with a larger selection of products that her customers are asking for. This way, she will boost profits. Ms. Lopez depends on this business to support herself as well as her son’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Bertha L. tiene un negocio de abarrotes ubicado en la colonia Américo Villarreal en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. La Sra.Bertha ya fue acreditada de Kiva ya terminó de pagar su primer préstamo.

Está solicitando su segundo préstamo para surtir más la tienda de variedad de productos que sus clientes le están solicitando y así tener más ingreso al negocio. La Sra. Bertha depende de este negocio para apoyar a sí misma y a su hijo en los estudios.

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria is a perservering woman with a fortitude that does not allow her to get knocked down by financial problems. She opened up a path for herself little by little, starting with two rams and using the earnings from her first sale to buy some pigs and later some cows and bulls. She buys these animals at a low price and resells them for more, generating a profit that is the sole means of income for her household. For the moment she will continue doing business in this manner, however she hopes to be able to have a livestock stable in the future. Victoria wants to see her children become professionals, which is the reason she is asking for a loan to purchase a higher quality cow that she can then sell for a profit. Help support Victoria continue to perform well in her endeavors.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria es una mujer constante y de mucha fortaleza para no dejarse abatir por los problemas económicos, se abrió paso poco a poco, primero comenzó con 2 carneros, luego con la ganancia que obtuvo de su primera venta de estos carneros pudo comprar cerdos, después vacas y toretes. Ella compra estos animales a un menor precio y los revende a uno mayor, de esta manera obtiene las ganancias que le permiten ser el único sostén de su casa, por el momento ella seguirá trabajando de este modo, pero más adelante su deseo es tener un establo de vacas. Victoria quiere ver a sus hijos profesionales, por ello que solicita un préstamo, con el cual comprará una vaca de mayor calidad para revenderla a mayor precio. Apoya a Victoria a seguir desempeñándose hábilmente en su trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase a high-quality cow to sell for income.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel’s big dreams of getting ahead demonstrate the steadfastness with which she wants to overcome any obstacle. She is 51 years old, the mother of two school-aged children and, together with her husband, has more than 15 years of experience running a cooking business. Ysabel and her husband started selling prepared foods door-to-door using a bike that they had and a small cooktop. The high quality and great care with which they prepared their products led to increased sales, allowing them to rent their own space and a better kitchen. Each day, Ysabel and her husband rise early in the morning, get their children ready for school, and immediately thereafter go to the market to buy the basic ingredients for their foods. They cook during the afternoon, and sell their products until 10 pm. Their meals include "salchipapas" (fried potatoes), “salchipollos” (a chicken and fried potato dish), hamburgers and other fast foods. Their goal is to have a poultry store, and in the meantime they will continue putting forth great effort toward their work. Ysabel is seeking this loan to invest in a roasting oven. Please help support Ysabel and her husband and be a part of making their plans a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Los grandes deseos de superación de Ysabel son muestra de firmeza para superar cualquier obstáculo, a sus 51años Isabel es madre de 2 hijos que están en edad escolar y junto a su esposo hace más de 15 años emprendieron en negocio de la cocina, utilizando para ello, la buena sazón que ambos tiene, es así que Ysabel y su esposo se animaron a vender comida de manera ambulante en un triciclo que tenían y con una cocina pequeña, la acogida que tuvieron por la calidad de sus productos los ha conducido a aumentar sus ventas y mejorar hasta alquilar un local y comprar una mejor cocina. Diariamente, Ysabel y su esposo se levantan en la mañana, alistan a sus hijos para que vayan a la escuela e inmediatamente después se van al mercado a comprar los ingredientes básicos para la preparación, cocinan por la tarde y venden hasta las 10 de la noche; salchipapas, salchipollos, hamburguesas entre otros platos rápidos, la meta es tener una pollería, mientras tanto seguirán esforzándose por seguir trabajando, en esta ocasión Ysabel solicita un préstamo, el que invertirá en la compra de un horno pollero. Apoya a Ysabel y a su esposo para que sus proyectos sean una realidad.

loans.use: Purchase a roasting oven for her food preparation business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther is a noble woman who for years has been dedicated to working the land. She has spent 20 years working arduously as a farmer, planting quinoa, wheat, potatoes, corn and alfalfa. With these activities, Esther and her husband have been able to support their children who are now grown men and women of whom she is very proud. They give her the impetus to continue with her endeavors. She is now getting her seeds ready for the next planting season. As far as her alfalfa fields, she leases them and sells in lots, which provides income that she uses to support herself on a daily basis. Farming makes Esther feel active, and she tends to her lands cheerfully. The loan she is requesting is to purchase fertilizers for her crops. Help support Esther so she can continue to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Esther es una noble mujer que durante años estuvo dedicada a las tareas del campo, ella lleva 20 años D. esta ardua labor, siembra quinua, trigo, papa, maíz y alfalfa, por esta actividad ella y su esposo han podido solventar los gastos D. sus hijos que hoy son hombres y mujeres D. bien. Esta es una gran satisfacción para ella que le da ánimo para continuar, ahora está preparando la semilla para la próxima etapa D. siembra, en cuanto a sus campos D. alfalfa, ella los arrienda y los venD. por lotes, D. esta manera se genera el sustento diario. El trabajo, a Esther la hace sentir activa, por lo que continua alegremente en sus tierras, la solicitud D. préstamo es para comprar abono y fertilizantes. Apoya a Doña Esther a seguir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Angela María

texts.es:
Ms. Angela B. has many years of experience in the business. At this time, she has two businesses: a stationery store and a snack bar in which she sells sandwiches, nachos, corn, and other types of fast food. She has previously obtained two loans with FVP, which she has promptly repaid.

Ms. B. is requesting a loan with Kiva so that she can purchase merchandise for her stationery store and kitchen essentials for her snack bar. She is the only one who runs the businesses.

Ms. B. is married and has two children. The businesses are the family’s main sources of income, along with her husband’s salary.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Angela María tiene muchos años de experiencia en el negocio. Al momento cuenta con dos negocios uno de papelería y otro de venta de lonches, nachos, elotes y otros tipos de comida. Ella ya ha tenido dos préstamos con FVP los cuales los pago puntualmente.

La Sra. Angela está solicitando un préstamo a Kiva para la compra de mercancía para la papelería y artículos de cocina para la lonchería. Ella es la única que atiende los negocios.

La Sra. Angela está casada y tiene dos hijos. Los negocios son la fuente principal de ingresos de la familia, además del sueldo que recibe el esposo por su trabajo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for stationery store and items for snack bar

loans.name: Manino's Group

texts.en: This Gataivai Group was just started this month when the members first heard about it from one of the groups within the village. They joined in and became members of the group. They were able to attend training and applied for their first loan of 750 Tala each. They are unemployed women, and they are really happy for this financial support to help them start a new life. These ladies plant taro, taamu, yams, bananas, and also vegetables on their plantation and then sell these products at flea markets in the main market.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment and chemicals to start up their businesses

loans.name: Kattia

texts.es:
Katia had many intentions of being in business, year after year selling clothing door-to-door which unfortunately often did not allow her to spend time with her three children. For this reason, she made the steadfast decision to save money and establish her own store in her home. It’s been a month now since she first opened, and she is proud of her accomplishment. However she has a goal to attract more customers toward which she is putting all her efforts. Her constant motivation is her small children who are of school age. She is a big help with regard to the family’s economic situation, given that her husband’s income often is not enough to cover their living expenses. One of her goals is to improve her store, all while continuing to work buying merchandise. It’s for this reason that she seeks a loan so she can purchase products of a greater variety and that will appeal to her customers. Please help be an integral part of Katia obtaining her loan so she can continue to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Katia tuvo muchos intentos de hacer negocio, año tras año estuvo vendiendo prendas de vestir de manera ambulante y muchas veces esto no le permitía estar tiempo con sus 3 hijos, por ello que tomo la firme decisión de ahorrar dinero y establecer una tienda en su propia casa. Ha pasado recién un mes de haberla abierto y ella se siente feliz de haberlo logrado, pero tiene otro reto, la de adquirir clientes, para la cual está poniendo todo su empeño, su motivación constante son sus pequeños que están en edad escolar y ser un poyo muy importante en la economía de su hogar ya que muchas veces el sueldo de su esposo no alcanza. Una de sus metas es poder ampliar su tienda, mientras tanto sigue trabajando en la compra de mercadería, por ello es que solicita un préstamo para adquirir productos variados y atractivos. Sé parte solidaria en el préstamo de Katia para seguir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock her store with a variety of products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is a stupendous mother and persistent woman with three children, the oldest of whom now lives on his own. Currently her efforts are concentrated on the two younger children who are still in school. For the past ten years she has dedicated herself to farming activities, cultivating corn and potatoes, as well as raising cuyes (guinea pigs). Ana’s wish is to improve her next harvest, which depends greatly on the planting. For this reason, she is asking for a loan to invest into preparing her lands and purchasing fertilizer and alfalfa seeds for her cuye farm. Let’s support this woman who strives to excel.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana es estupenda madre y mujer perseverante, tiene 3 hijos, D. los cuales el mayor vive ya solo, ahora sus esfuerzos están concentradas en los dos menores que están en edad escolar. Ella se dedica desD. hace 10 años a las actividades agrícolas, cultiva papa y maíz, también se dedica a la crianza D. cuyes, el deseo D. Ana es mejorar su próxima cosecha, la cual sabe que depenD. mucho D. la siembra, es así que solicita un préstamo que serán invertido en la preparación D. sus tierras D. cultivo comprando abono, fertilizantes y semilla D. alfalfa para su granja D. cuyes. Apoya a esta mujer decidida a tener éxito.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and seeds for her farmland; also alfalfa for her guinea pigs.

loans.name: Pauai's Group

texts.en: Malae Faga is a beautiful village with natural and beautiful beaches in front. In their backyard, they also have very fertile soil suitable for farming and planting. Malae Faga is one of the new centers, and these ladies work on different agricultural businesses such as cattle farming, taro plantations, and vegetable plantations in order to earn income for their families. They are on their first loans and they applied for 750 Tala each. This is the fifth week since they got disbursed and they are doing well with their payments as well as their businesses.

loans.use: Buy tools, equipment, and chemicals to start up their businesses

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva is an eminent vegetable and livestock farmer whose dedication, year after year, has been concentrated in these activities which are an important factor in supporting the household. She has two children ages 13 and 8, who are the reason for all her efforts. She cultivates corn, potatoes and carrots and in her small stable she raises cows from which she sells the milk and their offspring. Meanwhile, she waits patiently for the harvest season. Eva wants to increase her cow herd as well as the size of her crops so she can sell her products at wholesale. For these reasons, she seeks a loan that will allow her to plant and care for her land with all the necessary tools. Please help support Eva’s work so she can ensure a better future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Eva es una eminente agricultora y ganadera, año tras años su dedicación a estado concentrada estas actividades que le permiten ser un sostén importante en la economía de su hogar. Ella tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 8 años que son la razón de sus esfuerzos, ella cultiva maíz, papa y zanahoria y en su pequeño establo tiene vacas y vaquillonas de las cuales vende su leche y sus crías, mientras espera pacientemente la época de cosecha. Eva tiene el deseo de incrementar la cantidad de vacas que tiene y aumentar la siembra para obtener una mejor cosecha par vender sus productos al por mayor. Por ello, solicita un préstamo que le permitirá sembrar y cuidar sus tierras con todo lo necesario. Apoya a Eva a seguir trabajando por un buen futuro para sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming activities, as well as better quality cows to add to her herd.

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es:
Yrma works her farm each and every day. At 55 years of age, she has not lost her vitatility for working the land -- an inheritance from her parents and her way of life. She rises early each morning to take care of her corn and potato crops to make sure she will have a good harvest. Currently, Yrma would like to buy animals to raise, start a small general store, and also get ready for planting next season’s crops. For these reasons, she is asking for a loan which she will invest into purchasing the needs for her next planting and also for merchandise to stock her new store. Please help support Yrma so she can continue with her endeavors.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Yrma se esfuerza cada día en sus tierras de cultivo, a sus 55 años no ha perdido la vitalidad para las tareas del campo que son una herencia que sus padres le dejaron, y es su forma de vida. Se levanta muy temprano todos los días para vigilar sus campos de cultivo de maíz y papa para asegurarse de que su cosecha sea de provecho, ahora Doña Yrma tiene el deseo de obtener animales para criarlos, implementar una pequeña bodega, y además se está preparando para la época de siembra de la próxima temporada para lo cual esta solicitando un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de todo lo necesario para la siembra y también la compra de mercadería para su nueva bodega. Apoya a Doña Yrma a continuar.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizers, as well as merchandise to open a small general store.

loans.name: Fuaina's Group

texts.en: This is the second group of ladies from Malae Faga village.  They just started, and they applied for 750 Samoan Tala each for their first loans.  These ladies have not been working for years, and this is the first time for them to have access to loans and also to run their businesses themselves. These are their priorities now which are different from what they usually do.  They are attending weekly meetings, and they are looking forward to being granted more loans to improve their businesses in the future.

loans.use: Purchase rake, knives, crowbar, wheel barrow, weed killing spray, and chemicals for gardens

loans.name: Maria Cirila

texts.en:
Maria weaves and sells huipiles (traditional woven dress). She learned to weave when she was eight years old and says “it’s what we do, making huipiles at home.” Her huipiles are sold in the market in San Martin Jilotepeque, but she doesn’t actually leave her village of Pachay las Lomas. Her neighbors, or others who don’t know how to weave, buy them from her and take them to the market to sell them. She is requesting this loan to buy more thread for the huipiles and also to buy some pigs to raise to supplement her income. Maria can make a huipil in eight to ten days and can sell them for 350-400 Guatemala Quetzals (about US$45-50).

Maria is 31 years old and has four children, who range from one to nine years old. The older ones are studying and she herself studied up through sixth grade. She is married and her husband works in agriculture on their own land. Maria wants to make more huipiles and expand her business. She dreams of having a better house, buying more land and, more than anything, that her children get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Maria trabaja en el tejido y la venta de huipiles. Aprendió de tejer cuando tenía 8 años y dice “es que hacemos, haciendo huipiles de la casa.” Se vende sus huipiles en el mercado de San Martín Jilotepeque, pero ella no sale de su cantón de Pachay las Lomas. Sus vecinos, a alguien que no sabe como tejer, los compras y los lleva al mercado para venderlos. Está pidiendo este préstamo para comprar más hilo para los huipiles y también para comprar algunos marranos para criar para complementar a sus ingresos. Maria puede hacer un huipil en 8 a 10 días y puede venderlos por 350-400 Quetzales (aproximadamente $45-50). Maria tiene 31 años y tiene cuatro hijos de un año hasta 9 años. Los más grandes están estudiando y ella misma estudió hasta el sexto grado. Es casada y su esposo trabaja en agricultura en sus propios terrenos. Ella tiene ganas de hacer más huipiles y aumentar su negocio. Sueña con tener una casa mejor, comprar más terreno y, más que nada, que sus hijos sigan adelante.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving huipiles and to purchase pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Maria Flora

texts.en:
Maria sells beauty products in the local market in the city of Chimaltenango. She is from a rural and remote village and travels 45 minutes each way by bus to get to the market everyday. She is requesting this loan to invest in more beauty products such as cosmetics, nail polish, and hair care products. This is her first loan from FAPE and she is happy to have the opportunity to invest more in her business, which she has had for six years.

Maria is 30 years old and has three children that are four months, five, and ten years old. Her oldest child is in school, but the others are still too young. She is married and her husband is a baker. Maria dreams of expanding her business so that her children can have better things and more opportunities in life.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Maria tiene una venta de belleza en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Chimaltenango. Ella es de un cantón rural y retirada y viaja en camioneta unos 45 minutos de ida cada día al mercado. Está pidiendo este préstamo para invertir en más productos de belleza como cosméticos, y pintauñas, y productos para el cabello. Este es su primer préstamo de FAPE y está contenta de tener la oportunidad de invertir más en su negocio, que ha tenido por seis años. Maria tiene 30 años y tiene 3 hijos de 10 años, 5 años, y 4 meses. Su hijo más grande está en la escuela, pero los otros todavía están demasiado jóvenes. Es casada y su esposo es panadero. Maria sueña con aumentar su negocio para que sus hijos puedan tener cosas mejores y más oportunidades en la vida.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and other beauty products

loans.name: Rimber Joel

texts.es:
Joel is a young man with a great desire for self-improvement. At 19 years of age, he has his own cuye (guinea pig) farm and at the same time he cultivates alfalfa. He has been raising cuyes since he was ten years old, having been motivated and taught the trade by his parents who he lives with. His dream is to serve his country by becoming a policeman. In the meantime, Joel will continue to tend to his farm while simultaneously working toward making his law enforcement career dreams a reality. Joel needs to plant alfalfa to feed his cuyes, which is why he is seeking this loan with the promise that he will be punctual with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Joel es un joven con muchos deseos de superación, a sus 19 años posee su propia granja de cuyes y a la vez cultiva alfalfa, la crianza de cuyes lo realiza desde que tiene 10 años porque sus padres lo motivaron e inculcaron, él vive con sus padres y tiene el sueño de servir a su patria siendo un honesto policía. Mientras tanto, Joel seguirá trabajando en su granja y a la vez preparándose para que su anhelo sea una realidad. Joel necesita sembrar alfalfa para sus cuyes, para ello, es que solicita el presente préstamo, con la promesa de ser puntual en sus pagos.

loans.use: Purchase alfalfa to plant, as it is the food he uses for his guinea pigs.

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise for her convenience store, Tienda Mary. She has had this business for one year. Before that, she worked selling fruit in Guatemala City. She says that her customers are asking for more products and she wants to meet that demand. Therefore, she is going to use her loan to purchase daily consumption items such as beans, rice, oil, soap, etc. This is her first loan with FAPE, but she has received other loans from other banks in the past.

Paula is 53 years old, married, and has 7 children, who are between the ages of 14 and 38. Her children have studied but only through primary school. Paula herself has studied a little and says she can read and write a little. Paula has many dreams to improve her life. She wants to invest in more inventory, to advance herself, and maybe someday have more businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Paula está pidiendo este préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su tienda de productos básicos que se llama Tienda Mary. Ella ha tenido este negocio por un año. Antes, trabajó en la venta de frutas en la ciudad capital de Guatemala. Ella dice que la gente pide más mercadería y ella quiere satisfacer esta demanda. Por lo tanto, va a usar su préstamo para comprar cosas de consumo diario como frijol, arroz, aceite, jabon, etc. Este es su primer préstamo con FAPE, pero ha recibido otros préstamos de otros bancos en el pasado. Paula tiene 53 años, es casada, y tiene siete hijos que tienen entre 14 y 38 años. Sus hijos han estudiado, pero solo sacaron primaria. Ella misma estudió un poco y dice que puede leer y escribir un poco. Paula tiene muchos sueños de mejorar su vida. Quiere invertir mas en productos, superarse, y quizás algún día tener más negocios.

loans.use: to purchase daily consumption items such as beans, rice, oil, soap, etc.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina, along with her husband, works hard to ensure that their two small children improve themselves each day by continuing their studies. For several years, she sold tubers -- such as potatoes -- door-to-door. However her activities, along with the other traveling salespeople in the area, were halted by the local municipal police given that house-to-house sales are prohibited. The end of her business led her to start selling sheep in the markets of Chupaca on the weekends. The rest of the days of the week, she works with her husband in a brick factory. With these activities, they manage to earn income to feed their children. Aquilina does not stop – her goal is to grow her livestock enterprise, for which she is seeking a loan that she will invest wisely into the purchase of additional sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Aquilina que trabaja junto a su esposo arduamente para ver a sus 2 pequeños hijos superarse cada día a través del estudio, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta ambulante de tubérculos como la papa. Pero fue desalojada por la policía municipal junto a los demás comerciante de su zona por la prohibición de venta ambulatoria. Para detenerse en su trabajo, empezó a dedicarse a la venta de ganado de ovejas en las ferias ganaderas de Chupaca, esto lo hace todos los fines de semana y los demás días, junto a su esposo, trabajan en una fabrica ladrillera. De esa manera ellos logran conseguir el pan a diario para sus hijos, Aquilina no se detiene, tiene como meta crecer en la ganadería, para lo cual solicita un préstamo que invertirá hábilmente en la compra de más ovejas.

loans.use: Purchase of more sheep to help increase her income.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol is a 41-year old woman who has a great responsibility: the support her 12-year old son and provide him with a university education. For some time now, she has worked raising animals to later offer for sale. She also sells milk and dedicates herself to farming, planting primarily potatoes and corn. She hopes that her endeavors will help her to get ahead. Three years ago, she inherited three cows and the land on which she farms from her parents. This helped her tremendously to increase her working capital. Marisol seeks a loan to improve the feed she uses for her livestock, enabling her to purchase a more balanced and nutritious blend of products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Marisol es una mujer de 41 años que siente que tiene una gran responsabilidad, ser el sustento de su hijo de 12 años y brindarle una carrera universitaria. Desde hace mucho tiempo ella trabaja criando animales para venderlos luego, también vende leche. Además se dedica al cultivo, siembra principalmente papa y maíz, con estas actividades ella puede seguir adelante. Hace 3 años heredó unas vacas y las tierras de cultivo de sus padres que la favorecieron enormemente y con ello aumentó su capital de trabajo. Marisol cual solicita este préstamo para mejorar la alimentación de sus animales comprando productos balanceados.

loans.use: Purchase more nutritious and balanced feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Maria Telma

texts.en:
Maria is only 24 years old but is very ambitious and already has several businesses. These include weaving huipiles (traditional embroidered dress), raising pigs and chickens, and selling pots and pans. She is requesting this loan to buy thread to use in weaving huipiles, which she does by hand, to purchase chickens to raise and sell, and to buy pots and pans to sell. She has 16 years of experience weaving huipiles and has raised animals for 9 years. Maria lives in a rural and remote village and spends most of her time working at her house. She can weave two huipiles in a month and she takes them to the city of Chimaltenango where she can sell them for 400-425 Guatemala Quetzals (about US$55-60) each. She also takes her chickens to Chimaltenango to sell when they are grown. Most of her pots and pans sales are in her own village. She buys them by the box for 320 Guatemalan Quetzals (US$43) and sells them for 600-650 Quetzals (US$80-88).

This is her first loan with FAPE, although she has received other loans before from another bank. She is happy to have the opportunity to invest in her businesses and hopes that they will continue growing. Maria has 4 children, who range from 5 months to 5 years old. She dreams that she can move forward and that her children will have better lives. She also wants to buy more land to someday leave to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Maria solamente tiene 24 años, pero es muy ambiciosa y ya tiene varios negocios: el tejido de huipiles, la crianza de marrones y pollos, y la venta de bahías. Está pidiendo este préstamo para comprar hilo para usar en el tejido de huipiles que hace a mano, para comprar pollos para criar y vender, y para más bahías para vender. Ella tiene 16 años de experiencia en tejer los huipiles y ha criado animales por nueve años. Maria vive en un cantón rural y retirada y pasa la mayoría de su tiempo trabajando de la casa. Puede tejer dos huipiles en un mes, y los lleva a la ciudad Chimaltenango donde los puede vender por 400-425 Quetzales (aproximadamente $55-60) cada uno. También lleva los pollos a Chimaltenango para venderlos cuando están grandes. La mayoría de sus ventas de bahías están en su propio cantón. Las compra en caja por 320 Quetzales ($43) y las vende por 600-650 Quetzales ($80-88). Este es su primer préstamo con FAPE, aunque ha recibido otros préstamos antes de otro banco. Está contenta de tener la oportunidad de invertir en sus negocios y espera que sigan creciendo. Maria tiene 4 hijos de 5 meses a 5 anos. Sueña que se supere y que sus hijos tuvieren vidas mejores. También quiere comprar más terreno para, algún día, dejar a sus hijos.

loans.use: to buy thread to use in weaving huipiles, to purchase chickens to raise and sell, and to buy pots and pans to sell

loans.name: Alva Marina

texts.en:
Alva sells vegetables in the local market in the city of Chimaltenango. She has worked in this business for three years and is happy to have the opportunity, with the help of this loan, to invest in her business and expand it. She is going to use the credit to buy more vegetables, such as onions, tomatoes, and potatoes to sell. She also sells chickens to supplement her income.

Alva is 19 years old and has two children, who are two years old and a month and a half. Her husband works with her selling vegetables but also works in a factory. Alva dreams of getting ahead in life. Someday, she would like to have a car. More than anything, she dreams that her children will receive a good education and will have more opportunities to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Alva tiene una venta de verduras en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Chimaltenango. Ella ha trabajado en este negocio por 3 años y está contenta de tener la oportunidad, con la ayuda de este préstamo, de invertir en el negocio y aumentarlo. Ella va a usar su crédito para comprar más verduras, como cebollas, tomates, y papas para vender. También vende gallinas para complementar sus ingresos. Alva tiene 19 años y tiene dos hijos de dos años y de un mes y media. Su esposo trabaja con ella en la venta de verduras pero también en una fabrica. Alva sueña que se supere. Quiere tener un carro algún día. Más que nada, sueña que sus hijos van a recibir educaciones buenas y tener más oportunidades de seguir adelante en la vida.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva knew that she would have to support her household herself for many years when her husband died. She had to manage on her own to generate income to settle the needs of her 6 children. Now they are adults that can maintain themselves. Elva is dedicated to the arduous tasks of the field. Like she herself says, one works where one’s strength permits. She feels full of vitality to continue, having already completed 20 years as a hard-working farmer, making trips to sell her products in the capital city. To increase the profits from her crop of potatoes and corn she is requesting a loan that she will invest in buying agricultural supplements and fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Elva supo durante muchos años solventar sola su hogar, luego que su esposo muriera, ella tuvo que ingeniárselas para que sola pueda generar ingresos para solventar las necesidades D. sus 6 hijos, ahora ellos ya son personas adultas que se auto sostienen. Elva se dedica a las arduas tareas del campo, como ella misma dice, trabajara hasta donD. sus fuerzas lo permitan, y se siente llena D. vitalidad para continuar, son ya 20 años cumplidos D. Elva como una esforzada agricultora, realizando viajes para vender sus productos en la ciudad capital. Para incrementar las ganancias D. su siembra D. papa y maíz está solicitando un préstamo el que invertirá comprando abono y fertilizantes

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplements and fertilizer to increase her potato and corn crop.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.en:
Maria operates a convenience store, Tienda San Antonio, in the front of her house. She is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise, such as beans, rice, oil and other items to sell in her store. She has had the store for seven years and this loan would help her a lot right now because her inventory is scarce. In addition to selling from her store, Maria travels to Guatemala City to sell at the market, where she sells things like beans, rice, fruits and vegetables. She has the most sales on Saturdays and Sundays. When Maria is selling in the city, her sister and her grandmother help her with the store at her house.

In addition to selling daily consumption items, Maria grows corn on the land around her house and also has a mill to grind corn for making tortillas. She has received loans from another bank in the past, which she used to invest in grinding corn. Now she wants to invest in Tienda San Antonio. She says that if she has more inventory, she can sell more and earn more. There is demand for her products and she only needs to capital to buy more in order to expand her business.

Maria is a 24 year old single mother and her seven year old son is in school. She only studied up to the sixth grade and wants her son to have more opportunities than she had. She dreams of being able to expand her business to continue supporting her son in his studies and that he will continue moving forward in life.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Maria tiene una tienda de consumo diario en la frente de su casa que se llama Tienda San Antonio. Ella está pidiendo este préstamo para comprar más mercadería, como frijol, arroz, aceite, y otras cosas de consumo diario para vender en su tienda. Ha tenido su tienda por siete años, y dice que este préstamo la ayudaría mucho porque ahora su inventario está escaso. Además de sus ventas de su tienda, Maria viaja casi todos los días de su cantón rural y retirada a la cuidad capital de Guatemala para vender en el mercado, donde vende cosas como frijol, arroz, frutas, y verduras. Tiene las más ventas en los sábados y los domingos. Cuando Maria está vendiendo en la capital, su hermana y su abuela la ayuda en su tienda en su casa. Además de sus ventas de consumo diario, Maria también cultiva milpa en su terreno alrededor de su casa y tiene molino de maíz también. Ha recibido préstamos de otro banco en el pasado que usó para invertir en el molino, pero ahora quiere invertir en la Tienda San Antonio. Ella dice que, si hay más mercadería, venderá más y ganará más. Hay demanda para sus productos, y solamente necesita la capital para comprar más para aumentar su negocio. Maria es una madre soltera de 24 años, y su hijo de 7 años está en la escuela. Ella solamente estudió hasta el sexto grado y quiere que el tenga mas oportunidades que ella tuviera. Sueña que puede aumentar su negocio para seguir apoyando a su hijo en sus estudios y que él seguirá adelante en la vida.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as beans, rice, oil and other items to sell in her store

loans.name: Thelma Lucrecia

texts.es:
Mrs. R. has more than 7 years' history with the Leon 2000 Foundation. All of her credits have been put towards the purchase of raw materials related to her tailoring shop, she being a fashion designer. She lives in her own house that she has also remodelled with the help of past credits. She is married and has 7 children, two of which are still dependents and one is afflicted with Down's Syndrome.  These are the only children left in her charge.  Her husband is a bus driver, owner of his own vehicle, and he helps economically.

In her small tailoring shop she emplioys two individuals and they work from home.

She offers her services to a steady clientele, already established and to whom she delivers merchandise or the finished products. Her sales are carried out in cash or on credit, of which she collects 50% within 45 days.

Her dreams have mostly materialized in seeing her children become professionals, and work for themselves. Her biggest concern is of her daughter who is differently abled who will be left alone when she passes away. She doesn't feel that the care she provides her now will be the same type of care that she will receive from one of her siblings.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora R. tiene mas de 7 años de trabajar con fundación leon 2000, todos su creditos han sido para la compra de materia prima relacionaados con su taller de costura siendo ella modista, vive en casa propia, que tambien con los creditos ha vendido mejorando, es casada, tiene siete hijos de los cuales dos aún dependen de ella uno estudia en la universidad cursa el tercer año en administración de empresa y su otra hija quien le nacio con problemas de SINDROME DE DAUNW ( mentales), siendo los unicos hijo a su cargo.
Su esposo es transportista dueño de una unidad, quien le ayuda economicamente.

En su pequeño taller de costura se genera fuentes de empleo para dos personas dierctamente ya que estás trabajan en su casa.

Ella ofrece sus servicios a clientes fijos, ya establecidos a quienes les entrega mercadería o producto terminado, sus ventas son de contado y credito en un 50 porciento que recupera en un plazo de 45 dias.

Su sueño en su mayoria se han concretizado ya que la mayoria de sus hijos ya son profesionales, y trabajan por su propia cuenta, su mayor pesar es dejar a su hija con capacidades diferentes sola una vez que ella fallezca porque considera que el cuido que ella le da no se la van a dar sus otros hermanos.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina raises animals, buys and sells fruit, and helps her husband farm. She is requesting this loan to buy food for her cows and purchase fruit, including mangos, strawberries, raspberries, and peaches. Sabina lives in a rural and remote village, but travels to the city of Chimaltenango to sell her fruit at the local market. She has been selling fruit for 20 years, but it was only 7 years ago that she was able to secure a fixed location at the market.

As she also works with her husband in agriculture, Sabina will use part of her loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. Sabina and her husband own their house and also have six little plots of land.

Sabina is 41 years old and has 11 children, who range from 1½ to 23 years old. Of all of her children, only three are in school right now. However, all of the older ones have received some education. Sabina only studied up to the second grade and can read a little but can’t sign her name. She says that she has suffered in life and has had to sacrifice a lot since she has so many children. She hopes that this loan will help her expand her business and increase her income so that she and her family can have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Sabina trabaja en la crianza de animales, la compra y venta de frutas, y le ayuda a su esposo en la agricultura. Está pidiendo este préstamo para comprar comida para sus vacas y más frutas, como mangos, fresas, moras, y duraznos. Sabina vive in un cantón rural y retirado, pero viaja a la ciudad de Chimaltenango para vender las frutas en el mercado municipal. Ha trabajado en la venta de frutas por 20 años, pero hace 7 años logró el éxito de tener su propio lugar fijo en el mercado. Como también trabaja con su esposo en la agricultura, también quiere usar parte del préstamo para comprar cosas como abono y semillas para que puedan cultivar más. La casa de Sabina y su esposo es propia y tienen seis cuerdas de terreno. Sabina tiene 41 años y tiene once hijos de un año y media hasta 23 años. De todos sus hijos, solamente tres están en la escuela ahora, pero todos de los más grandes han recibido algo de educación. Sabina solamente estudió hasta el segundo grado y dice que puede leer un poco pero no puede firmar su nombre. Ella dice que ha sufrido en su vida, y hay que sacrificar mucho para tantos hijos. Tiene esperanza que este préstamo la ayudará a crecer su negocio y aumentar sus ganancias para que tengan una vida mejor.

loans.use: to buy food for her cows, fruit to sell, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Mrs. V. is the owner of a small grocery store where she offers a variety of products for the home. This business is run by her and her children. She lives in her own house. Aside from this source of income she also runs a small bakery where she provides work for 2 other family members.

She is married and has 4 children who are already married and do not depend on her. Her clients are people from the area. She sells bread to the grocery stores in the adjacent areas carrying on her transactions in cash and on credit, collecting payments bi-weekly.

One of her wishes is to better equip her bakery, in terms to the store structure and equipment, especially because her oven in for crafts and is not an industrial oven.

Another one of her dreams is to remodel her store to make it larger and to be able to offer all products needed for the home, from her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora V., es propietaria de una pulpería donde ofrece una variedad de productos del hogar, dicho negocio es administrado por ella misma y sus hijos, vive en casa propia, ademas de estos ingresos tiene una pequeña panadería, donde genera fuentes de empleo para 2 personas siendo familiar el negocio. Es casada tiene 4 hijos que ya estan casados, no dependen de ella, en cuanto sus clientes estos son personas del sector, venden lo que es el pan a pulperias de los barrios aledaños de contado y credito que recupera cada quince dias. Uno de sus deseos es acondicionar mejor su pequeña panadería, en cuanto a local y maquinaria, ya que su horno actual es artesanal y no industrializado. Otro de sus deseos es poder acondicionar un local mas grande para ofertar todos los productos para el hogar relacionados con su pulpería.

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Leon 2000 - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Flora

texts.en:
Maria has worked selling vegetables, fruits, and beans in the local market in the city of Chimaltenango for 15 years. She lives in a rural and remote village. She buys her products in nearby San Martin Jilotepeque and then brings them to the market on Tuesdays and Thursdays. On other days of the week, she sells at other locations. She offers a lot of variety, selling strawberries, mangos, potatoes, broccoli, avocados, beans, peaches, and more.

This is her first loan from FAPE, but she has received other loans before. Maria will use the credit to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. She is happy to have the opportunity to invest in her business and expand it.

Maria is 47 years old and has 11 children, who are between the ages of 4 and 23. Four of her children are studying right now and some of them have completed primary school. She herself studied for two years and she can read a little and sign her own name. Maria has her own house and land, where her husband works growing beans and corn. Maria dreams of growing her business and is grateful for the support from this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Maria tiene 15 años en su negocio de venta de verduras, frutas, y frijoles en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Chimaltenango. Ella vive en un cantón rural y retirada, compra sus productos en San Martín Jilotepeque y los lleva al mercado los martes y jueves. En los otros días vende de otro lugar donde hay más gente. Ella ofrece mucha variedad en sus productos, como fresas, mangos, papas, brócoli, aguacate, frijoles, melocotones y más. Este es su primer préstamo con FAPE, pero ha recibido otros préstamos antes con otro banco. Maria usará su crédito para comprar más frutas y verduras para vender y está contenta de tener la oportunidad de invertir en su negocio y aumentarlo. Maria tiene 47 años y tiene once hijos que tienen entre 4 y 23 años. Cuatro de sus hijos están estudiando ahora y algunos han sacado el básico pero no todavía están estudiando más. Ella misma estudió dos años y dice que puede leer un poco y firmar su propio nombre. Tiene su propia casa y terreno, donde su esposo trabaja en la siembra de frijoles y milpa. Maria sueña con aumentar su negocio y está agradecida por el apoyo de este préstamo.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Kari Marina

texts.es:
Mrs. Sanoval is the owner of a small grocery store located in her house. She has more than 8 years running her business. She lives in her own house and has three children, two are currently in high school and one in primary school, all attending private schools. Her partner works as a used car salesman, and he helps with the support of the children. She lives in the 1 Mayo region.

Her business is directly managed by her and her adolescent chidlren. Her sales are carried out in cash and on credit to the people in the area.

Her living conditions are such that her house is made of cement blocks and the floor is made of bricks. 

Her greatest dream is to expand her business to offer more products.  This way she will be able to acquire more goods for her children and provide them with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora sanoval, es propietaria de una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitación, teniendo mas de 8 años de tener dicho negocio, vive en casa propia tiene tres hijos, actualmente dos cursan secundaria y uno primaria, en colegios privados, su compañero trabaja como vendedor de autos usados, quien le ayuda en la manutencion de los hijos, ella vive en el reparto primero de mayo.
En cuanto su negocio es atendido directamente por ella y sus hijos adolescentes, sus ventas son de contado y credito a personas del sector.
En cuanto a sus condicones de vida su casa es de bloque y zinc, piso de ladrillo.

Su mayor sueño, es ampliar su negocio y poder ofertar mas productos, así como poder adquirir otros bienes para sus hijos y darles mejores condiciones.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es:
Maria Gabriela is a merchant of new clothing, a job that has come about from the lack of employment. She had a job but she was fired when she got pregnant, but even today she continues with her business./p>

She lives in her own house and she has two children who are still minors. One is attending primary school at Asuncion Primary School and the other is still a newborn. Her husband works in the fast food and delivery sector, these being the primary income of the family.

The sales she carries on are in cash and by credit (collecting weekly and bi-weekly payments) for clients in the area. She makes her purchases in Managua and Chinandega.

Her dream is to set up a clothing store in her house and to settle in to her house because they had little time. She wants to remodel because the new house is not finished lacking bedrooms, bathrooms and other divisions.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Gabriela, es comerciante de ropa nueva, actividad que surge como una alternativa al desempleo ya que estuvo trabajando pero al salir embarazada fue despedida, y actualmente trabaja con dicho negocio. Vive en casa propia es casada tiede dos hijos menores de edad, una estudia primaria en el colegio la asunción y el otro es recien nacido, su esposo trabaja en servicios de comida rapida con entega a domicilio, siendo los ingresos del nuceo familiar. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y credito que recupera en abonos semanales y quincenales, a clientes del sector, sus compras las realiza en managua y chinandega. Sus sueños son instalar una tienda de ropa en su casa de habitación y acondicionar su casa ya que es casa nueva teniendo poco tiempo de haberse traslado a este domicilio y no tiene las condiciones necesarias como cuarto, baños, en especial divisiones internas del inmueble.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mrs. Pon R. is a stove maker in Tie Prumpie Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Tin Phan, helps his wife. They have three children, two of whom are working as construction workers while the third is a motorbike-taxi driver who earns only a small income because the price of gasoline has gone up and his old motorbike uses a lot of gasoline at a time.

Thus, Mrs. Pon R. is requesting a loan so she can buy a new motorbike for her son. Mrs. Pon R. obtained a previous loan from AMK to buy clay to make stoves and she has fully repaid this loan. Mrs. Pon R. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her son's business.

loans.name: Francisca Lorena

texts.es:
This woman lives in her own house, is divorced, and is mother of three children who are attendng a public school. their home is made of cement blocks.

Her work is carried out alongside her mother who helps her with the tailoring shop. Her clients are from the area abut she also takes it on the road to sell her merchandise in Honduras. Her transactions are in cash and credit (which she collects on a weekly or bi-weekly basis). She travels two days a week. Although she is separated from her husband, he provides economic support for her children.

Her credit request is for the acquisition of raw materials related to her tailoring shop. In her credit history she has had 8 loans with the Leon 2000 Foundation, all of which have been repaid on time.

Her dream is to see her children trained as professionals, and to expand her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora vive en casa propia, es divorciada, madre de tres hijos, estudian en colegio publico, su casa de habitación de bloque y zin, Su actividad la lleva cabo en conjunto con su señora Mamá, quien la ayuda en el taller de costura, sus clientes son personas del sector, tambien sale a vender parte de su mercadería a honduras, de contado y credito que recupera a los quince dias o semanales, vieja dos veces en la semana, aunque esté separada el padre de sus hijos le ayuda economicamente en su manutención. Sus creditos han sido para la adquisición de materia prima relacionados con su taller de costura, lleva 8 creditos con fundación leon 2000, ha pagado en tiempo y forma. Sus sueños, es ver preparados profesionalmente a sus hijos, y ampliar su taller.

loans.use: Tailoring shop

loans.name: Ranty

texts.en:
Mrs. Ranty L. lives in Kraing Khmer Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 44 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are attending school while the others are too young to work or study. She buys rice in bulk which she later sells at a better price.

Since her business is going well, Mrs. Ranty L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more husk-rice to keep in stock. Her husband, Mr. Saveuorn Nhoeb, rears pigs in the local village. Mrs. Ranty L. obtained a previous loan from AMK to buy piglets for her husband's business and she fully repaid that loan. Mrs. Ranty L. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more husk-rice to hold in stock and sell later at a better price.

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhim P. is a farmer in Trear Chaoeng Village in Kampong Chhnag Province. Her husband, Mr. Khensarim Khoem, is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Sokhim P. is 28 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. During the rainy season, she usually cultivates rice. Unfortunately, this year she does not have enough money to hire a laborer with cattle to help plow the rice field.

Thus, Mrs. Sokhim P. is requesting a loan with which she can hire a laborer and some cattle. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to help increase crop yields. Mrs. Sokhim P. has obtained a previous loan from AMK to buy the motorbike her husband uses for his business and she succeeded in repaying this loan. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To i) hire a laborer and cattle to help with plowing; and ii) buy fertilizers to raise crop yields.

loans.name: Sothorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sothorn P. is a driver in Trear Chaoeng Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. His wife, Mrs. Phoeurn Loung, is a farmer. A severe dry spell of late has meant that her crops have done theri worst this season.

In order to solve this problem, Mr. Sothorn P. is requesting a loan to buy a pump to water the field. Mr. Sothorn P. has a child who is employed in a garment factory. Previously, Mr. Sothorn P. had obtained a loan to add to his savings to build a new house and he fully repaid the loan. His wife is shown in the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a pump to irrigate their crops.

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en:
Mr. Sareth E. is a motorbike-taxi driver in Trear Chaoeng Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is 38 and the father of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while two others are attending school. The remaining one is too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Sitha Ros, is a farmer. She usually hires a laborer and some cattle to plow her rice field, but this time she does not have enough money to do so.

Thus, her husband, Mr. Sareth E., is requesting a loan to help pay for a laborer and cattle. He will also use part of the loan to purchase fertilizers to help increase crop yields. So far, Mr. Sareth E. has obtained one previous loan from AMK to build a new house and has succeeded in paying off the loan. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer and cattle to plow her rice field and purchase fertilizers to help increase crop yields.

loans.name: Chhoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoeurn C. is a farmer in Hang Chhouk Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a 62-year-old widow with four children, one of whom is a motorbike-taxi driver while another one is employed in garment factory. The remaining two attend school. Although 3 of the family members are employed, they still live in an old house. Thus, Mrs. Chhoeurn C. has decided to request a loan to build a new house to replace their old one in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To build a new house to replace her old one in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Giau

texts.vi:
In 2000, Mrs. Ngyen T. Giau's husband went to other villages to find jobs. Since then, he has never come back. She was left with two young children. Mrs. Giau became the sole bread winner of the family. She works any job around the village, and does some tailoring to earn money so that her kids can go to school. She has two perches of land to plant wheat, but because of her sickness, she has to leave the land unattended. Last year Mrs. Giau was able to hire someone to work on the land, earning 4,000,000 VND (around 235 USD). When her husband left the house, her youngest son was very small. He is now in second grade. Mrs. Giau's life is still very difficult. She wants to borrow money to buy some cows and save money for her sons' schooling.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong N., Kiva's Volunteer.

Năm 2000 chồng đi làm thuê xa nhà và từ đó đến nay bỏ 3 mẹ con đi luôn ( Chị có hai con ) một mình mẹ bươn chải nuôi con ăn học. Bản thân vừa làm thuê vừa may vá lặt vặt cho bà con chòm xóm. Nhà có được 2 sào đất trồng mì nhưng do sức khỏe hạn chế thành ra đất thường bỏ không, năm rồi thuê người làm thu nhập được 4 triệu, Khi chồng bỏ nhà ra đi đứa thứ 2 còn nhỏ và nay cháu đã vào lớp 2. Vì hòan cảnh hiện tại còn nhiều khó khăn, gia đình muốn có ít tiền nuôi bò gây vốn sau này cho 2 con ăn học.

loans.use: Raise Cattle

loans.name: Oanh

texts.vi:
In 2003, Mrs. L. T. H. Oanh's husband passed away after an accident, leaving her with their two young children. Theif lives were hard; the house was unsettled. Mrs. Oanh tries very hard to provide her kids with food and education. At the beginning of 2004, Mrs Oanh remarried and has another child with her second husband. Her husband's job is to sell sand from the river. However, this is a seasonal job, which he can only work during the dry season. During the raining season, he has to do all kinds of jobs. Mrs. Oanh is doing farming. However, since the soil is not good, and she cannot employ a lot of technical advances, their family income is still very limited. Earning money is hard, and keeping peace in the family is not good either (since her sons and her husband do not get along well). Mrs. Oanh wants to borrow money to raise cows and save money for her children's schooling. In Mrs. Oanh's family, the average monthly income is 190,000 VND ( equivalent to 12 USD) per person.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva's Volunteer.

Năm 2003 chồng bị tai nạn giao thông chết để lại cho vợ 2 đứa con thơ vì thế hòan cảnh gia đình rơi vào túng T.ếu, nhà cửa chưa ổn định. Một mình vất vả làm thuê nuôi 2 con ăn học. Đầu năm 2004 cô Oanh đi bước nữa với người chồng thứ 2 bây giờ và có thêm 1 đứa con nữa. Chồng mới làm nghề vớt cát dưới sông đem lên bờ bán, tuy nhiên nghề này chỉ làm được vào mùa khô còn mùa mưa thì làm lung tung đủ thứ. Vợ làm rẫy nhưng do đất xấu và T.ếu kỹ thuật canh tác nên thu nhập thấp. Kinh tế hiện tại gặp nhiều khó khăn, gia đình lại cảnh cha dượng, con vợ nên lắm lúc rối tung cả lên. Gia đình muốn có nguồn vốn nuôi bò để các cháu ăn học sau này. Thu nhập bình quân 190.000 đ/người/tháng.

loans.use: Raise cattle

loans.name: Yong

texts.en:
Mr. Yong Y. is a villager in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a farmer and firewood seller. His wife, Mrs. Khon Sun, is also a farmer. They have two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending school.

The older child (working in the garment factory), is married but still lives with his parents. Mr. Yong Y. wants them to have a place of their own but he does not have enough money to build them a new house. Thus, he is requesting a loan for this purpose. Previously, Mr. Yong Y. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cart and he has already repaid that loan in full.

loans.use: To build a separate house for his married children.

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Mrs. Kun H. lives in Kraing Kantrol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farm worker who tills soil for a living. Mrs. Kun H. is 49 and a widow with two children who are employed in a garment factory.

Even though Mrs. Kun H. and her children are employed, they still live in an old house. Thus she is requesting a loan to build a new house for her family in order to improve their standard of living.
