The income from Ana’s store provides for the daily provisions for her home and pays for the education of her daughters which makes this an indispensable business for the family. With a desire to increase her profits, Ana wishes to increase the products she sells and to stock her store with a variety of merchandise. In order to do this she needs the loan she is requesting. She promises to be responsible in making the payments on the loan as Ana knows that the money that you loan her also comes from great effort and hard work. This is why she will treat your contribution as hugely valuable help which will not be erased from her memory.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Ana, en base a esfuerzo y trabajo logró instalar una tienda en su domicilio, lo que es conveniente para que ella no descuide la atención de sus hijas.Las ganancias de la bodega de Ana es la provisión diaria de su casa y lo que solventa los gastos de educación de sus hijas, lo que lo hace un negocio indispensable para esta familia.Con el deseo de incrementar estas ganancias Ana pretende incrementar los productos que vende y surtir su tienda con variedad de mercadería.Para ello requiere de la cantidad de dinero que solicita en calidad de préstamo con la promesa de ser responsable en sus pagos, además Ana sabe que el dinero que ustedes le pueden brindar también proviene de esfuerzo y trabajo, por ello considera que su aporte sería una ayuda tan valiosa, que no se borrará de su memoria.

loans.use: Capital investment to increase the merchandise in her store.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther is a very serious woman but is very amiable with people. Dedicating herself to raising livestock is what pleases her most because taking care of her animals is less burdensome that working in the fields. Thanks to her husband, who dedicates himself entirely to farming she can keep caring for her animals. This allows her to stay at home to watch over her children and her husband. Her desire is to increase her livestock and to be a prosperous cattle rancher who can fulfill the meat demand in the local markets. In order to take the first step towards her goal, she is asking for a loan. This money is necessary to purchase breeding animals. Esther knows that with your help she can keep taking steps in the direction towards prosperity.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Esther es una mujer seria, pero muy amable con las personas, dedicarse a la ganadería es lo que más le agrada, porque cuidar de sus animales es menos pesado que trabajar en el campo, gracias a su esposo, quien es el que se está dedicado íntegramente a los terrenos de cultivo, puede mantenerse al cuidado de sus animales, esto le permite quedarse en casa y velar por el bienestar de sus hijos y su esposo. Su deseo es de incrementar su ganado y ser una gran próspera ganadera, que satisfaga la demanda de carne en los mercados de su localidad.Para dar el primer paso, solicita este préstamo, dinero necesario para la compra de animales de raza. Esther sabe que con su ayuda, podrá seguir dando más pasos en el camino de la prosperidad.

loans.use: Purchase of animals of a better breed to improve the quality of her livestock.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the Despertar Village Bank.

Gregoria is a married, fifty-nine-year-old mother of nine children. Gregoria has a small grocery store in her house in the Santa Rosa neighborhood. She sells groceries, vegetables, fruit, beer, meat, and also telephone cards. Gregoria starts her day at dawn, around four in the morning, when she goes to the markets to purchase vegetables. She then manages her store from six in the morning to nine at night. In addition, Gregoria has two telephone booths. Gregoria also cultivates alfalfa that she sells at her store.

Gregoria needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in more rice, oil, milk, sugar, noodles and eggs so she can further expand her business.

Gregoria´s dream is to further stock her business, proviD. the best education for her children, and to have a livestock grange.

loans.use: Gregoria needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in more rice, oil, milk, sugar, noodles and eggs so she can further expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Despertar Village Bank.

Maria is a thirty-nine-year-old mother of two children. Maria and her husband has a small grocery store where she sells vegetables, house supplies, stove gas, fruit, ice cream, etc., items that she buys from the markets in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Maria has a beauty salon next to her store.

Maria needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in sugar, rice, milk, cooking oil, noodles, meat, and detergent so that she can further expand her business.

Maria´s dream is to further stock her business, to have her own working capital, and to see that he children become good professionals.

loans.use: Maria needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in sugar, rice, milk, cooking oil, noodles, meat, and detergent so that she can further expand her business.

loans.name: Andrea, Victoria, And Silvia Group

texts.en:
Andrea, Victoria and Silvia are members of the Lirio Village Bank.

Andrea is a married, forty-year-old mother of eight children. Andrea travels to different regional fairs to buy cereal, small animals, cheese, etc. to sell in the Nery García Market. In addition, Andrea sells fruit and soda in front of her home.

Meanwhile, Victoria is a married, thirty-eight-year-old woman. Victoria engages in artisan embroidery of fabrics such as scarfs, tapestries, etc,, which she sells in the Santa Clara Market.

Silvia is a married, thirty-year-old mother of two children. Siliva travels to different regional fairs to purchase cereal, cheese, meats, etc. to sell in her neighborhood market and door-to-door.

Andrea, Victoria, and Silvia need separate loans of 400 soles each, to invest in beans, corn, thread, dye, meat, and cheese so they can further expand their businesses.

Andrea, Victoria and Sylvia´s dreams are to have their own homes, to have their own working capital, to repatch their house roofs, and to see that their children study hard.

loans.use: Andrea, Victoria, and Silvia need separate loans of 400 soles each to invest in beans, corn, thread, dye, meat, and cheese so they can further expand their business.

loans.name: Namerta Hilda

texts.en:
Namerta is a member of the Lirio Village Bank.

Namerta is a fifty-five-year-old, single mother of three children. Namerta has a small car parts store at a rented location on Mariano Melgar Rd. Her business is very close to mechanics shops and she has had her store for many years. Namerta acquires car parts in the city of Lima and manages her store from eight in the morning to seven at night.

Namerta needs a loan of 3,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in lubricants and motor parts.

Namerta’s dream is to move forward, to improve her business, and to see that her children become professionals.

loans.use: Namerta needs a loan of 3,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in lubricants and motor parts.

loans.name: Gregoria Ccasani

texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the Lirio Village Bank.

Gregoria is a married, fifty-three-year-old mother of five children. Gregoria sells firewood in her home that she brings from the city of Anadahuaylas. In addition, Gregoria and her husband have stereo systems that they rent to different people, districts, and provinces. Gregoria also sells food outsiD. of her home in the evenings.

Gregoria needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in more firewood and stereo systems.

Gregoria’s dream is to work with more stereo systems, to construct her home, and to see that her children study hard and move forward.

loans.use: Gregoria needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in more firewood and stereo systems

loans.name: Zenaida, Luicita And Isabel Group

texts.en:
Zenaida Luicita and Isabel are members of the Lirio Village Bank.

Zenaida is a married, thirty-year-old mother of four children. Zenaida sells food in different regional fairs and travels to different villages during their festival seasons to sell food. In addition, Zenaida sells homemade bread in the Pilacucho neighborhood.

Meanwhile, Luicita is a married, twenty-four-year-old mother of two children. Luicita sells fruit at regional fairs, where she also purchases cereal that she resells to different businesses in the Nery Garcia Market. In addition, Luicita has an embroidering service for different businesses.

Additionally, Isabel is a thirty-three-year old mother of three children. Isabel has a store in her house where she sells vegetables, home supplies, and meat. In addition, Isabel travels to different fairs, where she buys livestock that she resells to restaurants.

Zenaida, Luicita and Isabel need respective loans of 400, 400, and 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in vegetables, fruit, rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, and meat.

Zenaida, Luicita and Isabel’s dreams are that they further supply and improve their businesses, and their children finish their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: Zenaida, Luicita, and Isabel need respective loans of 400, 400, and 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in vegetables, fruit, rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, and meat.

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
My name is Jose Guadalupe and my wife and I have a house. Our bathroom is very small and we now need more space to have a comfortable home. We decided to expand it but don't have the resources to do so. In order to complete the construction, we're asking for a loan of 500 dollars.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es José Guadalupe mi esposa y yo tenemos una casa de interés social, nuestro baño es muy pequeño y realmente necesitamos mas espacio para tener una casa mas cómoda así que decidimos ampliarlo hacia un costado de nuestra casa pero por falta de recursos no habíamos podido hacerlo por eso solicitamos la cantidad de 500 dll.

loans.use: Expand his Bathroom

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Cristóbal

texts.es:
Don Cristóbal is 57 years old. He is married and works as a labourer buying and selling bananas. His business is located at his home in the Caserío Pajocá, in the village of Pacamaché, Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, in Sololá department. Because of his constant efforts to get ahead, he managed to obtain a small banana business. His positive attitude in the community means he is a well-known and well-liked businessman in Caserío Pajocá.

In the past he was a labourer doing work in the countryside for various people; he used to work on farms in order to earn money for his family. Thanks to his hard work, he managed to buy several plots of land growing bananas and coffee. As a result of the harvests, he managed to start a small business buying and selling bananas. Because he doesn’t have enough money to continue his business, he went to the ASDIR offices for a loan so that he would be better able to serve his customers and become more a part of the community. In this way he will be able to continue expanding his business and provide his family with better quality of life.

Cristóbal M. E. is known in the community as a responsible and principled person and as a good businessman. He currently has one employee in his banana business, a business that has generated work opportunities and also provided a better standard of living for his employee.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

Don Cristóbal tiene actualmente 57 años de edad, es Unido, de oficio Jornalero y que actualmente se dedica al comercio (compra y venta de banano) la cual su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio en el Caserío Pajocá, de la Aldea Pacamaché, Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, departamento de Sololá, gracias a sus esfuerzos día a día para salir adelante logro tener un pequeño negocio de Banano, y su actitud positiva en la comunidad ahora ya es un comerciante muy conocido y querido en la comunidad del Caserío Pajocá, ya que antes era jornalero para realizar trabajos de campo con diferentes personas, viajaba en fincas a ganar dinero para el mantenimiento de su familia, y gracias a esos esfuerzos consiguió comprar varias cuerdas de terreno con cultivos de banano y café, y con sus cosechas que recibe de parte de ellos logro iniciar un pequeño negocio de compra y venta de banano, por tal razón que no cuenta con un capital suficiente para seguir dicho negocio se vio en la necesidad de acudir en las oficinas de la Asociación ASDIR, para poder dar una mejor atención a la clientela y así poder identificarse mas con la comunidad y solo así poder seguir creciendo en su negocio y poder mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia. A don Cristóbal M. E., se le conoce en la comunidad como una persona responsable y de buenos principios como un buen emprendedor del trabajo que realiza, actualmente cuenta con 1 trabajador en su negocio de compra de banano la cual esto ha generado oportunidades de trabajo, como también a que la familia del empleado tenga una mejor condición de vida.

loans.use: Buying and selling bananas

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo is a brave and strong woman. At 47 years of age, she is in charge of supporting her family. She takes great satisfaction in being alongside her 22 year old son who is in school. She supports him so that he can finish his university career. Consuelo sells all kinds of personal articles. When she has an opportunity to acquire merchandise at a low price that will allow to obtain future profits, she does not hesitate to do so. In this occasion she was able to acquire children’s backpacks and women’s purses. She sells her merchandise on the streets of Huancayo. Consuelo is starting another business which will be a fruit juice stand. She wishes to rent a stand and to buy the necessary equipment to make juices. At the present time she needs to increase the sale of her merchandise to obtain greater profits so she can continue on the road to establish her new business. For this reason she is requesting a loan which she will invest in the purchase of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Consuelo es una mujer luchadora y valiente, a sus 47 años de vida, está pendiente del sostenimiento de su hogar, tiene la gran satisfacción de estar al lado de su hijo de 22 años que está estudiando, ella lo apoya para que pueda concluir su carrera universitaria. Consuelo vende todo tipo de artículos personales, si tiene la oportunidad de adquirir mercadería a un bajo precio que le permita obtener futuras ganancias, no duda en hacerlo, así como en esta ocasión pudo conseguir mochilas para niños y carteras para dama; vende de manera ambulante en las calles de Huancayo. Consuelo está iniciando otro negocio, que es el de una juguería, desea alquilar un local y comprar lo necesario para la elaboración de jugos. Pero, por el momento necesita incrementar la venta de su mercadería para obtener mejores ganancias y continuar dando pasos para su siguiente negocio. Para ello, solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de mercadería.

loans.use: Increase merchandise for her business so that with the profits she can open a fruit juice stand.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is 28 years old and is a young mother. She has a nine year old son who is provides her reason and strength for living. Thanks to encouragement from her friends she established a business stand in her neighborhood market where she sells products of prime necessity. She also occasionally undertakes various occupations but she dedicates the majority of her time to the growth of her business. Despite having only been in business for a short while, Norma has realized that she can accomplish many things with hard work and dedication. She is very happy because her list of clients increases everyday. She comes before you today to ask for a loan which she will invest in purchasing more merchandise to increase her profits and the daily income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es una joven de madre de familia de 28 años de edad, tiene un pequeño hijo de 9 años que es toda su razón y fuerza de vivir. Gracias a una de sus amistades, que la animó, se estableció en un puesto del mercado de su barrio, donde vende diariamente productos de primera necesidad, también realiza oficios eventuales diferentes, pero la mayor parte de su tiempo lo dedica al crecimiento de su negocio. A pesar de tener muy poco tiempo vendiendo y creer que no era buena para las ventas, Norma se ha dado cuenta que con empeño y dedicación se pueden lograr muchas cosas, ella está muy contenta porque cada día su lista de clientes va aumentando, y ahora se presenta ante ustedes para solicitar un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para acrecentar sus ganancias y el ingreso diario de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of greater quantity of merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer was born with a talent; he is a great painter and artist. Ever since he was young Wilmer developed this talent, and was famous for it while attending school. Now at 59 years old, Wilmer continues with the art that has become an integral part of his life, and for which he's well known. Some time ago, Wilmer offered to paint family portraits, which he turned into a means of earning money. He also has a small store in his home that earns supplemental income. In his paintings, Wilmer applies a new technique, adding chrome to make the portrait appear shiny like a photograh. Wilmer consideres this his profession and his happy to do it. With age, Wilmer's work has decreased, as he can no longer paint as rapidly as when he was young. Because of this, he ias asking for a loan of 1300 soles to buy materials for his art works and merchandise for his store. Give a hand to Wilmer so that he can continue to follow his passion.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Wilmer nació con un gran talento, es un gran artista del dibujo y la pintura, desde muy pequeño desarrolló ese gran talento, que fue reconocido en su época escolar. Hoy a sus 59 años sigue con el arte que lo caracteriza, y por el cual es reconocido. Desde hace tiempo atrás, él va de casa en casa ofreciendo el servicio de retratos familiares al óleo, actividad que se ha convertido su forma de ingresos económicos. También cuenta con una pequeña tienda que ha instalado en su casa que le permite obtener ingresos extra. Para sus pinturas, Wilmer aplica una técnica novedosa, que es el cromo, imitando la pintura al óleo, dándole un efecto semejante al de las fotografías. Wilmer considera este trabajo su vocación de vida y está contento con lo que hace. Y como el tiempo no pasa sin dejar huella, este ha mellado en la rapidez del trabajo de este artista, pero no en la calidad, Wilmer ya no pinta tan rápido como lo hacía de joven, y esto baja un porcentaje sus ganancias, por esta razón solicita en préstamo 1300 soles para la compra de materiales para sus trabajos artísticos y además mercadería para su tienda, actividad en que se apoya adicionalmente. Bríndale una mano a Wilmer para que continúe realizando lo que más le apasiona.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to keep painting portraits.

loans.name: Margarita Marcelina

texts.es:
Sra. C., 45, is single and has one daughter who is now in her first year at a local university. She's received five loans from our institution. She began as a street vendor, selling cosmetics. With the loans, she has set up a small kiosk where she sells photocopying services along with cold drinks and snacks. She still operates the cosmetics business, as well. She started as a way out of unemployment and the businesses have served to support her and to support her daughter's studies for 10 years.

With the loan, Sra. C. plans to continue investing in the business and improving her house, itself a product of her earnings. She lives in her own house. She can't depend on relatives for financial help and her business is her sole source of income.

Sra. C.' greatest dream is to have a place of her own because the one she has now is small and rented. She would like to offer other products such as Internet services and eventually, with the Lord's blessing and your support, to have the opportunity to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora C., tiene 45 años, es soltera tiene una hija menor de edad actualmente cursa el primer año de la universidad, no tiene esposo, ha trabajado cinco creditos con nuestra institución, inicio ofertando cosmeticos de forma ambulante, con los creditos ha instalado un pequeño kiosko donde ofrece servicios de fotocopiado, vende frescos naturales y respoteria manteniendo siempre su actividad inicial como es la venta de cosmeticos. Su negocio surge como una alternativa al desempleo con el cual ha podido ir saliendo adelante sin dejar de apoyar a su hija en sus estudios, teniendo 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad.

Con el financiamiento pretende seguirle invirtiendo al negocio, e ir mejorando poco a poco su casa producto de las ganancias, vive en casa propia, no tiene ayuda economica de familiares, depende de su negocio en su totalidad.

Su mayor sueño, es tener un lugar propio, ya que donde esta es pequeño y alquila, y ofertar mercadería así como brindar el servicio de Internet., que poco a poco con la bendicion de Dios y el apoyo nuestro tendrá la oportunidad de ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucia is a recognized hard worker, and a mother who fights to keep her family happy. This depends not only on love and care, but also on the economic opportunities for her family. Because of this, Lucia works very hard raising animals, which she sells to butchers or other buyers. This work requires patience, as the animals must grow and get fat, which requires them to be well fed and comfortable. Additionally, Lucia sells the milk produced by her cows. In order to raise her income, Lucia is asking for a loan to buy two cows. She hopes that you can help her.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucía es reconocida como una madre y mujer emprendedora que lucha por mantener la tranquilidad y felicidad en su familia, y eso depende no sólo del afecto y cariño sino que también de las posibilidad económicas de su hogar, pensando en ello Lucía trabaja arduamente criando animales, que después vende a los carniceros o quien se los solicite. Para este trabajo se necesita de mucha paciencia, ya que los animales tienen que crecer y engordar, para ello se tiene que estar pendiente de su alimentación y comodidad, adicionalmente, vende la leche producida por sus vacas.Para el incremento de sus ganancias, Lucía solicita un préstamo para la compra de un par de vascas y acude a usted para que la puedan ayudar.

loans.use: Purchase of cows to sell milk and increase her income.

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Flor de Maria dedicates her time to agriculture and farming. She raises cows and bulls, which also help with her crops. On weekends, Flor de Maria sells milk in the markets of the nearest city. She is a mother of three studious children, and she hopes to provide them with everything necessary for their studies. For these reasons, Flor de Maria would like a loan of 2000 soles, which she'll use to buy another cow, thereby enabling her to sell milk and cheese more frequently. With part of the money, Flor de Maria would also like to help her husband, who is also a farmer, by purchasing seeds and fertilizer. Flor de Maria hopes that you'll accept her request.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Flor de María es una mujer dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, cría toros y vacas, los que también le ayudan en el trabajo agrícola. Durante los fines de semana, vende leche en los mercados de la ciudad más cercana. Es madre de 3 niños quienes son escolares y desea brindarles todo lo necesario para sus estudios. Es por estas razones, nos comenta, requiere de 2000 soles que le servirá en la compra de una vaca más, además de vender leche y queso con más frecuencia, también le gustaría, con parte del dinero, apoyar a su esposo que es agricultor, con la compra de semillas y abono.Flor de María queda a la espera de la aceptación de su pedido.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow to sell milk and cheese, as well as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es:
Rosalbina is a hard-working mother of two. Her children study in the capital city, and each month she sends them money to pay their university tuition and basic expenses. Rosalbina sells groceries, and she has a small store in her home. Additionally, she travels to the capital to sell fruit. Rosalbina doesn't think twice about what she'll do next; she wants to have a stall at one of the markets in the capital, where she can securely bring her fruits and other products. With the hope of being able to achieve this goal, Rosalbina is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise for her store as well as fruit to bring to Lima, so that she can continue to build a presence there.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosalbina es muy trabajadora, ella tiene dos hijos que estudian en la ciudad capital, cada mes les envía una cantidad de dinero para el pago de la universidad y de sus necesidades básicas.El negocio de Rosalbina es la venta de abarrotes, tiene una pequeña tienda instalada en su casa, con la cual solventa las necesidades de sus hijos, que ya hemos mencionado. Adicionalmente, lleva fruta a la capita para la venta. Y como cuando se trata de progreso Rosalbina no lo piensa dos veces, ella quiere tener un puesto en uno de los mercados de la capital, donde pueda llevar de forma segura sus frutas y otro tipo de productos. Con la esperanza de poder conseguir todo esto, solicita el presente préstamo para la compra de mercadería, tanto para su bodega como fruta para llevar a la ciudad de Lima, e ir implementado un puesto por allá.

loans.use: Increased capital to buy merchandise for her store and fruit to sell in the capital city.

loans.name: Jahziel

texts.es:
My name is Jahziel Sánchez. My wife and I want to put a roof on the patio of our house. We have two sons who very much enjoy playing outside on the patio but since we live in a semi-desert area, it is impossible for us to permit them to go out to play for fear that they will suffer sunstroke or that they will get dehydrated. This is why we decided to roof our patio, and for this reason we are asking for 1,000dll.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Jahziel Sánchez mi esposa y yo deseamos techar el patio de nuestra casa ya que tenemos dos hijos varones a los cuales les gusta mucho jugar afuera en el patio pero dado que vivimos en una zona semidesértica nos es imposible permitirles salir a jugar por temor de que sufran una insolación o se puedan deshidratar así que decidimos techar el patio de nuestra casa para esto solicitamos la cantidad de 1,000 dll.

loans.use: To roof the patio

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is married and has a 13 year old daughter, an 8 year old daughter, and a 3 year old son. She started the business because her oldest daughter was sick and she needed money to buy her medication. That's why she began to sell clothing and comforters. Because the business went well, she saw it as a possible way to have her own business that would allow her to help her children succeed and work without leaving them unattended. She started this 13 years ago when her daughter was a baby. She bought clothing and sold it door to door; with the profit, she invested until her business grew.

She needs a loan of $300, which she will repay in 2 months, in order to expand her business to sell shoes and more merchandise.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda es casada y tiene 3 hijos una niña de 13 años, una de 8 y un niño de 3 años. Ella inició el negocio ya que su hija mayor estaba enferma y necesitaba dinero para comprale medicamento por lo que emepzo a vender ropa y edredones , como le emepzo a ir bien ella lo vio como una posibilidad de tener un negocio propio que le permitiera sacar adelante a sus hijos y poder trabajar sin descuidarlos. Comenzó hace 13 años cuando su hija era una bebe compre ropa y empezó a ofrecerla casa por casa con sus vecinas y amigas, con las ganancias fui invirtiendo mas hasta que fue haciendo crecer su negocio.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 2 meses para ampliar su negocio con la venta de zapatos y mas mercancia.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria has five children, who are 34, 32, 24, 22, and 16 years old respectively. She started her business so that she would be able to pay for her children's education. She began by selling door to door, taking her goods in a shoebox, and only selling small objects.

She needs a loan of $500, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to restock her business and thus have more clients and be able to expand both her profits and her business.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana Maria tiene 5 hijos de 34 , 32, 24, 22 y 16 años. Inició el negocio por la necesidad de un negocio propio ya que deseaba tener ingresos para poder pagar los gastos de estudio de sus hijos. Comenzó ofreciendo sus productos de casa en casa lo llevaba en una cajita de zapatos y solamente vendia pomadas, cajitas de té y otros productos pequeños.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir el negocio y asi tener mas clientes para tener mas ganacias e ir ampliandolo.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #57901

loans.name: Martha Ofelia

texts.es:
Martha has 3 children who are 22, 15, and 9 years old respectively. They help in her business. She started her business because she didn't have another job and needed to be able to help her children succeed and give them schooling. She began 8 years ago with the sale of sodas and fries in her home; gradually, she added merchandise until she had a general store.

She needs a loan of $500, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise to continue with her sales and expand her business.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha tiene 3 hijos de 22, 15 y 9 años, quienes le ayudan en el negocio. Inició su negocio porque en ese momento no contaba con un trabajo y necesitaba sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles estudio. Comenzó hace 8 años con la venta de sodas y frituras en su casa, y poco a poco fue surtiendo mercancia hasta que logro tener su tienda de abarrotes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia para continuar con las ventas y poder agrandar su negocio

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #57902

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jesus is married and has two children. His wife is a housewife. He doesn't have any help in his business. He started his business because he needed more income to pay for his children's education. He has been selling clothes for three years; gradually, he has purchased more merchandise and acquired more clients.

He needs a loan of $800, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to buy more merchandise. With your help, he will succeed.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Jesus está casado, tiene dos hijos y su esposa se dedica al hogar, ellos no le ayuda en el negocio y no tiene empleados adicionales, inició su negocio debido a que necesitaba un ingreso mayor al sueldo que percibia, para poder sustentar el estudio de sus dos hijos empezó hace tres años vendiendo ropa que consiguió, y poco a poco fue comprando mercancia y haciendose de clientes.

El necesita un prestamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses que le va ayudar para poder comprar mercancia, con tu apoyo el saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Juzdy Nelly

texts.es:
Juzdy is married. Her husband works as a carpenter. She has a one year old child whose name is Francisco. She started the business because she is very active and wants to help her husband with household costs and giving a better quality of life to their child. She started selling clothes to her relatives three years go and now sells clothing and shoes to the public.

She needs a loan of $500, which she will pay in 6 months, in order to restock her merchandise. With your help, she will succeed.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Juzdy esta casada, su esposo trabaja como carpintero y tiene un hijo de un año, se llama Francisco. Inició el negocio por que es muy activa y aparte ayuda con los gastos de la csa a su esposo para tener un mayor ingreso para su familia y ofrecerle mejor calidad de vida a su hijo, comenzó hace tres años vendiendo a sus familiares ropa posteriomente empezó a vender ropa y zapatos al publico en general.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para poder surtir mercancia. Con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #57904

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is a hard-working woman who spends her time selling candy and drinks in a small store that she built years ago. This business has helped her cover living expenses for her four children. Nancy puts a lot into her store, because she knows that if she works hard she can turn it into a prosperous business. For this reason she hopes to start improving it by supplying new merchandise and a diverse set of products that are difficult to find in the region but can satisfy her clients' needs. Nancy believes that if she can supply these products, her business will attract more visits from her neighbors. Nancy needs 1500 soles to complete the quality improvements, and she promises to be punctual and responsible in her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy es una mujer emprendedora que trabaja en la venta de dulces y de bebidas en la pequeña tienda que instaló hace un par de años. Dicho negocio le ayuda a solventar los gastos de sus cuatro hijos.Ella está muy entregada a su tienda, porque sabe que si se esfuerza más podrá hacer de él un negocio muy prospero, por ello, desea empezar a mejorarlo desde ya, surtirlo con nueva mercadería y diversos productos que sean difíciles de encontrar en la zona para poder satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes, así propiciar la mayor concurrencia de sus vecinos a su bodega.La suma que requiere para ello es de 1500 soles, que espera que usted, pueda brindarle en calidad de préstamo y con la promesa de ser puntual y responsable en sus pagos.

loans.use: Buy new, unique merchandise for her store

loans.name: Yath

texts.en: Mrs. Yath S. is a villager in Bampong Phchoek Village in Kampong Chnang Province. She is a basketmaker. Her husband, Mr. Hoen Ros, is a construction worker. They have four children, one of whom is a construction worker while two others are attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Although the family members have different business activities, it is not enough to support the family, so Mrs. Yath S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Her husband is in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Theam

texts.en: Mrs. Theam R. lives in Bampong Phchoek Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a basketmaker and her husband, Mr. Saneth Hoeurg, is a farmer and pig breeder. Even though Mrs. Theam R. and her husband have different business activities, they still cannot support the family well. Therefore, Mrs. Theam R. decided to ask for a loan to buy a piece of land to sell later at a better price. Mrs. Theam R. is 34 and the mother of six children, four of whom are attending school while the others are too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Theam R. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets, and she has fully paid it back. She and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Sak

texts.en: Mrs. Sak T. is a basketmaker in Bampong Phchoek Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Noeurn T., is a fisherman. They have four children, one of whom is a construction worker while two others help their mother. The last one is attending school. Mrs. Sak T.'s family now lives in old house, so she wants to build a new house in order to improve her living conditions. Mrs. Sak T. asked for a loan for this purpose. Her husband is in the photo.

loans.use: To build a new house in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mrs. Ry N. is a basket maker in Bampong Phchoek Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Khaorl Thlok, is a fisherman. His business now faces a small problem because his boat is too old and he cannot gather any fish. Thus, Mrs. Ry N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new boat for her husband's business. Mrs. Ry N. is 39 and the mother of four children one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the three others are attending school. Her husband is shown in the picture on the left.

loans.use: To buy a new boat for her husband's business in order to gather more fish.

loans.name: Sutariyanto

texts.id:
Sutariyanto (46 year old) lives in a rented house with his family. He rents the house for USD 25/ month. His son, Delta, is attending Junior High School.

Sutariyanto is a used goods/ wasted goods/ garbage collector. He walks around places to find used goods/ wasted goods and collect them. These goods are for example: used iron cans, paper carts, used boxes etc. He sells these goods to a recycle depot.

He usually starts his day at 5 am, then he takes break from 12 noon to 2 pm before he starts again to walks around places up tp 5 pm. He earns IDR 50 thousand/ day (around USD 6/ day).

He wants to use the loan money as a working capital so he can open somekind of small depot where people can go directly to him to sell their used goods/ wasted goods.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Keseharian Sutariyanto (46) adalah sebagai seorang pemulung. Dia berjalan keliling dari satu tempat ke tempat lainnya mencari barang bekas dan rongsokan. Barang bekas seperti besi, karton, kaleng, kertas dan lain-lain nantinya akan dijual lagi ke penadah. Sarana yang dipakai sehari-hari adalah gerobak dorong untuk menampung barang bekas hasil cariannya. Mulai dari pagi jam 5, dia sudah siap berkeliling sampai siang hari jam 12. Setelah beristirahat 1 jam, dia berangkat lagi jam 2 dan pulang jam 5 sore. Penghasilan yang didapat perhari sekitar Rp.50.000. Keuntungan yang didapat dari usahanya dipakai untuk kebutuhan sehari-hari dan membiayai sekolah anaknya, Delta yang saat ini sudah di bangku SMP. Saat ini bersama keluarganya, dia tinggal di sebuah rumah yang disewa perbulan dengan harga Rp. 200.000. Dia berharap, dari pinjaman kali bisa dipakai untuk dijadikan modal membeli barang bekas, sehingga dia tidak haris berkeliling mencari lagi. Dengan demikian, keuntungan yang didapat bisa lebih besar.

loans.use: To purchase used goods/ garbage (Membeli Barang Bekas)

loans.name: Maria

texts.id:
Maria (45 year old) and her husband, Max, have a daughter Mita. Mita is in Junior High school at the moment. They live in their own house in Baturiti area.

Maria sells snack and fruits at Baturiti market, 30 km north of Denpasar, Bali. She opens her stall from the morning to the evening together with her husband. She can get in average of IDR 75 thousand to IDR 100 thousand (approximately of USD 8-12/ day) as profit on daily basis. She uses this profit as working capital and also to finance Mita's schooling.

She hopes she can expand her business with the loan money.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha yang dijalani oleh Maria (45) saat ini adalah sebagai penjual kue dn buah-buahan. Lokasi usahanya terletak di Pasar Baturiti, 30 km sebelah utara kota Denpasar. Sehari-harinya, mulai dari pagi hari sampai sore, Maria menjajakan kue buatannya di pasar dengan ditemani suaminya Max. Tempat usahanya yang strategis didalam Pasar membuat usahanya lancar. Meskipun banyak usaha yang sama, tetapi sampai saat ini dia bisa menjaga kestabilan jumlah penjualannya setiap hari. Keuntungan yang didapat perhari rata-rata 75.000 – 100.000. Keuntungan ini, selain untuk dijadikan modal lagi, juga untung tabungan untuk pendidikan anaknya. Dia berharap, kali ini diberi pinjaman yang nantinya akan dipakai untuk mengembangkan usaha ini. Saat ini maria memiliki seorang anak, Mita dan sedang bersekolah di SMP. Bersama keluarganya, Maria tinggal di Baturiti dengan menempati rumah sendiri.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Mr. Men T. is a farmer who lives in the Tramses Village, Pursat Province. He lives together with his wife and his four children. T.'s wife makes and sells Cambodian cakes in the village, earning around US$3 per day, while T. earns around US$2 per day. The couple's combined income cannot sufficiently support the family with its increasing expenses; therefore, their daughter has to work in a garment factory in Phnom Penh.

T. would like to expand his rice farming business to earn adequate income for his family. He is therefore requesting a loan of US$600 to be able to purchase an additional plot of land.

About HatT. Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HatT. Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: Purchase of a plot of land for farming

loans.name: Sri

texts.id:
Sri U., 48 year old, lives with Nanang (husband) and Riski (son). Their son is 15 year old. Her husband works as a mechanic in a local motorcycle repair shop. They live in Prikila street in Denpasar, Bali.

Sri U. sells rice in her small stall. She goes to the local market every morning at 6 am to buy the ingredients. She cooks and prepares the rice for her stall as soon as she gets back from the market. She opens the stall at 8 am. She only sells few portions of rice, that's why the rice is usually sold out already by noon time.

She wants to use the loan money to expand her business.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Sri U., saat ini berusia 48 tahun. Usaha yang dijalaninya saat ini adalah sebagai penjual nasi. Setiap hari, dia berangkat ke pasal pada pukul 6 pagi dengan mengendarai sepeda motor. Setelah selesai belanja untuk kebutuhan warungnya, dia pulang untuk memasak. Pada pukul 8 pagi warungnya sudah siap melayani pelanggan. Oleh karena jualannya hanya sedikit, biasanya pada pukul 12.00 warungnya sudah tutup. Kali ini Sri U. mengajukan pinjaman untuk menambah dan mengembangkan warungnya. Dia berharap, nantinya keuntungan yang didapat akan lebih besar. Bersama suaminya Nanang, saat ini mereka tinggal di Jl.Priskila Denpasar bersama anaknya Riski (15). Pekerjaan suaminya saat ini adalah sebagai pekerja disebuah bengkel sepeda motor.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is a 30-year-old single man who lives in Nyalenda in Kisumu. He is the proprietor of several businesses. One of his businesses supplies milk and bread to several outlets. He also keeps poultry which produce eggs for sale locally. Dickson initiated his businesses between the years 2006 and 2007. He requires an additional credit amounting to US $600 to help him buy more milk and bread to supply his top clients.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Purchase more milk and bread

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a 48-year-old married mother of four school-going children. She lives in Nymasaria in Kisumu, Kenya. She runs a tailoring and dressmaking shop which she initiated in 1994. She specializes in making women's dresses and school uniforms which are fast-moving. She requires US $600 to purchase a new sewing machine to cope with her demand.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace (photo shy) is a 29-year-old entrepreneur. She is married and has three children who are all in school. She sells both second-hand and new clothes, a venture she started early this year. She needs US $600 to boost her second-hand clothing sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Buy stock of second-hand and new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 29-year-old single man. He lives in Nyalenda slums in Kisumu, Kenya. He is one of the first people trained by KMET in home-based care for people living with HIV/AIDS. He has also received three microfinance loans from KMET. Henry has several housing structures for rental in Nyalenda slums and is able to generate US $100 in rent every month. He has applied for US $700 to build more structures.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Build more structures for rental

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Oeurn S., 35, is married and has four children. He earns money operating a machine for rice grinding to produce rice meal. S. earns about US$4.50. His wife, Teav Saran, is 31 years old and earns income raising pigs and making and selling rice wine. She has been involved in this business for ten years now and earns around US$2.60 per day. The family lives in the Porysmach Village, Siem Reap Province. S. currently wants to expand his rice-grinding business and is therefore asking for a loan of US$1,100 to be able to build a hall for the grinding machine. The photo pictures Mr. S. and his wife.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: Construction of a hall for a rice-grinding machine

loans.name: Vay

texts.en:
Vay S., 24, earns income selling groceries in the Prasat Bakorng Village, Siem Reap Province. She makes around US$3 per day. Her husband is a farmer and sells wood. He makes around US$2 per day. They have two children, both of whom are still little and go to school that must be paid for. The family lives in the Kork Morn Village, Siem Reap Province. Because of the growing demand from her customers, Vay S. currently needs to purchase additional groceries for sale. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of $400.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery stocks for sale

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Mr. Lai L. is a motorcycle-taxi driver as well as a farmer. He has been driving a motorcycle-taxi for five years now and makes around US$1.67 per day. His wife, Yean Dy, is 21 years old and sells pigs and poultry. She earns about US$1 per day. The couple has one child, and the family lives in the Beng Village, Siem Reap Province. Currently, L. wants to expand his farming business and is therefore requesting a loan of US$300 to be able to purchase a plot of farmland. He will use the remainder of the loan to purchase fertilizer for rice farming.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: Purchase of land and fertilizer for rice farming

loans.name: Pach

texts.en: Mrs. Pach R. is a stove maker in Tie Prumpie Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 55 years old and a widow, with two children who are construction workers. Her children always spend a lot of money on transportation to work. In order to improve their lives, Mrs. Pach R. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for them. Previously, Mrs. Pach R. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy clay to make a stove, and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children for traveling to work.

loans.name: Bron

texts.en:
Mr. Bron N., 36, is an oxen trader and earns around US$4 per day. His wife, Mrs. Phorm Theap, 36, is a pig farmer and also makes and sells rice wine, making around US$1.50 per day. She is pictured in the photograph. The couple has three children, all of them still very young. Because of the high demand by customers and his interest in expanding the business, N. currently needs a loan of US$1,000 to be able to purchase more oxen for sale. The loan will allow him to expand the oxen sales business and thereby increase his family’s income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: Purchase of oxen for sale

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Mr. Sun V. is a villager in Dambouk Kokaos Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He uses electricity to charge batteries for the local village. His wife, Mrs. Phally V., is a farmer. They have four children, two of whom are attending school while the others are too young to work or study.

Recently, Mr. Sun V.'s mother died and he does not have enough money to do a funeral, so he decided to ask for a loan to this purpose. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: Do a funeral for his mother.

loans.name: Pak

texts.en:
Pak P., 28, runs a small construction business. He employs a few workers for his building operations and earns around US$10 per day. His wife, pictured in the photograph, is a farmer and sells crops in the market, earning around US$2 per day. The couple has two children, both of them very young, and the family lives in the Beong Chum Village, Siem Reap Province. Currently, P. needs a loan of US$1,000 to be able to expand his business. Specifically, he will use the borrowed money to purchase a cement-mixing machine. The loan will thus allow him to offer additional construction services and thereby increase his income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: Purchase of a cement-mixing machine

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap E. is a grocer in Kveth Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Since her business is doing well, Mrs. Sopheap E. wants to expand it. She is now requesting a loan to buy more grocery goods for her customers.

Her husband, Mr. Phalla Pum, is a bike repairer who can generate a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sopheap E. is 37 and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending school while the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her customers.

loans.name: Saophai

texts.en:
Mrs. Saophai P. lives in Kork Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a vegetable seller and pig breeder. Since her pig-breeding business is doing well, Mrs. Saophai P. wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food.

Mrs. Saophai P. is 56 years old and a widow with three children, one of whom is a farmer while another one is a construction worker. The youngest child is enrolled in school. Previously, Mrs. Saophai P. had obtained a loan from AMK to start selling vegetable and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food to improve her standard of living.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas C., 55, is a farmer growing crops on her farmland. She has been farming for fifteen years and earns around US$2 per day. Her husband, Mr. Theam Ven, pictured in the photo, works as a provider of rechargable batteries in the village, making around US$5 per day. The couple has seven children, two of whom are married, while the other five are single. One of their children works in a restaurant. The entire family lives in the Kork Morn Village, Siem Reap Province. Currently, the equipment that Ven uses for his business is experiencing technical problems and fails to run smoothly. C. is therefore asking for a loan of US$200 for her husband to repair the machine.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: Repair of farming equipment

loans.name: Ma

texts.en:
Mrs. Ma P. is a farmer and pig breeder in Thmor Reap Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 53 years old and a widow with five children, two of whom are employed while the other three are attending school.

Since both of her businesses have been doing well, Mrs. Ma P. wants to expand them so she asked for a loan to buy a pig for breeding and she would use the rest money to purchase fertilizers for her rice field. In the past, Mrs. Ma P. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy piece of land to cultivate rice and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy a pig for breeding and she would use the rest money to purchase fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap R. is a dessert seller in Kork Village in Kampong Chhanng Province. Previously, Mrs. Sopheap R. had obtained a loan to start her current business, and she has fully paid it back. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Sopheap R. decided to ask for a loan to buy beans and white sugar in order to make a delicious dessert for her customers. She is a 42-year-old widow with three children who are all attending school.

loans.use: To buy bean and white sugar in order to make a delicious dessert for her customers.

loans.name: Sory

texts.en:
Mrs. Sory P., 39, earns income selling groceries at her house. She makes around US$2.33 per day. Her husband, Mr. Lon Lam, 37, is a motorcycle-taxi driver and makes additional income growing crops. Altogether, he makes around US$2 per day. The couple has three children, and the family lives in the Samrong Village, Siem Reap Province. In order to increase the family's income by expanding the grocery sales business, P. is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase additional grocery stocks and a cart to transport them.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery stocks and a cart to transport groceries

loans.name: Chon

texts.en:
Mrs. Chon S., 26, is a farmer as well as earns income raising pigs. She makes around US$1.5 per day. Her husband, Mr. Chhung Chha, 27, operates a rice-grinding business. He buys rice and grinds it to sell for profit. In order to be able to expand the ground rice sales business, S. is asking for a loan of US$300 which will be used to purchase additional quantities of rice.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: Purchase of rice for grinding and sale

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chun N., 29, earns income raising pigs and making rice wine. She makes around US$4 per day. Her husband is a fisherman in Tonle Sap Lake and makes around US$3 per day. N. and her husband have three children, and the family lives in the Thnal Dach Village, Siem Reap Province. N. currently needs a loan of US$500 to purchase pigs to raise, as well as to buy fishing tools for her husband's business. The loan will allow N. to expand her business and increase the family’s income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: Purchase of 1) pigs to raise and 2) tools for fishing

loans.name: Waheed

texts.en:
Waheed A., a young man, is one of the active farmers in the Ningarhar province. He is 23, and because of civil wars in Afghanistan during the past three decades, he was not able to go to school, so he was left illiterate. He helped his father to earn income for their family.

Waheed’s father was also a farmer but now he has some serious sicknesses, and doctors don’t allow him to work. So Waheed is working alone on their agricultural lands growing tomatoes, onions, peppers, and other vegetables. Actually, they have much better lands in a good area, which is to near a marketplace where they can sell their products easily. However, Waheed still has some complaints about one thing: a lack of irrigation water. They have faced this problem for several years, and Waheed was so sad about it and didn’t know how to solve it because he didn’t have much money to purchase an electric water pump.

When one of his friends told him about the AFSG micro finance institute, Waheed became so happy and immediately requested a loan of 30,000 Afghanis.

Waheed hopes that through this credit, he will be able to purchase a water pump for his lands and stand on his own feet as soon as possible. He also dreams of a brighter future for his family, especially for his younger brothers. He thanks lenders in advance who help needy people like him.

loans.use: To purchase an electric water pump

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: Mrs. Mark S., 39, is a farmer living in the Krakor District of Pursat Province. Her husband, Mr. Chou Koy, pictured in the photograph, sells chicken that he buys from a local village. Mrs. S. currently needs a loan which she will use to purchase a buffalo for her farming business as well as a new motorcycle to replace her old one.

loans.use: Purchase of a buffalo for farming and a new motorcycle

loans.name: Rogério Fernando

texts.pt:
Rogério Fenando T. is from Maputo, district of Matola, in the Cine 700 neighborhood. He is single and the father of a six-year-old child. Rogério studied until the 3rd year at the Industrial Institute of Matola. He was forced to stop because he was drafted into the armed forces to defend Mozambique in 1982. He had to leave his hometown and live n Nampula until 1994.

Rogério has been a permanent employee of the Ministry of Defense since 1982. His workday begins at 7:30 a.m. and ends at 3:30 p.m. He learned his profession at the Industrial School of Matola. His monthly wage is 7,326.00 MT and he is able to save 1,200.00 every month.

This is Rogério’s third loan with Hluvuku, and forth in his life. He has also taken out a loan with the International Bank of Mozambique. He previous loans with Hluvuku were for 9,000.00 and 17,000.00. He found out about Hluvuku through friends at work who were already clients.

One of Rogério’s dreams is to buy a vehicle to transport the products he gets from his place in the Boane district.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Rogério Fernando T. é natural de Maputo distrito da matola bairro cinema 700, solteiro e pai de um filho com 6 anos de idade.

Rogério estudou até o 3 ano do instituto industrial da Matola e parou por que foi obrigado a incorporar se nas forças armadas de defesa de Moçambique em 1982 e desta maneira deslocou se da provincia de origem e esteve em Nampula e em 1994 voltou a Maputo.

Rogério é funcionário permanente do Ministério da defesa desde 1982 e tem um Horário das 7:30 as 15:30 e aprendeu a exercer o seu trabalho na escola Industrial da matola. Tem um salário mensal de 7326,00mt e consegue poupar mensalmente 1200,00mt.

Para Rogério este é o Terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e Quarto na Vida onde teve um no Banco Internacional de Moçambique, na Hluvuku já se beneficiou dos seguintes montantes ( 9000,00mt e 17000,00mt). Conheceu Hluvuku a traves dos colegas do serviços que já eram clientes. Constitui grande sonho para Rogério comprar uma viatura que usara para transporte seus produtos obtidos na quinta dele existente no Distrito de Boane.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: José Vicente

texts.pt:
José Vicente T. is 53 years old and was born in Maputo. He is married and the father of 7 adult children, 2 of which still live at home. His 21-year-old is in the 12th grade. José himself was not able to study past 12th grade because his family could not afford to pay for his studies. Because his parents separated early on, he lived with his mother who raised him on her own.

Besides working in the military services, José has a small plot in a rural community in the Mahau district of Matutuine. José has been an employee of the ministry of defense for 30 years. His work day begins at 7:30 a.m. and ends at 3:30 p.m. His monthly salary is 10,500.00 MT, and he saves some of it at the end of every month. He lives in his own house.

This is José’s third loan. The first and second ones he used to purchase goats and cows, and with this one he intends to buy construction materials. José’s dream is to open a small general store.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

José Vicente T. tem 53 anos de idade e natural de Maputo. Casado maritalmente e pai de 7 filhos já maiores de idade apenas vive com dois filhos um com 21 anos e frequenta 12ªclasse.

José estudou até 12ªclasse não continuou por que a família não tinha condições para pagar os seu estudos a mãe teve que criar-lhe sozinha por que muito cedo os pais separaram e ele viveu com a mãe. Para alem do trabalho como militar tem uma pequena machamba numa comunidade rural de mahau distrito de matutuine.

José é funcionario do ministério da defesa a 30 anos e trabalha das 7:30 às 15:30h tem um salário mensal de 10500,00mt e poupa algum no fim de cada mes. Vive numa casa própria.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo para José o primeiro e segundo usou o dinheiro para compra de gado caprino e bovino e este pretende comprar material de construção. Constitui grande sonho para José abrir uma pequena mercearia.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: Jorge Marcos

texts.pt:
Jorge Marcos J. was born in Maxixe in the province of Inhambane. He is married and the father of 2 children aged 15 and 12. Both children go to school. Besides supporting his family, he also supports a stepson and a nephew. Jorge is in his second year of college, studying social sciences. In 1982 he joined the armed forces that defended Mozambique and moved from the province of Inhambane to Nampula. He lived there for 5 years.

Jorge works for the Ministry of Defense. His workday begins at 7:30 a.m. and ends at 3:30 p.m. He receives a monthly wage of 13,400.00 MT and puts some into savings at the end of each month. He learned his profession at the military school in Nampula.

This loan of 20,000 MT is Jorge’s second. His first was for 12,000.00 MT, which he used to enlarge the living room and bedroom in his house that is still under construction. He found out about Hluvuku through friends from work. His future goal is to buy a vehicle and to build a security wall.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge Marcos J. é natural de Maxixe Província de Inhambane. É casado maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos. Com idade entre 15 e 12 anos de idade todos vão a escola, para alem da sua família sustenta duas pessoas que é um enteado e um sobrinho.

Jorge é estudante do segundo ano da faculdade de ciencias sociais e em 1982 mudou se da Província de Inhambane para Nampula quando ingressou na Forças Armadas de defesa de Moçambique onde viveu 5 anos.

Jorge é funcionário do ministério da defesa e tem um horário das 7:30 às 15:30h e tem um salário mensal de 13400,00mt e poupa algum no fim de cada més. Aprendeu o trabalho na escola militar em Nampula.

O empréstimo de 20.000,00MT é segundo para Jorge e o primeiro foi de 12000,00mt que usou para ampliar a sala e quarto na casa que ainda está em construção. Conheceu a Hluvuku atraves dos colegas de serviços.

Constitui seu plano para o futuro a compra de viatura e construção do muro de vedação.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: Kamollidin

texts.ru:
Kamollidin S. lives in the Yavan town. He is 33 years old. He is married and has 5 children. He is a farmer, and he had been in agriculture for the past 15 years. He would like to obtain a loan so he could prepare for Fall season. He needs seeds and fertilizers. This will help him to plant the seeds on time. He plans to pay off the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Шамсиддинов Камоллидин проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 33 года.Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Занимается земледелием. Уже 15 лет работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы подготовиться к осеннему посеву. Закупить семена и минеральные удобрения. Это поможет ему своевременно засееть землю. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seeds

loans.name: Bahorgul

texts.ru:
Bahorgul A. lives in the town of Nurek. She has 4 children. Since her children are still very young, she is the single provider for the family. She has been in the business of cattle farming for the last 25 years. She purchases skinny animals, feeds them for a number of days, and sells them later on. This process is continuous and it brings her profits, which are sufficient for food only. To develop her business, she needs additional capital. For this reason, she decided to obtain a loan for 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Эралиева Бахоргул проживает в городе Нурек. Вдова . Имеет четверых детей. Дети еще маленькие. Поэтому она одна обеспечивает свою семью. 25 лет как она занимается животноводством. Покупает худых животных , откармливает и продает. Так постоянно . Бизнес неплохой. Дает прибыль, которую хватает только на питание . Но для того чтобы развивать бизнес необходимо вложение денег. Поэтому она решила получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Sailigul

texts.ru:
Sailigul A. lives in the Yavan town. She is 39 years old. She is married and has a son. They have a small and strong family. Her main occupation is sales. She owns a place on a market. She sells parts and accessories for cell phones. She had been in this business for the last 5 years. In addition, she works in "Airregistry" as a bookkeeper. She would like to renew her inventory, and for this reason, she wants to obtain a loan for 6 months. This will give her an opportunity to attract new customers and increase profits.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Амирхонова Сайлигул проживает в городе Яван. Занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на рынке города. Торгует запасными частями для мобильных телефонов. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 5 лет. Кроме того работает в аэрокассе , бухгалтером. Хочет обновить ассортимент товара , поэтому хочет получить кредит сроком на 6 месяцев. Это даст ей возможность привлечь новых клиентов м увеличить прибыльность дела.Сайлигуль 39 лет. Живет с мужем и сыном. У них маленькая и дружная семь

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.ru:
Nasimjon N. is an experienced farmer. He had been in this business for the last 10 years. He is married and has 3 children. He leases land, which he uses to plant various vegetables and fruits. To prepare for the fall season, he would like to purchase seeds and fertilizers. He plans to pay off the loan within 15 months. This credit will help him purchase seeds at lower prices because later, during the season, the prices of seeds and fertilizers are going to be a higher. Currently, he is collecting crops of melons and watermelons.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Намозов Насимджон дехканин со стажем. Десят лет работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Женат , имеет троих детей. Арендует участок земли, который засеивает различными культурами. Для того , чтобы подготовиться к осеннему посеву хочет получить кредит и закупить необходимые семена и удобрения. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 15 месяцев. Получение кредита даст возможность закупить семена по более низкой цене, так как в сезон цены на этот вид продукции подорожает .В даннвй момент он собирает урожай арбузов и дынь.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru:
Zebo Y. lives in Yavan. She is a homemaker and has 4 chidlren. Zebo raises livestock. She would like to take out a loan to purchase one more calf. After feeding and fattening it, Zebo will be able to sell the calf and earn a profit. She will use the profit for her family and reuse the sum of the loan to purchase another calf. Zebo plans to pay back the loan over a 9 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ятимова Зебониссо проживает в городе Яван . Домохозяйка , имеет четверых детей. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно рогатый скот. Хочет получить кредит и купить еще одного бычка. После откормки она сможет его продать и получить доход. Его она использует для семьи , а сумму кредита использует для покупки нового бычка. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Oim

texts.ru:
Oim Q. lives in Nurek. She has been selling vegetables for 10 years now. Her business is very important to her family as she is the only supporting them. Oim’s husband is currently not working and she needs to work a lot in order to feed her family. Oim would like to take out a loan to increase her inventory. She will pay back the loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Кайнарова Оим живет в городе Нурек. Занимается торговлей . Торгует овощами на центральном рынке уже 10 лет. Ее бизнес очень необходим для ее семьи так как она одна кормит всю семью. Муж в данный момент не работает , поэтому ей приходится очень много работать , чтобы прокормить семью. Сейчас хочет получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 10 месяцев

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru:
Safargul J. lives in Nurek. She has a sales location at a city market where she sells clothing. Safargul has been in this business for 4 years. The business earns a small income; in order to increase the profitability of the business Safargul would like to increase her inventory by taking out a loan.

Safargul is 38 years old and has 4 children. She is divorced and the entire responsibility for the family rests on her.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Джалолова Сафаргуль проживает в городе Нурек. Занимается торговлей . Имеет торговую точку на городском рынке. Продает одежду. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 4 года. Бизнес приносить небольшой доход , но для того ,чтобы увеличить прибыльность дела она хочет увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Сафаргуль 38 лет , у нее 4 детей . Но она разведена и поэтому вся ответственность лежит на ней.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for sale

loans.name: Yormuhammad

texts.ru:
Yormuhammad H. lives in Nurek. He is married and has 6 children. He works in agriculture and grows vegetables. Yormuhammad sells his harvest at the market. He has been in this business for 20 years and earns decent profits. Yormuhammad would like to take out a loan to purchase fertilizer. In addition, he is getting ready for planting and would like to purchase high quality seeds. Yormuhammad will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хакимов Ермухаммад житель города Нурек.Женат , имеет шестерых детей. Занимается земледелием. Выращивает овощи . Готовый урожай продает на рынке . Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 20 лет. Дело имеет неплохой доход. В данный момент хочет получить кредит и закупить удобрения. Кроме того он готовиться к засеву и хочет купить качественные семена. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Bunavsha

texts.ru:
Bunavsha S. lives in Yavan. She purchases and sells calves. Bunavsha has been in this business for 5 years. The business has been progressing well and she would like to take out a 9 month loan in order to purchase one more calf. This will help Bunavsha to earn more money and to improve her living conditions. Bunavsha is married and has 5 children.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипова Бунавша жительница города Яван. Занимается купле продажей молодых бычков. Занимается данным видом бизнеса уже пять лет. В данный момент бизнес продвигается неплохо , поэтому она хочет получить кредит сроком на 9 месяцев и купить еще одного бычка. Это поможет ей заработать больше денег и улучшить условия жизни. Бунавша замужем и имеет пятерых детей.
