loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Bozorgul

texts.ru:
Bozorgul H. lives in Yavan. She is married and has 4 children. Bozorgul has worked in her business for 20 years. She owns a store in her village, where she sells food products. Bozorgul would like to take out a loan in order to increase her inventory. This will help her to expand her business and to increase profits. She will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хайдарова Бозоргул жительница города Яван. Замужем и имеет четверых детей. 20 лет занимается бизнесом. Имеет свой собственный магазин в своем кишлаке. Торгует продуктами питания. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет развивать ее дело и увеличить прибыльность бизнеса. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Bibijon

texts.ru:
Bibijon Z. has been working in sales for the pas 8 years. She sells clothing for children and teenagers. She is not married, but has 5 children. Her business is doing pretty well, but she would like to obtain a loan in order to refresh her selection of goods. She plans to repay the loan within a 10 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Зиеева Бибиджон бизнесмен. 8 лет занимается торговлей.Продает одежду для детей и подростков. Не замужем , но имеет пятерых детей. Бизнес идет не плохо. Но для того , чтобы обновить ассортимент хочет получить кредит и завезти товар. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of pants, shoes and beauty products for a small business.

loans.name: Oimhol

texts.ru:
Oimhol S. lives in the city of Yavan. She is not married and has 2 children. In order to provide for her family Oimhol works in sales. She brings clothing from Dushanbe and sells them on the central market of Nurek. She has been in this business for the past 5 years. The back to school season is about to begin. Fall season is also near. For this reason she plans to obtain a loan and use it to purchase goods. She plans to repay the loan within a 10 moths period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Солихова Оимхол жительница городв Яван. Не замужем , имеет двоих детей. Для того , чтобы прокормить семью , она занимается торговлей. Привозит одежду из города Душанбе и продает на центральном рынке Нурека. Занимается этим бизнесом уже пять лет. Наступает сезон торговли к школе , а так же осенней одежды. Поэтому она планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы завезти товар .Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of various goods to replenish a small grocery store.

loans.name: Mirali

texts.ru:
Mirali H. lives in the city of Nurek. He is 24 years old and single. He is in the business of raising cattle. He would like to obtain a loan in order to purchase feed for his animals. The loan will allow him to provide the calves with high quality feed. With good food the animals gain weight faster. This will allow raising animals faster. Mirali plans to repay the loan within a 10 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Холов Мирали проживает в городе Нурек. Возраст 24 года , не женат. Занимается разведением крупно-рогатого скота. Хочет получить кредит для закупки комбикормов для своих животных. Это поможет обеспечить бычков качественным кормом. Кроме того при хорошем питании животные быстро набирают в весе . Это будет способствовать быстрому темпу откормки скота. Погасить кредит Мирали планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of jewelry and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing and silver jewely for a small business.

loans.name: Gulbadan

texts.ru:
Gulbadan Z. lives in the city of Nurek, is married and has six children. She is a housewife. She also raises cattle and sells young calves on the market. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. When she learned about the possibility to obtain a loan, she decided to further develop her business and obtain a loan of $750. She plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Зухурова Гулбадан проживает в городе Нурек. Замужем , имеет шестерых детей. Домохозяйка . Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот и молодых телят продает на рынке. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Сейчас , узнав о возможности получить кредит , Решила развивать свой бизнес и получить кредит в размере 2500 сомони. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a claf

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.ru:
Sadriddin U. lives in the city of Nurek. He is married, but doe snot have any children. He lives with his parents and takes care of the entire family. He is in business of raising cattle. He would like to rebuild the barn for winter, but to do that he first needs to obtain a loan, which will allow him to purchase building materials. He plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Юсупов Садриддин житель города Нурек. Женат , детей не имеет . Но живет с родителями и сам обеспечивает всю большую семью. Занимается животноводством. Хочет к зиме перестроить сарай. Но для этого он сначала должен получить кредит , который позволит ему купить стройматериалы. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.ru:
Mahsuda P. lives in the Djalloliddini Rumi region. She is 28 years old, married and has 4 children. She is a housewife. She has a milk cow and sells milk on the market. She would like to purchase another cow in order to increase the amount of milk she has for sale. This will allow her to increase the amount of profit obtained from the business and will help better the living conditions of her family. She plans to repay the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Полвонов Махсуда проживает в районе Джаллолиддини Руми. Возраст 28 лет . Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Домохозяйка . Имеет корову , молоко которой продает на рынке . Хочет приобрести еще одну корову для того , чтобы увеличить объем получаемого молока. Это даст возможность клиентке увеличить прибыль. Это улучшит условия жизни ее семьи. Для этого планирует получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Herving

texts.es:
I am Herving P., and I work in a factory in Piedras Negras. In order to help me out with the household and my young daughter’s expenses, my wife runs a small general store in our home. We have not been able to sufficiently stock it up with goods so that it can be productive. We are, therefore, requesting a loan of $675.00 USD so that we can supply our general store with goods and obtain profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Soy Herving P. trabajo como obrero en una fábrica de Piedras Negras, para ayudarme con los gastos de la casa y de nuestra pequeña hija, mi esposa me ayuda con una pequeña tiendita que tenemos en nuestra casa, pero no hemos podido surtirla lo suficiente para que sea productiva, así que solicitamos la cantidad de 675 dls para poder surtirla y así tener alguna ganancia.

loans.use: Supply general store with groceries

loans.name: Rebeca Floridalma

texts.es:
Mrs. Rebeca Floridalma X. G. is 35 years old, and is married. She lives in Caserío Xecaxonabaj, Aldea Nimasac, in Totonicapán, Guatemala. Rebeca spins thread, which is a stage in the process of making traditional clothes. Because Rebeca is enthusiastic about getting ahead with her family, she asked the ASDIR association for a loan of 4,986 Quetzales, which she'll use to set up her own shop for creating traditional clothing. One of Rebeca's children worked for two years with Manuel Velasquez to learn how to make traditional clothing, and now Rebeca would like to put his knowledge into practice. She'll use the capital to buy a loom and work tools, and with the earnings she'll be able to grow her business and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Rebeca Floridalma X. García, de 35 años de edad, Casada, residiendo en el Caserío Xecaxonabaj, Aldea Nimasac, Totonicapán, Guatemala, con oficios de amarradora de hilo, la cual es una etapa del trabajo para la elaboración de cortes típicos, debido a la necesidades y ese entusiasmo de salir adelante con su familia, solicita en la asociación ASDIR, un crédito por un monto de Q. 4, 986.00, préstamo que utilizara para iniciar su pequeño taller de elaboración de cortes típicos, ya que conforme pasó el tiempo uno de sus hijos, laboro durante dos años con don Manuel Velásquez en la elaboración de cortes típicos, en donde en la actualidad pone en practica los conocimientos adquiridos, necesitados de un capital para la compra de un telar y sus herramientas de trabajo para la elaboración de cortes típicos, la cual através de los ingresos que genere su taller elaboración de cortes típicos, podrán crecer económicamente y mejorar su condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Working capital (Purchase of raw materials)

loans.name: Iván

texts.es:
Iván T. R. works in a factory in Piedras Negras. In order to cover the household expenses and support his son, he and his wife have a taco stand that they operate at night outside their home. However, they have to rent the small cart they are using to make the tacos, which lowers profits. For this reason, they would like to obtain a loan of $350.00 USD in order to build a wall in their house so that they can serve their patrons from home and not have to pay rent for their current taco cart.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Iván T. R. trabaja como obrero en una fabrica en Piedras Negras, para poder pagar todos los gastos de su casa y los de su pequeño hijo el junto con su esposa tienen un puesto de tacos afuera de su casa que atienden en las noches, pero el carrito que utilizan para hacerlos se los están rentando las ganancias son muy pocas por eso desean un préstamo por la cantidad de 350 dlls para poder construir en su casa una pared para poder atender a sus clientes en su casa y no tener que pagar la renta del carrito que tienen actualmente.

loans.use: Construct a wall for their business

loans.name: Ama Abozou-Mondom

texts.fr:
Born in Kara on December 31, 1975, Mr. Ama Abozou-Mondom A. is single and has no children. He has had his own business since 2005. He completes construction projects and is paid once the entire project is finished. This way of doing business sets him apart from other business owners, who insist on being paid for part or all of a construction project before it is even started. His services are thus in greater demand than those of his competitors. However, he sometimes lacks working capital, especially if the construction project he is working on is a large one. He has already received and repaid one loan. He is requesting this second loan in order to finish a construction project consisting of renovating a parking lot.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né à Kara le 31 décembre 1975, Monsieur A. Ama Abozou-Mondom est célibataire sans enfant. Il est un entrepreneur qui exerce depuis 2005. Il reçoit des chantiers qu’il exécute entièrement et se fait payer après exécution complète. Cette façon de procéder fait qu’il se différencie des autres entrepreneurs qui se font payer partiellement ou entièrement avant l’exécution. Il est alors plus demandé que les autres entrepreneurs. Ainsi il lui arrive parfois d’avoir une insuffisance de fonds de roulement surtout si le chantier est assez important. Il avait eu recours à un premier prêt qu’il a bien remboursé. Il demande ce deuxième prêt qui lui permettra de finir un chantier de réhabilitation d’un parking.

loans.use: Renovating a parking lot

loans.name: Teófila

texts.es:
Teófila works everyday in order to make a better future for her only son, who is 17 years old. She is 39 years of age and has two jobs: one as a poultry farmer, and the other in interprovincial transportation, covering the route between Huancayo and Satipo. Teófila has resolved to increase her poultry population, but she needs to plant pasture in a small grazing field in order to feed them. The loan that Teófila is requesting will be used for giving maintenance to one of her buses, and another portion of it will be used to purchase more poultry. Thanks to your invaluable support, Teófila will continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Teófila trabaja a diario para forjar un mejor futuro para su único hijo que tiene 17 años. Ella tiene 39 años y se desempeña en dos actividades: la crianza de aves de corral y el transporte interprovincial, cubriendo la ruta entre las ciudades de Huancayo y Satipo. Teófila que se ha propuesto aumentar la población de sus animales, para ello sembrará pasto en un pequeño terreno pasto para alimentarlos. El dinero que solicita Teófila, en calidad de préstamo, será utilizado para el mantenimiento de uno de sus buses, además de una parte en la compra de más aves de corral. Con tu valioso aporte, Teófila seguirá adelante.

loans.use: Bus maintenance

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es:
Rocío is a health professional; she is an obstetrician. With a great deal of effort, she opened her own pharmacy in her house, which is located in the central plaza of her community, in a strategic area for business. She offers her professional services, giving guidance about medicines and watching over the expectant mothers. At the same time, she works in the medical clinic in her community that is managed by the state. Because of her treatment and the quality of her attention her clients continue to increase. Soon, she hopes to be able to open an obstetric office in her house and, in turn, to improve her pharmacy. Rocío has a five-year-old son; she watches over him and saves money for his studies. Rocío feels satisfied that in a year and half she was able to achieve these successes. This encourages her more to continue going forward. With this goal, she requests a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of medicines for her pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva volunteer.

Rocío es una profesional de la salud, ella es obstetra, con mucho esfuerzo abrió su propia botica en las instalaciones de su casa, la que está ubicada en la plaza central de su comunidad, zona estratégica para el comercio, de esta manera ella ofrece sus servicios profesionales, dando orientación sobre fármacos, y velando por las de madres gestantes. Paralelamente, trabaja en la posta medica de su comunidad que está regentada por el estado. Por su trato y calidad de atención su clientela va en aumento, entonces ella espera próximamente a poder abrir un consultorio obstétrico en su casa, a su vez, mejorar su botica. Rocío tiene un hijo de 5 años por el que vela y ahorra para sus estudios, Rocío siente la satisfacción de que en un año y medio haya podido conseguir estos logros, eso la anima mucho más para seguir adelante. Con ese motivo solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de fármacos para su botica.

loans.use: To buy medicines to stock her pharmacy.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida is a persevering woman, who doesn’t let herself be defeated. In spite of facing obstacles that prevented her from finishing her university education in accounting, her aptitude and the support of her father, who is an accountant, has helped her to work in the field. Her dream is to be able to finish her studies, but now she focuses on the livelihood of her two children, who are studying; the older is already in university. This is what motives her to continue working. Nelida gives accounting advice about procedures and taxes to small businesses. She works in a company with her father. Nelida dreams of finishing her education and of being able to work independently and, in the future, of running her own transport business. In the meantime, Nelida will continue offering her accounting services. At this time, she requests a loan of $375 which she will use for a better implementation of her office and also for the maintenance of her first car, with which she will begin her transport business.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva volunteer.

Nelida es una mujer perseverante que no se deja vencer, a pesar de haber tenido obstáculos para concluir su carrera universitaria de contabilidad, su vocación y el apoyo de su padre que es contador, la ha ayudado para desempeñarse en esta rama. Su anhelo es poder terminar sus estudios, pero ahora prioriza el sustento de sus dos hijos que están estudiando y el mayor ya está en la universidad, lo que la motiva a seguir trabajando. Nelida se dedica a dar asesoría contable, sobre trámites e impuestos a pequeñas empresas, trabaja en sociedad con padre, Nelida sueña con concluir su carrera y poder ejercer de manera independiente y en un futuro administrar su propia empresa de transportes. Mientras tanto, Nelida seguirá ofreciendo sus servicios contables; y en esta ocasión, solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles, que utilizará para una mejor implementación de su oficina, y además el mantenimiento de su primer carro con el que iniciará su empresa de transportes.

loans.use: The implementation of her office, where she offers accounting services.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abla A. was born on September 21, 1986 in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is married and has one child. She is a hairdresser in the Adidogomé neighborhood in Lomé. Since 2001, when she started in this line of business, her customer base has never stopped growing. She is requesting this first loan to purchase hair relaxers and hair extensions in order to better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Abla est née le 21 septembre 1986 à Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle est mariée et a un enfant. Elle est coiffeuse et exerce ce métier dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Depuis l’année 2001 qu’elle a commencé cette activité elle ne cesse jamais de recevoir plusieurs clients. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter des défrisants et des mèches afin de pouvoir bien servir ses clients.

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions and hair relaxers

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Born in Lomé on January 1, 1982, Mrs. Abra D. is a married mother of two children. She sells braised fish in the Adidogomé neighborhood in Lomé. She normally purchases the fish at the large market in Lomé. She has already received and repaid one loan from WAGES. She is requesting this second loan to purchase two crates of fresh fish in order to better serve her customers and earn an income so she can help her husband pay the family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Lomé le 1er janvier 1982, madame D. Abra est mariée et a deux enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des poissons braisés dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Généralement, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et a bien remboursé. Elle sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter deux cartons de poissons frais afin de pouvoir bien servir ses clients et de dégager un revenu pour aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase of fresh fish

loans.name: Sikiratou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Sikiratou S. was born in 1963 in Tabligbo, in the Yoto prefecture in the coastal region of Togo. She is a married mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling cosmetics since 2002, and she always helps her husband pay the family’s expenses. During the summer vacation period, she would like to increase her supplies in order to sell a large quantity of them and pay for a part of her children’s education. She is thus requesting this second loan, after quickly repaying the first loan she received, to purchase four boxes of lotion and two boxes of other beauty products.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame S. Sikiratou est née en 1963 à Tabligbo dans la préfecture de Yoto dans la région maritime au Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants qui vont à l’école. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des produits cosmétiques depuis 2002. Elle aide toujours son mari dans les dépenses de la famille. Pendant ces vacances, elle désire augmenter son stock afin de pouvoir bien vendre et supporter une partie des frais de scolarité de ses enfants. A cet effet, elle sollicite ce second crédit après un prompt remboursement du premier pour acheter 4 cartons de crème et 2 cartons d’autres produits de beauté.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Koffi Jean

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi Jean H. was born on December 13, 1972 in Tchékpo Dévé, a village in the Yoto prefecture in Togo. He has been living in Lomé since 1995, when he got married and opened a tailoring workshop in the Adidogomé neighborhood. His long-standing business in the neighborhood makes him a respected tailor. He has two young sons who are in school. He is requesting this first loan to purchase five rolls of pants fabric and five rolls of shirt fabric to increase his supplies and thus sell more clothing and earn greater profits.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Koffi jean est né le 13 décembre 1972 à Tchékpo Dévé, un village situé dans la préfecture de Yoto au Togo. Il s’est installé à Lomé depuis 1995, s’est marié et a ouvert en cette même année un atelier de couture dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Son ancienneté dans le quartier fait de lui un tailleur reconnu. Il a deux petit fils qui vont à l’école. Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter cinq (5) rouleaux de tissus de pantalon et cinq (5) rouleaux de tissus pour chemises pour augmenter son stock afin de mieux vendre et gagner beaucoup de bénéfice.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric to make clothing

loans.name: Ama Enyonam

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ama Enyonam A. is married and was born on April 30, 1977 in Agou, a village rich in fruits such as bananas, avocados, mangos, etc. She has two children, and her business consists of selling fabric to make clothing. To beat the stiff competition, she goes from office to office and department to department to sell her products. By doing so, she has won many customers, most of whom are civil servants. She thus normally sells them the fabric and then receives the money and the end of the month. Her customer base is currently expanding, and she no longer has enough capital to satisfy the demand. She is thus requesting this first loan to purchase four rolls of pants fabric.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame A. Ama Enyonam est une femme mariée qui est née le 30 avril 1977 à Agou village dans lequel abondent les fruits tels que banane, avocat, manque etc. Elle a deux enfants et a pour activité principale la vente des tissus de confection d’habits. Pour contourner la rude concurrence, elle vend de bureau en bureau et de service en service. En faisant ceci, elle a eu beaucoup de clients qui sont pour la plupart des fonctionnaires. Donc elle a l’habitude de leur vendre et de récupérer l’argent à la fin du mois. Maintenant sa clientèle grandit et ses fonds ne lui suffisent plus pour les satisfaire. Ainsi, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter quatre (4) rouleaux de tissus de pantalon.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric to make clothing

loans.name: Essi Dodzi

texts.fr:
Married and the mother of two children, Mrs Essi Dodzi T. was born on September 5, 1976 in Tsévié, the capital of the Maritime Region. In 2007, she started a business to sell mineral water wholesale to retailers and small bars in her neighborhood. She's seeking this first loan to buy 30 boxes of bottled water to increase her stock and her sales volume.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de deux enfants, dame T. Essi Dodzi est née le 05 septembre 1976 à Tsévié, le chef-lieu de la région maritime. En 2007, elle a ouvert un magasin de vente d’eau minérale en gros aux boutiques et petits établissements du quartier. Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 30 cartons de bouteille d’eau minérale afin d’augmenter son stock et de mieux vendre.

loans.use: To buy boxes of bottled water

loans.name: Luís Eduardo

texts.es:
Mr. Luís Eduardo sells natural products for a living. He is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to purchase merchandise (such as candles and natural products) because he does not have the necessary funds for the moment and he does not want his business to lose profits.

He has been in business for over a year. His mother also works in the business, which is located in their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Luís Eduardo tiene un negocio de venta de productos naturales. El está solicitando un préstamo a Kiva para la compra de mercancía (como velas y productos naturales) ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario por el momento y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio.

El tiene dedicándose a este negocio desde hace más de un año. En el negocio trabajan el y su mama y el negocio está ubicado en su propia casa.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ignasia And Rosa Group

texts.en:
Ignasia and Rosa are members of the Brisas Village Bank. Ignasia, a single 48-year-old mother of one daughter, has a small workshop in her house where she has two machines upon which she makes aprons that she sells at different regional markets, usually on credit. Rosa, a single, 33-year-old mother of two children, sells candies, fruits, jellos and chicha (a traditional drink) on the street side near a hospital in the city of Ayacucho. Ignasia and Rosa need loans to invest in fabrics, cookies, caramels and sodas.

Ignasia and Rosa’s dreams are to improve their businesses, have a stable store and ensure that their children study hard.

loans.use: To invest in fabrics, cookies, caramels and sodas.

loans.name: Avelina And Nancy Group

texts.en:
Avelina and Nancy are members of the Brisas Village Bank. Avelina, a separated mother of four children, sells emoliente (a hot drink with curative properties) by cart on a crowded street from morning to late night. Nancy, a 21-year-old mother of one son, sells ice cream that she acquires from her mother-in-law by cart in front of a high school. Furthermore, in her spare time Nancy helps make the ice cream and gets paid for it. Avelina and Nancy need a loan to invest in linseed, sugar, kerosene and ice cream ingredients.

Avelina and Nancy’s dreams are to improve their lives, have all the basic services necessary to live, finish their studies and provide a good education for their children.

loans.use: To invest in linseed, sugar, kerosene and ice cream ingredients.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Fabiana, a widowed 37-year-old mother of five children, is a member of the Brisas Village Bank, where she has learned to be punctual, responsible and frugal. Fabiana makes ice cream in a traditional style, which she learned from her current partner, as well as lollipops and milkshakes with the help of her daughter-in-law. She sells her products directly to a variety of regional fairs, in front of high schools, and on the streets of the city. Fabiana invested a previous loan to purchase a machine to begin her ice cream business. She now needs a loan of $575 to invest in sugar, ice cream cones, drinking glasses and a motor for her machine.

Fabiana’s dreams are to improve her business, become economically established, have her children study hard, and enjoy a tranquil old age.

loans.use: To invest in sugar, ice cream cones, drinking glasses and a motor for her machine.

loans.name: Bladimir Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Bladimir Antonio M. is 33 years old, married, and has one daughter. His daughter is 6 years old, and is in the first grade. Bladimir works in welding and soldering and his wife works for ARNECOM. In addition to their day jobs, the couple also has their own clothing business. This business serves as a means of increasing their household income, and they've been operating it for 4 years. Bladimir is asking for 9800 Cordobas, which he'll use to buy pants, shirts, and underwear in Managua twice a month, depending on sales. He and his wife will then bring the clothing to sell to colleagues, neighbors, and friends in Leon.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Bladimir Antonio M., tiene 33 años de edad, es casado, tiene una hija de 6 años, que actualemnte cursa el primer grado, su esposa trabaja en ARNECOM, es en solicitar un financiamiento por la suma de C$ 9800.00 córdobas para adquirir ropa actividad que lleva a cabo en conjunto con su esposa ya que donde labora tambien tiene la oportunidad de ofertarle a sus compañeros de trabajo, al igual que el señor M. ya que tambien trabaja en un taller de torno y soldadura. Dicha actividad economica la desempeña como una alternativa para poder incrementar los ingresos del hogar, desarrollandola de forma ambulante teniendo 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. El financiamiento será utilizado para comprar mas ropa como pantalones, camisas y ropa interior, llevando a cabo sus compras en managua dos veces al mes dependiendo de sus recuperaciones, sus ventas las realiza de contado y credito que recupera a los quince dias o al mes. Sus principales clientes son sus compañeros de trabajo, y perosnas del sector aledaños a su domicilio

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana, a member of the Brisas Village Bank, is a 49-year-old mother of seven children. She and her husband make traditional breads such as chapla and wawa (breads made of oat flour shaped like babies or horses) during the Todo Santos celebrations. Cipriana sells these breads by cart in the Santa Clara market. She also has a car which her spouse uses for their taxi business in the city of Ayacucho. Cipriana now needs a loan of $575 to invest in flour, sugar, yeast and salt for her business.

Ciipriana’s dreams are to construct her house, improve her business, and provide her children with a good education so that they become professionals.

loans.use: To invest in flour, sugar, yeast and salt.

loans.name: Tania Gloria

texts.en:
Tania, a member of the Trébol Village Bank, is a single 24-year-old woman who travels to the Huamanguilla fair where she sells vegetables and purchases cereals to resell in the Ayacucho markets on the weekends. She is also a gasoline attendant for a family business, twenty minutes away from the city of Ayacucho. Tania now needs a loan of $725 to invest in maize and sacks of oats for resale.

Tania’s dream is to have her own gas station, expand her cereal business and have a car to transport her products.

loans.use: To invest in maize and sacks of oats.

loans.name: Bethsy Magaly

texts.en:
Bethsy, a member of the Trebol Village Bank, is a single, 21-year-old mother with a six-year-old daughter. Bethsy purchases car parts from Lima which she resells to stores in the cities of Huancay and Ayacucho. She learned this business with the help of her mother who had a car parts store. Furthermore, Bethsy is studying to be an obstetrician (doctor of child birth) at university. Bethsy now requests a loan of $975 to invest in a variety of silicon products, adhesives and tapes.

Bethsy’s dream is to finish her studies, become a professional, have her own car parts store and provide the best for her daughter.

loans.use: To invest in a variety of silicon products, adhesives and tapes.

loans.name: Felipe Santiago

texts.es:
Mr. Felipe H. S. is 61 years old, and a widower. He has grown children, and has been working with Fudacion Leon 2000 for 8 years. Felipe is from telica, but moved to Leon and purchased his own home, where he now lives. Felipe owns a taxi, which he operates with one of his sons. He has been in the transportation business for 32 years, starting first as an apprentice to other drivers and then acquiring his own vehicle. Felipe would like a loan to pay for repairs to his taxi, which is having mechanical problems. He doesn't have a source of income besides the taxi, and his son also depends on it. Felipe's dream is to continue improving his home and in the future, to buy a new vehicle to replace his current taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Felipe H. S., tiene 61 años de edad, es viudo, no tiene hijos menores de edad, todos trabajan por su propia cuenta, tiene mas de 8 años de trabajar con fundacion leon 2000,. El se dedica a brindar los servicios de transporte especificamente taxi, actividad que desarrolla en conjunto con un hijo, su negocio es de forma ambulante, tiene 32 años de ejercer este trabajo, dicho negocio suge como una alternativa de empleo ya que inicio siendo cadete de otras unidades es decir le trabajaba a otra persona, posteriormente se le dio la oportunidad de adquirir su propio medio de trabajo hasta la fecha continua desempeñandolo El financiamiento lo necesita para poder adquirir unos respuestos para reparar su unidad de trabajo, ya que le esta dando problemas de origen mecanico. En cuanto sus condiciones de vida vive en casa propia, el era originario del municipio de telica, actualmente vive en Leon donde compro su casita, le ha venido haciendo mejoras, no tiene otro apoyo economico, ademas del que le genera el taxi, su hijo que tambien trabaja con él depende de esta unidad. Sus sueño es continuar acondicionando su casita y mas adelante comprar otra unidad es decir otro vehiculo para sustituir el actual.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Clotilde Mirta

texts.es:
Mirta is a hardworking, enterprising woman who always looks for opportunities for the development and well-being of her family. Four years ago, she opened her own general store, where she meticulously attends to her neighbors, who are her customers. She offers a variety of groceries. This business allows her to look after her young, 4-year-old daughter, and it is for her that she started the business. For Mirta, sales used to be uncharted territory, but she has now become quite the expert. In order to improve her economic status, she is requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of provisions in order to increase her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Mirta es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora que siempre busca oportunidades de desarrollo y el bienestar de su familia. Hace 4 años abrió su propia bodega, donde esmeradamente atiende a sus vecinos que son sus clientes, ofrece gran variedad de productos alimenticios, este negocio le permite cuidar de su pequeña hija de 4 años, ya que es por ella que se inició en este negocio. Para Mirta, las ventas eran un terreno totalmente desconocido, pero ahora ya es toda una experta. Para mejorar su situación económica solicita un préstamo, el que invertirá en la compra de víveres para incrementar su mercadería.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase general store inventory

loans.name: Leonor Del Rocío

texts.es:
Leonor and her husband have decided to work hard for the sake of their two children and to pay for their education. Leonor sells cosmetics and her husband works as a driver. Leonor is very happy because her sales have been going up, she goes door to door looking for new clients, and her convincing and pleasant manners have allowed her to reach all her selling goals. She is asking for a loan because she would like to increase her earnings; that is why the loan will be used to buy merchandise of good quality and different brands. With the hope of your support, Leonor promises to be responsible on the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Leonor y su esposo se han propuesto trabajar arduamente por el bienestar de sus 2 hijos y costear su educación. Por su parte, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, y su esposo al transporte de pasajeros. Leonor está muy contenta porque ve crecer sus ventas, ella sale de puerta en puerta en busca de nuevos clientes, y con trato amable y poder de convencimiento, Leonor cada día supera las metas que ella misma se pone para su negocio.El motivo de que ella solicite el presente préstamo, es justamente porque desea que los ingresos económicos para su casa aumenten, para ello, el dinero será utilizado en la compra de nuevos cosméticos, de variadas marcas y buena calidad. Con la esperanza de que respondan a su pedido Leonor promete ser responsable en sus pagos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business (cosmetics sales)

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa is the mother of 2 children, who are 10 and 7 years old. She has always looking for a better way of making income. It has been a year since she established a seafood restaurant, where she offers a wide variety of plates based on fish and seafood. The dedication and the good flavor have converted “The Corner of the Sea” into one of the best seafood restaurants in the region. In the future, Elsa wants to open a branch of the restaurant in another area. Constant innovation is one of the weapons with which Elsa attacks the competition; her clients always can find something new in her restaurant. With these motives, Elsa requests a loan so that she can buy a refrigerator, with which she will be able to have more space to preserve her food.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva volunteer.

Elsa es madre de 2 niños de 10 y 7 años, ella siempre ha buscado la mejor forma de generarse ingresos económicos, hace un año, estableció una marisquería donde diariamente ofrece una gran variedad de platos a base pescado y mariscos, la dedicación y buena sazón han convertido al “Rincón del Mar” en una de las mejores marisquerías de su zona. Elsa desea a futuro, abrir una sucursal en otro zona, la innovación constante es una de las armas con la que Elsa ataca a la competencia, ya que sus clientes siempre podrán encontrar algo novedoso en su restaurante. Con esos motivos, Elsa se presenta por este medio para solicitar un préstamo de dinero para la compra de una refrigeradora, con la que podrá tener mayor espacio para la conservación de sus alimentos.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her restaurant.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida, a member of the El Trébol Village Bank, is a widowed 61-year-old mother of five children, one of whom lives with her. Zenaida sells canchas (corn and rice snacks) and wine. Acquiring the wine from taverns in the city of Chincha, she resells it to various stores in Ayacucho. She purchases the cancha from the city of Lima, and then resells her products in the Ayacuchana jungles. Zenaida now needs needs a loan of $375 to purchase additional wine.

Her dream is to construct a home, help her son finish his studies, and ensure the stability of her business.

loans.use: To invest in wine for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa works selling magazines. She rents a space in a downtown area in the city of Huancayo where it is very convenient for her to sell her magazines. She has been 35 years in this business, and hence knows very well what her clients buy and thus knows what magazines to buy. Rosa lives with her two children, and they help her organizing the magazines. Rosa has noticed that taste changes with time, and that the classical magazines no longer sell well with the newer clients. That is why Rosa would like to buy a set of new and varied magazines, and she is asking for a loan with the promise to repay it responsibly and on time. Rosa considers that when a person offers a lending hand to others, that person deserves her utmost respect.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa es una mujer de mucha trayectoria en el ámbito de las ventas de revistas, ella arrienda un espacio en una zona céntrica de la ciudad de Huancayo donde puede ofrecer sus revistas con mucha comodidad. Ella lleva 35 años en este negocio, por ello que conoce muy bien el gusto de sus clientes y sabe cuales revistas traer y cuales no. Rosa vive con sus dos hijos, los que le colaboran mucho con su trabajo y le ayudan a organizar sus revistas. Rosa se ha dado cuenta que los gustos van cambiado según el paso de los años, y las revistas clásicas, muchas veces ya no satisfacen el gusto de nuevos clientes.Por ello Rosa desea adquirir un lote con novedosas y variadas revistas, y solicita este préstamo con la promesa de pagar puntual y responsablemente. Ya que ella considera que cuando una persona le tiende la mano a otra, merece todo su respeto.

loans.use: To buy a new set of magazines to sell them in her business.

loans.name: Diana, Teodosia, Rosa Group

texts.en:
Diana, Teodosia and Rosa are members of the El Trébol Village Bank. Diana is a single 22-year-old woman who, with her mother, sells food from a cart at the Nazarena Market in the mornings. As well, Diana works part time babysitting to generate more income for her household.

Teodosia is a 41-year-old mother of four children who sells chichi (corn and rice snacks) on Fridays and Sundays from a cart in front of a church. She and her husband also buy livestock at a variety of fairs.

Rosa is a widowed 70-year-old mother of ten children, two of whom live with her. Rosa sells cheese door to door in the city of Huanta.

Diana, Teodosia and Rosa need loans to invest in sugar, cooking oil, sheep, pigs and cheese. Their dreams are to improve their businesses, educate their children to become professionals, have their own homes and improve their health.

loans.use: Diana, Teodosia and Rosa need loans to invest  in sugar, cooking oil, sheep, pigs and cheese.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Mercedes G. P. is 26 years old, and a single mother of two. Her children are 7 and 8 years old, and are enrolled in fourth and fifth grade, respectively. Maria lives with her children and their father, and she depends on her business for income. Maria began selling shoes with help from her mother, who also works in retail and helped Maria get started. Maria has a small stall in the market in the bus terminal, where she sells footwear. She dreams of being able to help her children grow as professionals, expanding her business, and turning it into an exclusive footwear store. With a loan, Maria will be able to increase her inventory and use the resulting earnings to continue improving her home and helping her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Mercedes G. P., tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera, madre de dos hijos, con edades comprendidas entre los 7 y 8 años respectivamente, cursando uno de ellos el cuarto grado y el otro el quinto grado, estudiando en un colegio publico, el padre de sus hijos no vive con ella, depende totalmente de su negocio siendo este la venta de calzado en general, teniendo un pequeño tramo ubicado en le mercado la terminal de buses frente a distribuidora el Ahorro, atendido personalmente. Sus sueños, son poder ayudarle a sus hijos a desarrollarse como profesionales, ampliar su negocio y de ser posible poner una tienda exclusiva de calzado. Su negocio da inicio producto de la necesidad de empleo contando con el apoyo de su señora madre que le apoyo en el desarrollo de dicha idea de negocio ya que tambien era comerciante. Con el financiamiento pretende incrementar su inventario y con las ganacias poder ir mejorando su casa y por consiguiente apoyar a sus hijos lo mas que pueda.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther has 3 school age children, who are the reason for her daily toil because she wants to give them the necessities. For 5 years now, she has been selling food, offering lunches to truckers from Monday through Friday. On weekends, she sets up tables and chairs on her patio in order to sell beer. Esther wishes to have a recreational center where she can sell food and drinks. For this, she needs to start setting up a space and buy furniture, games, etc. She is requesting this loan in order to increase capital so that she can start making her business grow. Furthermore, she will use the loan to purchase the ingredients needed to make her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Esther tiene 3 hijos que actualmente están en la escuela, y por los que realiza su labor diaria para darles lo necesario.Hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de comida, ofreciendo almuerzos diarios a los transportistas, de lunes a viernes.Los fines de semana acondiciona su patio con mesas y sillas para la venta de cerveza. El deseo de Esther es tener una casa recreo, para los fines de semana, donde pueda vender comida y bebidas. Para ellos bebe ir acondicionando el espacio, comprando muebles, juegos, etc.Solicita el presente préstamo para incrementar su capital y pueda iniciar el crecimiento de su negocio, además de comprar alimentos para la preparación de sus comidas.

loans.use: Increase capital for her food and beer business

loans.name: Felicitas' Group

texts.en:
Felicitas and Geovina are members of the El Trébol Village Bank. Felicitas is a 48-year-old mother of seven children who, with the help of her daughter, sells breakfast from a cart in the Nazarenas market to businesspeople at their posts. As well, she washes clothing and cooks for various clients.

Meanwhile, Geovina, a 24-year-old mother of two children, operates an ironing and painting workshop with her husband at a rented location. She also works at many different businesses in order to learn more and to eventually have her own workshop. Felicitas and Geovina are requesting the loan to invest in sugar, eggs, oil and paints.

Ffelicitas and Geovina’s dream of their children becoming professionals and expanding their businesses . Geovina also dreams of studying for a technical career.

loans.use: To invest in sugar, eggs, oil and paints.

loans.name: Magno

texts.es:
Magno is a farmer and there are seasons, such as during the harvest, when he has to stay on his lands for weeks. During this time he leaves his wife as head of the household, since his fields are far from home. Rafaela, his wife and the person pictured in the photograph, comments that Magno is a wonderful father who tries in every way possible to satisfy the needs of their six children who are pursuing basic level education. With this goal of meeting basic needs in mind, Magno and his wife Rafaela would like to acquire additional land in order to plant peas and obtain income more quickly, since peas are harvested in less time. For this reason they seek a loan, money that will allow them to increase their production and obtain income over shorter time periods. If you are able to help this family get ahead, Magno and his wife would be eternally grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Magno es agricultor y hay temporadas que tiene que permanecer en sus terrenos por semanas, en los días de cosechas, durante ese tiempo deja a su esposa como cabeza de su hogar, ya que sus cultivos están alejados de su casa. Rafaela, su esposa, y a quien se le ve en la foto, comenta que Magno es un gran padre que trata, en lo posible, satisfacer las necesidades de sus 6 hijos quienes cursan estudios básicos.Con esta finalidad, Magno y su esposa Rafaela desean poder adquirir un terreno adicional en donde pueda cultivar alverja y obtener ingresos prontamente, debido a que la arveja se cosecha en menos tiempo.Para ello solicita un préstamo, dinero que le servirá para ampliar su producción y obtener ingresos a corto plazo. Si usted puede ayudar a esta familia a progresar Magno y su esposa se lo agradecerán de por vida.

loans.use: To purchase arable land in order to plant peas.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina is a woman dedicated to selling milk. Each morning she leads her cow to pasture, milks the cow, and then carries the milk to market. However, Alejandrina’s economic needs have grown, and she hopes to purchase an additional cow in order to increase her sales. She would also like to dedicate herself to making cheeses that she could sell in the markets of nearby towns and in the local markets of her city. The $450.00 that Alejandrina is requesting will be enough to purchase a cow. Alejandrina earnestly requests your help with this loan. She will be eternally grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandrina es una mujer dedicada a la venta de leche, cada mañana lleva a su vaca a pastear para luego ordeñarla. Luego de eso lleva su leche para la venta. Sin embargo, sus necesidades han aumento, por ello, desea obtener una vaca más aumentar sus ventas y dedicarse a elaborar más quesos que pueda llevar a los mercados de los pueblos cercanos y a las ferias de la ciudad.La cantidad que solicita es la necesita para la compra de la vaca. Alejandrina solicita encarecidamente que le puedan brindar este préstamo, le estará eternamente agradecida por su apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase a cow in order to increase production of milk and cheese.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es:
Octavia is a mother of 9 children who are the apple of her eye; she has made an effort to provide for them the best possible way according to her capacities. Thanks to her work she was able to bring them up and give them education and now she is alone with the last two. Octavia is a farmer and a stockbreeder and with these activities she can support her home. She knows very well how to look after and feed her cows to obtain the necessary amount of milk to be sold on week-ends and to make cheese. Octavia wishes to increase her income and for that purpose she needs one more cow and therefore she requests this loan and hopes to count on your support to satisfy her need.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Octavia es una madre de 9 hijos quienes son sus más grandes tesoros, por ellos se esforzó para darles todo lo posible, dentro de sus capacidades. Gracias a su trabajo pudo educarlos y criarlos, ahora se ha quedado con los dos últimos, que son su única compañía. Octavia es agricultora y ganadera, con estas actividades puede mantener su hogar. Ella sabe muy bien cómo cuidar y alimentar a sus vacas para que pueda obtener leche necesaria para su venta los fines de semana y para la elaboración de quesos. Octavia espera incrementar sus ingresos y para ello necesita adquirir una vaca más, por lo que pide este préstamo, ella expone su caso para que con su ayuda pueda darle solución a su necesidad.

loans.use: Purchase a cow to increase sale of cheese and milk.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila is an industrious mother who recently started selling food at the same premises where her husband sells beer; so they work together all day long. Nevertheless, if this business is duly set up it can provide them with a very good income as it is located on the local square where there is a lot of people. Therefore, Lucila and her husband need to adjust and improve the appearance of the premises with adornments and furniture to make them more comfortable to the customers. They need a loan of 1100 soles to help improve the look of their premises as the food is very delicious and of good quality.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Lucila es emprendedora madre que inició su negocio de venta de comida recientemente en el mismo local donde su esposo vende cerveza, juntos trabajan todo el día. Sin embargo, si este negocio es debidamente implementado puede dejarles muy buenos ingresos, ya que está ubicado en la plaza de su localidad donde hay mucha concurrencia de personas. Por ello, Lucila y su esposo quiere ambientar y mejorar la apariencia de su local con diversos adornos y muebles que sean acogedores para sus clientes. Para esto requieren de la suma de 1100 soles, dinero que le ayudaría a mejorar el aspecto de su local, ya que su comida es muy rica y de buena calidad.

loans.use: Purchase adornments and furniture to improve appearance of a restaurant.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Over three years ago, Marleny and Hugo started their family with the idea of offering their young daughter a better future. This young couple owns a modest carpenter’s workshop in which they produce the finest quality, made-to-order furniture for their customers. While Hugo is in charge of sanding and putting the pieces of wood together, Marleny does the finishing touches, avidly learning the secrets and abilities of this field. She is also in charge of selling the furniture in the city of Juliaca’s main square. Together they make the perfect team. This young and enterprising couple’s wish is to obtain a loan that they will invest in purchasing several different types of wood so that they can continue their noble work.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Marleny y Hugo hace más de 3 años formaron su hogar con la ilusión de ofrecerles un futuro mejor a su pequeña niña, esta joven pareja tienen una modesta carpintería, donde elaboran muebles de óptima calidad, conforme al diseño y requerimiento de los clientes. Mientras Hugo se encarga de tallar y unir pieza por pieza sus muebles, Marleny realiza los retoques finales, aprendiendo habidamente los secretos y habilidades de este trabajo, también es la encargada de ofrecerlo en la plaza de la ciudad de Juliaca, juntos hacen un equipo perfecto. El deseo de esta joven y emprendedora pareja es adquirir un préstamo, dinero que invertirán en adquirir variedad de madera para continuar con su noble oficio.

loans.use: Purchase different types of wood to produce their fine-quality furniture

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona is from the province of Azángaro and is 50 years old. She is an exemplary and hard-working mother, who has worked in different trades with the goal of offering tranquility, education, and security to her children, with whom she opened a body-work shop for taxis. This is work that, in spite of her advanced age and condition as a women, she manages efficiently. This mother wants to acquire materials (iron) to continue with this trade for her satisfaction and that of her children; her business has proven to be profitable. With her goal in mind, she appeals to you.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva volunteer.

La provincia de Azángaro es el pueblo natal de Simona, ejemplar y laboriosa madre de 50 años de edad, quien ha desempeñado diferentes oficios con el fin de ofrecer tranquilidad, educación y seguridad a sus hijos, con quienes ahora en sociedad, abrieron un taller de carrocería para motocarros, trabajo que pese a su avanzada edad y condición de mujer se desenvuelve eficientemente. El deseo de esta madre es adquirir materiales (fierros), para continuar con este oficio, que para su satisfacción y la de sus hijos, les viene resultando rentable. Con ese fin recurre a ustedes.

loans.use: To buy material (iron) for her body-work shop for taxis.

loans.name: Graciana

texts.es:
The business of buying and selling Andean products turned into the main source of income for Graciana, a diligent mother who, after separating from her husband, responsibly took the reins of her household. She became responsible for the education and well-being of her 2 children, who after many years of effort and dedication are now independent adults. This industrious woman obtains Andean products from markets in different areas of her city. After collecting the adequate amount of products such as barley, potatoes, oca (an Andean vegetable root), and cheese, she sells them as a street vendor in the Manco Cápac market of her district. Over the last few months, her products have been in high demand, which is why Graciana would like to increase her capital—her reason for requesting this current loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de compra y venta de productos andinos, se convirtió en el principal ingreso económico de Graciana, madre diligente y laboriosa, que al separarse de su esposo tomó responsablemente las riendas de su hogar, haciéndose cargo de la educación y bienestar de sus 2 hijos, quienes después de muchos años de esfuerzo y dedicación ya son mayores e independientes. Esta hacendosa mujer adquiere producto andinos en las ferias de los distintos pueblitos de su ciudad, luego de reunir una buena cantidad de estos tales como: cebada, papa, oca y queso se dedica a venderlos en forma ambulatoria en el mercado Manco Cápac de su localidad. En estos últimos meses sus productos están logrando tener gran demanda, motivo por el cual, Graciana desea aumentar el monto de su capital de inversión, por lo que solicita el presente préstamo.

loans.use: Invest in Andean products

loans.name: Solema

texts.es:
Solema is a woman who works raising livestock. She developed this skill as a child alongside her parents, and now it helps her meet household expenses. Solema raises her animals with great dedication in order to later sell their meat in town. She also meets certain special requests that she receives from the city, and these offer her the best income. In order to be sure of good earnings, since she is aware that the cost of living is increasing, Solema wants to acquire a few more animals in order to increase her income and the amount of her livestock. In order to accomplish this she needs a sum of 1300 soles ($475 US), money that she hopes you will be able to help loan.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Solema es una mujer que trabaja criando su ganado, actividad que desde muy pequeña desarrolló junto a sus padres, y que ahora le ayuda con los gastos de su hogar. Solema cría sus animales con mucha dedicación para luego vender su carne en el pueblo, también atiende algunos pedidos especiales que le hacen para la ciudad, siendo estos los mejores ganancias le traen.Para asegurar buenas ganancias, ya que entiende que el costo de vida va en aumento, Solema desea adquirir un par de animales más para incrementar sus ingresos y la cantidad de su ganado. Para ello necesita la suma de 1300 soles, dinero que espera usted le pueda prestar.

loans.use: To purchase livestock in order to increase earnings

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma has been a mother since she was 15 years old. At that age she had to find a way to meet the needs of her first child. Together she and her partner began to plant the fields that they inherited from their parents. Now they have three children and household expenses have grown. This young couple wants to begin a parallel activity that will supplement their income. They hope to open a grocery store in the city close to the town where they live. In order to begin this business project, they are asking for your help. They will invest the money from the loan that they receive in the implementation of their store. They recognize that the urgings of youth led them to commit errors, but the responsibility of being parents and carrying the burden of the home on their shoulders has made them mature quickly. They honestly are able to assure you that with strength and dedication they will be able to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Vilma es madre desde los 15 años, a esa edad tuvo que buscar la manera de solventar las necesidades de su primer hijo. Junto a su pareja empezaron a sembrar en las tierras que heredaron de sus padres. Ahora ya tienen 3 hijos y los gastos en su hogar se han incrementado. Esta joven pareja quiere realizar una actividad paralela que aumente sus ingresos económicos. Desean abrir una bodega en la ciudad cercana la pueblo donde viven.Para iniciar este proyecto de negocio, solicitan su ayuda, con un préstamo de dinero que invertirán en la implementación de su tienda.Ellos reconocen que el ímpetu de su juventud los llevó a cometer errores, pero que la responsabilidad de ser padres y llevar en sus hombros su hogar los ha hecho madurar, con honestidad pueden asegurar que con esfuerzo y dedicación podrán salir adelante.

loans.use: To furnish and purchase supplies for a new store

loans.name: Mat

texts.en:
Mrs. Mat C., 37, is a grocery seller and her husband is beef seller who buys oxen to kill and sell for profit. They live in Bak Roteas Village, Pursat Province. C. buys her grocery stocks from the town market and resells them to customers in her area. They have three children, all of whom are young and in school. C. earns around $4 per day. Her husband, Mr. Om Sokhorn, 45, earns around $50 per month. C. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more stock for her grocery store and to purchase oxen for her husband's business. The loan will allow her to expand her business and to increase her family’s income. C.’s husband is pictured because Mrs. C. is not available.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery stocks and oxen

loans.name: Construction, Recycling, Livestock Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thuy Nam Thi N. is 31 years old. Both she and her husband work in the construction industry. She is requesting 4,256,000 VND to invest in a construction company and to pay worker’s wages. She has two children who are going to school. She and the other members in the group have completed one successful cycle of funding and repayment. The money Mrs. N. is able to borrow helps her reduce her costs. Her family’s income is about 150,000 per day.

Her group includes:

  • Mrs. Hanh Thi N., requesting 4,256,000 VND as capital for a recycling business.
  • Mrs. Dung Thi M., requesting 4,256,000 VND to buy feed for pigs.
  • Mrs. Luong Thi N., requesting 2,016,000 VND to raise pigs.
  • Mr. Minh Dinh N., requesting 3,808,000 VND to raise pigs.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

    Chị Nguyễn Thị Thùy Nam (MS: 020046), năm nay 31 tuổi. Cả hai anh chị đều làm nghề xây dựng. Chị vay 4.256.000 VND để phục vụ cho việc xây dựng cơ sở hạ tầng, trả tiền công thợ. Chị có 2 con hiện còn đang đi học. Chị cùng các thành viên khác trong nhóm đã tham gia vay vốn được một chu kỳ và đã hoàn trả xong. Chị muốn vay vốn vì nó giúp chị tiết kiệm được rất tốt. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chị là khoảng 150.000 VND/ ngày.

    Trong nhóm chị còn có:

  • Chị Nghiêm Thị Hạnh (MS: 020018), vay 4.256.000 VND để lấy vốn đi buôn đồ phế liệu.
  • Chị Mẫn Thị Dung (MS: 020021), vay 4.256.000 VND để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn.
  • Chị Nghiêm Thị Lương (MS: 020048), vay 2.016.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn.
  • Anh Nghiêm Đình Minh (MS: 020049), vay 3.808.000 VND đê chăn nuôi lợn.

loans.use: Invest in construction company, recycling business, and livestock

loans.name: Livestock Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vui Thi C. is 43 years old. She is the senior member of the group. Her group has completed a good first funding round. In this second round, She is requesting 4,256,000 VND to invest in a breeding pig.

Her group includes:

  • Mrs. Xuan Thi N., requesting 4,256,000 VND to buy cattle.
  • Mrs. Gia Thi N., requesting 4,256,000 VND to buy feed for pigs and chicken.
  • Mrs. Bich Duyen Thi N., requesting 4,256,000 VND to buy breeding pigs.
  • Mrs. Tam Thi N., requesting 4,256,000 VND to buy pig feed.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

    Cô C. Thị Vui (MS: 09050022), năm nay 43 tuổi. Cô là người trưởng nhóm rất nhiệt tình. Cả nhóm cô đã hoàn thành rất tốt C. kỳ một. Lần này tham gia C. kỳ hai, cô vay 4.256.000 VND để lấy vốn mua lợn giống.

    Trong nhóm cô còn có

  • Chị Ngô Thị Xuân (MS: 09050026), vay 4.256.000 VND để mua bò.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Giá (MS: 09050024), vay 4.256.000 VND mua cám cho lợn, gà.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Bích Duyên (MS: 09050025), vay 4.256.000 VND để mua giống lợn
  • Chị Ngô Thị Tám (MS: 09050028), vay 4.256.000 VND mua cám lợn.

loans.use: Buying livestock and feed

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor A. is a 34-year-old man. He is married and the father of four children. They have lived in Ningarhar province for a long time. Noor has been working as a farmer for the last several years in his village. His children go to school and he is the sole breadwinner for his family.

Noor A. grows different kinds of vegetables on his lands and sells them in the center of the city. However, his current $8-a-day income is not sufficient for the family; he needs $20 at least. His sons help him on the farms in addition to their schooling, but Noor doesn’t allow them to spend a lot time there because he wants them to do well in school and pursue a bright future.

Noor A. has been thinking about how to solve his problems for a while now. He finally decided to purchase some livestock and do animal husbandry. He knows that this business is quite profitable in his area. There are a lot of grasslands in his village and he would provide sufficient food for the stock. He hopes that he will sell milk and yogurt. With this plan in mind, he has applied for a loan of 50,000 Afghanis over 24 months.

Noor A. hopes that if he is able to expand his business, he will buy more livestock and will start a stock-selling business in the future. He thanks the lenders in advance.

loans.use: To purchase some livestock

loans.name: Agricultural Machinery Services And Raising Livestock Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ha Thi N. is 30 years old. She is a very hardworking person. Not only does she work the farm, raise pigs and cattle, but she also invested in buying a tilling machine and wheat processor to serve the agricultural community. Her group has completed their first round of funding and repayment in good fashion. In this round of funding she is requesting 3,808,000 VND to buy another wheat processor.

Her group includes:

  • Mrs. Chuyen Thi N., requesting 3,808,000 VND to supplement her capital in a silk business.
  • Mrs. The Thi N., requesting 2,464,000 VND to invest in buying breeding chickens.
  • Mrs. Han Thi N., requesting 3,360,000 VND to invest in buying feed for pigs and chickens.
  • Mrs. Huong Thi C., requesting 3,808,000 VND to invets in feed for pigs and chickens.
  • Mrs. Loi Thi N., requesting 2,464,000 VND to invest in buying pigs.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

    Chị Ngô Thị Hà (MS: 09050007), năm nay 30 tuổi. Chị là người rất chăm chỉ. Chị không chỉ làm ruộng, nuôi lợn, bò. Chị còn đầu tư máy cày, máy tuốt lúa để làm dịch vụ cho bà con nông dân. Nhóm chị đã hoàn thành C. kỳ một rất tốt. Lần này chị vay 3.808.000 VND để mua máy tuốt lúa.

    Trong nhóm chị còn có

  • Chị Ngô Thị Chuyên (MS: 09050006), vay 3.808.000 VND bổ sung vốn làm tơ tằm
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Thế (MS: 09050008), vay 2.464.000 VND bổ sung vốn mua gà giống.
  • Chị Ngô Thị Hân (MS: 09050011), vay 3.360.000 VND bổ sung vốn mua cám lợn, gà.
  • Chị C. Thị Hường (MS: 09050010), vay 3.808.000 VND bổ sung vốn mua cám cho lợn, gà.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Lợi (MS: 09050009), vay 2.464.000 VND bổ sung vốn mua lợn.

loans.use: Buy machinery, feed, breeding animals

loans.name: Construction, Livestock Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hong Thi C. is 30 years old. She is a farmer and also raise livestock. Her family owns an automobile which they use to transport construction materials for people in the area. The four other members of her group have done very well in their repayments in the first round. In this second round of participation, she is requesting 3,808,000 VND to supplement her capital to buy construction materials to sell.

Her group includes:

  • Mrs. Tien Thi N., requesting 3,808,000 VND to buy a breeding pig.
  • Mrs. Oanh Thi N., requesting 3,808,000 VND to buy goods to sell at a general store.
  • Mrs. Loan Thi N., requesting 3,808,000 VND to buy chicken feed.
  • Mrs. Hue Thi N., requesting 3,186,000 VND to buy chicken feed.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

    Chị C. Thị Hồng (MS: 09050031), năm nay 30 tuổi. Chị vùa làm ruộng vừa chăn nuôi. Nhà chị có ô tô để đi chở vật liệu xây dưng cho bà con trong vùng. Bốn thành viên trong nhóm chị đã hoàn trả rất tốt C. kỳ một. Lần này tham gia C. kỳ hai chị vay 3.808.000 VND để bổ sung vốn mua vật liêu xây dưng bán.

    Trong nhóm chị còn có

  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Tiền (MS: 09050033), vay 3.808.000 VND để mua lợn giống.
  • Chị Ngô Thị Oanh (MS: 09050032), vay 3.808.000 VND để mua hàng tạp hóa bán.
  • Chị Ngô Thị Loan (MS: 09050030), vay 3.808.000 VND để mua cám lợn.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Huệ ( MS: 09050083), vay 3.186.000 VND để mua cám lợn

loans.use: Construction materials, raising livestock, and investing in business

loans.name: Livestock And Woodwork Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Kinh Thi N. is 52 years old. The four other members in her group has participated in the first round and have been very good at handling the repayments. Mrs. N. works for the Women’s Association; she is very hardworking and industrious. Her family has many occupations including: raising pigs and chicken, farming, making and selling buns. Her son makes wooden art. In this round of funding she is requesting 4,704,000 VND to supplement her investments in buying breeding chickens.

Her group includes:

  • Mrs. Huong Thi N. is requesting 2,464,000 VND to buy breeding pigs.
  • Mrs. Thuy Thi N. is requesting 354,000 VND to buy feed for chickens.
  • Mrs. Dang Thi N. is requesting 4,256,000 VND to buy breeding chickens.
  • Mrs. Lien Thi N. is requesting 2,245,000VND to supplement her capital in a woodworking business.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

    Cô Nguyễn Thị Kình (MS: 11040001), năm nay 52 tuổi. Bốn thành viên trong nhóm cô đã tham gia chu kỳ một và đã hoàn trả rất tốt. Bản thân cô làm cán bộ Hội Phu Nữ rất chăm chỉ và năng động. Gia đình cô làm rất nhiều nghề như: nuôi lợn, gà, làm ruộng, làm bánh bán, con trai cô còn làm gỗ mỹ nghệ. Lần nay cô vay 4.704.000 VND để bổ sung vốn mua gà giống.

    Trong nhóm cô còn có:

  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Hường (MS: 040004), vay 2.464.000 VND để mua lợn giống.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Thủy (MS: 040003), vay 354.000 VND để mua cám cho gà.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Đang (MS: 040002), vay 4.256.000 VND để buôn gà giống.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Liên (MS: 040026), vay 2.242.000 VND để bổ sung vốn làm đồ gỗ.

loans.use: Buying breeding animals, invest in woodworking business

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Mrs. Lay H., age 36, is married with two small children. She lives in the Banteay Srey district of the Siem Reap province in Cambodia. She has just opened a stand at her home selling groceries and snacks to the people in her area. In a normal day she earns up to 10 USD in revenue, which she uses to cover her family's expenses. Her husband works selling charcoal and firewood in his community; his income of around 10 USD per day is also used to pay for the family's expenses.

Because her customer demand has increased lately, Lay H. is seeking a loan to expand her inventory to keep pace with the new demand.

loans.use: To puchase more grocery products to expand her inventory

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mrs. Mai S., age 22, lives with her husband and child in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She and her husband work on their farm growing rice and raising pigs to feed their family. The output of rice can feed them for an entire year. In order to find a source of income, her husband would like to purchase chickens from the breeders and resell them from place to place in his town. To be successful at this, her husband will also need a motorcycle which he can use for transportation.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and resell them for a profit

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Thoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoun T., 45, is a rice farmer who lives in Toul Krous Village, Pursat Province. Her husband, Mr. Chab Khoeurn, sells rocks and earns $3 per day. They have seven children, four of whom are married and live away from the family. The other three are young and help to earn income by working with their father. Mrs. Thoun T. wants to purchase a plowing machine to use for her rice faming but she does not have enough money. She requests a loan of $400 to add to her cash so she can purchase a plowing machine.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a plowing machine

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhun Y., 55, sells fruits and vegetables, including banana, coconut, and corn in the market. She buys from farmers and resells for profit, earning around $2.5 per day. Her husband, 51, is a construction worker and earns around $2 per day. They have five children, all of whom are young and in school. They live in PealnhekI Village, Pursat Province. In order to expand her business and improve her family’s income, she now is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more fruits to sell and to purchase a few pigs to raise.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits to sell and to purchase a few pig to raise

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhum C., 30, is married and has two children. She sells vegetables that she buys from growers. She earns around $7 per day. Her husband, Mr. Put Sothol, helps to sell the vegetables. They live in Prek Chhdor Village, Battambang Province. C. has responsibility for her large extended family. She cares for her elderly parents and two younger sisters. To expand her growing business, C. is humbly requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a new cart as transportation for business and to purchase some pigs to raise for resale, which will increase her family’s income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a new cart as transportation for business and to purchase pigs

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aminata Dioné is 47, has seven children, and lives in a polygamous family with her husband, co-wife and their children in the Darsalam II area of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region of the Republic of Mali).

After unsuccessfully trying several business activities, she decided, 28 years ago, to specialize in selling freshwater fish. She has been doing this using her own means, which have proved to be inadequate. While looking for financial assistance, she decided to enter the Soro Yiriwaso micro-credit program a year ago. She is on her second personal loan, and the first was repaid without difficulty.

With this loan, she plans to buy 10 large baskets of fish in the Mopti region (a region rich in fish) with the help of Bozo and Somono fishermen, and to store them in freezers at home or in an area set up for such a purpose. She sells at the Koutiala fish market, which is very popular with homemakers, restaurant owners on the square, and other passing clients.

Mrs. Aminata Dioné estimates a monthly profit of 90,000 CFA francs, with which she will contribute to her household expenses, pay the interest on the loan, and add to her operating budget. In the future she plans to increase her points of sale in the city of Koutiala.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Aminata Dioné a 47 ans, mère de 7 enfants et vit dans une famille polygame avec son mari, sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier Darsalam II de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso République du Mali).

Après plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus entreprises sans succès elle décida de se spécialiser dans la vente de poissons d’eau douce et cela depuis 28 ans. Elle exerçait cette activité avec ses moyens propres qui s’avéraient insuffisant. Dans sa recherche de ressources financières complémentaires elle intègre le programme crédit de l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant une année. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel et le précèdent a été remboursé sans difficulté.

Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 10 gros paniers de poissons dans la région de Mopti (région poissonneuse) avec des pêcheurs (Bozos et Somonos) pour les stocker dans ses congélateurs à domicile ou un endroit est aménagé à cet effet.. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché de poissons de Koutiala très fréquenté par les ménagères, les restaurateurs de la place et d’autres clients de passage.

Madame Aminata Dioné compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA, avec lequel elle contribue aux charges de la famille, payer les intérêts du prêt et renforcer son fonds de commerce. Dans l’avenir elle envisage multiplier les points de vente dans la ville de Koutiala.

loans.use: Purchase of fish

loans.name: Tarangire Group

texts.en:
Hamida, 37 years old, is a mother of three girls. They are 12, 9, and 7. She is widowed and raises the children on her own. She runs a clothing store called 'Babiki' in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She has operated the business since 2003 and works from 9am to 4pm daily. She earns about $120 a month. With this loan from Kiva, Hamida hopes to renovate her business. By adding a new frame and supporting structure she will be able to increase the size of her business and add more inventory.
