She has taken out three loans from Tujijenge previously and successfully paid back all of them.

Hamida is the group leader of the Tarangire group. Along with five other members, who operate in the clothing, charcoal, and food sector, she will share this loan. The group members take out the loan together, and guarantee each other's payments. Therefore, the repayment of the loan is guaranteed.

loans.use: To renovate the business and add a new frame to her shop.

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Union Fait La Force) Group

texts.fr:
On average, the women of the Benkadi group are 42 years old and have six children. They are married and live in extended families that generally include their co-wives, in-laws, and children in the Moussabougou area of the city of Koutiala (Koutiala Prefecture, Sikasso region of the Republic of Mali).

They know each other because they are related, friends or neighbors. They engage in different commercial activities, from sales of small general-store type items to clothing (primary). In order to increase the size of their operations, they decided to enter the Soro Yiriwaso micro-credit program, through which they are receiving their first loan.

They get their supplies from wholesalers at the main market in Koutiala exclusively and resell at retail prices for cash and credit primarily at the previously mentioned market, but also via traveling sales to households.

This loan will be used to purchase a stock of various items for general use and about a dozen outfits. With this loan, they estimate that each member will make an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs per cycle, which will be used to pay the interest on the loan, help with household expenses, and be invested in the business. Strengthening their business activities and network are the primary challenges of this group.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva volunteer.

Les femmes du groupe benkadi sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’age de 42 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles élargies avec généralement des coépouses, les beaux parents et leurs enfants dans le quartier Moussabougou de la ville de Koutiala (Préfecture de Koutiala Région de Sikasso République du Mali).

Elles se sont connues à travers des relations de parenté,d’amitié et de voisinage. Elles mènent differentes activités qui vont de la vente d’articles divers de petits commerces et sutout d’habillement. Afin d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé ensemble d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elles sont à leur premmier pret.

Ells s’approvisionent exclusivement au grand marché de Koutiala auprés des grossistes et effectuent leurs ventes en détail à crédit et au comptant, essentiellement au marché de la dite localité mais aussi de facon ambulante dans les familles.

Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter un stock d’articles divers de petit commerce et une douzaine d’habits. Avec ce prêt, elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen et mensuel 50 000 CFA par cycle.qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérets du prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et investir le reste dans l’activité. Le renforcement de leurs activités et des liens sociaux constituent le défi majeur des membres du groupe.

loans.use: Purchase of general-use items and clothing

loans.name: Damalie Nakijaba's Group

texts.en:
Damalie N., the leader of a group of five women, is 53 and single with three children, aged 33, 32 and 25, all of whom are working. Damalie also has five grandchildren. She lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Damalie has been selling bananas in Nakawa market for the last 24 years, working six days a week at a kiosk she rents in the market. Obtaining her bananas from a truck that transports them to the Mbarara village market, she must pay not only for the produce but also the high transportation fees.The biggest challenge Damalie faces is selling the bananas before they go bad. Her customers are families and other vendors in the market.

Damalie has been working with MCDT for the past five years, during which time she has been able to pay the school fees for her children and buy a house with three rooms. Damalie hopes to continue to develop her business so that she can one day buy another plot of land.

loans.use: To increase her stock of bananas.

loans.name: Retail, Livestock Group

texts.vi:
Gai Thi N., born in 1963, currently lives in Luc canh, Xuan Canh, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She is borrowing 4,452,000 to run a small business. Her husband works as a freight driver for hire, and she sells goods at the market daily to bring in a regular income. Their average family income is about 3,500,000 VND per month. The method of borrowing a flat amount and making small payments fits very well with the financial needs of her family so they enjoy it a lot. Currently, she and her husband are still supporting their children who are going to college, so their finances are still in a difficult state. She always wishes to borrow money to expand her business and improve the family’s lives and their living conditions. The group also includes: Nga Thi P., born 1954, is borrowing 4,028,000 VND to raise pigs; Thao Thi P., born 1981, is borrowing 4,028,000 VND to raise pigs; Hai Thi H., born 1976, is borrowing 3,604,000 VND to do business; Quynh Lan Thi N. is borrowing 4,452,000 VND to invest in raising livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

Nguyễn Thị Gái, sinh năm 1963, hiện đang sống tại Lực canh, Xuân Canh, Đông Anh, Hà Nội (Ms 23010001), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để buôn bán nhỏ. Chồng chị là lái xe chở hàng thuê, bản thân chị hàng ngày đi chợ bán lẻ hàng hóa có thu nhập thường xuyên. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.500.000 vnđ / tháng. Với mức vay chẵn, hoàn trả nhỏ lẻ rất phù hợp với kinh tế gia đình chị nên gia đình chi rất thích. Hiên tại, vợ chồng chị phải nuôi 2 con học đại học nên kinh tế còn khó khăn. Chị luôn mong muốn được vay nhiều tiền để phát triển kinh tế góp phần cải thiện đời sống và con cái chị đỡ khổ. Trong nhóm chị còn có: P. Thị Nga, sinh năm 1954 (Ms 23010020), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn. P. Thị Thảo, sinh năm 1981 (Ms 23010079), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn. Hoàng Thị Hải, sinh năm 1976 (Ms 23010139), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đi chợ. Nguyễn Thị Quỳnh Lan, sinh năm (Ms 23010052), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Raising livestock, business

loans.name: Djiguiya (L’Espoir) Group

texts.fr:
On average, the members of the Djiguiyagroup are 37 years old and have four children. They live in traditional families with their husbands, children and co-wives in the Moussabougou area of the city of Koutiala (Koutiala Prefecture, Sikasso region of the Republic of Mali).

They primarily trade in cosmetics and clothing. They get their supplies from wholesalers in Koutiala and resell at retail prices via traveling sales to a primarily female clientele. They sell based on credit that is payable on a weekly or daily basis.

When looking for funding in order to increase the size of their operations, they decided to enter the Soro Yiriwaso micro-credit program, through which they are receiving their first loan. With this loan, they plan to make a group purchase which will allow them to increase their profit. The group estimates that each member will make 40,000 CFA francs in profit, which will be used to pay the interest on the loan, help with household expenses, and increase their operating budget.

In the future, the Djiguiya group plans to open a prominent beauty products boutique in the city of Koutiala.

Note: Mariam S. does not appear in the photo for personal reasons (loss of a family member).

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva volunteer.

Les membres du groupe djiguiya,avec une moyenne d’age de 37 ans et 4 enfants; vivent dans des familles traditionnelles avec coépouses maris et enfants dans le quartier Moussabougou de la ville de Koutiala (Préfecture de Koutiala Région de Sikasso République du Mali.)

Elles exercent essentiellement le commerce de cosmétiques et d’habillements. Elles s’approvisionnent auprès de grossistes à Koutiala et revendent en détail de facon ambulante à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. La vente s’effectue à crédit payable hebdomadairement ou quotidiennement.

Dans leur recherche de fonds complementaires afin d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elles sont à leur premier prêt. Avec ce prêt, elles comptent faire un achat groupé ce qui permettra d’augmenter leur marge bénéficiaire. Ainsi elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen individuel de 40 000 CFA.qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérets du prêt, subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et augmenter le fonds de commerce..

Dans l’avenir, le Groupe Djiguiya compte ouvrir une boutique de produits de beauté de reference dans la ville de Koutiala.

NB: sur la photo la nommée Mariam S. n’y figure pas pour des sociales:décès d’un parent.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim Y., 29, is a farmer. She grows rice on her farmland and earns around $3 per day. Her husband, Mr. Lach Pheak, 29, is a bricklayer and earns around $4 per day. He has been working since 1998. They have three young children, all of whom are in school and living in Spean Village, Pursat Province. Mrs. Kim Y. needs a loan of $500 to purchase fertilizer for the rice and to purchase a pig to raise.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her rice crop and to purchase a pig to raise

loans.name: Please Delete Group

texts.en:
Veronica Kasaba is 32 and a mother of one.  Her son is nine years old.  She operates a cooking stand while her husband works in the city.  She has operated this stand since 2003, working weekdays and Saturdays from 6am to 8pm.  Veronica earns a monthly income of 100USD.  

With a loan from Kiva, Veronica hopes to increase her capital in order to purchase more inventory.  She would thereby be able to serve more people and earn a higher income.  She has taken three loans out from Tujijenge previously, and successfully paid back all of them.

Veronica is the group leader of the Basara group.  There are 19 other members in the group.  Each member guarantees the others, thereby ensuring the repayment of the entire loan in full.

loans.use: Increase inventory and capital to help expand.

loans.name: Faïda (Elegance). Group

texts.fr:
The members of the Faïda group are on average 38 years old with four children. They live in traditional families with their husbands, children and co-wives in the Sogomougou area of Koutiala (the Sikasso region of the Republic of Mali). Linked by being neighbors, relatives and colleagues, this group generally trades in fruits, vegetables, tubers and clothing. Because they have confidence in each other, they decided to enter the Soro Yiriwaso micro-credit program, through which they just received their first group loan (solidarity loan).

They generally get their supplies from neighboring villages or from sellers of fruits, vegetables and tubers on market days. Their clothing supply comes from Bamako or Burkina Faso (a neighboring country). They usually buy fruit by the sack which they stock and resell at retail prices at the Koutiala market.

With this loan, the Faïda group estimates that each member will make 40,000 CFA francs in profit, which will be used to pay the interest on the loan, help with increasing family expenses, and contribute to their savings. In the future, the Faïda group plans to enter the wholesale fruit and vegetable business and gain a national reputation.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva volunteer.

Les membres du groupe faïda, ont une moyenne d’age de 38 ans 4 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et coépouses dans le quartier Sogomougou de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso République du Mali). Liées par des liens de voisinages de parentés et professionnels, elles exercent généralement le commerce de fruits, légumes, de tubercules et d’ habits. Se faisant mutuellement confiance les membres du groupe ont décidé ensemble d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso auprès de laquelle institution de microfinance elles viennent de bénéficier de leur premier pret de groupe (prêt solidaire).

Elles s’approvisionnent généralement. dans les villages voisins ou les jours de foire auprès des paysans spécialisés dans la production de fruits, légumes et tubercules. Par contre les habits sont achétés à Bamako ou au Burkina Fasso (Pays voisin du Mali). Elles achètent généralement les fruits par sac qui sont stockés et revendus en détail au marché de Koutiala.

Les femmes du groupe faïda comptent chacune réaliser, avec ce prêt; 40 000 CFA. de bénéfice qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux charges de famille de plus en plus importantes et renforcer leurs fonds propres. Dans l’avenir, le groupe faïda compte devenir des grossistes en fruits et légumes avec une réputation nationale.

loans.use: To buy pagnes (traditional wraparound clothing item) and sacks of tubers (root vegetables)

loans.name: Badenya (Kinship) Group

texts.fr:
The women of the Badenya group are on average 30 years old, have 5 children, and live in traditional families in the Sogomougou district in the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region of the Republic of Mali). Tied by their professional relationships and long-standing friendships, these women are very shrewd entrepreneurs. They sell ready-to-wear clothing, beauty products, soaps, and raw materials for food service. In order to satisfy a growing clientele, they decided to use Soro Yiriwaso’s loan program and just obtained their first group loan. They stock up in Bamako and Koutiala from wholesalers and sell them retail at the market in Koutiala or in the city. This loan will be used to buy boxes of beauty products, ready-to-wear clothing, and soaps. Each member of the group plans to earn 50,000 CFA francs, which will be used to pay interest on the loan, help their husbands with family expenses, and invest in their business. In the future, the Badenya group plans to open a ready-to-wear clothing shop and diversify their business by making traditional soap.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Les femmes du groupe Badenya ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans avec 5 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles au quartier Sogomougou de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso République du Mali). Liées par des relations professionnelles et d’amitié de longue date, ces femmes sont des entrepreneurs très avisées. Elles exercent le commrece d’habits “prêt à porter”,des produits de beauté, des savons et le lot de matières premières nécessaires pour la restauration.. Pour satisfaire une clientèle de plus en plus importante, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et viennent d’obtenir leur premier pret de groupe. Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako et à Koutiala auprès de grossistes pour les revendre en détail au marché de Koutiala ou en ville de façon ambulante. Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter ensemble des cartons de produits de beauté, des habits “prêts a porter”, des savons. Chaque membre du groupe compte réaliser 50 000 CFA. de bénéfice qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt, aider leurs époux dans les dépenses familliales et investir le reste dans les activités. Dans l’avenir, le Groupe badenya compte ouvrir une boutique d’habillements de “prêt a porter” et diversifier leurs activités en menant l’activité de fabrication du savon traditionnel.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, beauty products, and raw materials for food service

loans.name: Deborah Nsereko's Group

texts.en:
Deborah N., the leader of a group of five women, is 47 and married with three children who are 27, 25 and 22 years old. All of her children are in school. Deborah lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season. She has been selling old clothes for the past 21 years, and the market for her business is fair. She sells her clothes at Owino market, the largest market in Kampala.

Deborah plans on using this loan to increase her stock of used clothing. Since she began working with MCDT, she has repaid 24 loans. With these loans, her business has prospered and her profits have enabled her to educate her children. Deborah hopes to one day be able to buy a plot of land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock of old clothes.

loans.name: Nulu Katende's Group

texts.en:
Nulu K., the leader of a group of four women, is 45 years old and married with ten children, all of whom have graduated from school. Nulu lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season. She sells water and charcoal to her customers, and the biggest difficulty she faces in running her business is the heavy flooding during the rainy season.

Nulu plans on using this loan to boost her business so that she can continue to improve her standard of living. Since she began working with MCDT, she has repaid several loans. These loans have enabled Nulu’s business to prosper, and the resulting profits have allowed her to educate her children. Nulu hopes to be able to continue running her business in order to accumulate additional profits.

loans.use: To increase her stock and boost her business.

loans.name: Sabali (Wisdom). Group

texts.fr:
The Sabali group is made up of women who are on average 44 years old, have 5 children, and live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, in-laws, brothers, sisters, and children. They all live in the Dar-salam II district in the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region in the Republic of Mali). They have a diverse business, selling fruits and vegetables, grains, clothing, and other food products. Very experienced and enterprising, these Sabali group women sought the help of Soro Yiriwaso’s loan program with plans to increase the size of their business. They have worked with Soro Yiriwaso for 4 years and have benefited from nine group loans, all of which have been properly repaid. They stock up in the villages outside of Koutiala with small fruit and vegetable farmers. They buy the clothes they sell in Bamako or in Burkina Fasso (a neighboring country of Mali). The current loan will be used to buy large quantities of fruits, vegetables, food products, and clothing. These things will be sold retail at the market in Koutiala. They plan to earn 100,000 CFA francs each, which will be used to pay interest on the loan and to help their husbands keep up with the family’s ongoing expenses. In the future, the members of the Sabali group plan to stock peanuts.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Le groupe Sabali est composé de femmes ayant en moyenne 44 ans , 5 enfants et vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, les coépouses, les beaux parents, les frères et soeurs et les enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Dar-salam II de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso République du Mali) Elles exercent une activité commerciale diversifiée allant de la vente des fruits et légumes à celle des céréales, des habits et des produits alimentairtes. Très expérimentées et entreprenantes dans les activités économiques, ces femmes du groupe Sabali ont sollicité la collaboration du programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités. Cette collaboration date maintenant de 4 ans et elles ont bénéficié de neuf prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) tous remboursés correctement. Elles s’approvisionnent dans les villages aux alentours de Koutiala auprès de paysans spécialisés dans la production de fruits et légumes. Pour les habits les achats se font à Bamako ou au Burkina Fasso (Pays voisin du Mali). Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des quantités importantes de fruits, de légumes, de produits alimentaires mais aussi des habits. Ces articles seront revendus en détail au marché de Koutiala. Elles comptent réaliser chacune 100 000 FCFA de bénéfice qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt et aider leurs maris à faire face aux charges courantes de la famille.Dans l’avenir, les membres du groupe sabali comptent faire du stockage d’arachide.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, peanuts, and misc.

loans.name: Sarah Sserunjoji's Group

texts.en:
Sarah S., 28 years old and the married mother of four school-aged children, is the leader of a group of five women. Sarah lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season. She has been running her small retail shop for the last eight years. The market for Sarah's business is moderate, her greatest challenge being the fact that many customers prefer cheap commodities.

Sarah decided to begin working with MCDT so she could set up her retail shop. She plans on using this loan to expand her business. In the past she has paid back 19 loans and has used the money to increase her personal income and standard of living.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Aidha Namukasa's Group

texts.en:
Aidha N., 47 years old and single with six children, is the leader of a group of five women. Her eldest child is 28 and her youngest 15, and all are enrolled in school. Aidha lives in a suburban slum area outside of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Aidha has been selling used footware for the past six years, buying from shops in Kampala and reselling them at one of the largest markets in Kampala, Owino Market. Working six days a week selling to both men and women, her busiest days are Mondays and Saturdays. The market for Aidha’s used shoes is good and she plans to use this loan to increase her stock.

Aidha has been working with MCDT for five years and has repaid over 10 loans. She originally decided to work with MCDT because she wanted to be able to help her family. Since then, the revenues from her business have helped her provide her children with good nutrition and pay school fees to ensure all her children get an education. Aidha one day hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock of used shoes.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Micro Credit Development Trust SACCO (MCDT) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mariam D. is a 46-year-old mother of seven who lives with her husband, her co-wife, and their children in Sanoubougou II, a district in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). Having not gone to school for social reasons, she started a fabric-dying business with a famous dyer in Bamako (the capital of Mali). With 7 years of experience, she enjoys a good reputation in Sikasso and gets a lot of orders, especially for ceremonies and celebrations. In her search for complementary financial resources in order to satisfy her growing clientele, she looks for help from Soro Yiriwaso with whom she has been for 4 years. After 4 group loans with a local female association, Association SOUTOURA de SANOUBOUGOU II, she is now on her third individual loan, with all of her previous loans properly repaid. With this loan, she plans to buy 5 pieces of white bazins (very sought after fabrics in West Africa), 10 bags of soda lime, and 10 boxes of different-colored dyes. She gets her supplies from Bamako and dyes the fabrics in her workshop (at home). She then sells them for cash or credit to dyed-bazin retailers, dressmakers, and some women in her area. Mrs. Mariam Djiré hopes to make 200,000 CFA francs, which will be used for her family’s considerable expenses, to pay the interest on her loan, and to grow her dying business.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Mariam D. est une femme de 46 ans, mère de 7 enfants et vit avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou II, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali). N’ayant pas été à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle s’est initiée à une activité génératrice de revenus qui est la teinture de tissus auprès d’une des célèbres teinturières de Bamako (la capitale du Mali). Avec 7 ans d’expériences dans le metier, elle jouit d’une grande réputation dans la localité de Sikasso et reçoit ainsi beaucoup de commandes surtout lors des cérémonies et des fetes. Dans sa recherche de ressources financières complementaires pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante elle sollicite la collaboration de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après 4 prêts de groupe avec une association de femmes de son quartier “Association SOUTOURA de SANOUBOUGOU II. Elle est maintenant à son troisième prêt individuel et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 5 pièces de bazins blancs (tissus tyrès prisé en Afrique de l’ouest), 10 sachets de soude caustique, 10 boites de teintures de differentes couleurs. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako en matières premières (bazins blancs, soude caustique et teintures) Elle teint les tissus dans son atelier (à domicile). Ensuite elle les revend au comptant ou à crédits; généralement aux revendeuses des bazins teintés, aux couturiers et à certaines femmes de son quartier. Madame Mariam Djiré envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour les dépenses importantes de la famille, payer les intèrêts de son prêt et renforcer son activité de teinture.

loans.use: To purchase bazins, soda lime, and dyes

loans.name: Rose Nansubuga's Group

texts.en:
Rose N., a midwife and the leader of a group of four women, is 45 years old and married with seven children ranging in age from 18 to 30. The two youngest children are in school while the five oldest work. Rose lives in an urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

As the owner of her hospital facility, Rose has been offering her midwife services since 1994, working seven days a week. She sees approximately 10 women each week and has many repeat customers because, as she says, she treats each woman very well. With this loan Rose plans on buying medicine for her patients from pharmacies in Kampala.

Rose has repaid 12 loans since she began working with MCDT. With these loans she has been able to develop her business, buy a house, build houses that she rents out and pay school fees. Rose hopes to be able to continue running her business and one day see all of her children get jobs. .

loans.use: To purchase medicine.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Micro Credit Development Trust SACCO (MCDT) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Salif

texts.fr:
Mr. Salif Y. is 49 years old and lives with his two wives and seven children, in Sanoubougou I, a district in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). After several unsuccessful businesses, he specialized in selling sound system equipment and accessories (radios, cassettes, solar panels, parabolic antennae, etc.), which he has now been doing for 10 years. He gets his supplies from Bamako and sells his things for cash or retail wholesale in his shop located at the bus station. His clientele mainly consists of bus travelers and several young music-lovers in the city of Sikasso. In order to obtain complementary resources to be able to diversify his business, he decided to try Soro Yiriwaso’s loan program, which just granted him his first individual loan. With this loan, he plans to buy 15 radios of different brands, 2 solar panels, 3 boxes of batteries, and 200 audio cassettes. The expected profit is around 250,000 CFA francs, which will be used to pay interest on his loan and to reinvest in his business.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Salif Y. a 49 ans et vit avec ses deux femmes et ses 7 enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali). Après plusieurs activités économiques sans succès, il s’est spécialisé dans la vente de materiels de sonorisation et accessoires (radios, cassettes, panneaux solaires, antennes paraboliques etc...) depuis maintenant 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne géneralement à Bamako et vend ses articles au comptant en détail ou en demi gros à Sikasso dans sa boutique sise à la gare routière. Sa clientèle est essentiellement composée de voyageurs de routiers et plusières jeunes mélomanes de la ville de Sikasso. Pour obtenir des ressources complementaires afin de diversifier son activité, il decida d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso qui vient de lui octroyer son premier pret indivuduel. Avec ce pret Il compte acheter 15 radios de marques différentes, 2 panneaux solaires, 3 cartons de batéries blindées et 200 cassettes audio. Le bénéfice envisagé est de l’ordre de 250 000 FCFA qui servira à payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: To purchase radios, solar panels, batteries, and cassettes

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Aminata B. is a 50-year-old woman, she's married and the mother of 2 children. With this first load, she intends to bolster her food-serving business, which will enable her to make a better living and to help provide for her children's school expenses. It will also help her improve their living conditions and health status. She intends to repay the loan after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Aminata B. est une femme de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle envisage avec ce premier prêt, s’activer dans le domaine de la restauration. Elle pourra ainsi bien gagner sa vie et aider à l’amélioration des conditions de santé et de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To bolster her food-serving business

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr:
Fanta S. is a 43-year-old woman, she's married and the mother of 3 children. With this first loan, she wishes to bolster her investment capacity in the food-serving business, the field in which she works. She intends to repay the loan after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Fanta S. est une jeune femme de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle souhaite avec ce premier prêt renforcer sa capacité d’investissement dans la restauration, domaine dans lequel elle s’active. Elle va rembourser ce prêt en une seule échéance au bout de six mois.

loans.use: To bolster her investment capacity in her food-serving business

loans.name: Altine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Altiné K. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and her 6 children in a monogamous household in the Hérémakono Nord district in the city of Bougouni (Sikasso region in the Republic of Mali). Since she was young, she has tried many businesses without success but ended up specializing in making wheat donuts, which she has learned from her grandmother over the last 20 years. She enjoys an unparalleled reputation in her area, one of the most populated in the capital of Banimonotié Bougouni. In her search for complementary financial resources, she decided to try the loan program from microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After having obtained 3 group loans with a local association, she moved on to individual loans; she is on her 3rd loan. Each of her loans were repaid without difficulty. She would like this loan to buy 2 bags of wheat flour, 20 liters of cooking oil, and 2 loads of firewood. She gets her supplies from wholesalers at the big market in Bougouni and cooks in front of her door, located in the Heremakono district. The donuts she makes are sold at a set price in front of her home, and the clientele consists of every social class in the city. With the help of the loan, she plans to be able to earn 50,000 CFA francs per month, which will be used to pay interest on her loan, improve her business, and contribute to her family’s expenditures.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Altiné K. est agée de 40 ans et vit avec son mari et ses 6 enfants dans une famille monogame dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (Région de Sikasso République du Mali). Dès son jeune age elle tenta plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus sans succès mais fini par se spécialiser dans la fabrication des baignés de farine de blé apprise auprés de sa grand mère depuis 20 ans.Elle jouit d’une réputation sans pareille dnas son quartier un des plus peuplés dela capitale du Banimonotié Bougouni. Dans sa recherche de ressources financières complémentaires elle décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso Après avoir bouclé 3 prets de groupe(pret solidaire) avec une association de son quartier, elle est passée au prêt individuel ou elle est à son 3e.Tous les précédents ont été remboursées sans difficulté Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elle veut ce prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de farine de blé, 20 litres d’huile de cuisine et 2 chargements de bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières au grand marché de Bougouni auprès des grossiste et fait sa cuisine devant sa porte sise au quartier Heremakono Les baignés ainsi fabriqués sont vendus de facon fixe devant la dite concession conjugale et la clientèle est constituée de toutes les catégories sociales de la cité. Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA. qui sera utilisé à payer les intérêts du prêt, améliorer son entreprise et contribuer aux dépenses de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Boubou

texts.fr:
Mr. Boubou D. is 43 years old and lives with his 3 children and his wife in Torakabougou, a district in the city of Bougouni in the Bougouni Prefecture (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali). After his military retirement, Boubou D. is returning to one of his money-making businesses, poultry-farming, which he learned from a friend for over two years. With the intention of growing his business, he decided to join microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso who has just granted him his first loan. He plans to buy 200 chicks, 8 feeding troughs, 8 drinking troughs, 2 boxes of vaccines, 20 bags of vitamins, and 1400 kilograms of feed. He gets his supplies from Bamako, the capital of the Republic of Mali. He sells his products (eggs, hens) to a clientele consisting of professional sellers in poultry markets, restaurateurs, food shops, etc. Holiday periods (traditional and religious), social events (weddings, baptisms), and weekends are conducive to sales. With this loan, he plans to be able to earn 80,000 CFA francs per month, which he will use to invest in his business, pay interest on the loan, and provide for his family.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Boubou D. est agé de 43 ans et vit avec ses 3 enfants et sa femme à Torakabougou un des quartiers de la ville Bougouni Préfecture de Bougouni ( Région de Sikasso République du Mali). Après sa rétraite militaire, Boubou D. revient à une de ses activités génératrices de revenus à savoir l’aviculture qu’il appris auprès d’un ami 2 ans durant. Dans le soucis d’aggrandir son entreprise,il décida de rejoindre l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso qui vient de lui octroyer son premier pret. Il compte acheter 200 poussins, 8 mangeoires, 8 abrévoires, 2 cartons de vaccins 20 sachets de vitamines, 1400 kilogrammes pour la nourriture. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako capitale de la République du Mali. Il vend ses produits (oeufs,pondeuses recylées) à une clientèle composée de vendeurs professionnelles du marché à volaille de restaurateurs les boutiques les alimentations etc. Les périodes de fêtes (traditionnelles et réligieuses) les évenements sociaux (mariages baptèmes) et les week end sont favorables aux ventes. Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000FCFA.qu’il utilisera pour investir dans son entreprise , payer les interêts du prêt et assurer les dépense de la famille.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, troughs, vitamins, and vaccines

loans.name: Djerry

texts.fr:
Mr. Djerry Sidibé is 37 years old and lives with his four children and wife in the district of Torakabougou in the Bougouni region in Sikasso in the Republic of Mali. He worked at a phone booth kiosk for two years before he decided to become self-employed. He has mastered this business.

In order to obtain the necessary complimentary resources for the development of his business, he approached Soro Yiriwaso. This is his first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. With this loan, he is hoping to buy a significant amount of prepaid calling cards (Orange and Malitel) and a Sotelma-Malitel telephone (a national telephone company in Mali).

He generally buys his stock in Bamako, the capital of the Republic of Mali and sells these cards retail in his own telephone booth kiosk.

With this loan, Djerry Sidibé hopes to earn a monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA. He hopes to pay for the interest of the loan and support the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Djerry Sidibé a 37 ans et vit avec ses 4 enfants son épouse dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.Région de Sikasso République du Mali. Il fut 2 ans durant employé d’une cabine téléphonique avant de décider de s’installer à son propre compte. Il a une grande maîtrise de cette activité. Pour obtenir des ressources complémentaires indispensables à l’épanouissement de son affaire il approche Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle institution il est à sa premiere expérience. Il compte acheter avec ce pret une importante quantité de cartes de recharges prépayées(Orange et Malitel et un appareil téléphonique de la Sotelma- Malitel(une compagnie de téléphonie nationale du Mali). Il s’approvisionne très généralement à partir de Bamako capitale de la République du Mali et vend ses cartes essenteillement en détail au niveau de sa cabine téléphonique. Avec ce prêt, Djerry Sidibé compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000FCFA. avec lequel il va payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase prepaid calling cards (Orange and Malitel) and a telephone

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Mrs Maimouna M., age 44, is a widow and the mother of 3 children. She's seeking a loan to bolster her vegetables wholesale business. She intends to repay the loan after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Maimouna M., 44 ans est veuve et mère de 03 enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt pour s’activer dans la vente en gros et demi gros de légume. Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To bolster her vegetables wholesale business

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Half of the members of the group Benkadi are married and half are single. The average age of the group is 27. The group has on average three children and lives in monogamous families in the district of Torakabougou in Bougouni (the region of Sikasso in the Republic of Mali).

They sell various items (wood carbon, grains, locally manufactured soap, tea, milk and sugar) as their main businesses.

The members of the group Benkadi mainly know each other because of friendship and blood relations. Three years ago, in their search for financial capital to expand the amount of their investments, they decided together to work with Soro Yiriwaso. The group is on its fifth loan and the previous loans have been paid back without difficulties.

With this loan, they hope (as a whole) to purchase: 20 sacks of carbon, 200 kilograms of grains, 2 cartons of soap, 1 sack of powdered sugar, nearby the wholesalers in the market of Bougouni. They make their sales at the market in Torakabougou under the sheds, on top of the slacks and from home, where the neighbors in the district obtain fresh supplies day and night.

The members of Benkadi would like to become wholesalers at the level of Torakabougou, where the population is growing.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont à moitié marié et moitié célibataire ayant une moyenne d’age 27 ans et 3 enfants qui vivent dans des familles monogames au quartier de Torakabougou de Bougouni( Régoin de Sikasso République du Mali. ) Elles ont comme activités principales le commerce d’articles divers(charbon de bois,céréales,savon de fabrication locale,thé lait sucre). Les membres du gruope Benkadi sont liés par des liens d’amitié et surtout de parenté. Dans leurs recherches de ressources financières en vue d’aggrandir la taille de leurs investissements elles ont décidé ensemble de nouer un parténariat avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans.Le groupe est à son cinquième pret et les précédents ont été remboursés sans difficultés. Elles comptent (constituée des stocks) en achetant avec ce pret: 20 sacs de charbon, 200 kg céréales,2 cartons de savon, 1 sac de sucre en poudre auprès des grossistes du grand marché de Bougouni. Elles effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Torakabougou sous des hangars sur des étales et à domicile ou les voisins du quartier s’y ravitaillent nuit et jour. Les membres de Benkadi veulent dvenir des grossistes au niveau de Torakabougou ou la population est en nette croissance.

loans.use: Purchase wood carbon and other various consumption products

loans.name: Ibrahima Drissa

texts.fr:
Mr. Ibrahima Drissa T. is 25 years old and single. He lives with his father in Bougouni in the Dialanicoro district. After having managed several businesses without success, he decided to try the tailoring profession. After an apprenticeship with a tailor (his uncle) that lasted about five years, Mr. T. became self-employed. With six years of experience, he has total mastery of this business and has a good reputation.

In order to purchase an additional sewing machine, he has decided to ask for a loan with Soro Yiriwaso. This extra equipment will allow him to increase his capacity for work and further satisfy his clients. His clientele is primarily composed of women living in his same district. The period of holidays (Tabaski, Ramadan, etc.) and the beginning of the school year mark a time of good business for tailors. He hopes to earn a monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA. With this profit, Mr. T. hopes to improve the appearance of his workshop in order to have more clients, meet his own needs and contribute towards the family expenses.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Ibrahima Drissa T. est un jeune célibataire de 25 ans et vit chez son père à Bougouni dans le quartier Dialanicoro. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, il décida d’exercer le métier de tailleur. Après un apprentissage qui dura cinq ans auprès d’un maitre tailleur (‘son oncle), Monsieur T. s’installa à son compte. Avec une expérience de 6 ans, il a une maîtrise totale de cette activité et jouit d’une bonne réputation. Pour acquérir une machine à coudre supplémentaire, il décida de soumettre une demande de prêt à Soro Yiriwaso. Cet équipement supplémentaire lui permettra d’augmenter sa capacité de travail et donner plus de satisfaction à sa clientèle. Sa clientelle est composée principalement de femmes vivant dans le même quartier que lui. Les périodes de fêtes (Tabaski, Ramandan, etc...) et la rentrée scolaire constituent des périodes de grandes activités pour les tailleurs. Il compte réaliser un chiffre d’affaires de 50 000FCFA par mois. Avec ce bénéfice Monsieur T. compte améliorer la présentation de son atelier pour avoir plus de clients, subvenir à ses besoins et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Koman

texts.fr:
Mr. Koman Konaté is 52 years old and lives with his wife and six children in Bougouni in the district of Torakabougou in the prefecture Bougouni within the region of Sikasso in the Republic of Mali. Having received a diploma from the higher education institution of Bamako (where he received a Masters in Education Psychology), Mr. Konaté managed several business of an intellectual nature within many fields such as community health, formal and informal education, governance and decentralization, and natural resource management without success.

He decided to devote himself to agriculture, which he learned from his parents at the young age of three.

In order to access the capital for the equipment, he will join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program. It will be his first loan with this institution. With this loan, he will buy two loads of organic fertilizer, four drums of insecticide, four drums of herbicide, and five hoes. This is sold at Bougouni, nearby the blacksmiths and the phytosanitary stores.

He sells his production in Bougouni and a large part in Bamako, where the products sell for a higher value. His clients are, for the most part, sellers of condiments and vegetables and also some housewives.

Koman hopes to have a monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA, which will serve to pay interest on the loan, provide for the expenses of his family and prepare for the next season.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Koman Konaté a 52 ans et vit avec sa femme et ses 6 enfants à Bougouni dans le quartier Torakabougou Préfecture de Bougouni Région de Sikasso République de Mali.. Diplômé de l’école normale supérieure de Bamako (ou il obtient une maitrise en psycho pédagogie) Monsieur Konaté ména plusieurs activités d’ordre intellectuelle dans beaucoup de domaines tels la santé communautaire, l’éducation formelle et non formelle,la gouvernance et la décentralisation,la gestion des réssources naturelle...sans réussite. Il décida de se consacrer à l’agriclture qu’il a appris auprès de ses parents dès son bas age, il y’a de cela 3 ans. Afin d’obtenir un fond pour s’équiper il intégra le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est à sa premiere expérience. Avec ce pret il achétera 2 chargements de fumure organique, 4 bidons d’insecticides, 4 bidons d’herbicides et 5 houes. Il s’aprovisionne sur place à Bougouni auprès des forgerons et des boutiques de phyto sanitaire. La vente de sa production se fait à bougouni et une grande partie à Bamako ou les produits sont plus rénumerés. Ses clients sont essentiellement les vendeuses de condiments, légumes et quelques ménagères. Koman compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuelle de 70 000FCFA qui servira à payer les interêts du prêt, assurer les dépenses de la famille et préparer la saison prochaine.

loans.use: Purchase organic fertilizer, insecticide, and hoes

loans.name: Kossi Jean

texts.fr:
Mr. Kossi Jean S. was born on August 16, 1972 in the town of Tohoun, located at the center of the prefect (district) of Mono. He is married and the father of four (4) children. In 2003 he opened a store selling basic grocery items in the Agoe neighborhood of Lome. He has five (5) years experience in this business and always responds to the needs of his customers.

To increase his stock and insure that he has adequate supplies, Mr. S. is requesting his first business loan to purchase four (4) cans of oil, six (6) sacks of rice, eight (8) cartons of milk and fifteen (15) cartons of spaghetti.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur S. Kossi Jean est né la 16 août 1972 à Tohoun dans la préfecture de moyen Mono. Il est marié et père de quatre (5) enfants. En 2003, il a ouvert un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Avec cinq années d’expérience dans ce commerce, il répond toujours aux besoins de ses clients. Pour augmenter son stock et éviter les ruptures de stock, monsieur S. Kossi Jean sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 4 bidons d’huile, 6 sacs de riz, 8 cartons de lait et 15 cartons de spaghetti.

loans.use: Purchase of basic grocery products

loans.name: Adzovi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adzovi K. was born on December 31st, 1975 in the Village of Neope, in Togo. She is married and the mother of three (3) children. With her parents assistance, she achieved her childhood passion of become a dress maker. She began her practice in 2001 and after marrying a tailor, developed the idea of starting a sewing materials business. The business started successfully as she and her husband were the first clients. She has become the source for sewing materials for her competitors, however, she has not been able to adequately serve them as she can not provide sufficient stock. To resolve this, she is requesting her first business loan to increase her stock by purchasing 20 rolls lace, 20 rolls of poplin fabric and 10 pieces of pagne (decorative cloth).

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Née le31décembre 1975 à Noèpé un village du TOGO, madame K. Adzovi est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Ses parents l’ont aidé à réaliser sa passion d’enfance, devenir couturière. Ainsi elle exerce son activité depuis 2001 et étant donné qu’elle s’est mariée à un tailleur, elle a eu la géniale idée de faire le commerce des articles de mercerie. Ceci a réussi car son mari et elle-même sont le premier client de cette activité. Elle constitue en même temps le point d’approvisionnement de ses concurrents, cependant elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle à cause de la rupture de stock. Pour y remédier, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock par l’achat de 20 rouleaux de guipures 20 rouleaux de popeline et 10 pièces de pagne.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing materials and pagne (decorative cloth)

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Mr. Mamadou D. is 38 years old and lives with his son and wife in a monogamous family in the district of Heremakono in Bougouni in the Sikasso region in the Republic in Mali. Early on, he left his studies in order to start businesses that generated income, notably repairing motorcycles, a skill he learned at a young age from his uncle.

With 10 years of experience, he has a great reputation and a perfect mastery of this business in the city of Banimonotié Bougouni.

In order to obtain the financial resources needed to meet the ever growing demand of his clients, he has asked for a loan through Soro Yiriwaso. It is his first loan with this institution.

With this loan, he hopes to buy motorcycle parts in Bamako, the capital of the Republic of Mali, and resell them retail at his store for cash and sometimes credit.

Mr. Mamadou hopes to have a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA, which he will use to pay the interest on the loan, expand his business, and provide for the expenses of his family. `

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Mamadou D. est agé de 38 ans et vit avec son enfant et son épouse dans une famille nomogame au quartier Heremakono de Bougouni Région de Sikasso République du Mali Très tot il a interompu avec la fréquentation scolaire pour se entreprendre les activités génératrices de revenus notamment la réparation des motos qu’il a apprise dès son jeune âge auprès de son oncle. Avec une experience de 10 ans, il jouit d’une grande réputation et une parfaite maitrise de cette activité dans la cité du Banimonotié Bougouni. Pour obtenir une ressource financière afin de faire face aux demandes sans cesse croissantes de sa clientèle il sollicite la collaboration de Soro Yiriwaso.Il est à sa prémière expérience avec l’institution. Avec ce pret il compte achéter les pièces détachées pour moto à Bamako capitale de la République du Mali et les revendre sur place dans sa boutique en détail au comptant et quelques fois à crédit. Monsieur Mamadou compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA qu’il utilisera à payer les intérêts du prêt, aggrandir son entreprise et assurer les depenses de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle parts

loans.name: Koffi Albert

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi Albert Akapo was born on December 12th, 1981, in the village of Tsevie, not far from the city of Lome in Togo. His is single and takes care of one child. He is an electrician by training, however, lacking the resources to open his own workshop, he started purchasing used equipment which he repaired and resold to the market. Over time, he became specialized in the sale of electronic equipment. Since 2007, he has enjoyed combining the business of selling electronic equipment, along with a range of general grocery supplies. After careful study, he is requesting his first loan to purchase groceries supplies, including milk, tomatoes, soap etc.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Le 12 décembre 1981 naissait monsieur A. Koffi Albert dans un village non loin de la ville de Lomé au TOGO, Tsévié. Il est célibataire avec un enfant à la charge. C’est un électronicien de formation. Mais n’ayant pas les moyens d’ouvrir son atelier, il a commencé à acheter des appareils d’occasion qu’il répare et revend sur le marché. Petit à petit il a fini par se spécialiser dans la vente d’appareils électroniques. Ayant pris goût au commerce, il a associé à la vente d’appareils électroniques, la vente des divers d’alimentation générale ce qui lui réussi depuis 2007. Après une étude qu’il effectua récemment, monsieur A. demande ce premier prêt pour augmenter son fonds de roulement afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale tels que lait, tomate, savon...

loans.use: Purchase of basic grocery items

loans.name: Zegué

texts.fr:
Mr. Zegué Koné is 20 years old, single and does not have children. He lives with his father in the Torakabougou district in the Bougouni prefecture in the Sikasso region in the Republic of Mali. After having managed several businesses, notably caretaking, carpentry, etc. without success, he finally decided to attempt a new adventure, which was to become a miller. For two years, he learned this business from his older brother. To access the capital that would allow him to satisfy the demand, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso to purchase a shelling machine. This is his first loan.

He is going to purchase this machine in Bougouni and will work in his workshop in Torakabougou, a very populated district that has little competition.

His clientele is mainly composed of women from his district and the villages surrounding Bougouni.

The turnover in this business is very high and he hopes to earn a monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA. With this profit, he hopes to improve his business, pay the interest of the loan and help contribute towards the family expenses.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Zegué Koné est célibataire sans enfant agé de 20 ans qui vit chez son père dans le quartier Torakabougou Préfecture de Bougouni Région de Sikasso République de Mali. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités notammant le gardiennage, la menuiserie etc sans réussite,il décida finalement de tenter une nouvelle aventure qui fut la bonne à savoir l’activité de menier. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son grand frère et durant de deux ans. Pour obtenir un fonds, pouvant lui permettre de satisfaire les nombreuses demandes, il décida d’intégrer Soro Yiriwaso avecil est à sa premiere expérience ; pour acheter une machine appelée la décortiqueuse. Il va se procurer de cette machine à Bougouni et va travailler dans son atelier sis àTorakabougou un quartier très peuplé et ou il n’ya presque pas de concurrance pour lui. Sa clientèlle est composée essentiellement de femmes du quartier et des villages environnant de Bougouni. La rotation de cette activité est très élévée et il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice il compte améliorer son activité, payer les interêts du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase a shelling machine

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akoua N., was born in the city of Atakpame. She is 39 years old, married and the mother of two (2) children. She is a traveling retailer of pagne (decorative cloth) and shoes in the Agoe neighborhood of Lome. She started her business in 2005 and buys pagne from the central market then resells it to customers in her home neighborhood.

After the prompt repayment of her first business loan, she is requesting this second loan to purchase 30 pieces of pagne and 28 pairs of shoes. The revenue from this business allows her to contribute to the family expenses.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Originaire de la ville d’Atakpamé, madame N. Akoua est une femme âgée de 39 ans mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle est revendeuse ambulant de pagnes et de chaussures dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2005 et achète les pagnes au grand marché avant de revendre aux clients de son quartier de provenance. Après un prompt remboursement de son premier crédit qu’elle avait obtenu, elle sollicite ce second prêt pour acheter 30 pièces de pagne et 28 paires de chaussures. Ainsi avec le revenu de cette activité elle pourra contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase of pagne (decorative cloth) and shoes

loans.name: Koassi

texts.fr:
Mr. Hoassi A. B. was born on August 1st, 1970, in Aneho, in the district of Lacs, Togo where he started his profession. Since1997 he has installed and maintained grinding machines in various neighborhoods. The grinding machine is a necessity in Togo as it transforms corn into flour in order to prepare pate (corn dough) which comprises the basic food in Togo. It is a thriving business which allows him to earn revenue.

The first business loan that he made has been completely repaid. He is requesting this second loan to enable him to purchase spare parts such as ten (10) grinding wheels and three (3) drive motors. This will allow him to service and keep his customers by being able to repair their broken grinding machines.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Né le 1er août 1970 à Aného dans la préfecture des Lacs au Togo, monsieur A. B. Koassi est commerçant de profession. Depuis 1997 il a mis en place des moulins dans de différents quartiers qu’il gère. Le moulin est une machine très indispensable au Togo car il sert à transformer le maïs en farine afin de pouvoir préparer la pâte qui constitue une nourriture de base au Togo. C’est une activité très florissante qui lui permet de tirer des revenus.

Il a une fois obtenu du crédit et a bien remboursé. Ce second crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des pièces de rechanges telles que 10 paires de meules et 3 dynamos afin de pouvoir réparer les moulins qui sont tombés en panne afin de ne pas perdre ses clients.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for grinding wheels

loans.name: Issowe Bernard

texts.fr:
Mr. Issowe Benard S. was born on October 14, 1970 in Lome. He is married and the father of three children. He is a retailer of electronic goods. His store, ETS AUREOLE WINBA, is located in the Adidogome district of Lome. He makes his cellphones and television monitors widely available by providing his customers with an attractive repayment plan, allowing them to purchase items through weekly payments.

His first business loan has been completely repaid. He is requesting this second loan to enable him to purchase eight (8) high quality cellphones and six (6) television monitors

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur S. Issowe Bernard est né le 14 octobre 1970 à Lomé. Il est marié et père de trois enfants. Il est revendeur des appareils électroniques dans son magasin ETS AUREOLE WINBA dans le quartier Adidogomé à Lomé. Pour pouvoir permettre à tout le monde de disposer de portables et de télévision, il met à la disposition de ses clients un système de paiement relativement avantageux qui leur permet de d’acquérir des portables et de payer par semaine. Il a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé. Ce second crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 8 téléphones portables de haute qualité et 6 postes téléviseurs.

loans.use: Purchase of Televisions and Cellphones

loans.name: Talate

texts.fr:
Married and father of three children, Mr. Talate K. was born on July 15, 1977 in Korbongou, Togo. Coming from an area where pig-raising is popular, Mr. K. has been selling pigs since 2003. He buys them in his village from the farmers who raise them and then sells them in the city, in Lomé. As his business capital is limited, he buys just a few and then after he sells those, he returns to buy more. The frequent trips cause his overhead to be elevated. He would like to minimize his overhead by increasing his capital, so that he can then maximize his profits. For this reason, he is requesting this first loan to purchase 10 pigs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Marié et père de trois enfants, monsieur K. Talate est né le 15 juillet 1977 à Korbongou au TOGO. Originaire d’un milieu où l’élevage du porc est vulgarisé, monsieur K. s’est lancé depuis 2003 dans la vente de porcs. Il les achète dans son village auprès des éleveurs, et les revend en ville à Lomé. Ne disposant d’un capital important, il fait l’achat en petite quantité et après la vente il retourne encore s’en procurer. Ces déplacements fréquents font que ses charges sont gonflées. Il a alors pensé minimiser ses charges afin de maximiser ses bénéfices en augmentant son capital. C’est pourquoi il demande ce premier crédit pour acheter 10 porcs.

loans.use:
Purchase of pigs for re-sale

Achat de porcs

loans.name: Massan Kossiwa Ayépo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Massan Kossiwa Ayépo A. was born on August 31, 1969 in Atakpamé, a town located 140 km from Lomé. She is married and the mother of 3 children. Her primary business is selling costume jewelry and lengths of African print cloth (known as "pagnes") in the Agoè district in Lomé.

This first loan which she is requesting will allow her to add to her inventory by buying 15 pagnes and some jewelry.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Massan Kossiwa Ayépo est née le 31 août 1969 à Atakpamé, ville située à 140 Km de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de bijoux et de pagne dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé.

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’augmenter son stock par l’achat de 15 pièces de pagnes et des bijoux.

loans.use:
Purchase of costume jewelry and 15 lengths of African print cloth (pagnes)

Achat de bijoux et de 15 pièces de pagne

loans.name: Koudjoukalo

texts.fr: At 38, Mrs. Koudjoukalo K. E. A. is married and the mother of 3 children. Ever since she was a little girl, she belonged to choirs in her native village of Bassar, due to her remarkable voice. Today she lives in Lomé and has had the opportunity to excel in the domain of music, indeed, she is a star gospel singer. This year she put out an album and wants to have it reproduced so it can be marketed. She is requesting this first loan which will help her to get the reproduction done. Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer A 38 ans, madame K. E. A. koudjoukalo est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Dès son jeune age, elle a fait partie des chorales dans son village natal à Bassar, à cause de sa voix remarquable. Aujourd’hui elle vit à Lomé et elle a eu l’opportunité d’exceller dans le domaine de l’art musical, ce qui fait d’elle une vedette de la chanson gospel. Cette année elle a fait sortir un album et désir faire la multiplication des disques pour la commercialisation. Elle sollicite ce premier crédit qui l’aidera à faire cette multiplication de disque.

loans.use: reproduction of a music albumMultiplication de disque

loans.name: Maman Filicité

texts.fr:
Mrs. D., 24, married and mother of 3 children, was born in Davié and now lives on the outskirts of the city of Lomé. A seamstress by trade, she is the owner of a workshop called “COUTURE DAME FELICITE”. She is specialized in sewing women’s fashions so she has an essentially female clientele. Since 2005 she has added to her business the sale of costume jewelry for women. But Mrs. D. did not stop there. She also sells charcoal since she is married to a chauffeur who brings back charcoal that she warehouses and sells in small quantities.

This first loan will allow her to purchase 40 sacks of charcoal and some jewelry to expand her inventory.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 24 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants, madame D. née à Davié habite aujourd’hui à la périphérie de la ville de Lomé. Couturière de profession, elle est propriétaire de l’atelier « COUTURE DAME FELICITE ». Elle est spécialisée dans la couture en couture dame ce qui fait qu’elle a une clientèle essentiellement féminine. Depuis 2005 elle associa à son activité, la vente de bijoux pour femme. Madame D. ne s’est pas arrêtée là. Elle vend aussi du charbon car elle s’est mariée à un chauffeur qui lui ramène du charbon qu’elle stocke et vend en détaille.

Ce premier crédit lui servira d’acheter 40 sacs de charbon et des bijoux pour augmenter son stock.

loans.use:
Purchase and re-sale of charcoal and costume jewelry

Achat et vente de charbon de bois et de bijoux

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa S., age 34, is divorced and has two children to support. She's seeking a loan to bolster her business, that consists in selling fruits and hard-boiled eggs at the bus station of her village. She intends to repay the loan after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Awa S., 34 ans est divorcée avec 02 enfants en charge. Elle sollicite un prêt pour améliorer son petit commerce de vente de fruits et d’œufs durs à la gare routière du village. Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To bolster her small business selling fruits and hard-boiled eggs

loans.name: Kossiwavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kossiwavi T. was born in Pya-Lao in 1969. She is married and responsible for 3 children. Coming from a poor family, she did not have a chance to pursue her studies. On the other hand, her parents taught her how to make charcoal. Since she now lives in Lomé, she no longer makes it, but buys it in the village at a lower price to re-sell in Lomé. She began this business in the year 2000.

To transport her merchandise all the way to Lomé, Mrs. T. hires a truck which is becoming more and more expensive. She would therefore like to increase her inventory to lessen the transport charges and she is requesting this first loan to purchase 15 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame T. Kossiwavi est née à Pya-Lao en 1969. Elle est mariée et a 3 enfants à la charge. Issue d’une famille pauvre elle n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études. Par contre ses parents lui ont appris à faire du charbon de bois. Etant donné qu’elle est basée maintenant à Lomé elle n’en fabrique pas mais elle en achète dans son village à prix réduit et elle revend à Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis l’an 2000.

Pour transporter sa marchandise jusqu’à Lomé, madame T. fait appel au camion transporteur qui revient de plus en plus chère. Elle a donc pensé augmenter son stock pour amoindrir la charge et sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 15 sacs de charbons de bois.

loans.use:
Purchase of 15 sacks of charcoal

Achat de 15 sacs d charbons de bois

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba G. is a fishmonger. She is married, but her husband's income as a fisherman is not sufficient for Aba and her 3 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: El Ceibo Group

texts.es:
The group called “El Ceibo” has been working with Pro-Mujer for the last several years, finishing their tenth cycle. Currently it has 13 active associates who have shown to be a well organized group as it relates to their loan quotas. Within the group, the majority are married with an average of 6 children. They feel in need to look for additional sources of income since the necessities of their children are always increasing.

There are various businesses within the organization such as sales of food, dairy products, and cereals; the main activity, however, is the making of wool skirts (polleras) and other clothing for the local women (typical clothing used in the altiplano region). They sell their clothing at the 16th of July fair, which only allows them to sell twice a week, for this reason they need a loan to rent store space where they can offer their clothing all the days of the week. This will enable them to generate more income and continue to maintain the well being of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La asociación denominada “El Ceibo ” trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer hace ya varios años cumpliendo su décimo ciclo, a la fecha cuenta con 13 socias activas que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito. Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con un promedio de 6 hijos, se ven en la necesidad de buscar otras fuentes de ingresos ya que las necesidades de sus hijos aumentan cada día mas.

Existen diferentes negocios dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de comida, de lácteos, cereales, pero la actividad principal es la confección de polleras y ropa en general para cholitas (vestimenta típica en algunas regiones del altiplano ) luego venden sus productos en la feria de la 16 de julio, pero esta feria solo les permite vender dos veces por semana por lo que necesitan crédito para poder alquilar tiendas para ofrecer sus prendas todos los días, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos que les permita ofrecer bienestar a sus hijos.

loans.use: They need a loan to be able to rent spaces for their businesses.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Mrs Awa D. is married and has 4 children to support. With this loan, she wishes to bolster her business, that consists in selling vegetables and other food products. She intends to go the capital, Dakar, to purchase rice, corn, and vegetables, and to resell them in Ziguinchor, where she already has potential customers. She intends to repay the loan after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Awa D. est mariée et a 04 enfants à charge. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt renforcer son activité de ventes de légumes et autres produits alimentaires. Elle va ainsi s’approvisionner en riz, maïs et légumes à la capitale à Dakar et venir les écouler à Ziguinchor où elle dispose déjà d’une clientèle potentielle. elle compte rembourser ce prêt au bout de six mois en une seule échéance .

loans.use: To bolster her business selling vegetables and other food products

loans.name: Affi

texts.fr:
Agée de 53 ans, madame A. Affi est une femme veuve avec à sa charge 04 enfants. Elle est née à Lomé, y a grandi et y vit actuellement. C’est une brave femme qui se bat pour élever convenablement ses enfants en leur assurant une éducation adéquate. Elle y arrive grâce à son activité, qu’est vente de pagnes et de produits cosmétiques qu’elle a commencé depuis 1995.

Elle achète les marchandises au grand marché de Lomé en gros qu’elle revend dans son quartier. Elle attire sa clientèle par les prix concurrentiels de ses produits. Elle baisse sa marge bénéficiaire et vend en masse. Cette façon de procéder fait qu’elle augmente sans cesse son capital. C’est ainsi qu’elle demande ce deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Affi A., 53, is a widow who is raising 4 children. She was born in Lomé, grew up there, and lives there at present. She is a well-respected woman who is fighting to raise her children appropriately and assure an adequate education for them. She manages to do this thanks to the business of selling lengths of African print cloth (pagnes) and cosmetics which she has been pursuing since 1995.

Mrs. A. buys her merchandise wholesale in the big open-air market in Lomé and resells it in her neighborhood. The competitive prices of her products attract customers. She lowers her profit margin and sells larger quantities. This procedure has allowed her to continually grow her business capital. Thus she is presently requesting her second loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes" and cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 2 tanks of propane gas and 10 cylinders of oxygen.

payments.comment: la cuota real de pago es de $ 45.83 dólares

loans.name: Débora

texts.fr:
Born in 1968 in Tsévié, Mrs. G. is married and the mother of three children. She and her family live in a neighborhood which is quite far from the center of the city of Lomé. The inhabitants of her neighborhood have to go quite some distance to stock up on everyday necessities. Having analysed this need, Mrs. G. began selling such products. She buys them wholesale and retails them. This is a business that is working very well for her, except for the fact that she often runs short of this product or that. She is therefore requesting this first loan to add to her inventory.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1968 à Tsévié madame G. est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit avec sa famille dans un quartier qui est un peu éloigné du cœur de la ville de Lomé ce qui fait que les habitants de son quartier font une distance assez importante pour se ravitailler en produits de première nécessité. Ayant analysé ce besoin, elle s’est lancée dans la vente de ces produits. Elle les achète en gros et les revend en détail. C’est une activité qui marche très bien pour elle sauf qu’elle est souvent en rupture de stock. Elle sollicite alors ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock.

loans.use:
Purchase of grocery staples for re-sale

Achat des produits de première nécessité

loans.name: Terintambwe (Step Ahead) Group

texts.en: Terintambwe (Step Ahead) is a credit association. This is their first loan request. The group is composed of 5 members, 4 women and 1 man. They are: Mukarurangwa F., who is married with 2 children; Ntawuhirwankundi O., married with 6 children; Bayingana E., married with 8 children; Dusabimana J., married with 2 children; and Nyirakamana P., married with 7 children. Their businesses are clothes, shoes, and general commerce. They started their businesses in 2005. They started off well and have a strong commitment. They request a loan to increase their capital and improve their businesses.

loans.use: Increase their capital and improve their businesses

loans.name: Sol Radiante Group

texts.es:
In the city of El Alto the Panamericana center is found, to which the association named “Sol Radiante” composed of 17 members belongs. It is a very happy group that together with their credit assistant works with Pro-Mujer with a lot of responsibility and enthusiasm. The majority of the group members are married and with large families. Currently they live in rented rooms which have become small for them with the passage of time and the growth of their children. They have the dream to be able to buy their own homes to be able to offer greater comfort to their children, which is why they work from the early morning making lunches and dinners which they sell in the markets of the city of El Alto. Now they have be able to get contracts in some construction sites, which is why they need the loan to be able to purchase more ingredients and to hire kitchen helpers. This will allow them to double their production and get greater earnings to be able to save for the purchase of a house in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

En la ciudad de El alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal de Panamericana, a este pertenece la asociación “Sol Radiante ” integrado por 17 miembros. Un grupo muy alegre que junto a su asistente de créditos, trabajan con Pro-Mujer con mucha responsabilidad y entusismo. La mayoría en el grupo son casados y con familias numerosas, Actualmente viven en alquiler en cuartos que con el paso del tiempo y el crecer de sus hijos les han quedado pequeños, tiene el sueño de poder comprar una casa propia para ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus hijos, por lo que trabajan desde muy temprano en la elaboración de almuerzos y cenas , que los venden en mercados de la ciudad de El Alto , ahora lograron conseguir contratos en algunas construcciones de edificios, por lo que necesitan crédito para la compra de mayores insumos y para contratar ayudantes de cocina, esto les permitirá duplicar la producción y conseguir mayores ganancias para poder ahorrar para la compra de su casa en un futuro .

loans.use: They need capital to purchase materials and hire assistants.

loans.name: Mawutoe

texts.fr:
Mr. Mawutoè A., 32, is married and the father of 2 children. He was born in Akoumapé in the Vo Prefecture and now lives in Lomé. He is a computer systems specialist and his shop, "Universal.com", which is at the same time a retail outlet has been open since 2003. He offers computer systems maintenance. He also buys used computers at low prices and repairs them to re-sell them at a profit. He also sells laptops and computer accessories.

Mr. A. is requesting this first loan so that he can fill an order for 2 computers and accessories.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

A 32 ans monsieur A. Kokou Mawutoè est marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est né à Akoumapé dans la préfecture de VO et vit aujourd’hui à Lomé. Il est maintenancier et son atelier,’’Universal.com’’, qui lui sert en même temps de boutique est fonctionnel depuis 2003. Il fourni des services de maintenance informatique. Il fait aussi l’achat des ordinateurs d’occasion à des prix moins élevés, qu’il répare et revend à des prix plus élevés. Il y associe aussi la vente de portables et accessoires pour ordinateur.

Monsieur A. sollicite ce premier crédit pour répondre à une commande de 02 ordinateurs et des accessoires.

loans.use:
Purchase of computers and accessories

Achat d'ordinateurs et accessoires

loans.name: Conzuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo is a happy mother and grandmother who throughout these years, along with her husband, has been making a living in the buying and selling of fruit. This activity has helped her to raise and educate her 6 children, only two of whom are still minors and are being taken care of by their parents. Every time that they get the fruit from the farmers, they sort it and place it in cases, which they then take to the city for sale. They are presenting the loan request to be able to buy a larger quantity of products and thus increase their income.
