Conzuelo is taking on the responsibility for the timely payment of the installments. She is grateful with all her heart to the persons that support her request.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Conzuelo es una alegre madre y abuela que a lo largo de todos estos años se ha dedicado a la compra y venta de frutas, al lado de su esposo, actividad que le ayudó en la educación y crianza de sus 6 hijos, hoy sólo 2 de ellos aún son menores y están bajo en cuidado de sus padres.Cada vez que adquieren la fruta de manos de los agricultores, la seleccionan y la colocan ordenadamente en cajones, lo que luego llevan a la ciudad para la venta.Ellos presentan su pedido de préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mayor cantidad, para así, incrementar sus ingresos. Conzuelo se hace responsable ante ustedes por el pago puntual de las cuotas. Manteniendo un corazón agradecido hacia las personas que atiendan a su pedido.

loans.use: Infusion of capital for their business of selling fruit.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia is a person that tries to make her work the best so that she can have the purchasing power that will help her continue to grow as a farmer. In the same manner, she wishes for her family to have the opportunity to improve their quality of living and above all develop personally and integrally, and to this end she works her farm fields. She is currently looking to increase her production and needs fertilizers that will help her obtain quality products and increase the yield. This is the reason for her request for a USD $375 loan. She hopes that you will be able to help her attain her objective of continuing to work as she has been, as a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Felicia es una mujer que trata de hacer de su trabajo uno de los mejores, para así tener la capacidad adquisitiva que le ayude a seguir creciendo como agricultora. De la misma manera, busca que su familia tenga las posibilidades para mejorar su calidad de vida y sobre todo desarrollarse personal e íntegramente, por ello trabaja arduamente en sus terrenos de cultivos.Ahora desea incrementar su producción, requiere abono y fertilizantes que le ayuden a obtener productos de calidad y generen rentabilidad. Por ello, solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles, y espera que usted pueda ayudarla a conseguir sus objetivos para seguir trabajando, como hasta ahora, como agricultora.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for her farm land.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro is a hard-working man. Over the years he has been known to be involved in various activities along with his work as a school administrator. Now, he has divided his time between administration and transporting passengers, to which he dedicates his afternoons and evenings. He bought his motorcar a year ago, and it helps him with his household expenses. In difficult times, like when his wife was suffering from kidney stones, he was able to cover the expenses of her treatment and medicine. Thankfully he could count on his grown, independent children, for support in helping with his wife’s health. In order to increase his income, he is asking for a loan for parts for his motorcar, which would improve its functionality in order to continue his daily work.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Alejandro es una hombre emprendedor, a través de los años a sabido desempeñarse en diversas actividades a la par con su trabajo de administrador en una escuela.Ahora, ha dividido su tiempo entre la administración y en el trasporte de pasajeros, al que se dedica por las tardes y noches, debido a que hace un año pudo comprar su motocarro, lo que le ayuda en la economía de su hogar.En momentos difíciles, como durante la enfermedad de su esposa que sufre de cálculos renales, pudo cubrir los gastos de medicinas y tratamientos.Gracias a que sus hijos son ya independientes, puede tener en ellos un apoyo para respecto a la salud de su pareja. Para incrementar sus ingresos, solicita un préstamo para los repuestos de su motocarro, mejorar su funcionamiento para continuar con su labor diaria.

loans.use: Purchase parts and maintain his motorcar.

loans.name: María Fermina

texts.es:
María Fermina is married and 62 years old; she studied until the third grade and has four children who no longer depend on her. She lives in the Victor Larco district in the Trujillo province of La Libertad.

Currently, she raises animales such as cows, pigs, hens, guinea pigs, etc. and later sells the bigger, fatter animals while keeping the smaller ones. She has customers who will buy the animals at her house, but she offers them at nearby markets; she also sells the milk that the cows produce.

María is a member of "The Palm Trees" Communal Bank where she received her first loan, which she used to buy small pigs to fatten and sell. With this loan of $550 that she will repay in six months, she will buy grass to feed her cows so that she can increase their milk production and generate more income to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora María Fermina está casada, tiene 62 años, estudió solo hasta tercer grado de primaria, tiene 04 hijos que ya no dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. Actualmente, se dedica a la crianza de animales, tales como: vacas, cerdos, gallinas, pavos, etc. Para luego vender los que están grandes y gordos y quedarse con los pequeños. Tiene clientes que van a comprar los animales en su casa pero además los ofrece en mercados cercanos; también envía a vender la leche que producen las vacas. La señora María es socia del Banco Comunal “LAS PALMERAS”, en el recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con los cuales compró cerdos pequeños para engordarlos y venderlos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que cancelará en 06 meses; comprará pasto para alimentar bien a sus vacas porque quiere incrementar la producción de leche lo cual le debe generar mayor ingreso con lo que piensa mejorar su casa.

loans.use: To purchase grass to feed her livestock.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es:
Fiedencio is a very efficient farmer. With this activity he remains active and he loves working in the field, dedicating himself to his farm is very important to him and his family. Different from other people, Fidencio has described himself as being involved developing his farm with great enthusiasm and strength. Year after year he grows potatoes and peas, products that give him the possibility of feeding and educating his family. He has great expectations for progress as a farmer, and therefore, has expanded his farmland, but he is lacking natural and chemical fertilizers as well as pest control treatments. Fiedencio, very worried, is asking for a loan, money which will help him obtain the necessary items needed for his next crop production.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Fidencio es un agricultor muy eficiente, con esta actividad se mantiene activo y le apasiona el trabajo en el campo, dedicarse a su chacra es muy importante para él y para su familia.A diferencia de otras personas, Fidencio se ha caracterizado por desenvolverse con entusiasmo y fortaleza en su chacra, año tras año ha venido cultivando papas y alverjas, productos que le dan la posibilidad de alimentar y educar a su familia.Tiene grandes expectativas de progreso como agricultor, por ello, ha ampliado sus terrenos de cultivo, pero la falta abonos, fertilizantes y tratamientos contra las plagas. Fidencio, muy preocupado se atreve por este medio a solicitar un préstamo, dinero que le ayudará a conseguir lo necesario para su próxima producción.

loans.use: Acquire necessary farming items: natural and chemical fertilizers and pest control treatments.

loans.name: Agowè

texts.fr:
Mrs. Agowè Madjakpre was born on July 6, 1961 in Tchamba. She is divorced and raising 3 children. She is uneducated and did not learn a trade. She has to support her family despite all this. For this reasons she undertook her little business making and selling juice and wholesaling mineral water. For the juice, she has ambulant salespeople who do the selling. The water is sold to retailers who come to get it from her.

A first loan allowed her to purchase a freezer to cool the juice. She is requesting this second loan so that she can expand her stock of raw materials for making the juice and add to her coolers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame MADJAKPRE Agowè est née le 06 juillet 1961 à Tchamba. Elle est divorcée avec 03 enfants à la charge. Elle n’est pas instruite et n’a appris aucun métier. Elle doit malgré tout subvenir au besoin de sa famille. Elle a donc monter sa petite affaire qui consiste a la fabrication et vente jus et la vente en gros d’eau minérale. Pour le jus, elle dispose de vendeuses ambulantes qui le commercialisent. L’eau est vendue aux détaillants qui viennent s’en procurer.

Un premier crédit lui a servi d’acheter un congélateur pour le rafraîchissement des jus. Ce deuxième crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’augmenter ces matières premières pour la fabrication du jus et le nombre de ces glacières.

loans.use:
Purchase of mineral water and coolers

Achat d'eau minérale et de glacière

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David is a young father with responsibility of taking care of his wife and two children, who are the driving force for his work. Everyday, early in the morning, David leaves to take care of his farmland, which he irrigates and fertilizes so his crops produce, and then when the harvest he can have quality products in order to get better income. His wife appears in the photo above, showing part of his production, in this case, of potato. One of this couple’s dreams is to use part of their earnings to buy the house where they live, which as of the moment they rent, but they still can’t complete this dream as they lack financial resources to do so. They are asking for the current loan to increase their crop production by buying seed, fertilizer and other supplies necessary for farming their land.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

David a temprana edad formó su familia, tiene la responsabilidad de cuidar de su esposa y dos hijos, quienes son el motor para su trabajo. Por ello, cada día, de madrugada, David sale rumbo a sus terrenos de cultivo, los cuales riega y abona para su adecuada producción, y así en la cosecha puede tener productos de calidad para obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Quien aparece en la foto es su esposa, mostrando parte de su producción, en este caso, papa. Uno de los sueños de esta pareja es que parte de sus ganancias puedan usarla en al compra de la casa donde viven, que actualmente alquilan, pero aún ese sueño no se puede hacer realidad por falta de recursos. Ellos solicitan el presente préstamo para incrementar su producción, con la compra de semilla, abonos y demás insumos necesarios para sus tierras.

loans.use: Buy seed, fertilizer and other supplies necessary for farming

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa María is 50 years old and married. She completed her secretarial studies and she has two children who no longer depend on her; she lives only with her husband and her mother. Her home is located in the Victor Larco district of the Trujillo province in La Libertad.

She worked for many years as a bank employee, but due to staff cuts she had to leave. At that time, her best option was to start a business. With some capital, she began selling a few products from her home. Currently, she has a well-stocked grocery store which she has successfully built thanks to her effort and dedication for the past 15 years.

She is a member of "The Palm Trees" Communal Bank, where she received her first loan to buy soft drinks to stock her store. With this current loan of $425, which she will repay in six months, she will buy beer to increase her sales. Rosa says that thanks to her business and the loans she has received from her bank she has been able to become more independent and to contribute to her children's education. She dreams of her small business growing each day and eventually turning it into a mini-market.

Translated by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa María está casada, tiene 50 años, estudió secretariado, tiene 02 hijos que ya no dependen D. ella, vive solo con su esposo y su madre. Su casa se ubica en el distrito D. Víctor Larco Provincia D. Trujillo, La Libertad. Trabajó varios años como empleada en un banco pero por reducción D. personal tuvo que salir y en ese momento la mejor opción fue poner un negocio así que empezó con un capital D. S/. 50.00 vendiendo pocos productos en su casa, actualmente, tiene una bodega muy surtida la cual ha logrado construir gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación durante 15 años. Es socia del banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS” en este banco comunal recibió su primer préstamo D. S/.300.00, con este dinero compró gaseosa para surtir más su bodega. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00, que cancelará en un plazo D. 06 meses; comprará cerveza, para incrementar D. esa forma sus ventas. La señora rosa nos cuenta que gracias a su negocio y a los préstamos que recibió en su banco comunal pudo ser una mujer más independiente y pudo colaborar con la educación D. sus hijos. Sueña con crecer cada día como microempresaria y convertir su bodega en un minimarket.

loans.use: To purchase beer in bulk to stock her small store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Evangelia

texts.fr:
Born in Lomé on May 27, 1962, Mrs. Evangelia F. is married and the mother of three children. She was born into a family of bakers, but she always had an interest in the retail trade. In 1998 she began selling staple products necessary for baking. She became supplier to her family. Little by little she became the supplier for other bakers in her area. Her clientele has grown over time and she now needs to expand her inventory to satisfy the demand of her clientele. For this reason she requested her first loan.

This second loan will also allow her to add to her inventory 25 sacks of sugar and 7 sacks of wheat flour.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née à Lomé le 27 mai 1962 madame F. Evangelia est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle est née dans une famille de boulangers, mais elle a toujours eu goût pour le commerce. Elle s’est alors lancée depuis 1998 dans la vente des matières premières en boulangerie. Elle devient ainsi la fournisseuse de sa famille. Petit à petit elle est devenue la fournisseuse des autres boulangers de son milieu. Sa clientèle s’est accrue au fil des temps et elle a eu besoin d’augmenter son stock pour satisfaire la demande croissante. C’est ainsi quelque demanda un premier prêt.

Ce deuxième prêt lui permettra aussi d’augmenter son stock de 25 sacs de sucre et de 7 sacs de blé.

loans.use:
Purchase of sugar and wheat flour

Achat de sucre et de farine de blé

loans.name: Fiorela

texts.es:
Fiorela is a young mother who started her business with the selling of fruit. She also sells bottles, which even though it does not appear so, says Fiorela, is very lucrative. Upon becoming a mother at such a young age, she has not wavered in strengthening her heart and putting aside her fears to face life with courage. Every morning she buys her fruit and bottles which she later takes to the city to sell. Without a doubt Fiorela wants to grow her business to be able to satisfy the needs of her children and her home, since the cost of living is currently increasing. She is requesting a loan of USD $375 that will give her more funds to buy her products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Fiorela es una joven madre que inicio su propio negocio con la venta de fruta, adicionalmente vende botellas, que aunque no parezca, dice Fiorela, es muy rentable. Ella, al verse madre siendo tan joven no dudó en fortalecer su corazón, dejar de lado sus miedos y enfrentar la vida con valentía.Todas las mañanas compra fruta y botellas, que luego lleva a la ciudad para venderlas.Sin duda, Fiorela desea incrementar su negocio, para así satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos y de su hogar, ya que por estos tiempos el costo de vida va en aumento.Por ello solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles que le ayude a tener mayor capacidad de compra de sus productos.

loans.use: Increase capital for her buisness of fruit and bottle sales.

loans.name: Alma Mireya

texts.es:
Alma started her business because she needed to help cover the expenses of her home and wanted to have extra income since her husband was not employed and they were experiencing financial difficulties.

She started her business two years ago, selling clothing to her neighbors, later she added the sales of shoes which currently is proving to be more profitable.

She needs a loan of USD $800, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase seasonal merchandise for the upcoming vacation season.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Alma inició el negocio por la necesidad de cubrir gastos familiares y tener ingresos extras para su casa ya que esposo se encontraba sin empleo y atravesaban por una situación económica difícil.

Comenzó con su negocio hace dos años, empezó con la venta de ropa primero con vecinas, después agrego la venta de zapatos que es lo que actualmente le esta dejando mejores ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía de temporada ya que se acerca el periodo de vacaciones.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Paz Y Amor Group

texts.en:
D. Jean Jacques is a young, talented woman living in the small Haitian community of Loma Bajito in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic. She is the only caretaker of her two kids (ages 16 and 19) after her husband passed away. She intends to use this loan to purchase pants, blouses, shoes, perfumes, and cosmetics. She will sell her inventory on the streets both in and outside of her community. D.´s business will help feed her kids and provide an education for them. She hopes to own and run a "colmado" (a small convenient store that provides basic supplies) someday. 

D. Jean Jacques is part of a five-person micro-bank, Paz y Amor, which means "Peace and Love." The group is composed of all Haitian immigrants living in the same community of Loma Bajito. Each woman has her own personal business, but they unite to pay their loan as a group. The purpose of the group loan is to assist each other in case someone defaults. Loans are divided among the group to pay back. 

We thank you for your support on behalf of D., the Paz and Amor group, and the entire team at Esperanza International.

loans.use: To purchase pants, blouses, shoes, perfumes, and cosmetics

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María Esther is married, 34 years old, studied until the second year of high school, and has three children - one is independent, two depend on her. She lives in the Victor Larco district in the Trujillo province of La Libertad. Currently, she prepares and sells meals every day from her father's house. She also buys manjar blanco (a dessert made with milk) from wholesalers who bring it from the city of Cajamarca, which she then sells on credit from house-to-house her customers. She invested her first loan in the purchase of rice, oil, and noodles in bulk to prepare the meals that she sells. María Esther is a member of the "The Palm Trees" Communal Bank. With this loan of $375, which she will repay in six months, she will buy rice, noodles, oil and other products in bulk to get a better price. She uses these ingredients to prepare the meals that she sells daily. Her goal is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora María Esther está casada, tiene 34 años, estudió hasta 2do año de secundaria, tiene 03 hijos, 01 es independiente y 02 dependen de ella; vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad . Actualmente prepara comida y vende todos los días en la casa de su papá; Además compra manjar blanco a mayoristas que traen de la ciudad de Cajamarca y vende al crédito visitando casa por casa a sus clientes. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00, invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite y fideos al por mayor, para la preparación de la comida que vende. La señora María Esther es socia del banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS”. Con el préstamo de S/.1000.00, que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses; comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y otros productos al por mayor para obtener mejor precio; estos ingredientes los utiliza para la preparación de la comida que vende diariamente. Tiene como meta tener su casa propia.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Lesbia Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Lesbia Maria T. is 45 years old, and a single mother of two. Her children are 13 and 14 years old, respectively, and both attend the public secondary school. The family doesn't receive economic help from anyone, so Lesbia is asking for a loan of 9000 Cordobas in order to expand her business. Lesbia sells breakfast in her home, and with a loan she'll also be able to sell lunch from a small stall in the bus terminal market. In the afternoons, she serves fried snacks to students in the area. Lesbia started this business 8 years ago, as an alternative to unemployment and in order to get ahead. Her dream is to install a restaurant and bar in her home, but she'll continue to grow her current business in order to earn the capital for renovations. With your help Lesbia may be able to realize her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lesbia Maria T., tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, de 13 y 14 años respectivamente, ambos niños cursan la secundaria en colegio publico, ya que no tiene ayuda economica de nadie mas. En esta oportunidad solicita un credito por la suma de C$ 9,000.00 cordobas con el proposito de poder ampliar su negocio ya que solamente vendia comida en el desayuno en su casa de habitación,con los creditos ahora vende tambien almuerzo en el mercado la terminal de buses teniendo un pequeño espacio donde ofrece su servicio, y por la tarde saca una pequeña fritanga en su casa, sus principales clientes son estudiantes del sector, Ella tiene 8 años de dedicarse a esta actividad la cual surge como una alternativa de subsitencia al desempleo y poder salir adelante con sus hijos ya que es el unico sosten del hogar. Su mayor sueño es llegar a instalar un Bar y comedor en su casa de habitación, pero para ello requiere un mayor capital, y acondicionar el local para poder salir adelante, que con el apoyo nuestro quizas se le permita concretizar sus sueños.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Violeta Group

texts.en:
Before becoming associates of Esperanza, Yecenia and Manuel lived with their five children in a one-room shack with a tin roof, tin walls, and a dirt floor. Manuel worked at a candy producing factory, while Yecenia had no means of income at all. Their one-and-a-half-year-old child was malnourished, looking as if he had been born only three months prior. As Yecenia and Manuel began their first loan cycle, their child died because of complications due to malnourishment. Despite efforts by their loan officer and community members, the child could not be saved.

With their first loan, Yecenia and her husband bought tools, two sacks of sugar, and other ingredients necessary to make sugar cane sticks. Using the knowledge gained from his previous employment, Manuel maD. the candy while Yecenia sold it around the neighborhood. With each of their three following payments, Yecenia and Manuel have been able to expand their business to incluD. four more types of candy and a vendor who takes the highway to the center of Santo Domingo to sell.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and ingredients in order to continue candy production

loans.name: La Violeta Group

texts.en:
Before becoming associates of Esperanza, Yecenia and Manuel lived with their five children in a one-room shack with a tin roof, tin walls, and a dirt floor. Manuel worked at a candy producing factory, while Yecenia had no means of income at all. Their one-and-a-half-year-old child was malnourished, looking as if he had been born only three months prior. As Yecenia and Manuel began their first loan cycle, their child died because of complications due to malnourishment. Despite efforts by their loan officer and community members, the child could not be saved.

With their first loan, Yecenia and her husband bought tools, two sacks of sugar, and other ingredients necessary to make sugar cane sticks. Using the knowledge gained from his previous employment, Manuel maD. the candy while Yecenia sold it around the neighborhood. With each of their three following payments, Yecenia and Manuel have been able to expand their business to incluD. four more types of candy and a vendor who takes the candy to the highway that runs to the center of Santo Domingo to sell.

With the money they have earned, Yecenia and Manuel have been able to move into a two-bedroom shack that they rent, which is not only bigger, but in a less dangerous location, and they are able to proviD. food for their children. They are saving money right now through the programmed and voluntary loans offered at Esperanza so that they can buy their own house in the future. They have been exemplary in repaying their loans. They have not missed a single repayment date despite various hardships. For example, one particular day, Manuel suffered a heat stroke while making candy. Instead of using the money he was saving to repay the loan to pay for going to the hospital, Manuel repaid the loan and refused to go to the hospital. Friends and community members forced him to go to the hospital and chipped in to help him pay for the bill. Another time they were robbed of their money only days before the loan repayment date, but they somehow managed to make enough money to make their payment. They are perfect examples of the what people can accomplish with a little help and a little hope.

loans.use: Yecenia and her husband Manuel need this loan so that they will be able to buy more sugar and ingredients in order to continue with their candy producing business. They would like to produce more candy, and also begin producing a sixth type of candy.

loans.name: Janiccia Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Janiccia R. R. is 27 years old and a single mother of two. She has a 6-year-old who was born with learning differences and now studies at a specialized school. Her other son is 8 years old and attends third grade at a public school. Janiccia sells clothing, and would like a loan to increase her inventory and selection so that she can travel with her merchandise. Janiccia now sells new clothing and cosmetics, which she buys in Managua each week. She recoups the cost of this investment each month or two. Janiccia is taking a course in beauty school, and one of her dreams is to be able to own a small beauty salon. She'd like to earn her own income and live independently, as the father of her children doesn't help the family at all. Janiccia currently lives with her mother, who taught her how to manage her clothing business. Janiccia has more than five years of experience in selling clothing and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Janiccia R. R., tiene 27 años de edad es madre soltera tiene dos hijos uno tiene 6 años el cual nacio con capacidades diferentes estudiando en una escuelita especializada y su otro hijo tiene 8 años el cual estudia el tercer grado de primaria en colegio publico, el proposito de solicitar credito obedece a poder tener un poco mas de capital para tener mayor inventario y ofertar su mercaderia de forma ambulante ya que ella comercializa con ropa nueva y cosmeticos comprando en managua cada semana y recupera de forma quincenal y mensual, Uno de sus sueños es poder instalar un pequeño salon de belleza ya que esta pasando un curso y obtener mas ingresos para el hogar ya que no recibe ayuda del padre de sus hijos para nada, otro de sus sueños es poder adquirir un terreno para vivir de manera independiente ya que vive con su señora madre quien le ha enseñado el oficio del comercio. Ella tiene mas de 5 años de dedicarse al comercio de ropa y cosmeticos, llevandolo a cabo directamente ella,

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is married and 47 years old; she completed primary school and she has three children, who do not live at home. She lives in the Victor Larco district in the province of Trujillo, La Libertad. Currently, she raises animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, etc. She sells them from her home to a certain customers and also offers them in some markets. She invested her first loan in animal feed, which she bought at small farms because she got a lower price. She belongs to "The Palm Trees" Communal Bank. With this loan for $375, which she will repay in six months, she will buy turkeys and hens to sell during the fiestas at the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Yolanda está casada, tiene 47 años, estudió Primaria completa, tiene 03 hijos, los cuales ya no viven con ella. Vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. Actualmente, se dedica a la crianza de animales, tales como: cuyes, pollos, etc. Realiza las ventas en su casa a determinados clientes y también los ofrece en algunos mercados. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00, invertido en la compra de alimento para los animales, este alimento sale a comprarlo en las chacras porque lo obtiene a menor precio. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS PALMERAS”. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00, que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses comprará pavos y gallinas para engordarlas y poder venderlas en las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.use: To purchase feed for small animals.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is an enterprising woman, who started her business nine years ago out of economic necessity per a neighbor's recommendation. She started selling shoes thought a catalog, initially offering them to friends and family. As time passed, she had a portfolio and recommendations that helped her grow her business.

She needs a $1000 loan, which she will repay in six months, to buy merchandise for the various orders she has to fill. With your help, she will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Martha es un mujer emprendedora, quien por necesidades económicas inicio su negocio hace 9 años por recomendación de una vecina, ya que a ella le iba muy bien por lo que inicio con venta de zapato por catalogo ofreciéndolos inicialmente a familiares y amigos. Con el paso del tiempo se fue haciendo de una cartera y de recomendaos lo que le ayudo a hacer crecer su negocio.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $1000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía ya que tiene varios pedidos por surtir. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Yesenia Yadira

texts.es:
Yesenia started her business to help her husband with the household expenses. A year ago she began selling natural products to her mother because she had problems with her weight. Since the results were so good for her mother, she now is a distributor and her sales have gone very well due to her many clients.

She needs a $300 loan, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy merchandise since her sales have been increasing.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Yesenia inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con el gasto familiar Comenzó hace un año a vender pero al principio su mama le vendió los productos naturistas para que ella lo consumiera ya que tenia problemas D. sobre peso pero le ha dado tan buen resultado que ahora ella es distribuidora y le ha ido muy bien con sus ventas ya que tiene mucha clientela.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para compra D. mercancía ya que sus ventas cada vez se han ido incrementando

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Erika Maribel

texts.es:
Erika started her business in order to help her husband with the family expenses. A year ago, she started selling dairy products and cured food such as cheeses, sausages and chorizo among family and friends. Later people began to recommend her products and her clientele grew. She decided to invest her earnings in a paper products store, which while it has been operating for only a short while, is doing very well. It is ideally located close to a school.

She needs a loan for $200, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to buy merchandise, since her sales and clientele are growing. With your support Erika will move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Erika inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con el gasto familiar comenzó hace un año a vender lácteos y embutidos: quesos, chorizo y salchichas entre amigos y familiares, después la gente la empezó a recomendar con lo cual amplio su clientela, decidió invertir sus ganancias poniendo una papelería, con la cual tiene poco tiempo pero como esta cerca de una escuela le esta yendo muy bien.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $200 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía ya que sus ventas se han ido incrementando, con tu apoyo Erika saldrá adelante

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Juana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Juana has 5 children, two of whom are married: Brenda Leticia, 25, and Néstor Fernando, 21. She also has 3 young children: César Eduardo, 16, Cintia Guandalupe, 11, and Ángel Agustin, 6.

Juana started her business in order to bring in additional income. She wanted to help her husband with the family expenses because his salary was not sufficient to cover them. Three years ago she started selling shoes to family members, and selling prepared meals, tacos and hamburgers on weekends. She sells more all the time now that her clientele has grown.

She needs a loan for $500, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to buy merchandise, since she has various orders to fill. With your support Juana will move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Juana tiene 5 hijos, dos están casados: Brenda Leticia 25, Néstor Fernando 21 y 3 pequeños Cesar Eduardo D. 16 años, Cintia Guadalupe D. 11 años y Ángel Agustín D. 6 años.

Inició el negocio para tener un ingreso extra ya que deseaba apoyar a su esposo con el gasto familiar porque con el sueldo que el percibía no completaban. ElL. inicio su negocio hace 3 años vendiendo zapatos entre sus familiares y los fines D. semana comida, tacos y hamburguesas. Cada vez venD. más ya que su clienteL. ha aumentado.

ElL. necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía ya que tiene varios pedidos por surtir. Con tu apoyo Juana saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #58081

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 20 heads of small bananas, 200 units of bananas “filipitos,” 10 sacks of coal, 5 dozen lemons, and 50 units of coconuts.

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 12.50 dólares

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza is married and has 2 daughters, aged 17and 10. She is a hardworking person who learned the art of hair styling when she worked as an assistant in a beauty salon. Little by little she observed how the stylists created different hair colors and styles, and in the afternoons she studied at a beauty school in order to earn her diploma. As time went by, Lorenza gained confidence and experience and finally she decided to open her own salon. She fitted out a part of her home for the shop and little by little she earned clients and credibility and now she enjoys a good reputation.

She needs a loan for $350, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy the sink and chairs that will give her salon better client service and a better image. With your support she will move her business ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Lorenza es casada y tiene 2 hijas de 17 y 10 años, es una persona trabajadora que aprendió el arte del Corte de cabello al trabajar como ayudante en una estética, poco a poco fue observando como se hacia los diferentes tintes y peinados y en por las tardes acudía a una academia de belleza para tener un diploma, con el paso del tiempo adquirió seguridad y experiencia y decidió abrir su propia estética, para lo que acondiciono un área dentro de su domicilio, poco a poco acredito el lugar y hoy día goza de buena reputación.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar un lavabo y sillas que requiere la estética para un mejor servicio e imagen. Con tu apoyo ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: To buy a sink and chairs for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana is married with 4 children: 2 daughters, aged 12 and 14 and two sons, aged 4 and 8. She started her business 3 years ago because she wanted to contribute to the family economy while still taking good care of her children. She opened a butcher shop at that time. Little by little she realized that she was capable of successfully growing it into a more formal business. That is exactly what she trying to do now but she lacks the capital to acquire more products and improve her sales.

She needs a loan for $250, which she will repay in 3 months, to buy merchandise. With your help Adriana will grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Adriana es casada y tiene 4 hijos: 2 niñas de 14 y 12, y 2 niños de 8, y 4 años, ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años ya que quería contribuir a la economía de su casa pero sin descuidar a sus hijos por ello decidió poner una carnicería, poco a poco se fue dando cuenta que podía lograr formar un negocio mas formal que es lo que esta intentando en la actualidad pero les hace falta capital para adquirir mas productos y mejorar sus ventas.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia. Con tu ayuda Adriana hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Benita

texts.es:
Maria Benita is married with 5 children, though 3 of her children are already married. Only a 17 year old daughter and a 15 year old son live with Maria and her husband. She started her business 3 years ago selling lingerie in order to keep herself busy while simultaneously generating an income and helping her husband , who works as driver, support the family. Sometimes his salary does not meet the family's expenses.

She needs a loan for $250, which she will repay in 3 months, to buy merchandise she will offer to her clients as a way to increase the possibility of selling the goods on credit, which will increase her earnings. With your help she will move her business ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

María Benita, es casada y tiene 5 hijos pero 3 ya son casados y solo una niña de 17 y un varón de 15 años que viven con ellos. Comenzó su negocio hace 3 años vendiendo lencería para distraerse y a la vez generar un ingreso y así apoyar a su esposo que trabaja como chofer transportista y en ocasiones no les alacanza son su sueldo.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía para ofrecerle a su clientela y asi aumentar la posibilidad de venderles en pagos lo cual aumenta su ganancia. Con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Norma Nuehmi

texts.es:
Norma is divorced and has to support her two small children, aged 10 and 6, practically alone. She began to sew clothing for people she knew since she has been a skilled seamstress since she was 16 years old. Now she has taken advantage of her abilities and is making school uniforms. Thanks to this business, she has been able to move her family ahead.

She needs a loan of $250, which she will repay in 3 months, to buy a sewing machine. The machine will allow her to fulfill her objectives and increase her earnings. With your help Norma will grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

.Norma es divorciada y tiene que mantener a sus 2 pequeños de 10 y 6 años, prácticamente sola. Comenzó a coser ropa solo a sus conocidos ya que lla cunta con esta habilidad desde hace 16 años, pero en la actualidad le ha sacado provecho a esto y hace uniformes escolares y gracias a esto ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar una maquina para poder cumplir con sus objetivos y de esta manera obtener una mayor ganancia. con tu ayuda Norma hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Fanny Maria

texts.es:
Fanny started selling snacks, but a neighbor was going to close her grocery store, and instead of closing it she transferred it to Ms. Fanny, currently she no longer sells snacks because she works full time on the grocery store which has been very successful.

She needs a loan of $250 that she will pay in 3 months to buy more products because she wants to stock school supplies and increase her paper inventory to be ready when classes season starts soon. With the loan this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Fanny comenzó vendiendo antojitos, pero una vecina iba a cerrar su papelería, y en vez de cerrarla se la traspaso a la señora Fanny, en la actualidad ya no vende antojitos pues se a dedicado 100% a la papelería ya que le ha ido muy bien.

ella necesita un prestamo por US S250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia para el proximo regreso a clases ya que desea surtir su papelería y contar con un inventario mayor para sus clientes. Con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: To buy products / comprar mercancia

loans.name: Sol Radiante Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal de Panamericana, a este pertenece la asociación “Sol Radiante ” integrado por 17 miembros.
Un grupo muy alegre que  junto  a su asistente de créditos, trabajan con Pro-Mujer con mucha responsabilidad y entusiasmo.
La mayoría en el grupo son casados y con familias numerosas, Actualmente viven en alquiler en cuartos que con el paso del tiempo y el crecer de sus hijos les han quedado pequeños, tiene el sueño de poder comprar una casa propia para ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus hijos,  por lo que trabajan desde muy temprano en la elaboración de almuerzos y cenas , que los venden en mercados de la ciudad de El Alto , ahora lograron conseguir contratos en algunas construcciones de edificios, por lo que necesitan  crédito para la compra de mayores insumos y para  contratar ayudantes de cocina, esto les permitirá duplicar la producción y conseguir mayores ganancias para  poder ahorrar para la compra de su casa en un futuro .

loans.use: Necesitan capital para la compra de insumos y para contratar ayudantes

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela is married and has 2 kids her son is 5 years old and her daughter is 2 years old. She started her business 3 years ago; she wanted to help her husband who works as a driver with the expenses at home. She started selling bed sheets by catalogue, currently she wants to stock bed sheets to offer a larger variety to her clients and have some available so she can be faster supplying and won’t have to wait until the bed sheets are sent.

She needs a loan of $250 that she will pay in 3 months to buy the merchandise. With your help she will achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Mariela es casada y tien 2 hijos un niño de 5 años y una niña de 2. Ella incio su negocio hace 3 años, deseaba de alguna manera ayudar con los gastos a su esposo quien es chofer y comenzó a vender colchas y sabanas por catalogo, actualmente quiere tener un stock de colchas para ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y tener disponibles algunas a fin de ser mas rápido el surtido y no esperar hasta el envió de las colchas.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia.Con tu apoyo ella lograra sus objetivos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise / comprar mercancia

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Paloma Village Bank.

Luz is a separated, forty-two-year-old mother of four children. Luz works at a regional hospital in the city of Ayacucho as a nurse technician. Luz also has a small store in her home, located on Cumana St. in the Nazareno District, where she sells home supplies, fruit, sausages, etc with the help of her son. She opens her store from six in the morning until nine at night. In addition, Luz rents rooms in her house.

Luz needs a loan of 2,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in rice, sugar, eggs, milk, and gelatin.

Luz’s dream is to stock more products in her store, to have another business, and that her children study in the city of Lima.

loans.use: Luz needs a loan of 2,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in rice, sugar, eggs, milk, and gelatin.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.en:
Marleny is a member of the Paloma Village Bank.

Marleny is a twenty-eight-year-old mother of two children. Marleny has a small café located in the Hierro Pozo Institute, where she sells food, various plates, drinks, candy, etc. She also provides meals to contracted institutions and people, most of whom are students. Three employees help Marleny, along with her husband during his free time. Marleny opens her business everyday from 6 in the morning to 4 in the afternoon.

Marlney needs a loan of 1,200 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in more furniture, such as tables and chairs.

Marleny’s dream is to have her own, bigger restaurant, to buy land and construct a home, and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: Marlney needs a loan of 1,200 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in more furniture, such as tables and chairs.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Anotonia is a member of the Paloma Village Bank.

Antonia is a forty-year-old mother of two children. Antonia has a small store in her house, located in a neighborhood of the Nazareno District. She sells vegetables, meat, firewood, fruit, stove gas, etc., which she acquires from a market near the city of Ayacucho in the very early morning. Antonia opens her store from six in the morning until eight at night. In addition, Antonia travels to regional fairs of Quinua and Ccejelambras on the weekends, where she sells fruit and purchases cereal to resell in the markets of Ayacucho.

Antonia needs a loan of 1,200 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk, and noodles.

Antonia’s dream is to have her own tavern, to expand her business, and to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: Antonia needs a loan of 1,200 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk, and noodles.

loans.name: Lucely Patricia

texts.es:
Lucely is married and has 4 sons, who are 18, 15, 12, and 8 years old. For some years now she has been working selling cold drinks, but she noticed it wasn’t such a good business because the profits were lean, that is how she looked for other products to sell and found that natural products had a higher demand among her friends, and she decided to sell them. These products are leaving her a better profit, she sells among her neighbors and her clients have increased day by day.

She needs a loan of 4250 that she will pay in 3 months to buy more products and be able to supply her clients. With your help she will be succeed.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Lucely es casada y tiene 4 varones de 18,15 12 y 8 años. Desde hace algunos años se decida al comercio, ella vendía refrescos en su casa, pero empezó a ver que no era tan buen negocio ya que no le dejaban mucha ganancia, fue así como empezó a buscar otras opciones para vender y encontró que la venta de productos naturistas tenia mucha demanda entre sus amistades, fue entonces que decidió dedicarse a la venta de estos productos los cuales les dejan muy buenas ganancias ya que los vende también entre sus vecinos y sus clientela ha ido aumentando cada día.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mas productos y poder abastecer a su clientela. Con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise / comprar mercancia

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
Demetrio is married and has 3 kids, one is 17 years old, and his two daughters are 12 and 14. He works creating ropes since he was a child because it has been the family business. Now he has his own family and because he needs more income, he decided to work independently and started his own business to manufacture ropes 30 years ago.

He needs a loan of $250 that he will pay in 3 months to buy material and be able to manufacture more ropes and supply more clients.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Demetrio es casado tiene 3 hijos, uno de 17, y dos niñas de 12 y 14 años. Se dedica a la elaboración de sogas desde muy pequeño ya que este siempre ha sido el negocio de la familia, ahora que el tiene su propia familia y ante la necesidad de tener mas ingresos, decidió independizarse y poner su propio negocio de elaboración de sogas desde hace mas de 30 años.

El necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses par comprar material y asi poder fabricar mas sogas y abastecer mas comercios.

loans.use: To buy work material / comprar material de trabajo

loans.name: Corazones De Oro Group

texts.es:
More than eight years ago, 18 women formed the “Corazones de Oro” Association. They work together with the Pro-Mujer family convinced that they can improve their quality of life. The majority of the women live in the Senkata neighborhood in the city of El Alto. The most common activity among them is the preparation and sale of food in local markets and boarding houses, as is the case with Bacilia who rents a space where she can offer, for the most part, traditional food like chairo paceño (soup made with dried potatoes and lamb), fricase (stew made with pork, white corn and dried potatoes) and pork rinds among other dishes.

The women affirm that an increase in food prices caused an imbalance in their earnings, which is what brings them to ask for additional credit. They will inject capital into their businesses in order to maintain economic stability in their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace mas de nueve años 18 mujeres conforman la asociación “Corazones de Oro” que trabajan junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer, convencidas de que pueden mejorar su calidad de vida. La mayoría de ellas viven en la zona de Senkata de la ciudad de El Alto, siendo la actividad mas común entre ellas la elaboración y venta de comida en mercados del lugar y también en pensiones, como es el caso de doña Bacilia, que alquila una pensión para ofrecer por lo general comida tradicional como ser: chairo paceño, fricase, chicharon y otros, afirman que el alza de los precios en los alimentos causo desequilibrio en sus ganancias lo que les lleva a solicitar créditos mayores para inyectar capital a sus negocios, con el unico fin de mantener estabilidad económica en sus hogares

loans.use: Injection of capital into the group's food businesses

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea has more than 10 years on the hammock business, she learned how to elaborate them since she was a kid thanks to her mother. Now she takes advantage of what she learned and creates her own hammocks and then sells them, so she can help her husband with the home expenses.

She needs a loan for $250 that she will pay in 3 months to buy threads and be able to finish a large request she received from clients. With your help she will be able to make it.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Andrea tiene mas de 10 años dedicándose al negocio de las hamacas, ella desde muy pequeña aprendió a elaborarlas gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre, por lo que ahora aprovecha de lo aprendido para elaborar sus hamacas y luego venderlas y así poder apoyar con el gasto familiar a su esposo.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar hilos y poder terminar un pedido grande que le hicieron. Con tu ayuda ella saldra delante.

loans.use: To buy thread / comprar hilos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a small generator to provide power during blackouts and keep operating a small salon.

loans.name: Silvia Beatriz

texts.es:
Silvia is married and has 2 kids who are 2 and 3 years old, she started her business to help her husband with the family expenses. She started selling shoes by catalogue among her friends, little by little her sales have increased and her clients asked her to sell cosmetics. This way she has been increasing her business and for this reason she wants to buy more products to provide her clients with more options.

She needs a loan of $250 that she will pay in 3 months to buy new catalogues and products of the season she will offer to her clients. With your help Silvia will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 1 y 3 años, ella inicio su negocio ante la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, empezó a vender entre sus conocidos zapatos por catalogo, poco a poco sus ventas fueron incrementando y comenzaron a pedirle que vendiera cosméticos de esta manera ella ha ido creciendo en el negocio y es por esa razón que quiere comprar mas productos para poder brindarles mas opciones a sus clientes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar los nuevos catálogos y productos de temporada para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Silvia saldra adelante.

loans.use: To buy catalogues and products / comprar catalogos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To get various goods to restock a small grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pork meat and other goods to keep operating her successful cafeteria.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan Antonio began his career working for a newspaper for a period of five years, after which he took the initiative to start his own business since he was receiving a very low salary at the paper and he had a desire to improve his life. Since he had experience in the business, he began his own printing company and little by little he began to earn a good income and things have generally gone well for him.

Juan Antonio is asking for a loan of US $800, which he will repay in six months, to purchase supplies. With your assistance he will be able to increase his business opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Juan Antonio empezó laborando en un periódico por un periodo de 5 años, pero posteriormente tuvo la iniciativa de iniciar su propio negocio, por que recibía un salario muy bajo y pues el quería superarse día con día, como el ya tenía conocimiento del mismo, puso su negocio de impresiones y poco a poco le fue dando buenos ingresos y le ha ido bien,

El solicita de un crédito por US $ 800 que pagara en 6 meses, para la compra de material. Con tu apoyo el hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Rosales Group

texts.es:
In the city of El Alto, the “Rosales” Association works in the Senkata Center. It is made up of 12 people that perform their duties with much determination. The group carries out different activities like the sale of CDs, cosmetics and clothing and they are also seamstresses. Within the association they know each other really well – they are partners and solidly united. Nowadays, the majority of the women sell their products in the streets with the help of their families. Rosa, for example, works alongside her father. They live in an area very far away and return each night to their home. It’s a little dangerous and for that reason her father accompanies her and always takes care of her.

The “Rosales” Association wants additional credit to be able to purchase or rent permanent stands in the main markets and/or fairs in the city where they will have guaranteed sales and make more money.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de El Alto, en el centro focal de Senkata trabaja la asociación “Rosales” formado por 12 personas que realizan sus actividades con mucho empeño. El grupo tiene diferentes actividades algunas se dedican a la venta de Cds ,venta de cosmeticos, venta de ropa, también son costureras . Dentro la asociación todos se conocen muy bien, son compañeros y solidarios. Actualmente, la mayoría de ellas realiza sus ventas de manera ambulante con la ayuda de su familia, Ross por ejemplo trabaja al lado de su padre, ellos viven en una zona muy alejada y retornar por la noche a su casa es un tanto peligroso .por eso su papa la acompaña y cuida siempre. La asociación Rosales quiere mayor crédito para poder comprar o alquilar puestos fijos en principales mercados y/o ferias de la ciudad con lo que tendrían ventas seguras y generarían mayores ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase and/or rent permanent stands in the city's markets

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita started her small business selling cosmetics and beauty products, to help pay for family expenses and schooling for her children. She got into the business in order to assure that her children are able to receive an education. Since starting her business she also began selling sweet both to individual customers and wholesale. These days her business is going well, thanks to her good customers.

Margarita is asking for a loan of US $1,000, which she will repay in three months, in order to purchase merchandise, market her business and increase her sales. She trusts that with Kiva’s help, she will get the loan she needs to improve her business and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Margarita inicio el negocio de la venta de cosméticos y artículos de belleza, para ayudar en los gastos económicos de su hogar ya que tenían los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos, por tal motivo inicio ese negocio. Posteriormente empezó con la venta de dulces a mayoreo y menudeo, hasta hoy en día le ha ido bien gracias a sus clientes.

Ahora esta solicitando de un crédito por US $1,000 que pagara en 3 meses, para la compra de mercancía, para ampliar el negocio, y darle publicidad y a la vez para poder incrementar sus ventas, Ella confía que con el apoyo Kiva obtendrá el financiamiento.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma has had her business selling chickens for 8 years. She is married and has eight children, three of whom help her with her chicken sales. She sells in a market where her clients seek her out day-to-day to buy her chicken. Irma is very happy with the help that she has received, and she is going to invest the money she receives from this loan to buy more chickens to sell. In the future, she would like to open another shop where her children can also sell chicken.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Irma lleva 8 años en el negocio, es casada, tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales 3 le ayudan en el negocio de la venta de pollo, ella vende en el interior de un mercado, donde la clientela la busca día con día, para poder comprarle, ella esta muy contenta con la ayuda que recibirá, ya que con el dinero que reciba, lo estará invirtiendo en mas compra de pollo, para tener en su venta, además ella a un futuro quiere colocar otra venta de pollo para que las hijas la puedan atender.

loans.use: To buy more chicken to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in bras, shoes, girdles, and other goods to keep running her small business.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel is a young man who just got married, and therefore has begun to assume new tasks and responsibilities. His wife is pregnant, and he wants to give his firstborn everything he needs. Gabriel just started a business selling seeds, which he transports from his town to the city of Arequipa (which is a route that takes more than 18 hours by land). He meets people who sell seeds, make the purchase, transports the merchandise, and thanks to the motorcycle that he bought, he can transport the seeds to far away towns. He began this business with a great desire to prosper, and now he has the opportunity to buy a greater quantity of seeds. For this he needs your financial support, and he presents himself in this manner, and waits for a positive response to his request.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Gabriel es un joven que acaba de contraer matrimonio, por ende, empieza a asumir nuevas tareas y responsabilidades, puesto que su esposa está embarazada, entonces desea brindar lo necesario a su primogénito. Acaba de iniciar un negocio de venta de semillas, que traslada desde su pueblo hasta la ciudad de Arequipa (que es una ruta de más de 18 horas por tierra). Él se contacta con personas que vendan semillas, realizar la compra y traslada la mercadería, gracias a que adquirió una moto puede trasladarse a los pueblos alejados para conseguir las semillas. Este es el negocio que Gabriel ha iniciado con muchas ganas de prosperar, ahora desea tener la posibilidad de adquirir mayor cantidad de semillas, para ello requiere su apoyo económico, y se presenta en este medio esperando una respuesta positiva a su pedido.

loans.use: Increase capital to buy more seeds

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
Nazario is a young father of a family and works as a farmer. By farming he can give his little son, whom he adores, what he needs. Despite the fact that he no longer lives with the mother of his son, he does not stop providing his son’s necessities. He works hard for him, planting corn, and he hopes that this season will be more profitable so he can visit his son and bring him things he needs. Without doubt, like any parent, he wants to give his son more than he can, and thinking this way, he would like to increase his cultivated land in order to grow more agricultural products. The loan that he requests is 600 soles ($225), which will be invested in the purchase of a plot of land to increase his cultivatable farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Nazario es un joven padre de familia que trabaja como agricultor, así puede mantener las necesidades de su pequeño hijo, quien es su adoración, a pesar de no vivir con la mamá del niño, no deja de atender las necesidades del mismo. Por él trabaja arduamente, sembrando maíz, espera que esta temporada sea más rentable, para visitar a su hijo y poder llevarle lo necesario. Sin duda, como todo padre, desea dar aun más de lo que puede, pensando así, desea incrementar sus terrenos de cultivo para producir otros productos agrícolas. La cantidad que requiere es de 600 soles que sería invertido en la compra de un terreno para ampliar su zona de producción.

loans.use: Buy a small plot of land to increase his farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of pork meat and vegetables for a small business.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz is a humble mother who works selling sweets from a small store that she recently rented. She also lives there, as she still has not been able to buy a plot of land. Nonetheless, she has to travel to the city of Huancayo to help her uncle who is sick, and she would like to take advantage of the trip and buy sweets and merchandise that she can use to supply her business. For this reason she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more products. She asks that you trust in her work and honor.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Luz es una humilde madre de familia que se dedica a la venta de dulces en una pequeña tienda que acaba de alquilar, donde también vive, porque aún no consigue comprarse un terreno. Sin embargo, tiene que viajar a la ciudad de Huancayo para ayudar a su tío que se encuentra enfermo, ella desea aprovechar el viaje para la compra de dulces y mercadería que pueda implementar y surtir mejor su negocio. Por ello solicita el presente préstamo, con el que podrá adquirir sus productos, ella pide que puedan confiar en su trabajo y honradez.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business (selling sweets)

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia works raising animals, something she has done since she was a girl. She grew up surrounded by sown fields and young animals which her parents raised and she learned how to care for and sell. Now she is a mother of three children and does this activity in order to pay for various household expenses. She gets up very early in the morning to take her livestock to pasture, and is waiting for the vaccines and medicines for the livestock’s development, in order to then sell them at a good price at market. Eulalia wants to increase her livestock and improve their breed, and in this way increase their value at market. For this she is requesting 600 soles ($225), which she promises to repay punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Eulalia se dedica a la crianza de animales, actividad que realiza desde niña, ella creció rodeada de sembríos y de tiernos animales, que sus padres criaron y que ella aprendió a cuidar y comercializar. Ahora que es madre y tiene 3 hijos, trata con esta actividad, de solventar los diversos gastos que tiene en su hogar, para ello sale muy temprano a pastear a su ganado, estando pendiente de sus vacunas y medicinas necesA. para su desarrollo, para que luego pueda venderlos a un buen precio en el mercado. Eulalia quiere aumentar sus ganado y mejorar sus razas, y así incrementar su valor en el mercado. Para ello requiere de 600 soles, cantidad que pide en calidad de préstamo con la promesa de pagar puntualmente.

loans.use: Buy animals of better breed in order to increase value of her livestock

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina is a mother who, thanks to her work as a farmer, was able to educate and feed her children. This work gave her great satisfaction and paid for the basic household necessities. Now she needs to support her daughter, who at only 16 years old is pregnant and was abandoned by her partner. As a mother she supports her daughter emotionally and financially, but she also has 7 other children to worry about, and in addition will be adding a grandson or granddaughter. Her work as a farmer has become very efficient, but the limitations and difficulties she has are due to the high prices of fertilizers and agricultural supplies that she needs for her land. For this reason, she is requesting a loan which she will use to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Alejandrina es una madre, que gracias a su actividad como agricultora pudo educar y alimentar a sus hijos, esta actividad le dio mucha satisfacción para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar.Ahora, debe apoyar a su hija, quien con tan sólo 16 años, fue abandonada por su pareja estando embarazada. Como madre, apoya moral y económicamente a su hija, pero también tiene otros 7 hijos por los cuales preocuparse, al que se sumará su futuro nieto o nieta.Su trabajo como agricultora lo desarrolla con mucha eficiencia, las limitaciones y dificultades que tiene es debido a los costosos precios de los abonos y demás insumos agrícolas que necesita para sus terrenos.Por ello, solicita un préstamo que de conseguirlo lo utilizará para la compra de abono para sus terrenos.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and other agricultural supplies for her farmland

loans.name: Vidal Felix

texts.es:
Felix es una gran persona que por su optimismo y resistencia al trabajo a sabido dejar de lado las malas experiencias y seguir adelante. Hace un tiempo cuando terminaba de curar y fumigar sus chacras, fue a almorzar, al ingerir sus alimentos se intoxicó porque los medicamentos para la cura de sus cultivos se mezclaron con sus alimentos, lo que lo llevó hasta la cama de un hospital, estuvo una semana internado por intoxicación.Ahora es más cuidadoso con los insumos que utiliza. El desempeño de su chacra muy buena, pero la falta de fertilizantes y abonos puede perjudicar su producción, por ese motivo solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono para su chacra, espera que puedan prestarle ese monto.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Felix is a very optimist person who is resilient to work and knows how to put the bad experiences behind him and move forward. Unfortunately once after he had finished spraying his fields he went for lunch and as he was eating, the food and the toxins he sprayed the fields became mixed as he was ingesting the food; this caused him to spend a week in the hospital for poisoning. Now he is much more careful with the instruments that he uses. The performance of his fields is very successful but he lacks some fertilizers and without them his production could be diminished, thus he is asking for a loan for the purchase of fertilizers for his land; he hopes that you may be able to loan him that amount.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for his fields.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
Maria Julia started her business after her husband died, leaving her alone to raise and support her three children. She had to obtain a loan in order to carry on and support and care for her family. She began to wash clothing and clean houses for other people, but one day she was invited to attend a course in tailoring and dressmaking and it was there she met her current business partner who proposed the idea of working together in order to take on larger orders. Since June 1997 when they began working together, things have gone very well for them and many know of their work. They are accredited by the school system, which sends them business making uniforms.

Maria Julia is requesting a loan of US $800, which she will repay in six months, to purchase material and supplies that will enable her to complete her customers’ orders, and ensure that they turn out well.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Maria Julia inició el negocio al fallecer su esposo, se qued sola con sus tres hijos y tuvo que trabajar para sostenerlos. Ella necesitaba oibtener un ingreso que le permitiera mantener a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante, al mismo tiempo que pudiera estar al cuidado de ellos. Comenzó lavando ropa ajena y haciendo la limpieza en casas, pero un día la invitaron a un curso de corte y confección y ahí conocío a su actual socia, la que le propuso que se uniéran para poder cumplir con pedidos grandes de ropa que les hacían. Desde Junio de 1997 a la fecha les ha ido muy bien ya que muchas personas las conocen y estan acreditadas en las escuelas, donde les mandan hacer uniformes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar materiales que le permitan cumplir con los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes a los cuales no les quiere quedar mal.

loans.use: Purchase material and supplies

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa is a hard-working mother and grandmother who looks after the welfare of her family; she works extremely hard at her restaurant. In the morning she prepares the delicious dishes that are offered at lunchtime. The competition is very difficult in their area so the only way to be successful is best flavor; Luis is winning on this front, but more than that she likes to have her restaurant looking attractive and welcoming, thus enticing the customer. The amount she is asking for is 800 soles; she hopes that you can help her cope with the stiff competition in a healthy and honest manner.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Luisa es una mujer muy trabajadora, madre y abuela que vela por el bienestar de los suyos, por ello trabaja arduamente en su restaurante, durante las mañanas se dedica a preparar los deliciosos platos que ofrecerá a la hora del almuerzo.La competencia es muy reñida por su zona, por ello que la única que forma de sacar ventaja es por la sazón, y en eso Luisa lleva la delantera, pero además de eso, le gustaría ambientar su local para que se vea más atractivo y acogedor, y así aumentar la clientela.El monto que requiere es de 800 soles, espera que usted le pueda ayudar a hacerle frente a la dura competencia, de una manera sana y honesta.

loans.use: Implement and improve the appearance of her restaurant.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel is the mother of two children who are still in high school and she works selling kebabs on a corner of the plaza. This dish consists of pieces of grilled cow heart accompanied by potatoes. She would like to have an air-conditioned space to sell her food, but she doesn’t have enough money. When her earnings aren’t sufficient, she tries to find customers for whom she can wash clothing and earn a little bit of extra money. Isabel requests this loan in order to rent a space where she can sell her kebabs in a more comfortable and receptive manner.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel es madre de 2 pequeños, que aún están en el colegio. Ella se dedica a la venta de anticuchos que vende en una esquina de la plaza. Este plato que consiste en pedazos de corazón de res a la parrilla acompañados de papa. A ella le gustaría tener un local, que esté acondicionado para la venta de comida, pero no tiene el dinero para esto. Cuando el dinero no es suficiente, busca la forma de encontrar clientes para lavar ropa y ganar un dinero extra. Isabel presenta su pedido de préstamo para alquilar un local donde pueda vender sus anticuchos de una manera más cómoda y acogedora para sus clientes.

loans.use: Rent a space where she can sell her kebabs

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es:
Saturnino, es una hombre muy trabajador, es agricultor, se esfuerza para obtener productos de calidad que le generen mejores ingresos para su hogar.Las dificultades de Saturnino en este momento son económicas, no puede adquirir los tratamientos y fertilizantes para sus sembríos. Por ello solicita este préstamo, para adquirir estos productos y lograr una adecuada preparación de su tierra y por ende unos productos de mejor calidad.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Saturnino is a hard-working farmer who works very hard to obtain quality products that will generate better income for his home. Saturnino’s currently has economic difficulties as he is unable to obtain fertilizers and other treatments for planting. Thus he is asking for a loan in order to be able to acquire these products and ensure the adequate preparation of his land and produce better quality products.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and other treatments to prepare his farmland

loans.name: Cesarian Teodosia

texts.es:
Cesarían es una mujer muy trabajadora, instaló una pequeña tienda en su casa, negocio que siempre quiso tener, ahora su afán es poder mejorarlo y hacer de ese negocio uno de los más concurridos en su zona.Para ello tiene que trabajar muy alegremente porque lo que hace que las personas concurran a un lugar es sentirse bien, nos dice, por ello que en el trascurso de estos meses Cesarían no solo aprendió a sonreír, sino también a administrar su negocio para poder seguir creciendo.Desea incrementar su negocio con diversos productos que puedan satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, por ello solicita un préstamo de dinero que espera usted pueda brindarle.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Cesarian is a hard-working woman, who has set up a small shop in her home; this is the business she always wanted to have and is now eager to improve it and make her business one of the busiest in the area. In order to achieve this she must be extremely happy and friendly to ensure that the people who come to her store also feel good; she told us that over the past few months Cesarian not only learned to smile but also to administer her business to allow it to continue growing. She hopes to continue building her business with a variety of products that meet the needs of her customers; in order to accomplish this she is asking for a loan that she hopes you can give her.

loans.use: Increase her capital to implement her store

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is a woman who in spite of her age is full of vitality, she believes that laughter is not only healthy for oneself, but also for those people who surround you. Teresa sells fruits, and she is very successful due to her great charisma, she always has a smile for her customers. Teresa not only sells from her stand, but she also takes orders for crates of seasonal fresh fruit, and she is punctual in fulfilling those orders. With this same responsibility she promises to pay the payments of the loan she is seeking in order to continue buying a batch of fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Teresa es una mujer que a pesar de su edad está llena de vitalidad, considera que la risa no sólo es saludable para uno mismo, sino también para las personas que nos rodean. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas, con la que tiene mucho éxito por su gran carisma, siempre tiene una sonrisa para todos sus clientes.Teresa no solo vende en su puesto, si no también que le hacen pedidos según la temporada para cajones de fruta, y ella es puntual en cumplirlos.Con esa misma responsabilidad promete pagar las cuotas del préstamo que solicita a continuación para compra un lote de fruta.

loans.use: Capital to acquire more fruit to sell in her business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita began her business in order to bring extra income into her household and provide a better standard of living for her family. It has also helped the family during times when her husband might find himself out of work. She started her business in June 1997 after taking a course in tailoring and dressmaking where she met another student who she became friends with and with whom she opened her business. They now take on large projects they would not have been able to accomplish alone, such as skirts for a school dance. Because of their ability to work together they have had success in their business.

Margarita is asking for a loan of US $800, which she will repay in six months, in order to purchase material and supplies that will allow her to finish her customers order during school graduation season.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Margarita inició el negocio por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra que le permitiera ofrecerle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia y que le sirviera para cuando su esposo se quedara sin trabajo. Comenzó en Junio de 1997, primero tomo un curso de corte y confección, ahí conocío a otra persona con la cual hizo amistad, y posteriormente se asocio con ella, ya que les encargaron un pedido muy grande de faldas para un baile escolar y por separado no se hubiera dado a vasto, y hasta la fecha han continuado de manera exitosa con el neogocio..

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materiales que le permitan cumplir con los pedidos que tiene para esta temporada de graduaciones escolares.

loans.use: Purchase material and supplies

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel started his own business after working in a mechanic shop for several years. He was paid very little in the shop and, as his family grew, so did their monthly expenses so he decided to open his own business. He began his business in March 1987 when his cousin sold him a hot dog cart. Since the beginning business has gone well for him and he now owns three carts. His eldest daughter works one and he is in charge of the other two. They sell hot dogs every day.

Daniel asks for a loan of US $400, which he will repay in four months, in order to purchase food supplies and raw materials in order to continue working and providing better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Daniel inició el negocio porqué era empleado de un taller mecánico pero ya tenía varios años trabajando allí y la paga era muy poca y su familia iba creciendo, al igual que los gastos, así que se decidío a poner su propio negocio. Comenzó aproximadamente en el mes de Marzo de 1987 cuando un primo le ofreció en venta un carrito para la elaboración de Hot-Dogs y se lo compro. Desde el primer día le empezó a ir muy bien y actualmente ya tiene tres carritos, su hija mayor se encarga de uno, y el me encargo de los otros, ya que todos los días venden.

El necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar materia prima que le permita seguir trabajando y dando un mejor servicio a mis clientes.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and raw materials

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben started his business because he wanted to become more independent and have his own business rather than earning his wages elsewhere since, as his family grew so did their expenses and he wanted earn more to support his family. His eldest daughter has started school and he wants to see his children succeed. Ruben has worked since he was young selling household items, at one point helping his brother who was a travelling salesman. It was in 1981 that he opened his own business. Things have gone well for him and he has been able to buy a truck which he now uses to transport his products.

Ruben is looking for a loan of US $400, which he will repay in four months, to purchase more merchandise to provide a greater variety of products for his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Ruben inició el negocio porqué quería independizarse y tener su propio negocio y no estar asalariado, en ese entonces contrajo matrimonio y como la familia comenzó a crecer, también los gastos se fueron haciendo más grandes, ante la falta de dinero para poder mantener a su familia, ya que su hija mayor comenzó a estudiar y el quería sacarlos adelante. Comenzó a trabajar en la venta de artículos para el hogar desde muy joven como ayudante de su hermano que era vendedor ambulante, pero fue en al año de 1981 cuando se independizo e inició su propio negocio y le empezó a ir muy bien, lo cual le permitió adquirir una camioneta donde actualmente transporto sus productos.

El necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar más artículos para el hogar que le permitan tener un mejor surtido para atender las necesidades de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise
